Review_Date: Rachel R wrote a review Mar 23
Review_Text: I honestly couldn't fault Riad 72. The staff are so nice (helpful and polite) the food lovely roof terrace stylish decor simple yet beautiful and the location lovely and quiet but close to everything. The whole experience was excellent and we had a really peaceful enjoyable stay. We can't wait to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ron N wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: We stayed for four nights at 72 Riad Living (would have been five except my wife developed a medical issue) and were so impressed by the deep commitment and attention to detail all staff demonstrated. Whether we interacted with the bellman receptionist waiter room cleaner right up to the general manager there was no doubt that all were on the same page when it came to ensuring guest satisfaction. Kudos to Stefania and her team.  The hotel itself is a quiet oasis in the beehive that is the old medina. We were glad that the hotel provides airport pickup as there's no direct taxi access to the property. The driver must drop you at the nearest medina entrance to be met by a Riad bellman who loads your luggage in a cart and guides you through the unmarked streets. A bit confusing at first but by Day Two we were navigating with ease.  The interior courtyard(or riad which translates from the Arabic word garden) is tranquil and our room was without faults. (We particularly enjoyed our private rooftop terrace.) A very thoughtful touch was the provision of a guest cell phone pre-programmed with speed dialing to the reception desk or manager. Extremely reassuring to have in your pocket if you happened to get lost or required assistance when out touring.  Overall 72 Riad Living met all our expectations. Thanks to all; we had a lovely visit.

With a superb location it felt like an oasis amidst the hustle & bustle of marrakech.  the food was excellent the bar was very well stocked & the staff very very friendly.  Accessing the rooms in the upper floors may be difficult for the elderly but it more than made up in comfort.

Beautifully designed Riad and perfect setting to start and end every day with its tranquillity and beauty. Every turn was a beautiful surprise and we kept discovering new aesthetically designed corners no matter how many times we walk through the Riad. They're building a new wellness centre and I can already tell its going to be again beautiful. Special shoutout to the the team Sara who went out of her way to help us with carparking and making sure we got to the Riad ok. Hassan who made us feel very welcomed and at home with always a smile on his face and of course Aziz for guiding us outside the Riad. Amazing experience and just what we needed after 10 days on the road!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David T wrote a review Mar 16
Review_Text: Wow just simply delightful from the super transfer professional and welcoming staff to the stunning bedroom delicious food and super roof top bar with stunning views - a special place! Thanks so much.  We’ll be back!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lucy R wrote a review Mar 8
Review_Text: I recently traveled to Morocco with my 21 month old daughter and husband. Our first stop was Riad 72. We were greeted by Stefania and her wonderful team. It was a perfect start to our adventure. We enjoyed very comfortable accommodations in a wonderful location. Riad 72 is an oasis from the bustle of the medina but still very close all that the old town has to offer. The staff was very kind to our daughter. My husband and I both enjoyed wonderful massages at the spa. The food is delicious and the staff is more than willing to help with any arrangements that need to be made inside or outside of the Riad. We are grateful to the entire team. Best wishes Lucy William and Brigitte

We had a wonderful stay at 72 Riad Living in Marrakech! Everything was amazing from the amenities the Riad itself and the staff who were really accommodating to all of our needs. The Riad is centrally located and close to the Medina. We also enjoyed our spa session and our daily tea breaks. We would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to enjoy an authentic experience in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just returned from a 2 night stay here. It was absolutely lovely. Staff were super attentive and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. We used the hamman which was really nice only downside was the noise from the building work during treatments. Overall highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leila L wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: INCREDIBLE Staff and beautiful rooms and hotel!
Review_Text: We stayed here with our 2 young children and absolutely LOVED it. The warmest welcome from the staff all super friendly and gorgeous with the children we arrived and had a traditional Moroccon Handwash and fresh mint tea and cakes before being taken to our room then having a tour of the riad. The staff were so friendly and helpful the rooms are immaculate and super stylish with everything we needed. The food is outstanding. Highlights were the roof top pool and lounge areas and of course the incredible spa! I had a traditional Hammam scrub followed by a massage while my husband chilled with the children by the pool it was the most blissful 2 hours and I would highly recommend it! We will be returning next time we visit Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Vibrancy of the Medina and tranquillity & peacefulness in the Riad within 5 mins!
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at 72 Riad it felt like a home with warm and friendly service from the staff. Being able to walk into the vibrancy of the Medina and then the tranquillity and peacefulness of the Riad was unexpected. The roof top terrace is amazing for seeing the sunrise and at dusk too. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stuart B wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: We went to Marrakech on a short weeks hols and decided to stay in a traditional Riad rather than a hotel - what a good decision! 72 Riad Living was wonderful - excellent location great room good views from the balcony roof terrace and superb food - both at breakfast and dinner. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly - they helped us with excursion and meal bookings and made us feel very welcome. We also did 2 of the Riad's excursions - both had good drivers and we felt very safe. The first trip was a walk to a waterfall in the Oureka Valley which was wonderful and not too crowded in February (although the included lunch was a bit disappointing). The following day we went on the Desert Lake and Mountains day out - great sites plenty of opportunity for stunning photos and a great lunch in a location to die for! Thank you to all our drivers and guides - they were excellent. And a big thank you to the team at 72 Riad Living for their hospitality and making us feel so welcome.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ryan M wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: The 72 Riad was a fantastic place to stay while we were in Marrakesh. I can always nitpick a hotel on small issues...however the issues were so small and few that they aren't even worth mentioning. We stayed for 6 nights and overall the Riad was beautiful the rooms were clean quite and well kept. The restaurant served delicious food from breakfast to lunch to dinner. The staff was welcoming and helpful. This Riad is in the heart of the action and it might be a little "busy" outside of the Riad for some people. But inside is a peaceful retreat. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I booked this lovely hotel with traditional moroccan style and amazed by its beauty. Our room has a terrace and 2 sun beds and got extra privacy. We could even order our breakfast to eat here which is very romantic .  Staff is very friendly and helpful and location is very near to everything. Basically you can walk to lots of places.  Hotel has its roof top swimming pool and sun beds and its very beautiful and we were sooo impressed with everything. Definitely recommend to everyone who is going to visit Marrakech !!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emma J wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad in a fantastic location to the centre and in easy walking distance to all the site seeing musts. We were surprising how big the Riad was!  Excellent staff who are very helpful and happy - they arranged experience/excursions hassle free.  Incredible spa facilities - recommend the traditional hamman experience.  Wonderful views over the Medina and a large rooftop area and pool to relax by.  So peaceful considering how busy the outside world is.

We have just returned from the most fantastic stay at Riad 72 Living. Stephania and her fabulous team have created such a peaceful tranquil haven. Every member of staff is so professional helpful and everything about this Riad runs perfectly. Every corner and detail is beautiful and there are so many surprising rooms and places in this expanding Riad it is no longer just Riad 72 but now includes Number 73 as well. We cannot recommend a stay here highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: 72 Riad Living is a gem at the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at 72 Riad Living. It is a gem at the heart of the sights of Marrakech and yet it is so quiet. You can walk to the major sights and top restaurants.    All the staff were friendly and helpful especially Stefania who met us as soon as we arrived and gave us an invaluable map with advice on sights to visit. She also gave us a mobile phone with hotel numbers uploaded which made us feel safe and which came in very useful when one of us lost our phone!    The roof has stunning views over the City. You can watch the sunset with a drink and you can swim if weather allows. The roof is also the best place to listen to the city’s calls to prayer from multiple minarets. What an experience it is.    The hotel restaurant is excellent for all meals especially dinner. Breakfast showcases Moroccan baking.    We would highly recommend this lovely comfortable authentic small hotel. Staying here is like being a welcome guest in someone’s home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: this Road is a real Oasis. I did not expect to see the amazing interior when the door to Riad opened.  Our room was beautiful comfortable bed. The Road team were very helpful and friendly.  Location is easy to find in the Medina.  Highly recommended stay  however need to take into account that there may be steep stairs leading to the. Room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent place and location. All the staff was very nice and helpful. I totally recomend.. Anything that you need they tried to solve it for you.  You feel like home. I can't wait to go back in a warmer time
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful time at 72 Riad Living. The entire team were courteous professional kind and efficient from the time we sent our first enquiry to the time our luggage was loaded into the taxi on the way home. This is testament to the clearly excellent management of this relaxed and comfortable establishment.    The location – in a quiet narrow street (no cars) – is perfect for a stay in Marrakech and within walking distance of wherever you’d need to get to. (The Yves Saint Laurent museum and Jardin Majorelle – both a disappointment but see separate Tripadvisor reviews – are less than half an hour’s walk away.)    Our room had its own private roof terrace and hot tub which was a privilege. The room itself was spotlessly clean and Housekeeping’s attention to detail was impressive and greatly appreciated.    The breakfast was generous: and generously served until 11:00. Wonderful! We had the option of being served breakfast wherever we wished: On our terrace; in our room; in the dining room of our choice or on the main terrace. Relaxed and laid back.    On our first day the team booked a city guide for a few hours to show us around the main souk and to help us get our bearings. The team also provided advice and guidance on a day tour (and booked it on our behalf).    Throughout our entire stay – whether at reception in the restaurant at breakfast or on the terrace bar – we were never once asked to provide our room number. All members of the team seemed to know who we were and didn’t need to ask. This is an example of how the management’s culture works in the background to make staying at 72 Riad Living a wonderful experience.    Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: High-end boutique-like Riad in best part of Medina
Review_Text: We spent New Year's weekend at 72 Riad Living. Stefania was very helpful from the very beginning. We had a single room for my 78 y.o. father-in-law and they had a perfect room for us to share with our 7 y.o daughter. She had her own little separate room/bathroom inside our room. The staff/service was excellent they were helpful with recommendations. Great location in the Medina. Great food. High end accommodations. Facilitated all of our dinner reservations. Would stay there again. We went to La Mamounia for a dinner. What a zoo. So glad we didn't stay somewhere like that. Maybe nice to visit for a meal or drink if you have time but so glad we chose a small boutique-like traditional Riad in the Medina

Review_Date: Andreas B wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: It’s a wonderful place in a great and quiet location with super friendly staff! I can totally recommend going there. Breakfast was great the rooftop terrace was amazing with a great view over the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wonderful hotel! Ask for the tour when you arrive - we didn’t get it immediately because we arrived late - so you see all the beautiful areas and amenities. Great location food design and service. A gem.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis in the middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: The Riad is beautiful and perfectly located. Stefania and her team were wonderful hosts and went out of the way to ensure a pleasurable stay. The amenities throughout the property made our time even more enjoyable.

Review_Title: The only choice for me in Marrakech!
Review_Text: I've been very lucky to be able to visit many hotels around the world and 72 Riad Living has to be among my all-time top 3.    Clearly it's a stunningly beautiful hotel which manages to combine luxury with a true flavour of Moroccan architecture and decoration. While staying in a beautiful hotel can be a true pleasure in itself what makes 72 Riad Living special are the management and staff who work there.    Stefania and her team are the true definition of hospitality. Every single member of staff greets you by name and most of them know you daily itinerary ensuring that you're not late for your guide or giving you tips and tricks on how to get around in Marrakech.    It's this attention to detail - this soul - that sets 72 Riad Living apart from many larger hotels. Let's face it with enough money a hotel can create a beautiful experience but it takes dedication training and a true spirit of hospitality to create a 360-degree experience like Stefania and her team do in 72 Riad Living (and not to forget that we stayed in the Riad during one of the busiest times of the year when most hotels would have been fully stretched. You didn't feel this at all in 72 Riad Living; everyone went to extreme lengths to cater to your every need).    (While it might be clear to most I do want to point out that the hotel does not have lifts and has some steep and winding stone stairs. This is to be expected in a Riad but if you're unable to climb stairs it might not be the best location for you - or you might want to ask for a ground floor room).    When we next go to Marrakech we are definitely staying at 72 Riad Living again. I can also thoroughly recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to fully immerse themselves in Moroccan hospitality and explore the Medina. Stefania and team will help you get the most out of your stay!

Review_Date: Clare M wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: This is a beautiful Riad with a warm welcome. We enjoyed delicious breakfasts and a good dinner at the hotel and spent some of the time chilling from the bustle in streets on our rooftop terrace with hot tub feeling very spoilt indeed. When we wanted to go out the hotel booked us a restaurant one day and a day trip into the mountains with a brilliant guide on another. Recommended.

Review_Date: francesca f wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: A Magical and Relaxing experience at 72 Riad Living
Review_Text: Magical Riad placed in the center of the Medina unique place where you can relax and enjoy the peace of the terrace and the swimming pool after the "adventour" through the Souk in the city center.  Stefania is a sweet and super helpful host that helped us also in organizing our desert trip (with quads experience and lunch in a luxury desert camp!!). Also the personnal is gentle and helpful our room was cleaned twice a day and alsways furnished with fresh macarons and fruits.  The breakfast in the main hall is delicious with home made cheese pancakes and fresh fruits and every day fresh bread and croissant are served.  It was a magical experience in Marrakech specially because of this Riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A really nice place to stay
Review_Text: Very nice place to stay! Super-helpfull staff. The rooms were big clean and really nice. The breakfast was good with bread fruit eggs and more.    The riad is located a short walk from the main square but still enough distance to avoid noise and traffic.    Would recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anya C wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: our family enjoyed our stay at 72 very much :) the rooms were beautiful and spacious! we loved that it was in the center of the city and gave us the true Moroccan experience. the staff was kind and the food was accommodating for our dietary restrictions. thank you so much 72!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Wonderful place of beauty and quietness
Review_Text: 72 living Riad is a wonderful place to stay when visiting Marrakech. We spent three days in a couple’s trip and everything was perfect the building is truly beautiful quiet and decorated with taste the atmosphere is relaxing even if the hotel is quite near to the busy area of the Medina! . Special mention to the staff who were really helpful and welcoming at every time. It was a really good experience that we hope to repeat very soon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Trip to a more Elegant Time
Review_Text: The Medina in Marrakech is daunting movement and noise everywhere small curved alleyways signs in multiple languages I can't read. We walked down the first street following directions to the turn - it got quieter. Down that short street to the next turn and it got quieter still. Finally after another turn and not sure we're in the right place everything went really quiet.    We knocked on the door and it opened into a small nondescript hallway. Wondering if we were in the right place we followed into a beautiful four story courtyard. This is the right place how we want to live.    Thanks to all the staff that made our stay memorable.

Review_Title: The Best Staff and Gorgeous Riad! stay here!
Review_Text: Our stay at 72 was most exemplary. From morning until night the staff was gracious prompt kind and went about e and beyond to make us feel welcome. We had a large room called Karma and it was so lovely with a huge skylight/cupola in the curling that they uncover in the day. The Riad is impeccable top to bottom comforting Moroccan modern and Italian design fused in harmony. There is nothing they won’t help you with. They also pick you up at the airport for no charge. Our flight came in near Midnighy so this was so appreciated esp since the Riad is a few small blocks from the public Road. They have someone waiting to take your luggage in and up. Also the food was amazing chef made us a bastilla on request and the breakfasts were bountiful. I am now at El Fenn after a trip to the mountains which costs more hand has problematic service etc. Will be writing a review of it as well later.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Martin S wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Wonderfull Riad in the old town
Review_Text: The Riad is perfectly situated in the oldtown. The rooms are nicely decorated luxury and largte. The staff is very helfull and friendly. Our stay was just unforgetable and our expectation were exceeded. Wunderfull stay next time again thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Dave S wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Luxury Riad with an excellent eye on service and style
Review_Text: We have just come back from a short break staying at 72 Riad Living and the experience exceeded our expectations. From pickup at the airport through to getting into our room the service was first class. The staff were attentive and provide us with a traditional welcome of being able to wash our hands before mint tea and biscuits/cakes.    Next we were treated to a guided tour of the Riad from top to bottom from its lovely roof terrace and pool area through to our room. We had a classic room and it was well lauded out with all the things you need and no TV which is a bonus. The bed was super comfortable and the attention to detail was outstanding. The restaurant was great and we enjoyed one dinner there and breakfast was excellent and you didn't need any more than the fruit breads cakes/pastries coffee and juice. There was the option of eggs and other extras but we didn't need any extras.    The staff provided us with ideas of places to visit and eat and were happy to arrange any bookings.    The Riad is in an excellent location on the edge of the Medina and easy walking distant of many of the sites resturants and things to do.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ricardo Z wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Perfect would be an understatement staff was incredibly friendly gave us great suggestions and tips to better experience the city.    Rooms were amazing and super clean you could stay all day within the Riad and feel relaxed and enjoy your stay.    Breakfast was great and take your time to have dinner at the restaurant and a drink at the roof top.    We will stay here again for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David W wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Nice way to start our holiday
Review_Text: Come to Riad 72 for dinner on our 2nd night in Marrakesh  We weren’t disappointed we stated the evening off with sunset drinks on the terrace followed by a lovely meal down stairs  The staff were outstanding friendly and attentive  The food was amazing had a lovely evening and the best way to start our stay in Marrakesh
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mario B wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Riad 72 is an amazing oasis of calm in a city of extremes.  From the initial welcome to the last goodbye the Riad proved to be a great home from home. Great rooms lovely staff excellent dinner and a lovely rooftop bar and pool.  Can't recommend it highly enough.

Review_Date: Simon H wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Excellent riad! Stayed here for 4 night during our honeymoon and it was lovely! Location is great for exploring the medina close to everything but tucked away in a back alley away from all the noise. Rooms are very well decorated clean and spaceious. Excellent views from the rooftop as well.  Staff were great Stefania will help guide you through a perfect stay in the city!    Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We discovered and loved to come home. The hotel with its great interieur offers great hospitality.  The restaurant "La Table du Riad" was for us the best restaurant of our Morocco stay. The celebrate there Moroccan cuisine on a very high level. The place is very chic and stylish and the service is very friendly.

Very happy with our three night stay here. We had the 2 room suite as we were traveling with our college aged daughter. Beautiful room huge roof terrace for exclusive use of this room very happy with size and style of accommodations. The staff were absolutely excellent very helpful and friendly. Also had a very good dinner at the hotel one evening.

Review_Title: Great Riad, good food, nice personell and service!
Review_Text: We did chose Riad72 based on a recommendation of friends. It's very well located and indeed a hidden paradise like you would expect it.  We had dinner with traditional made to order food. There are several courts and even a new one with pool which is about to be finished.  The rooftop is great with the option to dine or have lunch or breakfast. Numerous sunbeds and a small water basin.  We had a deluxe XL room - wow- very spacious!  The luggage has been picked up and at departure dropped at the next road where the taxis or shuttles stop.  We had 3 great nights! Thanks to the team!

In order to give a balanced review I try to think of the positives and the negatives but the riad was faultless. Not a single thing to critique. All staff felt like family. Breakfast was amazing every day the Riad was spotless and stunning. If I returned to Marrakesh I would go no where else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: I so wish there were more hotels in the world like this...
Review_Text: My wife and I landed at 72 Riad living kind of accidentally and I can't tell you how fantastic of an accident it was. From the shuttle meeting us at the airport to welcoming us with open arms when we arrived and helping us every possible way they could.    The hotel itself is stunning the rooms might even be more so. I could have happily stayed at 72 Riad Living for our whole trip. Oh I forgot to mention that the kitchen turns out fantastic food the Hammam is great as are the messages.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kera M wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: A wonderful stay that was far too short
Review_Text: I can’t really say enough about our stay with Stefania and her team at 72 Riad Living. The riad is quaint and welcoming the food was fantastic and the hammam was relaxing—- but the real star of the show was the care that all of the crew took to welcome us and make us feel at home. This will 100% be my hotel if we are ever in Marrakech again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tony R wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Fantastic stay - absolute haven in the centre of Marrakech
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived at the Riad until the moment we left the staff at 72 looked after us. Nothing was too much trouble and the friendliness and warmth of everyone made us feel at home. Breakfasts were fabulous and we ate in the hotel for dinner during the evening and the food was superb.  We also tried the Hammam and massage which were equally a great experience. The roof terrace and pool are great for relaxing or a pre dinner aperitif.  The Riad is perfectly placed to walk to the Souks and Jemma El Fna. A real gem of tranquility right in the centre of Marrakesh. We loved it and hope to return. Thanks to all the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Benoit C wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Amazing Road in the madness of Marrakesh
Review_Text: 72 Riad is a lovely riad offering a very relaxed setting so you can rest after a busy day in Marrakesh. We stayed as a family last week and had a lovely time. Stefania and her staff looked after us very well. The riad has a lovely terrace where you can chill during the day with a small bathing pool. It was also in the process of opening up a whole spa which looks amazing. Definitely recommend it!

Review_Date: Crystal G wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Riad 72 Living is a beautiful peaceful escape from the vibrant and busy streets of Marrakesh. Stefania the longtime manager here helped us literally for years with our booking. Our original booking was sadly cancelled due to Covid and subsequent re-bookings were also cancelled due to Covid. We FINALLY made it to Morocco this year! Stefania was a kind and helpful sea of calm during all of the re-bookings. This was our first trip to Morocco and we had all sorts of questions which were promptly answered by Stefania via email before we arrived. She even helped us with our hotel in the Atlas Mountains when that hotel not answering our emails. What a gem Riad 72 has in Stefania and for that matter the rest of the very friendly and helpful staff. The Riad itself is an oasis of beauty and calm. Our room was lovely and very grand and styled in cool Moroccan furnishings. The bathroom was massive. Our balcony looked into the lush courtyard filled with tall banana trees and other greenery and a bubbling fountain. The location of Riad 72 was just perfect for us. An easy walk into the maze of the medina but we also had an easy walk to the super cool shopping area of Gueliz. There are endless cafes and restaurants and shops nearby. We didn't spend much time at the pool or the rooftop of the hotel but that was only because we were always out shopping. The rooftop has a great view and lots of different seating areas. Really nice.

You step in to the Riad 72 from the narrow bustling streets close to the heart of the city and the peace is blissful. It is a fantastic green and tranquil contrast to the exotic chaos of the medina. The welcome from the staff and the transfer was spot on and relaxing. Throughout our stay they made us feel like we were coming home every time we came back to the Riad and we were sad to leave.    The room was spacious and cool and the bed was really comfortable. Lovely authentic styling and good finish. Nice balcony onto the internal atrium with comfortable chairs to sit in the shade and read a book or drink mint tea.    The rooftop is a proper suntrap with a newly opened plunge pool to cool off in. Plenty of space for the number of guests and frequently we had the area to ourselves. They were working on another pool area in an adjacent building while we were there which looks like it will be beautiful.    Breakfast was plentiful and we had a beautiful dinner in the riad one night.    We took advantage of the in-house Hammam and massage and both were excellent.    The narrow streets of the souks are about a 3 minute walk from the door and you can easily walk to Jemaa el- Fnaa.    I said it before but the staff were fantastic and really made it feel like home.    Would definitely stay again hopefully soon.

Riad 72 is simply lovely. The service is 5 star and all the staff were amazing very friendly and couldn't do enough to help us and make our stay fabulous.    We visited Riad 72 back in 2005 and liked it so much we came back to stay in 2022 with our teenage daughter. It didn't disappoint. The rooms are beautifully decorated and the rooftop pool and bar are fantastic. I would stay here again and again. It's in great location and easy to get to all the sights Marrakesh has to offer. The breakfast was lovely and the in-house restaurant very good.    Overall a perfect place to stay for trip to Marrakesh an oasis of tranquility after the chaos of the Medina!    Thank you to Stefania and her team.

Review_Date: Andi C wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Very lovely Riad that felt safe and was extremely peaceful. The staff was eager to help with any and everything. The features of the Riad were stunning there was always a smiling face to greet you and the mojitos were delicious! For breakfast a wide variety of food was prepared down to the delicious dinner and dessert options. A wonderful experience and would highly recommend this Riad for travelers to truly relax after the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Don L wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Couldn't have been more pleasant. From the moment we arrived Stefania was a delightful host. The riad is absolutely gorgeous makes it hard to leave but when you do it's a splendid oasis on your return. We dined one eventing in the restaurant and it was delicious. I would recommend to anyone wanting a very special place to stay while visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kay C wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Beautiful rooms, great staff, delicious food
Review_Text: We traveled with another couple and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had drinks and appetizers while watching the sunset on the roof and then enjoyed a wonderful meal in the beautiful courtyard restaurant. It is conveniently located in the heart of the medina and the staff is very helpful and friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jessica R wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at 72 Riad Living for our honeymoon and I could not recommend this Riad more!!  From the moment we walked inside Stefania and the entire team made us feel like we were at home. We are in the restaurant twice while we were in Marrakech it was some of the best food we had while in Morocco!  We will definitely be back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Darren C wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: This was our first time to Marrakech and I do not think we could have found somewhere better to stay. The Riad is perfectly located in a quiet side street in the Medina. When you enter it offers perfectly tranquillity away from the hustle and bustle of the medina. The inside is beautiful as are the rooms. The roof terrace offers views across the city and is a perfect place for a cool drink or soak in the pool.    Stefania and her team are brilliant and do their utmost to make you welcome. many thanks for this.    There are plenty of places to dine in Marrakech but the food at the Riad is as good a we ate anywhere. Compliments to the chef!!    If you want a truly fantastic place to stay to enjoy Marrakech look no further.

Review_Title: Marrakech, I did'nt know, but it would have been "First Episode"
Review_Text: 72 Riad Living: it has been perfect from the very beginning! They collect you from the airport and bring to the Medina. In the very heart of it the 72 is. Almost hidden in the alleys and when you walk to reach the hotel you remain a little bit astonished  asking you "where am I"? Well this is the Medina and when the hotel door open you really enter in the "paradise lost". A flourishing and lush patio welcomes you in this cozy Riad where everything work and run to let you stay well. Perfect the Staff always kind and efficient; and wonderful owner Mrs Stefania perfect host.  You must come here believe me.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: 72 Riad is the perfect place to stay in Marrakech!! from the warm welcome we received from the manager Stephania to the accommodating staff. This is my second trip to Marrakech and staying at 72 Riad made all the difference!! Beautifil Riad  very well appointed rooms specially enjoyed the delicious complimentary breakfast in the courtyard every morning. Highly recommend!!

72 Riad is a beautifully presented gem which we stayed at for 4 nights. The courtyard really was a tranquil refuge from the medina outside. Our room was stylish and moody - and had our own private terrace upstairs which we loved. Sublime toiletries also. The interior designer (Stefania?) has good taste!    We were a little surprised that the bar had run out of cocktails during our stay but I'm sure that was just a blip!    ITo conclude Stefania and her team (Majda et al) were wonderful hosts and made our stay in Marrakech very special.

Had the most amazing stay and we Will definetely be back in september 2023. Staff are so accommodating and welcoming really made us feel relaxed and like family! The room had everything we needed and Location was just perfect! Miss you All already and I give you my highest recommendations. Thank you for giving us such a wonderful time 🥰 All the best Cecilie & Mille
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Mark G wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: The most wonderful host in Marrakech
Review_Text: From the first moment when we arrived until the day we unfortunately had to leave 72 Riad Living was just perfect in all aspects of a stay in Marrakech. The kindness of the staff the attention of detail of the interior the spacious rooms ... it was like a story from ”A Thousand and One Nights”. Thank you Stephania and crew you also made our stay in Marrakech unforgettable.

Place was exceptional. Managnent and staff were very attentive informative  friendly and punctual though out our stay .  Architecture and design is breathtaking very authentic with a minimalistic modern twist
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I loved everything about our stay the Riad was beautiful  the service impeccable and the staff so helpful the best ever. It was modern yet authentic - very comfortable. The manager was keen to help us with whatever we needed. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner on the rooftop - everything was sublime
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neda Gehl wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel great service friendly and dedicated staff and a very lovely and super kind manager! We had a great 4 days stay at Marrakesh thanks to Stephania and her professional hotel staff! Will recommend it 💯 to everyone who’s planning to visit Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The service and experience the entire staff provided was impeccable. The staff was so tentative from the time we arrived to the time we left. Every detail is thought of at this Riad. Definitely hope to return one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: "great all round" First time guest. Top notch service and quality. The atmosphere is one of understated elegance. All employees went off their way to be helpful. After a long flight was able to check in early. The tranquility in the hotel gave the impression there were few guests but it was busy. I had the impression that each guest was considered special. It is obvious that the staff is well trained. Will stay here again on a future visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: If you want to stay in the medina, 72 Riad Living will be your best home !!
Review_Text: Thank you so much for your hospitality I had such an amazing time there !!  The riad is beautiful very relaxing and well located in the Medina.  Moreover rooms are spacious very clean and so comfortable…!  The food also is amazing everything is “fait maison” and you can enjoy it in your room in the charming and relaxing patios or on the cozy rooftop :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: simonetta c wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: really friendly staff. very clean and welcoming room. we enjoy so much. thank you stefania for your kindness with us. the riad is located in a perfect place really close to the main square in 10 minutes for a little walk in the new town but first of all I wanto to thank you again everybody for the help given us for our troubles. thank you so much stefania!!!

Riad72 is designed with the visitor in mind. Authentic Moroccan inspiration infused with modern sensibilities. You will be blessed with the human touch from homemade ingredients to natural products  and staff that treat you like family. A rare and previous time I will not forget
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Paul T wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: It was great experience to stay here. The room is very clean staff is very helpful and beautiful scenery. If you looking for a place that make you heal and chill this place is the answer! Definetely will comeback again. Worth the price.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: alma z wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at 72 for 3 nights and it was absolutely amazing. The junior suite is pure luxury and the staff are polite and very helpful. The food was delicious and all facilities well maintained and clean. Thank you 72 and Stefania for a wonderful stay... We will definitely be back!

Review_Date: Julie G wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Visiting from the US we were very impressed by the genuine hospitality and beauty of 72 Riad. From the elegant furnishings to the gorgeous interior courtyard this quiet space allowed us to fully relax during our stay. We are grateful to the professional kind staff for making vacation truly remarkable. Would highly recommend!

Review_Date: Claire H wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: My teenage daughter and myself stayed at Riad 72 Living last week as a celebratory end of exams treat. We were not disappointed! The hotel was an oasis of calm beauty and elegance. The staff were so helpful and nothing was too much trouble. I would highly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: LAUREN F wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Incredible hotel right in the center of everything.
Review_Text: 72 Riad is an incredible hotel right in the center of everything.    The staff went above and beyond the normal to make sure you had everything you needed planned incredible days and more.    The hotel is beautiful the breakfast was superb restaurant was great and the people were the absolute best! Definitely a great choice and would go back in a heartbeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Mark L wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: A beautiful riad with well appointed rooms. Excellent facilities including hammam and a restaurant with good food. Above all the cheerful staff were superb and the highlight of our trip. They went above and beyond to make sure our stay was as comfortable as possible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sanjana S wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Stefania and her team made our stay at Riad 72 absolutely incredible. She provided us with endless options for excursions and things to see and was able to arrange a tailor made trip to the Atlas mountains and waterfalls.  The attention to detail is second to none - you're provided with a special mobile phone with handy numbers a well thought out map and a book of excursions and recommended places.  The Riad itself is beautiful and tasteful the rooms are comfortable and the roof top terrace has an excellent view of the medina. The morning breakfast is wonderful in the gorgeous courtyard and the restaurant at the Riad is phenomenal - it was the best food we had and much better than at other high end places such as at La Mamounia!  The location of the Riad was also great - it is just off a main road in the Medina so everything is easily walkable if you choose to do so.  I would recommend a stay here to everyone and look forward to being able to go back!

72 Riad was an absolutely beautiful Riad with impeccable service. The Riad had a stunning courtyard where we ate our meals. Breakfasts were especially our favorites. The rooms were beautiful making you feel like you were staying in Morocco but with all the amenities we were used to in the States. The staff was very attentive to our every need always pleasant and welcoming. And we were walking distance from the main section of the Medina yet when you were in the Riad you felt like you were miles away (very quiet).

Review_Date: Antonio Boucinhas wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: We recommend this amazing Riad! Impeccable accommodation personalized breakfast and served in a beautiful and romantic garden where there is also a great restaurant! Every member of the staff is kind helpful and professional in all areas of the hotel! Emphasizing here the person of Stefania with pertinent and valuable indications and orientations about the city. 4 unforgettable days!  Antonio e Luzmarina - São Luís - MA - Brasil

Review_Title: Make this your home in Marrakech
Review_Text: My friends and I loved this riad so much it was so hard to leave. It truly was a peaceful oasis in what can sometimes be an overwhelming city.    Service: After hearing some horror stories from other friends who have traveled to Marrakech my friends and I immediately felt at ease with the outstanding service that 72 Riad provided. Riad 72’s amazing service begins as soon as they pick you up from the airport. Easy to spot them outside the terminal and the driver was so welcoming. Our driver introduced us to our luggage porter I think his name was Amir? Throughout our stay he ALWAYS had a smile on his face whether we saw him at the hotel or walking in the streets. Special shout out to Khalid who served us our welcome tea breakfast and also assisted with other requests. Khalid was always available to help out and made sure no request or question was left unanswered. Khalid is an asset to the team at 72 Riad! Also shout out to Yassini who provided excellent service for us at dinner. The housekeepers always made sure we came home to a clean bed and would even leave delicious macaroons at night! It’s unfortunate we did not get every team member’s name at the riad otherwise I would name everyone we encountered. Every employee made us feel at home and made us feel like VIPs!    Location: The riad seems tucked away as it is off the main road and away from the busy action of the Medina. We were very thankful to be in a quiet and secure area because we felt very safe here. We were only 5-10 minute walk to the Medina. The taxi stand is only a 2 minute walk away from the riad.    Ambiance: The riad is beautiful. Every single detail of decor is visually pleasing. It is obvious that the space and design of the riad were meticulously planned. Our deluxe XL room was absolutely gorgeous. It was enough space for 3 of us and we appreciated having 2 bathrooms. The showers in our room had strong water pressure and perfect range of temperatures. The air conditioning was strong and much appreciated by us Americans in the heat of June so to us it didn’t matter that there was no pool compared to other riads.    I highly recommend staying here and making this your home base in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lydia R wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: I cannot recommend this Riad enough. Every staff member was friendly kind helpful and professional. The service in all areas of the hotel was top level. The Riad itself is one of the most beautiful most calming spaces I have ever been in. Beautifully decorated in a traditional Moroccan style with a modern/luxurious twist. Our room and rooftop was just as stunning. Incredible location with everything you will want to see within walking distance. The food was delicious. Excellent value for money all round. I could not fault the whole experience and this will be the only place I stay in Marrakech from now on.

Review_Date: Waseem I wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: My wife and I had a wonderful ten days at the Riad 72 living. The boutique hotel is just the right size not too many rooms to be anonymous not to few to be intrusive. You can find new rooms seating areas and vistas while still not getting lost. The architecture design and furnishings are elegant. However the standout aspect are the staff. They operate as a team. Kind and positive to one another. Their attention and attitude is so warm and genuine that you are literally left wondering how special these people are and how special they make you feel. We were astonished and overwhelmed in the nicest possible way. I could go on about the amazing master suite with 10ft ceilings and a cupola or the great food but let's leave it at that. I'm sure you get the idea.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The place itself is ok. Unfortunately it’s spoiled by a patronising manager who speaks down to her customers. It’s a shame as it left a bad taste for us about the riad. Breakfast is exactly the same every day. The service was very slow. I wouldn’t recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jos H wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: A fabulous oasis of calm in the energising chaos of Marrakech Medina
Review_Text: Our stay at 72 Road Living was a dream; from the gorgeous environment they have created to the attentive and infinitely helpful team of staff.    The hotel itself is beautiful with attention to detail displayed in every aspect of its design and setup - it is peaceful and calming with a gentle buzz in the courtyard at mealtimes - created by a combination of hotel guests and external visitors who come to experience the excellent food.    Rooms are kept spotlessly clean like the rest of the hotel - and are visually calm and simple but cleverly designed with lovely detail touches that make guests feel at home. Of particular note is that the team provide a local pre-paid mobile phone for guests to use for the duration of their stay; making it easy to contact the staff from inside or outside the hotel.    The food prepared by the chef and team of ‘Table du Riad’ (the hotel’s restaurant) is superb; local fresh produce used sensitively and imaginatively - as well as beautifully presented.    72’s staff are its secret weapon - every member of the team is friendly and supremely helpful nothing is too much trouble.  From the simplest item of foodservice - to one-off occasions where they take the opportunity to help way beyond the call of duty;  When our flight was cancelled the manager Stefania and her team were able to accommodate us at (very!) short notice extending our stay by a total of 4 days - and ensuring we felt completely welcome throughout.  When my wife was suffering with a migraine as we were checking out the staff arranged a dark room for her attentively provided her with local remedies and virtually guarded the room to ensure peace and quiet for her until we had to leave for the airport.    In all - a fabulous experience created in no small part by an outstanding team of people - who are genuinely motivated to ensure every guest’s experience is individual and delightful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Janet T wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: Dirty, dark and claustrophic rooms with a patronizing manager to match.
Review_Text: The staff were amazing except the Manager Stefania who publicly berated me over a misunderstanding. Her tone was condescending obnoxious and patronizing.  1. Rooms were claustrophobic dim and dirty (pl see photos)  2. When we requested for Stefania to help book us Dinner at Royal Mansour she said it was "closed for an event" . But we managed to book directly and there were no events  3. She encouraged us to get airport fast track at 80 Euros a pax which was completely useless as it is not peak season and the line for regular immigration was shorter than the fast track    On the positive side the staff were attentive warm and genuine unlike the manager who was completely fake and was only nice when she could get something out of you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Justin Khoo wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: The hotel room was absolutely disgusting with filth on the carpet which was hung on the wall despite having all the lights on at night the room was still extremely dark.    Honestly we wanted to check out of the hotel due to how DIRTY it was but decided to stay because of the brilliant and kind staff who was the most accommodating excluding the manager Stefania which really felt as if she was scamming us even if she did not profit from it. Since it was our first time in Marrakech we did not know how immigration would be like and when Stefania kept on persisting that we needed something called "Fast track" we eventually caved in and got it which costed about 180 Euros for 3 people!!! When we got to the airport we were shocked to realise that there were more people in the fast track lane than normal immigration a total waste of money!!!    Even with the numerous amount of good reviews avoid Riad 72 unless you want to stay in a dark and dirty room. I hope that if any staff see this that they know how much we appreciated their good service throughout our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Corina M wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: All the comments on this page speak for themselves! I can only reiterate that my partner and I had a wonderful stay
Review_Text: Our first time in Marrakech was a wonderful experience thanks to the staff at Riad 72. Very welcoming kind and helpful they made our stay at the riad and in Marrakech a wonderful experience. The location service food and the riad itself were absolutely fantastic.

Review_Date: Teodor Cuciureanu wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: Absolutely top-notch services and overall experience! Will return soon!
Review_Text: We had a wonderful experience during our stay there everything was so carefully thought of from the arrival pick up at the airport to the welcome tea to the dress up of the breakfast/dinner space and the extraordinary facilities such as the Hammam and the massage. Stefania and her team were a lovely host very helpful and with an extreme care for details to make our stay as good as possible. The architecture of the Riad 72 is very authentic generous and calm and it offers multiple opportunities to set back and enjoy some quality some either alone or with a bigger group. I'd say it's great place for all sorts of guests either couples or small families. Big shout out to the stuff as well we were impressed by their kindness. I wish we stayed more but I am sure we will go back soon.

Review_Title: Amazing Riad! Amazing room, super friendly stuff, very tasteful breakfast, perfect location!
Review_Text: This place is amazing and could not recommend this highly enough. Everything from the location to the rooms breakfast and staff was perfect! We had a private large terras with Jacuzzi the staff was super friendly and helpfull and delivered the breakfast to our terras. The rooms we insanely spacious and clean!

Review_Date: Nancy B wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: Absolutely the best location for Marrakech. Hotel and rooms were spotless and well furnished. Staff was friendly and went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. We would never stay anywhere else. Food is special as well.

It was a great location everything being within walking distance. The hotel was beautiful and it felt very authentic to the Marrakech surroundings. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast included was amazing as well as other meals the hotel offered. Highly recommend staying here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An Oasis in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: When we first arrived we were tired and kind of overwhelmed by the sensory overload of Marrakech. As soon as we stepped into the Riad it was like stepping into an Oasis and immediately we were treated like family.    The design and decoration of this place is absolutely stunning. Fantastic job. Everything about 72 Riad was perfect but the Staff is what really puts it over the top. All of them were amazing.    Also the massage I received here was one of the best I've ever had!    Already looking forward to booking my next trip to Marrakech and staying at 72. Thank you all for an amazing stay.

Review_Date: Irit B wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Thank you for a great time. I felt at home. Beautiful Riad . Perfect location food and service.    Specials thanks to Aziza for her magic touch.  Will be back for sure.  Keep up the good work.    Love  Irit Saidoff-Bishburg

Review_Title: Lovely place, great location and welcoming staff: wonderful combination!
Review_Text: Thoroughly enjoyed a 3 night stay at 72 Riad and highly recommend for excellent location staff attentiveness lovely decor and delicious food. From the initial warm welcome we knew that our stay would be comfortable and it was. We enjoyed a fabulous view from our private terrace and also drinks on the roof terrace. Each breakfast offered new treats and on our last night the courtyard dinner was delicious. Giving guests a cellphone with direct connections to the riad reception is an added bonus for security.

Review_Date: karim m wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights a fabulous location and the service was just perfect. From the moment we arrived to when we left we felt as though it was a home away from home. Would highly recommend anyone to stay here. A truly wonderful place. The breakfast was delicious the staff were just amazing. We will come back for sure. Karim&Hannah
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: karina M wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: I have had the luck to make true my dream to stay at Riad 72  Beautiful place great location  the room the terrace  you feel so relax in this unique environment  but the most important was the kidness of every one who works there.  Stefania it is adorable and since I made the reservation any time I need help she answered to my mails rigth away .  Hopefully in a near future I can vist Marrakech again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Derek C wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: We had been told by a relative that this Riad was possibly one of the best in Marrakech. Not having been to any others difficult to compare but what a super place. From the moment of booking online the staff were in contact and they ensured that our whole holiday experience was seemless and trouble free. Mehdi Stefania and in fact all the staff were brilliant. Nothing was too much trouble and our 5 night stay was therefore a delight. The room was comfortable but could perhaps do with more places to put things particulary the bedside tables were almost completley full of lamp so very little space for the essentials of travel. Clock water mug torch and spectacles. Minor niggle only. Food was great too so a marvellous place for exploring the city.  Thanks to all.  Derek & Lesley

Review_Date: Mark B wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: What a place! This was our first visit to Morocco and though we wanted an "authentic" experience we were just a little nervous as we'd never stayed in a Riad. We sure made the right decision with this place though. From the airport pickup (super late night) to the warm welcome and amazing food everything here just felt perfect. The room wasn't huge but plenty spacious and the bathroom was completely modern while still feeling special. The location allowed us to walk to all of our tours and explore the markets on foot too which was perfect for us. We'll definitely be back to Marrakech and will absolutely stay with 72 Riad Living when we do!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leigh R wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights and have the best stay. The hotel is beautiful and smells incredible all the staff are extremely attentive helpful and professional. It's a great location to explore the medina and has a beautiful rooftop for sunbathing or chilling out after a day of exploring. They organised our transfers from the airport gave us loads of tips for getting round to see places of interest and made restaurant reservations. All in all they made our stay in Marrakech unforgettable!

Review_Date: Jillianne P wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Perfect location thoughtful staff delicious food great design clean and safe. Stayed with a girlfriend and felt extremely safe and taken care of as two women traveling alone. Anything we needed - reservations tickets transfers food laundry... was taken care of quickly and well. The riad staff is so kind and attentive and the owner Stefania is on site daily to provide recommendations of what to do in the surrounding area. The location was PERFECT - central without being loud.

We stayed 5 night and loved everything about our stay. Every staff member is beyond welcoming and always ready to assist you with everything. After booking the airport transfer was organised for us. Stefania the lovely manager introduced us to all possible activities you can imagine (as it was our first time in Marrakesh). The Riad is perfectly located but in a quiet street we walked everywhere and almost never had to use a taxi. The rooms are beautiful very well curated by the housekeeping team. Not to forget about the amazing breakfast which was always freshly served in the most beautiful and relaxing breakfast area.  We are definitely coming back! Thank's to Stefania and the amazing Team!

Review_Date: Daniel P wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Title: This will make your time in Marrakech! 10/10
Review_Text: Wonderful hotel it made Marrakech for us and is a pleasure to spend time in. They made it easy booking private transfers for us and meeting guiding you to the hotel which would have been confusing. Never write reviews but had to here recommend the suite with the hot tub for your own rooftop space but in any case it has a nice roof you can access and relax. Amazing hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 3 nights and it was just perfect. The Riad was so beautiful. Nice and friendly staffs. The freshly made breakfast was very tasty and varied every day. It is located on a quite street. We woke up with the singing of birds every morning. Definitely worth staying.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Roland A wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Fantastic 4 nights stay at 72 Riad Living in Marrakech. The Riad is very well located feels like a little piece of quiet heaven in the city.  The manager Stefania goes above and beyond with her guests! The entire 72 Living team is outstanding and very welcoming. From the moment we walked in until our last day we felt at home.  Exceptional service throughout the day. Great job Stefania and team!    The Riad itself is very tastefully decorated rooms are very elegant and each of them unique (we tried the Deluxe XL and the Grand suite). And last but not least the beautiful roof top terrace with magnificent sunset views.    We will be staying at 72 Living whenever we come back to Marrakech.  Highly recommend it.

Review_Title: Peaceful, stylish oasis with superb service
Review_Text: This is a perfect haven to retreat to after the exotic chaos of Marrakech. The door opens into a fresh take on Riad living - the deft hand of its Italian owners rendering a refreshing element of period modernism among the palms and Moroccan touches. Spacious rooms ideal location excellent food and service and a charming host ( Thankyou Stefania) who is ready to do anything to make your stay a delight. They’ll even mail back a child’s toy if you leave it behind! We will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Steven V wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad, fabulous location, amazing views!
Review_Text: Very special boutique hotel in the middle of Marrakech. You are greeted by a ceremonial hand-washing with rose water and calming mint tea. The beautiful courtyard is serene and the roof deck is the true highlight. The service was attentive and welcoming. Highly recommended for a unique and special stay.

Review_Date: Becky W wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Title: Wonderful and beautiful place to stay!
Review_Text: We had such a wonderful time at 72 Riad Living! Everyone was so friendly helpful and welcoming. The breakfasts were also delicious! The hotel itself is stunning and we will certainly be staying again this year. Such a calm and relaxing atmosphere despite being in the heart of the city - would hugely recommend!

We had a wonderful stay at Riad 72 for the first few nights of our recent trip to Morocco. Having planned the stay with Stefania prior to the pandemic then having to postpone and reschedule for 2 years later I had plenty of build-up looking forward to our stay here - the hotel and Stefania and staff lived up to our expectations! The riad is simply beautiful - an oasis in a quieter but still central part of the Marrakesh medina. And the staff could not have been more gracious friendly and helpful. We also had dinner our first night at the restaurant there which was excellent and highly recommended! Thanks Stefania and team for a great stay!

What a beautiful riad - a little gem in the middle of the bustling city providing an oasis of calm. Stefania and the staff are extremely friendly attentive and helpful. Very clean hotel and meticulous attention to detail. Will definitely stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed one week at this beatiful Riad. Close to the right part of the Souk. Polite helpful and kind personal. Very fresh and clean. Besutiful details everywhere! The breakfast was local och so yummy! A perfect place to go back to becuse we certainly will do so.  Looking forward the pool on the rooftop they are working on as this was the only thing I missed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Silvia G wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad72 for a few nights and everything was excellent. Beautifully updated and welcoming. The manager does a personal welcome and provides lots of great information about Marrakech. Meal service lunch and breakfast was outstanding. We stayed in the room with the private roof top and it was great. Highly recommend it!

Great location quiet yet a short walk to the souks. Clean comfortable rooms with every you'd expect from a 5* hotel and more.  In house restaurant serves good food. Breakfasts are amongst the best - everything is fresh and portions are generous.  Service is outstanding staff courteous lots of attention to details. The Manager Stefania is an outstanding host. Highly recommended we will be back look no further.

Review_Date: Janice H wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: I highly recommend staying in 72 Riad Living if you find yourself in Marrakech. The Riad organized our transfer from the airport and took great care of us from the second we arrived. The Riad is a beautiful property and is in a great location. The staff were wonderful hospitable and incredibly helpful especially Stefania. I was exchanging emails with Stefania before our arrival and she helped organize dinners and tours for us. When we arrived at the property the staff greeted us warmly and did a traditional had wash and served us a traditional mint tea with cookies. The Riad was incredibly cozy and you felt like your were in your own home. The food at the Riad was incredible!!! The breakfast was delicious and I highly recommend the restaurant for dinner. The chicken tajine was amazing. Our weather wasn't great so we weren't able to take advantage of the rooftop terrace but it is a lovely spot to spend some time when the weather permits. I can't speak highly enough of this property and the staff and I will definitely stay there again when I am back in Marrakech.

Review_Title: The perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the Souk
Review_Text: My 18-year-old daughter and I had a 4 day stay in Marrakesh and 72 Living was the perfect place to get away from the stresses of her A level studies and my busy job.    From the moment we entered through the heavy wooden door nothing was too much trouble. We were warmly greeted with the infamous Moroccan tea and treats that never ceased to flow. We loved the ambience of the Riad so much that in fact 3 out of the 4 nights we chose to eat dinner at night because the food was divine the service exceptional and it was the perfect retreat after a busy bustling day in Marrakesh and the surrounding areas.    We were so sad to leave and cannot wait to return. I'd highly recommend the Hamman and massage which was heavenly. The location was perfect to get a real sense of the myriad of Morrocan streets whilst allowing the visitor to relax to the smell of orange blossom and the gentleness of the running water.    Anyone that visits here is in for a treat.

Review_Title: Excellent location, excellent value, excellent staff
Review_Text: The staff at Riad 72 Living were exceptionally good from the moment our bags were collected (and then carted through narrow bustling alleys to the riad's front door) to the time we reluctantly checked out after a blissful three days and nights. Drinks were delivered to the roof terrace with a friendly smile ordered on the handy cellphones they give each guest for that purpose and to provide any assistance you might need when out and about in the Medina.    Our room was beautiful and large with an enormous shower room both decked out in elegant Moroccan style. Although our room was quite dark as a result of only two small windows (something to do with the original building planning permission and character) our accompanying friends' rooms were brighter being in a more modern part of the building. We were shown some alternative rooms and realised ours was actually preferable with far more original touches and went on to enjoy its coolness in the evening.    The roof terrace is large with panoramic views of the city and Atlas Mountains and comfortable seating areas and sun loungers - a wonderful place to relax with a drink listening to the prayers from the mosques after a day of haggling and sightseeing in the labyrinthine markets.    The riad is only a few minutes' walk to the markets and palace and it would be harder to think of a more convenient place for tourists to be based. It is set a few streets back from the main thoroughfares and so also - conversely - enjoys a tranquillity you actually very much need after the hustle and bustle of the day's sightseeing.    The riad has its own spa which we didn't use but our friends rated it superb. Breakfast under the shade of the palms in the courtyard was both delicious and peaceful - a mixture of Moroccan traditional fare with French/Western influences. Something for everyone. We were really only there for a long weekend and didn't dine there in the evenings but the facility is available and the food looked amazing.    You won't be disappointed and the prices are very reasonable.

Myself and my girlfriend has such a wonderful stay at 72 Riad Living. The place itself is beautiful relaxing and serene. The staff are incredibly attentive friendly and make you feel looked after at all times. The morning breakfast is great the roof terrace is gorgeous and we even treated ourselves to a hamman which was perfect. We couldn't recommend this place more.

Review_Date: Gabrielle N wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: 72 Riad Living was the perfect place for us to stay on holiday. The staff were incredibly attentive and friendly the breakfasts were delicious and generous our room was immaculate with a gorgeous bathroom (and huge bath!) and the decor is beautiful. Would highly recommend!

What an absolute treat! An oasis of calm in the middle of the hustle and bustle. The team that looked after us couldn’t do enough to make us feel welcome. Every little detail was thought of and delivered with a smile. The atmosphere whether eating on the terrace in the library or in the courtyard was thoughtful and considered and the food more than lived up to the beautiful surroundings.  We were made to feel very safe and local knowledge was invaluable.  We stayed in 3 different rooms for the experience. The beds were enormous comfortable with beautiful cotton bed linen. Bathrooms were individual and interesting with everything thought of. Everywhere was spotless but with plenty of character. Our first visit to Marrakech but it won’t be our last and Riad72living has set high standards and we wouldn’t go anywhere else for our return visit as we wouldn’t want to be disappointed. Can’t recommend highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tim P wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Title: The perfect place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: Riad 72 is a great place to stay in Marrakech with really lovely staff headed by Stefania. Nothing is too much trouble and all the guests are made to feel very welcome. The riad is tranquil with spotless rooms a lovely dining area and a great roof terrace to drink cocktails as the sun goes down. Tours restaurant reservations taxis transfers hammams and restaurant bookings are all effortlessly arranged. The breakfasts are excellent too with fresh fruit yoghurt eggs and an abundance of breads cakes and pancakes. You can even have an excellent dinner in the evening. You want for nothing more when staying in Marrakech with the souks only a five minute walk away.

Review_Date: Neil H wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: 72 Riad Living is a gem of modern elegance and luxury in the heart of the Medina. Every staff person was so kind attentive knowledgeable and caring. They exceeded our expectations in every respect anticipating our needs arranging wonderful guides making dinner reservations and organizing interesting and fun experiences. The food at their restaurant was delicious and the room’s impeccably clean. I would give it six stars if I could.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Caroline d wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: My daughter and I have just spent a wonderful time in Ryad 72. We always felt welcome by Stefania ad the team and the rooms were extremely comfortable with a great service. We had the suite with private terrace and private jacuzzi. very nice experience. Wood fire place at night in the living room with good atmosphere. The location is great as well quite close from the souk and very very quiet as well. I highly recommend this place. Special greetings for the fine decoration and interior design in every corner!

Review_Title: Second visit and still as perfect
Review_Text: My friend and I first stayed at 72 in 2016 during out first trip to Marrakech and absolutely loved it so when we returned with our other halfs it was Riad 72 we chose to stay at. The riad has expanded since our last stay and every detail is just as wonderful. All the staff are friendly and make you feel immediately at home Stefania gave us a particularly warm welcome as we were return guests which was a lovely touch.    We ate at Le Table du 72 on our first night and the food was brilliant perfect for the first night after a day's travelling.    This was our 4th trip to Marrakech and can say that 72 has one of the best locations in the city being close to Dar al Basha - it's a great reference point for taxis yet you are also walking distance to the medina (but still in a quieter location where you tnd to get hassled less. Also there are brilliant hammams in the surrounding streets).    We had booked a classic room and a jacuzzi suite and Stefania gave us adjoining rooms which sort of felt like we had our own little apartment - amazing. The weather was cool when we were there so it was a welcome treat to keep warm in the rooftop tub!    Stefania was telling us about further developments they are currently making to the riad so we cannot wait to return for a 3rd time to check them out! Thank you to all the staff at the riad.

Review_Title: Wonderful stay for a first-timer to Riads in Marrakech
Review_Text: 72 Riad Living is the perfect place to stay in Marrakech if you want to experience living in a Riad in the Medina. The location a few minutes walking to Dar El Bacha is strategic as most taxi drivers will recognize the place. It is also only about 15 minutes walking to the main square Jamaa El Fna. More importantly the service cleanliness and food were impeccable we really felt like we were being taken care of by a host family. Would recommend staying here if you want to experience a Riad lifestyle.

Review_Date: Ishaan Anand wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: Had an absolutely amazing time staying here the Riad it’s self was beautiful and very authentic feel. But the service was incredible. The staff were very welcoming and really helpful ( particularly Maria) and told us everything we wanted to know to about Marrakesh. Would 100% stay here again !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sevin Gallo wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: Fabulous staff stunning riad--- you cannot make a better choice in Marrakech. It is easy to find near Dar al Basha and a quick walk into the Medina. The room are styled to maximize relaxation and comfort. The in-house restaurant is magnificent. I cannot wait to return!

The Riad is very beautiful and pristine. The stuff was very nice. The front desk agent Majda was very welcoming and helpful she gave us plenty of recommendations and tips on how to navigate the Medina. The manager Ashraf was professional and made sure we get the best service possible. Overall great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Exceptional Stay with attentive staff and beautiful rooms
Review_Text: We have just completed a 6-night stay at the wonderful 72 Riad Living and we loved every minute! By booking directly through the Riad we were offered the best rate and a complimentary transfer to/from the airport.    Upon arrival our bags were whisked away by Aziz and we were taken through the maze of streets to the riad. Our room was gorgeous with high ceilings and beautiful furniture. The bathroom was large and had very modern fixtures and a hot shower with plenty of water pressure.    Breakfast each morning was an eclectic and delicious feast with fresh-cooked eggs fresh fruit cheese yogurt a changing daily baked item like pancakes and a bakery basket of Moroccan pastries and breads. The service was magnificent and by day two our server knew what we liked. In the evening we enjoyed the beautiful rooftop terrace with some truly delicious local wines served by the staff. The view of the medina mosques and sunset will be memories we will carry with us forever.    The staff were without exception extremely attentive fluently multilingual and well-directed by the amazing manager Stefania. She was always available and ensured that everything was perfect. She helped us plan our dinner reservations and Atlas Mountain excursions.    We were very sad to leave and are already strategizing our return to Marrakech and the beautiful 72 Riad Living with friends inshallah!

Review_Title: Really, it’s the place to be
Review_Text: A magical place that is definitely worth a visit. We really appreciated the quality of all the services the availability of Stefania and her entire team lead by the very kind Achraf.
