The whole team took great care of us from reception to departure. The Riad is sumptuous very clean and well equipped. We stayed on the patio it's really a magical experience (the candles the fountain the fragrances the Moroccan tea and even the music). Eating a delicious food on the roof with a magnificent view of Marrakech by night is an unforgettable experience.    The location of the Riad was very practical for us because it is right next to the famous Dar El Bâcha museum and its very popular coffee (you might need to book before) for lovers of great blinded coffee and also tea. Last but not least the Riad is very close to Jamaa Lafna place and the shops in the Medina.    To cut long story short the 72 Riad Living is kind a very nice experience to reconnect with things we love to do when we need a break to recharge the batteries.    We can't wait to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Early Visit after the end of Covid restrictions
Review_Text: We finally got to make our much postponed visit (due to Covid restrictions on travel to Morocco) to Marrakech and 72 Riad Living. We were returning for a second visit (we first visited in 2019). this time we brought our teenaged daughter and my wife's 90 year old father. The city was still quite empty of tourists which made the experience so much the better.    The Riad was a sea of tranquility in a location that was within the franetic souk. The building is a beautiful old "place" with its central courtyard which serves as the restaurant and breakfast area. Around this courtyard on two levels are the bedroom each one unique. We had 3 rooms for our party and each room had its own special character. Our daughter stayed in the room that had its own roof terrace which she was really excited by (something that teenagers on holiday with their parents is not always the case !). While my father-in-law had a ground floor room in the extension to the Riad which suited him perfectly. The staff could not do enough for us ensuring that our stay was truly memorable. The continental style breakfasts were a truly magnificent spread of fruit pastries pancakes jams honey teas and coffee (eggs were also available). The perfect start for a long day in the city.    As mentioned in previous reviews the both rooms & bathrooms were all spotlessly clean. Why would anybody want to stay in one of the international hotels on the outskirts of the city when they could get a much more charismatic experience in this beautiful Riad and be located right in the middle of the old city.    The Riad would also arrange day trips to locations outside of Marrakech which were conducted on an individual party basis - i.e. just our family and a driver. We took a trip up into the Atlas mountains which was such a contrast to the city and hugely interesting to get an appreciation of the Berber people of the mountains.    As noted this was our second visit and we would not hesitate to book the Riad again when we visit Marrakech again. It makes a great base to explore both the Souk and the other areas of the city.

Review_Date: Gerdi V wrote a review Feb 2022
Review_Text: We enjoyed every day .  Lovely staff .  Clean and comfortable rooms.  Great breakfast .  Everybody is looking after you.  The rooftop is super to lay down in the sun and  drink a cocktail.  We come back again 👌🏽👌🏽💋💋  Dick. Anne Lau and Gerdi  Holland
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Albert G wrote a review Dec 2021
Review_Text: Stefania and her team are doing a great job. The Riad is superb the service is perfect and location wonderful. We will repeat. Thank you! Unfortunately we had no time to enjoy the restaurant. We will next time.

Review_Date: Mona Q wrote a review Dec 2021
Review_Text: Living 72 is a hidden treasure Boutiqe hotel in Marrakech the calmness and freshness you feel as soon as you enter the hotel is beyond this world. The clean rooms bedsheets the middle court with the open sky and fresh breath. All that add the magical touch to this hotel. The hotel owner Stafenia is always around to welcome the visitors and the hotel staff are warm friendly and around 24/7 helping with any need. The rooms decoration and style are amazing. Loved the stay at this boutique hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Aicha O wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Text: We stayed in the riad for 4 nights and leaving has never been so hard! To be honest best Riad of the medina so far! So calm and particular… aesthetically speaking amazing but also on human side we found a team very passionate about their job always present without being disturbing. Every detail of our experience in the riad was so precious and curated but also very natural and spontaneous. One of the best memories of Marrakesh. The riad is so stunning that it becomes difficult to choose weather go visiting the city or staying in and enjoying its beauty!  Thanks all the team and specially Stafania!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was a bit more than we wanted to spend but it was gorgeously appointed quiet and the food was excellent. We ate two dinners there and both were outstanding. We brought our own wine for one dinner and the corkage fee was a bit pricey at €9. The staff were very attentive and quick to respond. Located just outside the souks it made for easy transport and walking. Rooms were huge and we opted for the private terrace which wasn´t necessary because the riad was only half full and we rarely saw anyone else. Early November weather was perfect and nights were cool. A day trip to the Atlas mountains via private guide was worth it (approx. €150 for two including lunch and hike to falls). One piece of advice ... don´t bring your credit card when shopping for carpets until you know what you want and are ready to bargain. We would stay here again although it is a splurge and we didnt really spend that much time in the riad. They are expanding it by 8 rooms for 2022.

Review_Date: Renato M wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Text: Our family stayed at 72 last week and it was a lovely experince. The Riad is beautiful and it was a right decision to stay at the city center that has so much to offer. Stefania arranged a guide transfers day excursions to the desert...flawless is every detail.  Riad Staff really make you feel at home and food is also outstanding. Highly recommend to stay there to have a great feeling of Marrakesh and its surroundings. Thank you Stefania and all the team for having us and hope to see you again next time.

Review_Date: Natasha I wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at 72Riad Living for our honeymoon and had the most romantic experience! From the moment you enter the Riad you get transported to a different world full of beauty relaxation and literally the best hospitality we experienced on our 10-day journey. The rooms are gorgeous with plenty of privacy the beds are very comfortable the rooftop terrace is one of the highest in the medina and was perfect to play some backgammon with a glass of wine at sunset. The food was also incredibly delicious! But the thing about the hotel truly was the customer service we felt like we were staying with family. One other thing to mention is the location. It's perfect walking distance to the souks through a more calm route. Not to mention just a few blocks from Le Jardin Secret and Dar Bacha. Would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Marrakech and wants a genuine and comfortable riad experience in a very convenient location.

Review_Date: Jordy v wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Text: Thank you very much Stefani we had the best time at Riad 72 Living. I can recommend this Riad to anybody coming to Marrakesh. The rooms were amazing and the service they provide was impeccable. Thank you

Thank you once again for your excellence in every way.  This is our 4th time to your Riad and we love it so much we brought along another family to marvel in the splendor. Absolutely outstanding in every way. From the moment you walk through the door we were nurtured - spoilt in fact by the amazing team and stunning location. 10 Stars!!  Above and beyond.  Merci Leah Jonny and Freya
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Maybe my 4th visit to Riad 72 - it only gets better - Stefania and her team run the best Riad in Marrakech without doubt - I instantly feel welcome relaxed and at home - its subtle and sophisticated perfectly curated staffed with the most genuinely nice people you can meet ideally located and faultless - I have left no more than 3 reviews on TA in my life and only when I am truly taken aback by a place - Riad 72 is simply the best experience you can have - thank you

Review_Date: Simon C wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Thank You Stefania for being a great host we really appreciated the time you spent checking us in and explaining the local area. The staff were all really friendly and helpful and the food was excellent    Regards

We stayed in a deluxe room which was just lovely. It was very spacious for the two of us and we loved our 2mt tub. We were blessed with fantastic weather and were able to enjoy lunch and dinner in the expansive rooftop overlooking the Medina. Meals taken in the restaurant were excellent and we loved its cozy lighting. We received five star service throughout our stay from a fabulous team who were working incredibly hard. Nothing was too much trouble and everyone was so friendly and kind. Can’t wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the best hotels in the world I have stayed at!
Review_Text: What an amazing experience staying at 72 Riad Living. From the moment I arrived to when I departed the service was 5 star from every member of staff- housekeepers support staff morning servers evening servers massage management. It is a beautiful hotel relaxed with fantastic food. I had a Hammam and massage which was wonderful. I also booked a half day tour which was great to see the city with a solo guide. Stefania gave a great recommendation for lunch at the Grand Cafe de la Poste which was amazing. Overall one of the best hotel experiences I have had while travelling the world. Would high recommend to stay!  highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Steven Seifert wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Stefania’s gorgeous riad is truly perfect! It is a peaceful retreat from the busy Marrakech medina. The service is truly impeccable! We had a lovely breakfast prepared for us every morning. Stefania also took the time out to give us a detailed map of the city and give us recommendations on where to go and where to eat. We had a wonderful trip and would highly recommend visiting this amazing riad in this beautiful country!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad 72 offers a beautiful blend of masculine energy with a feminine softness combined with the warmth of home. From arrival to departure the staff was attentive flexible and friendly with an aim to please.  The food was delightful and the amenities are superb!  Book your stay today!

Review_Date: Nathalie M wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: This is my 6th stay at Riad 72 and it never fails to impress me. We stayed in the Junior suite this time which was lovely great space both in the room and on the private rooftop the jacuzzi was lovely and refreshing in the heat.  The managers and staff are as welcoming and helpful as always nothing is too much trouble.  We felt very safe with the Covid precautions they had put in place.  The food is delicious  I would definitely recommend

Review_Date: S N wrote a review Aug 2021
Review_Text: We had the most wonderful stay at 72 Riad Living. The hotel is beautifully designed with clean large rooms and the staff go over and beyond to ensure you have the perfect stay. It is very close to the airport and also the top destinations and souks you want to visit yet is a pure escape from the bustling city outside the hotel doors. The food was delicious and we couldn’t recommend this hotel more if visiting Marrakesh. We look forward to returning. Thank you Stefania and the team at 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing Riad in the Marrakesh medina
Review_Text: Fantastic Riad! Very tastefully decorated and conveniently located in the heart of the Medina. The dinner was delicious very refined with great vegetarian options. Stefania and her staff were absolutely amazing. Great service for a beautiful place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: 72 Riad Living is absolutely perfect. Right in the Medina the Riad has been perfectly renovated and is a lovely blend of traditional living and Italian elegance. The food is also quite special (we had a lovely breakfast and an absolutely delicious diner). Our stay was simply perfect and Stefania and her staff made us feel very much at home. Would definitely recommend 72 Riad Living and look forward to coming back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad72 is an amazing oasis in the Marrakech Medina. The interior is incredibly stylish elegant yet modern. The service is impeccable; the manager Stefania really took great care of us through out the entire stay. We ended our stay with a lovely dinner at the rooftop overlooking the Medina. I would really recommend this place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jameela M wrote a review Jul 2021
Review_Text: Stefania and her team at 72 are amazing! The Riad was so beautiful and looked exactly like the photo's. The room was very spacious and clean and the bed was very comfortable. It was truly an oasis away from the bustling streets. The team at 72 was what made the Riad feel like home. Everyone was so friendly and really went above and beyond to make sure we felt comfortable and I will never forget my experience here. I would highly recommend staying here because you truly get the best service.  Thank you so much Stefania and all the lovely staff!

Review_Date: Cameron B wrote a review Jun 2021
Review_Title: Riad 72 Living is Open Again and Simply the Best!
Review_Text: Riad 72 Living was our first stop in a two-week trip to Morocco and it sure was the right choice! We spent four nights there and from the moment we arrived knew it was the right place to stay in Marrakech. Coming out of the Marrakech Medina and into the unassuming front door we were immediately transported into an oasis of fragrance chirping birds palm trees and trickling water. The owner Stefania was incredibly helpful our entire stay. Our room had a cell phone that had contacts programmed in already which was super considerate and although we never had to use it we carried it with us until we were able to get our SIM cards working in Morocco. The staff (Aziz and Fatiha) were incredible! So kind so gracious so patient with our bad language skills. They work so hard to make their guests comfortable and they’re simply the best. What a team! The food is wonderful the rooms are beautiful the nooks and spaces around the riad are tastefully furnished and cozy. It’s hard to pick the best thing about the riad! This was simply an amazing stay and we wish Riad 72 the best as Marrakech recovers from 2020.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I cannot recommend this riad enough! Not only is it beautiful but I have never had better service anywhere including some very expensive hotels. Stefania Aziz and the whole team took fabulous care of us witHout being obtrusive. Wonderful experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: The Perfect Place to Stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: Of all the places we stayed during our two weeks in Morocco Riad 72 living was definitely my favorite. Stepping into the property was like a breath of fresh air in a busy humming city. Our room was incredible and the bed was exceedingly comfortable. The local cell phone was an extremely useful touch! But what really made our Riad 72 Living experience exceptional was the staff. Stefania Aziz Fatihah and the rest of the staff went out of their way to make us comfortable. From helping us with our bags providing recommendations/directions and serving wine and olives in the evening on the patio we couldn't have asked for more. We were absolutely charmed and wouldn't hesitate to stay at Riad 72 Living upon our return to Marrakech!

Review_Date: Dov K wrote a review Feb 2021
Review_Title: 72 RIAD LIVING – ELEGANT RETREAT – HOME AWAY FROM HOME
Review_Text: 72 Riad Living is an exquisite boutique luxury hotel elegantly decorated as if you are in the Garden of Eden yet in the heart of the Medina. Designed for lovers of hotels where every piece of architecture is unique. It is with elegant interiors magnificent mature gardens and immaculate service. Every inch of this palatial-like property makes you feel as though you arrived in some elegant retreat in an Arabian kingdom. It is the essence of true luxury!    Management & Team  As a Hotelier myself with 40+ years’ experience everything starts with Management! They are exceptional to say the least and worth every penny if not more! The Management and Team will stop at nothing to ensure all your needs and desires are met during your stay giving much prestige to the 72 Riad Living label they do not miss an inch. I salute them! Truly 5-star excellence!    Guest Relations  Although the load factor is low due to COVID nothing is sparred with relation to obtaining the high-end luxury at the 72 Riad Living. The grounds are magnificently kept with gardens surround. It is a true paradise.    Service  The service is most impressive from all involved; from the GM Sales Front Desk Wait Staff Maitre De and Bellman. All are fully involved in the success of the Hotel and are very happy to try and accommodate all requests. Everyone from right at the entrance and lovely staff welcoming you on arrival offering assistance with your luggage to the wait staff and room upkeep staff are committed to exceed your expectations with their genuine and discreet service that defines signature 72 Riad Living Luxury. The hospitality of the Management and staff is “Outstanding”.    Location  The hotel has a great location with breath taking views with a wonderful rooftop terrace where you can bathe in the sun or enjoy the romance of evening sunset and dine under the stars. They are within walking distance to the medinas.    Bar/Dining  The Bartenders are very knowledgeable and friendly. The service for breakfast and world class dining is outstanding from the Maitre D to the wait staff. They are eager to please trying to accommodate even personal choice requests with a “Special Touch” and elegant silverware to boot. The Moroccan gourmet cuisine is delectable. Complimentary mint tea and pastries are abundant to savor.    Cooking Class  You truly can become fully immersed in the culture and tradition by joining in the very intimate class.    Accessibility/Transportation  Transportation is a breeze as they offer very professional transportation options to include day trips etc.  The concierge is pleased to assist with any private tour ultimate experience to explore excursions to the Atlas Mountains etc. Complimentary airport pick up is included.    Accommodations  Villas are exquisitely decorated with the finest. High ceilings luxury bedding and linens. Bathrooms are equipped with all amenities and richness. The balconies give the warmth and feeling as if you are in your own private exclusive estate. Each room is furnished with gorgeous furniture works of art and sculptured ceilings synonymous with the charm and elegance of Morocco.    Pool/Spa  The pools are spectacular some with magnificent views almost picture perfect. The Spa has a great team which is professionally staffed with very high standards including a Turkish Hammam (steam room) and a variety of specialty treatment therapies.    Overall  I highly recommend and salute 72 Riad Living as a place to relax and unwind to enjoy the ambience and ultimate romantic escape. This hotel offers the highest level of service with a great value for those who choose to visit Marrakech. It is a must visit to enjoy and experience the distinct “TASTE of LUXURY”! Do not miss trying to stay at the best of the best to experience the “Royal Opulence” and “Exquisite Cuisine”.

We stayed here for our first trip to Marrakech in Sep 2019 but had returned home to a busy year and never got to leave a review until now!    Our first night was in a Junior Suite the one/s that lead upstairs to a private jacuzzi tub on the rooftop. The following day we left our luggage with the riad to visit a desert camp and returned to a Grand Suite due to room availability. I actually prefer the former - the grand suite while very spacious felt a little empty where as the rooftop of the junior suite offered a sense of calm from the busyness of the city and the souks. Overall the property was clean there was no language barrier and service was hospitable. It was our first time to Morocco and I found the layout and architecture of the riads within the medina an eye-opener.    The transfer from the airport is very handy as an employee will wait to pick you up from the street where cars can go no further and lead you through the maze of streets to the riad. They are happy to guide you to and from the street this way but you probably won’t need the service after venturing out once or twice.    The El F’na square adjacent souks and the Ben Youssef school (it was closed for renovation at the time) are all within walking distance and we hailed taxis only to take us farther out. They operate mostly by agreed price than the meter so you do need to develop a sense of what is acceptable versus opportunistic. The riad should be able to give an idea of what’s fair.    Some restaurants one might come across while researching the trip are actually part of a riad and they typically serve local cuisine (and breakfast every morning). We didn’t stay in Marrakech for more than a few days and personally I’d suggest not to overdo the riad dining and miss out on restaurants or cafes in the city some of which seemed very interesting.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Francesca de Giacomo wrote a review Oct 2020
Review_Title: The perfect location if you want to travel after the virus
Review_Text: After the whole coronavirus thing I was so afraid of traveling and going around the world. But fortunately I found the perfect riad! Everything is cleaned and checked all the times there are hand sanitizer stations throughout the whole hotel the staff always wear masks the whole time. I felt protected and safe inside this place. Adding on to this the location is just amazing the staff is always there if in need and the food was just over the top!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Fatima K wrote a review Sep 2020
Review_Title: I came here for part of my honeymoon!
Review_Text: Absolutely amazing place the service is great and the dècor is stunning. Not a single fault in the hotel and it was just so peaceful serene and romantic. You are welcomed with a smile moroccon tea and biscuits which just really brings you in to the authentic Moroccan culture and atmosphere. I was surprised with how beautiful the place was inside. Really showed me that beauty lies in hidden things and simplicity. I loved how this place was so different and unique to all the other luxury hotels i had visited before. Something you would only experience for your self!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: a great place especially if you are wanting peace quiet and luxury. staff very very attentive but invisible until you need them. great food and rooftop bar. you walk into the riad from busy streets passing charming tiny homes and shops. very close to main bazzar and shopping. great location

We cannot recommend Riad72 enough for anyone looking for a beautiful elegant and supremely run place to stay in the heart of Marrakech. We had the pleasure of taking the property exclusively for 2 days in February for a 30th celebration with friends from around the world joining us having never been before all of whom could not compliment the service setting design location (the list goes on…) enough!    The rooms are beautifully decorated with style and taste and are great sizes with some benefiting from their own terraces and private jacuzzi’s. I would highly recommend the Arte Suite or Junior Suite if looking to treat yourself (it’s worth it!) as you get to enjoy your own terrace overlooking the rooftops of Marrakech. Perfect for sunbathing and sundowners complete with jacuzzi..! Most come with walk-in showers and/or bath combos (shower over the bath) - but if that’s important to you just be sure to check with the very friendly staff who can help recommend accordingly.    The property itself is expansive and very impressive. The courtyards come alive at night with candles music and feels very romantic and alluring. During the day they provide a great space to escape the sun whilst still taking in the stunning sky above and through the large trees. The rooftops are exceptional - and provide many spaces to eat drink relax and sunbathe. Being above all the other neighbouring properties really allowed you to take in the great weather endless vistas and are a great vantage point for taking in the snowcapped Atlas Mountains in the distance.    The location is very convenient situated just outside of the souks (3/4 min walk) in an area that feels very safe. The hotel has a porter than can walk with you to wherever you would like to go - and can assist with taxis private cars etc. very easily. We enjoyed walking with guests in and out of the souks and to neighbouring restaurants with ease. The riad are also very good at organising private transport (we often had 4/5 Viano’s on the go to help with guests getting around airport transfers etc) and are very competitively priced whilst offering a very professional service. We would highly recommend using this service through them should you need it - it’s worth the little bit extra.    The food and drink menus are wide ranging for a property of this size with breakfast lunch and dinner all being of very high quality and beautifully presented. They have an excellent selection of Moroccan wines and dishes (the Valoublia rose is a particular favourite). Meals can be enjoyed all over the property / where you wish and would thoroughly recommend enjoying dinner there one evening - as the restaurant is very highly regarded in Marrakech.    For our event we of course got to sample all of the above and cannot say a bad word about it. The terrace was the perfect spot to welcome guests for a champagne and canapé reception as they were treated to the most spectacular sunset whilst taking in some local musicians. It made for some sensational pictures! The canapés were plentiful and very tasty - a must have if doing something similar. This was followed by the most exceptional dinner with a beautifully designed long table for 30 adorned with candles roses and glassware - which we left in Stefania’s hands who did an amazing job. The setting was incredible and truly memorable - as was the food they served to guests. Everything was done with such thoughtful attention to detail - brilliantly presented whilst being very wholesome and leaving no one going hungry! Our guests (and ourselves) were beyond impressed and felt very special throughout - which is exactly how we wanted them to feel. It was a flawless evening that then opened up into the courtyard with a little music more drinks and conversation flowing well into the night.    Last but by no means least was service - which was very expertly executed friendly and efficient throughout. A very special mention goes to Stefania who does such a fantastic job at leading the team and creating a very effortless and pleasant experience for guests. She works very hard to ensure everything is just right and this naturally feeds through to the team - all of whom could not do enough to help you. This is what transformed the experience and our stay for us - from housekeeping to waiters bellboys to restaurant managers… no request was too big and Stefania and the team did a brilliant job at taking much of the stress out of organising and running such a fantastic event.    We cannot thank them enough for helping create the most special memories for us - and wouldn’t think twice about staying there again. We have been to Marrakech nine times now and out of all the medina properties this has been our favourite. If you are looking for an authentic stylish elegant expertly-run riad in the Medina - do not think twice and go here! You will not be disappointed.

I spent 3 nights at the Riad with my mother. It was our first time in Marrakesh and loved every minute of it. The staff was super helpful and kind in advising us on where to go and what to see during our short stay. They also got us a guide for the day who was great.  The Riad itself is stunning and beautiful decorated with class. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The roof top terrace is stunning with great views and a well stocked bar. The food served in the restaurant was fabulous and creative. All the staff was lovely helpful polite and made our stay memorable. We will definitely be going back!

Review_Title: 72 Riad Living was amazing, except for the manager!
Review_Text: The riad was lovely well appointed conveniently located great food and attentive staff. I can't say enough about the food the service and the front desk gentleman who gave me an extra bar of soap!  I have been in the luxury tourism industry for 13 years and I have also traveled extensively for leisure and business since the 1980's. I can honestly say that the manager of the riad (who was not Moroccan) was arrogant and not accommodating.  We were a group of 13 adults traveling together from the US March 8-20. In light of the corona virus pandemic the manger should have been a little more flexible. We had one traveler who cancelled the trip 12 days before our arrival..the hotel policy was 14 day cancellation. The manager would not budge on cancelling the one room for a 4 night stay. We had a a total of 40 room nights. Seriously?!?!  Our tour guide who normally would have stayed at a less expensive property ended up staying in the beautiful room that the manager would not refund. The manager begrudged our tour leader for giving the guide that room (that was paid for). How dare the manager dictate who should stay in that room!  In any event my travel advisor friend (who was with us as our tour leader) will be organizing many more trips to Marrakech in the future and will not book this riad again. In this competitive hospitality business it is important to work with appreciative and understanding partners. It's a shame because the property was delightful.

We absolutely loved our stay at 72 Riad Living. The staff was warm and inviting the grounds were beautiful and the rooms well sized and maintained. We particularly loved breakfast as well as the rooftop. The location was perfect and made walking around the city very easy. My only *very* small complaint would be the lack of counter space in the bathroom. We would absolutely stay here again!

Review_Date: Frederic M wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Really nice riad with a beautiful view from the roof top. We had a suite with a private terrace to enjoy the jacuzzi in the evening and get a quiet breakfast in the morning. Restaurant offered really tasty food (we really enjoyed the lamb tanjia). Great service. I'd highly recommend this place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We've just returned to London from a beautiful weekend staying at 72 Riad Living. Stefania and the extended team were beyond accommodating. The property feels premium and authentic. The food and service were both world-class. In reality parts of Marrakesh can feel a little overwhelming (when wandering the souks and streets all day) but not in the areas around 72 Riad Living. There are so many fascinating tourist destinations within a short walking distance from the hotel and it is without a doubt the best possible location in the whole city. It is an incredible and safe place to stay. I would highly recommend you arrange airport transfers through them also as it makes the entire experience extraordinarily seamless and relaxing.

From our warm greeting by Stefania when we arrived offering traditional mint tea and treats to the amazingly beautiful setting 72 Riad exceed expectations. It was like an oasis of calm and exquisite beauty in the middle of the ancient media of Marrakech.

Review_Date: Kirsten W wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: A Beautiful Home Away from Home
Review_Text: What a lovely place—warm and genuine staff excellent amenities while still retaining an authentic homeyness and such a peaceful location down a quiet alley within the medina. Breakfasts in the riad’s center courtyard were delicious and served with so many smiles and the open-air rooftop lounge was a treat! We would definitely return on another trip to Marrakech ...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wonderful stay in Marrakech and the most perfect riad experience without a doubt.    Highlights:  1. Manager Stefania was always prompt in answering our emails and helping with the smallest requests.  2. She provided a fantastic overview to get our bearings around the medina at check-in  3. The riad is beautiful a great blend of modern and traditional elements with spaces to lounge about in and a cute rooftop terrace  4. Location is perfect for those who want to be in the medina but not in the thick of the chaos. Definitely more walking to get to the sightseeing but the closest parking is just 5 minutes away  5. We were given a local phone to use while in the riad and carry while walking around like having a personal concierge in your pocket!  6. Breakfast on the rooftop - Everything fresh delicious and locally sourced    The only thing that would have made our stay better is if we had booked a larger room we found the standard rooms a little small for 2 people. But since we were out most of the day this is minor.    Everyone on the staff went above and beyond in anticipating our needs and making us feel as comfortable as possible. Truly the service was so welcoming and genuinely warm. We hope to return soon and will be recommending it to our friends :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great atmosphere. Staff was extremely professional and well managed. I wasn't expecting the staff's attentiveness to be at such a high level. We were 3 instead of 2 and they accommodated us at the last minute with no issues. The staff seem to know intuitively when you want help and when you need space - an underrated skill in hospitality. We had drinks on the roof and dinner on the main floor. Pretty good food and again excellent service. I wished we stayed at this hotel longer as it was 1 of 2 hotels during this stay.

Review_Date: James W wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: 2 minutes from another way of life
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad spotlessly clean where every member of staff is at your service with a smile. Unable to find any negatives apart from the 40 steps up to the roof terrace but putting in a lift would spoil the authenticity of the building so no complaints from me.

Review_Date: Jonathan Kendall wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: We had a week in Riad 72 - we went there ten years ago and it was amazing - now it is perfection - every aspect is perfectly curated and the staff make you feel like you have come home - if you do not stay here you will miss out on the very best experience in Marrakech - I never leave reviews but Riad72 was truly exceptional and thoroughly deserves it - STAY

Review_Title: a hidden gem - you have to stay here
Review_Text: Riad 72 is just perfect for a stay in Marrakesh. A great location where you can walk to lots of places Wonderful rooms with enormous beds and amazing showers - which come into their own after you enjoy a 2 hour desert buggy safari delicious food amazing massages and most of all helpful friendly staff who help you make the most of the fantastic city providing you with maps phones and lots of great tips on where to go. Highly recommended.

Review_Date: Tue H wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: The essense of quality Riad living
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed for four nights in week 7 2020. The riad was everything we hoped for. Super surroundings very nice room and very nice staff.    At the same time the riad is situated in a good spot (no noise at all) close to almost everything. You can walk to almost any place worth seeing or get a cab very easily.    We dined at the restaurant the first night and this was a pleasant Morrocan tasting experience.    Should I recommend the management team one thing should it be to add some more variety to the breakfast serving. A small detail :-)    All in all. If you consider a trip to Marrakech you should absolutely consider Riad 72.    Br.    Tue Holmberg  Denmark

Review_Date: Charlotte D wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Everything was perfect. Choose this for a truly authentic luxury riad experience. Beautiful riad georgeous rooms tranquil atmosphere fantastic service great location. Fantastic food. Our very warmest recommendation.

The thing I loved most about Riad 72 is how Stefania and team made us feel so welcome and at home. They were happy to help with anything and made some great suggestions on things to see and do. We opted for a classic room which was beautiful and comfortable. It really was a little haven in the busy medina. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christina Ivanova wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: I had the chance for my holidays to visit a new place with my friends Marrakech. Even more unexpected we were able to find this lovely Riad. By looking at the excellent reviews online we decided to come here and we couldn’t have made a better decision. It is a small moroccan paradise.  The place as you can see from the pictures is very well cured and perfect to the last detail. The food was an extraordinary experience for our palate. We tried to try every dish on the menu unfortunately we couldn’t but at least now we have an excuse to come back!  Our biggest regards go to the manager Stefania and the staff which have been very attentive to every request we made and gave us the best advice.  Can not wait to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Paul N wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Absolutely loved it! Incredible location for exploring Marrakesh whilst also feeling secluded and relaxed. The service of the whole team was as good as anything I've experienced and the prices were very reasonable. Will definitely be going back!

Review_Date: Gabriella H wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: After camping in the desert for two nights we couldn’t have chose anywhere better to relax and unwind. Riad 72 was absolutely beautiful upon arrival we were greeted with Moroccan tea and felt completely looked after. It was stunningly decorated and so peaceful our room was spacious clean and the shower was fabulous!    Thanks to the all the staff at Riad 72 for making us feel so welcome.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for a long weekend and could not have asked for more in a riad. Great location beautiful spaces AMAZING staff and service delicious food.  We enjoyed drinks at sunset on the roof and lovely breakfasts and dinners in the downstairs courtyard. So pleased to have treated myself to a hammam and massage. Returning to the riad after a day exploring souks palaces and gardens was a real treat. I’d definitely stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had a great stay at 72 Riad Living! The staff was gracious and accommodating and the facility is really beautiful. All the rooms are different with a nice mix of classical architecture and modern design. They have a really nice rooftop where you can enjoy a sunset view of the city.    The breakfast service is lovely and includes your choice of eggs which was nice. The scrambled eggs have browned butter in them and they are addictive. We also enjoyed one dinner here and it was fantastic! The presentation was beautiful and the food was delicious.    It's an easy walk from the Riad to the markets so the location is great. Would definitely stay here again!

The Riad is beautiful my friends and I had an amazing time and the service very good. However... my credit card was stolen from my luggage which was retained by the Riad after checking out and before returning for collection and transfer back to the airport. Prior to this it had been kept in the bedroom safe. Riad did not take any responsibility for this which is extremely disappointing as it was not possible for this to have occurred anywhere else. Be ware...

Review_Date: Leyland T wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Had an amazing time we were celebrating our daughters birthday and from the moment we arrived we noticed the level of luxury and attentiveness we would receive for our entire stay. Stephania spent time with us when we arrived explaining everything the staff treated our daughter like their own the food was excellent - we stayed in a suite and can’t begin to say how beautiful and comfortable we were including our beautiful roof terrace - just had an amazing experience thank you to all the wonderful staff

Review_Title: Beautiful Boutique hotel with amazing service and great ambience!
Review_Text: Recently stayed at 72Riad Living. Unbelievable service led by Stephania and the team from the mint tea and cookies to helpful organisation of our trips which included venturing out to the Atlas Mountains and cooking school near the Médina! If you want your stay to be extra special I strongly recommend the Grand Suite incredibly romantic and memorable.

Review_Title: Lovely - peaceful oasis with style and charm
Review_Text: We stayed with 72 in January for a long weekend to Marrakesh - it was our first visit to Marrakech but we received a warm welcome which included a pick-up at the airport! We booked directly with Stefania and she arranged for the Manar room - which was lovely - the roof terrace was amazing - but with all the exploring- I don’t think we used it as much as I would have liked!  Breakfast was simple but tasty and the service from the staff was always prompt and friendly!  I would wholeheartedly recommend staying with Riad 72 and would most certainly rebook if we visit again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emily O wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Every aspect of stay was perfect. Beautiful stylish Riad.  Welcoming attention to detail courteous accommodating convenient safe.  Had been 9 years since our last trip to Morocco thanks to a wonderful stay at 72 Riad Living we plan to return again much sooner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a lovely little hotel with friendly but not in your face staff. The food was good and we especially enjoyed having breakfast each morning on the roof top terrace. Well situated to access what the old and new towns have to offer.

Review_Date: Luli T wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: We stayed there for a long weekend and they could not do enough to help us out. From private transport and arranging massages to the incredible food our stay was exceptional. It is perfectly situated for shopping and close enough to the airport to make everything super easy.  The food was delicious sumptuous breakfast and the most delicious evening meal.  One slight niggle is that the bathroom as a little small but the room was wonderful the bed comfortable and the decor super.  Will definitely stay there again.

We booked here on the recommendation of a friend and we were so glad we did. We booked a deluxe room which comes with either a big shower or tub and is either courtyard side or has a private terrace- we ended up with a courtyard facing and shower so if you have a strong preference I would request via email or phone in advance.    The service from start to finish was outstanding. We booked an airport transfer the driver was so professional and the car was immaculate and smelled great. A luggage porter was waiting for us and led the way we were greeted by mint tea and a breakdown of the area with a very helpful map.    We were so grateful we chose to stay here it was a very conveniently located respite from the souks and was incredibly tranquil. We didn’t try the spa but wish we had. The renovation with a local architect is incredible and every facet of the design is gorgeous. Everyone we interacted with was friendly and eager to help our room was beautifully decorated and the bed was comfortable. Make sure you eat a meal at the restaurant and that you enjoy a drink up on the roof at sunset both are can’t miss.    I really enjoyed breakfast especially the local cheese and honey. If you do get eggs consider splitting them as the omelette is quite large.    The only things that could be improved are is that it got a little chilly in the room at night (but keep in mind that this is in January) and that from the bathroom window even closed smoke seemed to come in from the street. I’m not sure the latter can be fixed.    The other tip I have is to avoid the taxi stand nearby if possible that is the only stand we were consistently ripped off at (10 euro for a short ride) and they refused to negotiate.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment I contacted the Riyad Stefania handled all of my queries and requests brilliantly promptly and with impressive care and attention. The Riyad is beautifully kept staff are excellent food and service are of a very high standard. We were looked after superbly and made to feel so welcome. The local mobile 'phone provided by The Riyad for the duration of our stay helped considerably with our visit. I can't recommend the Riyad and staff highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad 72 is a really special place and definitely somewhere we would love to go back to. Room was ‘Elle-Deco’-worthy; bed was really comfortable; breakfast was a real treat and I was delighted with the delicious gluten-free alternatives which appeared each day; staff kind and attentive; communal areas of the Riad beautiful. But the best moment for me was the hammam experience followed by a massage. Joyous!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Deserves all the accolades it receives
Review_Text: Perfect location wonderful design impeccable service delicious food and the warmest of welcomes. Recommend at least one dinner in the Riad and a schedule that allows one to linger over the excellent breakfast. Can’t wait to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tim J wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad 72 for 5 nights in the New Year. It is a magical place in a magical city. Everything about the Riad is right: the location the design and decor the rooms the amenities (including a small hamam and spa) the terrace the restaurant - all of which is made even more wonderful by the superb service from Stefania and her team: always warm and welcoming but never intrusive. Also great attention to detail eg the very useful map provided by the hotel which includes the best restaurants and shops.  We can’t wait to return - and can not recommend the Riad highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A beautiful oasis of a Riad to savor Marrakesh!
Review_Text: The architecture of this Riad is contemporary and it draws you in with its charm. The singing of the birds in the patio that is beautifully decorated by Stefania and her thoughtful staff is an experience to savor. Stefania has such personalized and thoughtful recommendations for us during our stay. The staff especially Mr. Ahmed helped us so much in connecting us with a wonderful chauffeur and guide that took us on an excursion from Marrakesh to Skoura. We are so grateful to him! Special shout out to Mr. Khaled on the breakfast staff for nourishing us so well every day before we head out on our explorations. Do not miss the roof top terrace…another opportunity to take in this beautiful city Marrakesh!

Review_Date: Ruth V wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Location is fantastic a short walk to major sites.  Hotel is clean and all the staff is attentive friendly and very helpful.  We were greeted by Stefania who gave us all the information we needed and more which is welcomed when you first arrive at a new city.  The lack of natural light in the room can make you a little disoriented but it was beautifully decorated and the comfy bed made up for it.  Totally recommend a sunset cocktail at the roof top bar

Review_Date: Julia R wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: 72 Riad Living offers an oasis of calm and tranquility with 5 star service in the centre of Marrakech. We loved it - from the meet and greet at the taxi point by the cheerful porter who loaded our luggage into his cart to trundle through the streets to the Riad to the delightful surroundings and traditional Moroccan accommodation. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace is a must.  All of the staff without question were exceptional nothing was too much trouble. Heartily recommend you stay in this beautifully converted Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mega P wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: TWAS CHRISTMAS IN THE RIAD....NOT JUST A HOTEL BUT AN EXPERIENCE.
Review_Text: From the beginning from our first contact with Stefania it was clear that this was going to be a special experience. She organised everything for us in advance airport pick up and drop off dinners in different restaurants dinner at La Table du Riad guided tour of the medina and souk by our excellent and vastly knowledgeable guide Latif to our personal escorted excursion through the Atlas Mountains to Tin Mel driven and guided by the resourceful Hassan who helped us with our conversational French en route. All yes all of the staff at 72 Riad are fantastic efficient professional helpful willing kind and warm. Needless to say the food was excellent from the amazing breakfast to the fantastic fine dining at La Table du Riad. Our room was so atmospheric and we loved the atrium with birds drifting in and perching in the palms and the rooftop and its views over the mosques to the Atlas mountains. whilst sitting listening to the muezzins calling as the sun sets over Marrakech All so different personal memorable and unique. 72 Riad is actually not a hotel it really is an experience and we loved it.

Review_Date: Judith D wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: The ideal spot for a Christmas break. Friendly helpful staff luxurious room good restaurant easy to walk to all the major sites. Stefania gave us great advice on what to see and what to book. The airport pick-up and drop-off were very efficient.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The tranquility and effortless efficiency of riad 72 complements the colour and noise of the souks in equal measure. Thank you to Stefania and the staff at Riad 72 for making sure we had a memorable stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at Riad 72 while on our honeymoon in Morocco. The hotel staff accommodated our every request and welcomed us from the first moment with smiles and mint tea. The rooms are spacious and newly renovated. We enjoyed the hotel's restaurant lovely rooftop bar and the delicious complimentary breakfast each morning. We highly recommend taking a cooking class!

Review_Date: Ms S wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived at RIAD72 we were blown away with the amazing interior and friendly staff who greeted us warmly and made us feel incredibly welcome. They were always willing to help us with whatever we needed at any hour of the day!    The rooms were spacious and well equipped with easy access to the rooftop terrace hosting endless views of the city.    The restaurant is a must with a farm to table concept and healthy options on a seasonal menu.    We would defiantly recommend a stay at 72 RIAD for an authentic experience of Marrakech where tradition meets modernity close to the heart of the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Pooja P wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Thank you to riad 72 for an amazing stay. The staff was very attentive provided us with cell phones had a security guard to accompany when walking at night had the best mint tea in morocco and were beyond helpful when helping us plan our itinerary! The hotel is beautiful & clean and had amazing service! We Would highly recommend this Riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My sister and I stayed 6 nights at this magical Riad we had the family suite on top flor with private roof terrace and jacuzzi where we watched amazing sunsets and hundreds of birds flying.  The service was excellent from picking up our luggage during arrival/departure excellent in room made service breakfast in our own private balcony excellent restaurant.  The inner patios were beautiful beds were very comfortable luxury linens room decor was modern Moroccan very chic.  We ate several meals here and always were fresh really excellent quality and variety. After a day of walking it always felt like coming back to an oasis with top food and nice cold juices.  Expect to use stairs (no elevator) and 5 min walk from street curve through commercial but lovely walkway.  Location is really great close to market museums secret garden (a gem) ATM money exchange taxi stop. You can walk for hours around the area always felt safe and don’t be afraid to get lost in the old market with google maps you are good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had a fantastic stay at Riad 72. Stefania and her staff were wonderful always ready to help. The room was beautifully furnished breakfast and dinner delicious the rooftop incredible for sunsets. Wonderful place we hope to come back one day!

Review_Date: 42 big apples wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I'm glad to have chosen Riad 72 and wished I had stayed more than 2 nights there. I could have easily spent a whole day in the Riad alone lounging and relaxing. The hammam and massage experience were both exactly what I was looking for as well after a long flight. Breakfast was wonderful facing the courtyard with a few little birds coming by to say hi. I wished I had the same courtyard setting at my own home! The staff from the night guards to the porters knew exactly the right balance between being friendly while providing space and privacy. Location was excellent as well being right beside the medina but not being in the middle of the hustle and bustle of it all.

Great luxury rooms and customer service. Rooms are large especially the suites which I would recommend. Brilliant decor and service by all the staff. Location is also quite good and not far from medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Riad 72 was such a pleasant surprise. A beautiful oasis designed in a modern Moroccan style. Friendly staff lovely breakfast included and also a great restaurant for dinner. I booked the suite and was delighted to discover my won private terrace. The room itself was huge and I loved the modern bathroom layout.    Make sure to book your main course ahead of time as everything is made from scratch and each dish can take 45-1 hour to prepare. Awesome they provide an airport shuttle and it can also take you to a different hotel location if needed. Incredible touches like the personalized map unique experiences they can help book and the local phone they give you in case you need assistance are just so thoughtful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: I absolutely loved my stay at Riad 72. We did a lot of research on the best Riad's before arriving in Marrakech and we were not at all disappointed. We elected to get the transfer service from the airport to the hotel which was a little more expensive than a taxi would be but totally worth it. It would be a hard introduction to Marrakech to be dropped at a taxi stand and then try to figure out where to go. So someone was waiting at the drop off point for us carried our bags in a cart and led us to the Riad. The location is totally perfect away from the bustle of the crowded streets and quiet inside. We were presented with a traditional hand washing and tea and cookies.    Our room was so lovely well appointed and probably one of the most comfortable beds and comforters that I have ever slept on. I seriously wish I knew which brand the comforter was because I would have purchased it. We didn't get to enjoy the roof but we did go up and it was very pretty. We only had breakfast at the Riad (delicious) but several people were enjoying dinner each night and the atmosphere looked very nice. We had to leave very early in the morning to catch a tour on our departure morning and they were so kind to prepare us a to-go breakfast. It was completely dark and very early and the gentleman that prepared it for us was just SO gracious and hospitable and it truly made us feel so special.

Review_Title: Beautiful, luxurious riad in a great location.
Review_Text: Riad 72 is wonderful! I stayed at multiple riads while traveling in Morocco and Riad 72 was by far the most luxurious and has the most professional staff.    We used the hotel shuttle I would recommend if you are arriving into Marrakech for your first time. If you’re familiar with the medina and taxi areas you could manage on your own. It was about a 2 minute walk from the El Bacha taxi stop very easy.    The staff was very welcoming and accommodating. We had to leave very early and the employee working at 6am prepared a breakfast to go for us (delicious fruit and individually wrapped breads and sweets! Thank you!) and offered to carry our bags to the taxi stand. We met with the manager upon arrival and she gave us an overview of the hotel and tips for Marrakech. A member of the cleaning staff went into the room at least twice a day to tidy up and refill toiletries it was not needed but very much appreciated.    The hotel itself is stunning. The roof is relaxing and has amazing views there are TWO beautiful corridors to relax eat and take pictures in. The breakfast was great and I was so happy to have a bowl full of fresh pomegranate seeds! Many places serve the juice but not the actual seeds. The coffee at Riad 72 is very good. I found it near impossible to find good coffee outside of this riad. The best was THE MOST COMFORTABLE bed I’ve slept in in my entire life. The rooms are quiet and comfortable with great wi-fi. The location is perfect to the medina and to a main road/taxis. My only regret is not having dinner here. I would come back for dinner if given the opportunity.    I would recommend anyone to stay here. It was lovely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Paul A wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Amazing service and hospitality. Wonderful location and fantastic staff that makes you feel comfortable at every turn. Rooms are exceptionally clean and well appointed. The AC was great as it was warm when we were there.

Our family had two rooms with and adjoining balcony which was lovely. Riad staff absolutely helpful and friendly. We requested a Hammom experience and was set up and a wonderful spa- one of our highlights of the trip and experience highly recommended! Location of Riad is perfect for all needs in Medina and surrounding area. We were really only there for breakfast time (included and delish) and at end of day after touring etc. - ample space for tea coffee rooftop drinks. Etc. rooms comfortable and each unique as expected. Had a lovely experience and would recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sarah Elizabeth wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We absolutely loved our stay at Riad 72. The rooms and accommodations were everything we hoped for and the breakfast each morning was the perfect way to ease into our Marrekech days. Stefania helped us book many excursions and day trips and we were taken care of fully logistics wise by the hotel. It was a perfect spot very close to the souks and other popular spots like La Mamounia and El Fenn – but this place is less than half the price and the same quality! A VERY authentic experience.

Review_Title: Best start of our trip to Morocco
Review_Text: Thanks to Stefania and her staff for a superb stay. I wish we could have stay longer!! Thanks for a great welcome and delicious food! The cooking class was one of the highlights of the trip. Going to the market with the restaurant chef was a superb experience! Thanks for the opportunity to cook and taste the best lamb and veggie tagines of the trip.

Review_Date: Ryan Seufert wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: This place was beautiful. This was our first experience in Morocco so we didn’t know what to expect.    It was a little difficult to find but it’s in a great location. Just about a 15-20 minute walk to the main square. The room we had was awesome! Didn’t get much chance to see the rooftop because the time of year and the weather.    People were nice and dinner and breakfast was amazing!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I went back and forth on whether to stay in the Medina in a Riad or to stay outside in a luxury hotel. 72 Riad combined the bests of both luxury in the Medina. The Riad is so much more charming and sumptuous than the photos show. Our room was bigger and nicer than we had expected and the tub was so deep and luxurious we both had to take a bath (which I would normally never do in a hotel). The Riad is in the heart of the Medina but still very easy to find and easy walking distance to any where you want to go in the area. The staff was friendly helpful and went out of their way to make you feel at home. Drinks on the roof top at sunset was a great break at the end of the day sightseeing before heading out to dinner (or staying in because the food in the road is also spectacular). If I had any complaint it was that our time there came too quickly to an end.

5* home away from home. beautiful Medina hideaway. Stephanie - the manager and all the staff are very kind and helpful. they gave us all the tips and trick to survive in the crazy Medina. rooms are unique and very comfy with beautiful design. for our dates they had only classic room available but next time we will go for higher category as we spotted the suites are amazing. make sure you book in advance. Delicious brekkie. Love chilling in the evenings on the red patio. Do use their airport transfer to connect swiftly as taxi won't get you to the doors and medina streets are pretty difficult to navigate.

Riad 72 was such a pleasant surprise. A beautiful oasis designed in a modern Moroccan style. Friendly staff lovely breakfast included and also a great restaurant for dinner. I booked the suite and was delighted to discover my won private terrace. The room itself was huge and I loved the modern bathroom layout.    Make sure to book your main course ahead of time as everything is made from scratch and each dish can take 45-1 hour to prepare. Awesome they provide an airport shuttle and it can also take you to a different hotel location if needed. Incredible touches like the personalized map unique experiences they can help book and the local phone they give you in case you need assistance are just so thoughtful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: I absolutely loved my stay at Riad 72. We did a lot of research on the best Riad's before arriving in Marrakech and we were not at all disappointed. We elected to get the transfer service from the airport to the hotel which was a little more expensive than a taxi would be but totally worth it. It would be a hard introduction to Marrakech to be dropped at a taxi stand and then try to figure out where to go. So someone was waiting at the drop off point for us carried our bags in a cart and led us to the Riad. The location is totally perfect away from the bustle of the crowded streets and quiet inside. We were presented with a traditional hand washing and tea and cookies.    Our room was so lovely well appointed and probably one of the most comfortable beds and comforters that I have ever slept on. I seriously wish I knew which brand the comforter was because I would have purchased it. We didn't get to enjoy the roof but we did go up and it was very pretty. We only had breakfast at the Riad (delicious) but several people were enjoying dinner each night and the atmosphere looked very nice. We had to leave very early in the morning to catch a tour on our departure morning and they were so kind to prepare us a to-go breakfast. It was completely dark and very early and the gentleman that prepared it for us was just SO gracious and hospitable and it truly made us feel so special.

Review_Title: Beautiful, luxurious riad in a great location.
Review_Text: Riad 72 is wonderful! I stayed at multiple riads while traveling in Morocco and Riad 72 was by far the most luxurious and has the most professional staff.    We used the hotel shuttle I would recommend if you are arriving into Marrakech for your first time. If you’re familiar with the medina and taxi areas you could manage on your own. It was about a 2 minute walk from the El Bacha taxi stop very easy.    The staff was very welcoming and accommodating. We had to leave very early and the employee working at 6am prepared a breakfast to go for us (delicious fruit and individually wrapped breads and sweets! Thank you!) and offered to carry our bags to the taxi stand. We met with the manager upon arrival and she gave us an overview of the hotel and tips for Marrakech. A member of the cleaning staff went into the room at least twice a day to tidy up and refill toiletries it was not needed but very much appreciated.    The hotel itself is stunning. The roof is relaxing and has amazing views there are TWO beautiful corridors to relax eat and take pictures in. The breakfast was great and I was so happy to have a bowl full of fresh pomegranate seeds! Many places serve the juice but not the actual seeds. The coffee at Riad 72 is very good. I found it near impossible to find good coffee outside of this riad. The best was THE MOST COMFORTABLE bed I’ve slept in in my entire life. The rooms are quiet and comfortable with great wi-fi. The location is perfect to the medina and to a main road/taxis. My only regret is not having dinner here. I would come back for dinner if given the opportunity.    I would recommend anyone to stay here. It was lovely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Paul A wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Amazing service and hospitality. Wonderful location and fantastic staff that makes you feel comfortable at every turn. Rooms are exceptionally clean and well appointed. The AC was great as it was warm when we were there.

Amazing service and hospitality. Wonderful location and fantastic staff that makes you feel comfortable at every turn. Rooms are exceptionally clean and well appointed. The AC was great as it was warm when we were there.

Amazing service and hospitality. Wonderful location and fantastic staff that makes you feel comfortable at every turn. Rooms are exceptionally clean and well appointed. The AC was great as it was warm when we were there.

Amazing service and hospitality. Wonderful location and fantastic staff that makes you feel comfortable at every turn. Rooms are exceptionally clean and well appointed. The AC was great as it was warm when we were there.

Amazing service and hospitality. Wonderful location and fantastic staff that makes you feel comfortable at every turn. Rooms are exceptionally clean and well appointed. The AC was great as it was warm when we were there.

Amazing service and hospitality. Wonderful location and fantastic staff that makes you feel comfortable at every turn. Rooms are exceptionally clean and well appointed. The AC was great as it was warm when we were there.

Amazing service and hospitality. Wonderful location and fantastic staff that makes you feel comfortable at every turn. Rooms are exceptionally clean and well appointed. The AC was great as it was warm when we were there.

Absolutely beautiful riad in a great location. Close walk to everything in the Médina but on a quiet street. The staff was wonderful and the rooftop bar was incredibly beautiful. Would absolutely stay here again—the rooms are stunning.

Review_Title: Nice private terrace with our suite
Review_Text: My daughter and I stayed here for two nights after leaving a Riad that had building work next to it!  This one was situated in a nice and quiet area. I booked a suite with sun beds & private terrace. We had a jacuzzi but didn’t use it as it was dirty inside. It was very nice to sit out alone. This was accessed by a narrow flight of stairs but worth it!  We had a lovely breakfast up there both days. It’s a set breakfast for everyone including omelette choice bread / pancakes and cakes ( mmm- delicious) yoghurt & fruit. So a good selection.  The room was nice & spacious & had a big double shower & separate toilet. Handy when sharing with your daughter!  Water is replenished daily.  The Riad has no pool but a cool seating area on the ground floor and a nice communal rooftop terrace with tables sun beds & small bar. It could definitely do with some nice plants up there to soften the area. It was a stark contrast from our previous Riad that had plants and flowers everywhere- making it much prettier !  Locationally it is in a quieter part of the Souks. It’s a 5/6 minute walk down alleyways to the main Souk & fairly busy all around.  A couple of staff were very friendly & helped me a lot on the last day with printing new boarding passes & medicine for my daughter- thank you. Xx  A couple were not so friendly.  Overall a nice stay in what is a spotlessly clean and well kept Riad.  Ps. Try the new Kabana bar for Sushi / Tapas as an alternative to Tagine etc!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Paul S wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Enjoyed a lovely long weekend and couldnt have picked a better place staff are so helpful and the hotel is amazing.  Quite area and beautiful room. Sunrise was out of this world from the roof terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Needed to walk up narrow stairs to room
Review_Text: Large well appointed with the extras you'd expect from a 5* but the steps are off putting. Lovely terrasse welcoming mint tea anytime. Need a guide for Marrakech medina. But easy to get out from Riad to go to local restaurants. Place to buy lovely wool fabric not far from where cars pick you up.

Excellent place to stay and call home.  Amazing staff . Aziz and all the people working there are always ready to help.  Wonderful food prepared from local sources at the restaurant.  We had a junior suite and it was magnificent with steps to the roof and our personal hot tub.  We highly recommend it. We will definitely try to go back and stay there.  Our thanks to Stephania
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mike B wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: We had the good fortune to make a return visit just one year after our first. Let's just say everything that we found so enticing and beautiful on our first stay has been sustained - the welcome the unrivalled service and the friendly and attentive team for whom nothing is too much trouble. I'd like to extend our sincere thanks to everyone in the Team - You are truly exceptional!  Thanks to a late booking we enjoyed the contrasts of a Classic Room and the decadence of their Grand Suite across our 5 night stay - Memorable.  Evenings all began on their Terrace where fabulous sunsets and the haunting call to prayer from 3 or more nearby Mosques was an absolutely mesmerising experience.  Expanded food and drink options made the Riad just that little bit more sophisticated with it's honest charms very much still present.  An ambitious extension is underway with Sky Bar Restaurant and Swimming Pool planned it will hopefully enhance the experience still further. We will be certain to be saving up for our next visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The only place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed 4 nights in October. Cannot fault it beautiful hotel amazing service friendly staff Wonderful hamamspa and food. Location insane. Easy to orientate from here anywhere either walking or taxi.

Review_Date: Amber S wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Amazing Riad! Beautifully designed with attentive staff
Review_Text: We stayed two nights in October and loved everything about this hotel! The room decor food and staff were all wonderful. Zero complaints! Just wish we had stayed longer to enjoy more of the rooftop!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This riad in the middle of the medina of Marrakech is a wonderful retreat in the lively Marrakech. The rooms are beautifully furnished the staff absolutely obliging and helpful. The Hamam application is highly recommended...The next time we come back we will definitely return to the RIAD 72.

Review_Date: Patrick R wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: 72 Riad Living - the best place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: Riad 72 is an incredible place to stay. The building itself is beautiful and the staff make you feel like you are family. Be sure to eat the breakfasts which are amazing and a dinner here if you can. The rooftop is incredible for sunsets and the quality of the rooms is very high. The location was ideal for what we wanted to do -- close to shopping including high-end rugs and close to all major activities. Wonderful place and I hope to come back one day!

We booked our trip to Marrakesh early in the year. I found it difficult to find the right hotel at the right price and then I stumbled upon Riad 72. It looked like a pretty decent boutique hotel with really reasonable pricing. We booked and didn’t think much of it for the next few months.    We were travelling with my little one (21 months) and as the date approached I started to worry about what my toddler would be able to eat (we are vegan) and whether he would be bored. I should have booked ourselves into a big resort I thought.    On arriving at Riad 72 tucked away on a quiet street behind an unassuming door I soon learnt that I couldn’t have chosen a better place to stay.    The hotel is beautiful. Stepping off the crazy streets of Marrakesh and into a palatial sanctuary I immediately felt at home. My toddler felt at ease straight away - probably due to all the special attention he received from the friendly staff!    We had two rooms here; a suite with private terrace and I think what was the hotel’s most basic room. The suite was gorgeous and we weren’t sure how we would cope with moving down to a smaller room. The basic room was much smaller but it didn’t matter because we discovered the hotel’s roof terrace which was open to all guests. The perfect spot.    The food was really good. We made some special requests for meals to suit our dietary requirements/fussy child and they were more than happy to oblige.    The staff at Riad 72 are brilliant. Genuinely friendly approachable and attentive. We truly felt at home here and even part of the family. What more could you ask of a hotel...?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We finished off a two week tour of Morocco with 2 days here. The care and attention from the staff are exceptional and it’s an oasis in the middle of the crazy place that is Marrakech. The only suggestion we’d make for improvement is that sun umbrellas on the terrace would be great over the sun beds as once the sun gets up it can be pretty hot. Food was excellent nothing too much trouble hammam was fabulous beds and linen super high quality. 10/10 would come again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Before we arrived we had emails from the Rhiad checking if we would like transfers from the airport and bookings for dinner. The taxi was waiting on arrival and our welcome at the Rhiad was friendly with mint tea and local cakes. We arrived late morning and they assured us that they would try and get our room ready ASAP. The Rhiad has a lovely central courtyard with palm trees and tables. A lovely gesture of asking us which soap we would prefer in our room was unexpected and very novel. We had booked the classic double room which is simple but beautifully designed with a superking size bed lovely linen and very comfortable. Everything has been hand picked to be traditional but chic. Staff are friendly but not overly attentive. We had the Hammam in house in a their very small sauna room. It was fabulous but very intimate!! Breakfast is good and you can choose to have it on the ground floor or on the roof terrace... a lovely oasis for quiet sunbathing a cocktail or tea. We loved the simplicity of it but if you are wanting a five star hotel experience this is not for you. It is charming with low lighting a traditional feel and very relaxing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tom Clement wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: I’ve travelled extensively and stayed at many 5 star hotels. Without a doubt Riad 72 has been the most magical hotel experiences of my life!    Hidden behind a heavy wood door down a narrow alleyway in the Medina (safe any time of day) is an architecturally stunning riad spread on multiple levels around an open courtyard – sculpted archways tile work and fountains – straight out of Architectural Digest. The rooms are air conditioned and tastefully decorated with Moroccan carpets and artifacts. The main dining room off the central courtyard is breathtaking and the rooftop bar/patio offers stunning views over the Medina.    Food and service are truly exceptional – breakfasts are substantial and the three evening meals that we enjoyed over our extended stay were top notch and worthy of a Michelin star. Stefania Conte (the onsite manager) has assembled an A-team – a special callout to Ayoub Aziz Ahmeds 1 and 2 Asma and Abdul who always met us with a smile and made our stay truly memorable.    The riad has acquired a huge adjoining property and construction is underway on an oversized swimming pool and a second dining venue (open to outside patrons) while retaining the intimate feel that comes from having just 13 rooms. It’s set for completion in spring of 2020.    I can’t wait to return.

Review_Date: Scott F wrote a review Oct 2019
