Review_Text: My friends and I stayed at Riad 72 for 5 amazing nights. We could not have asked for better accommodations in Marrakech. The staff was so nice and helpful. The riad itself was beautiful. The rooms were perfect. We loved our breakfast (which was included) every morning -- fresh breads eggs yogurt and fruit. We also took advantage of the riad's hammam (highly recommend). And we had dinner at La Table du Riad which is the riad's farm to table restaurant (highly recommend). The food was so fresh and perfectly cooked.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Kate M wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: 72 Riad was just what we needed after a pretty stressful drive from Essaouira into Marrakech (flat tyre & speeding fine). As soon as I walked through the doors into the riad I felt the calm and luxury surround me. The courtyards are stunning and the roof terrace tops it all off (literally) with fantastic views over the city towards the Atlas mountains. I was just sorry I didn't have longer to spend on the sun loungers that looked extremely comfortable! As it was we enjoyed a hammam the roof top bar and then had a delicious meal in the restaurant. We had to leave the next morning for the mountains but I would definitely like to spend longer there next time!

I am an avid traveler & have stayed in multiple Riads in Morocco but never have I  experienced such hospitality and service. I can't stress how exceptional the service is from the bell hop to the manager.the manager greeted us upon arrival & explained every essential thing to do in Marrakech: where to go where to est where to shop & where to go dancing. We stayed for 3 nights and were treated like royalty. The rooms & the grounds of the riad are beautiful. We were so enchanted that we bought room fragrance from the Riad so that our own homes can smell like riad 72. Will definitely comeback & get married on the rooftop. I already miss this place. Thank you for making us feel so pampered.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Deha G wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: It was a great pleasure to stay at 72 Riad .. Very welcoming people and an oriental ambiance .. gives you to feel like you are staying in a palace .. hope to be back the next time ..  thank you for all of you making our stay wonderful !!  Serkan & Burcu  İstanbul

Review_Date: antoinette l wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed for 2 days the room was beautiful and the food from the restaurant was fantastic! The rooftop bar was a great place to unwind after a full days of walking around Marrakech. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed in the Junior Suite Terrace and Jacuzzi which we would highly recommend. We would enjoy the terrace every morning after breakfast and also when we returned from the souks in the late afternoon. The main rooftop terrace was also lovely for breakfast dinner or just a drink.  Great place to stay in Marrakesh- the service was excellent. Probably one of the nicest riad’s to stay in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Walking up to the door in the alley you'll never expect to see what is inside the place is beautiful! Stephanie greeted us and oriented us to the area and the hotel which was very helpful. The staff was very pleasant and always around to help you find your way around the incredibly confusing souk. Our room was on the ground floor and very spacious and nice. Breakfast/dinner was very good. Big thanks to Abdul at the front desk he's a super friendly guy and always making things happen!

I can confirm that all of the positive reviews of this property are absolutely true. I arrived by car and parked in the Mosque parking lot which is close to the hotel - I found it a bit by chance but if you plug the hotel address into your GPS you will likely end up at the Mosque parking lot - the Riad is accessible by foot. There will probably be an enterprising young man to take your luggage to the Riad - he will expect a tip of approx 5 EUR or USD. Otherwise you can make arrangements with the Riad directly but if you are unfamiliar with Marrakech you can easily get lost so it is well worth it to get some guidance.    Parking is very secure - a few of the local Riads do park their vehicles there as well.    I ate at the restaurant and enjoyed a glass of wine on the rooftop while listening to the evening call to prayer - truly magical.    Plus - the Riad is expanding and looking to add a pool / additional facilities. I hope to check it out once completed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David S wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: My wife and I did extensive research on the best places and activities in Marakech before our trip. 72 Riad Living kept coming up in our searches so we made our reservations. It certainly did not disappoint. The airport transfer was easy and the short walk through the streets of Marakech to the Riad was a great experience. One we arrived the service was incredible with a personal introduction and Moroccan tea. The entire Riad was beautiful and our room was a blended the original structure with high end modern touches. Of all 5 places we stayed in Morocco and Spain this was our favorite room. The food was delicious as well. The included breakfast was an assortment of breads jellies honey butter local cheese fresh orange juice and excellent coffee or tea. We both tried two of the tanjin meals that you need to order in advance. We had four tanjin meals in Morocco and this was the most flavorful and rich off the ones we tried. The lamb one was my favorite with the fast of the lamb adding great depth of flavor.    Also the location is ideal as well. It is a 3 minute walk to the start of the famous soukes (local shopping stores or stalls) and it is a 10 minute walk to the main square. There was nothing they were not willing to help with or try to provide and they were gracious with every request. They even helped us move our reservation at the restaurant Nomad after we mistakenly booked the wrong day. They do provide a security guard who can escort you if needed but honestly there was never a time that we felt unsafe or harassed in Marakech. It was much easier than we even expected and it was even fun negotiation for the prices (also long as you know beforehand about how much the more expensive items should be and that nearly every negotiation starts at least double or triple the real price you will pay).    The only real challenge for this Riad (and the other two we visited) is that these were designed as homes not hotels. So the stairs are usually narrow winding stairwells with lower clearances particularly at the roof access. It makes it charming and we are about 40 do this was not a problem for is other than negotiating bags up or down at times. Yet this is the only true challenge in what was an incredible experience.    Important note: We checked out to several other riads and you definitely get what you pay for. This is not the cheapest riad but it is a great value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a very relaxing stay tucked away from the Marrakech hustle in this beautiful riad. The roof top terrace was very private and adorable the restaurants cuisine was excellent and the staff were welcoming and friendly. The room was comfortable but don’t look for TV’s there are none. We didn’t mind. Everything was spotless and the room was very comfortable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Roberta L wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at Riad72 in Marrakesh. This Riad is located in Medina area it’s luxurious with nicely decorated rooms beautifully appointed and plush courtyard where we enjoyed having breakfast before heading out for the daily trips. The Riad features the roof top bar and the restaurant which we loved visiting in the evening after returning from the busy day of activities. It’s a true oasis in the otherwise very chaotic Medina area. The manager Stefania and her staff are top notch and provide impeccable service all the way around.

Review_Title: Fantastic Oasis in the historic Medina of Marrakech
Review_Text: This is a highly recommendable boutique Riad inside the busy Medina of Marrakech. Its small and very personable. Excellent service great rooms. Beautiful courtyard garden/dining room and rooftop bar. From next year we are told they will add a pool on the rooftop which will make this Riad if possible an even better place to stay.

Review_Date: Manuel P wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: If you staying in the Medina you have to look carefully for a good Riad/Hotel since it becomes your oasis in a very charmingly chaotic city and Riad was just that an oasis for relaxing recharging and rest from the heat and walking around Marrakech.    Rooms: I thing they only have six and I saw two of them (friends were staying there) and both were comfortable with good size and good bathrooms. Air conditioner work smoothly and rooms were impeccable in general. Great size btw and very quite.    Location: In the north of the Medina very close to the souks but also close to a taxi stop on a road with traffic to get to other areas fast. From the taxi stop the walking is not long so it is not a problem when carrying the luggage they send someone with our luggage on the checkout which was appreciated.    Riad: In general it was great they had a fabulous terrace with plenty of sitting area and it was nice at night when the heat was not as intense as during the they they offer spa treatments and restaurant service we only used for the breakfast and it was nice but simple fruit and bread. Only thin i felt missing was a pool I didn't look for a pool but once you are there in the heat it sure looks at something that would be great to have to refresh.

Review_Title: Perfect for exploring this magical city
Review_Text: Excellent service before travelling arranging pick-up and first night supper. Wonderful courtyard nicely decorated and very cool and relaxing. Wonderful staff on all level. Room nicely decorated and very quiet. Enjoyed both the roof terrace and the in-house hammam.

My wife and I traveled in Morocco for 12 days. It was an incredible experience. Morocco is a country full of history that is becoming modern very fast. A mix of old and contemporary and huge architecture describe moroccan cities.  People is very friendly. The country is very safe  Stay at the riads (old houses transformed into boutique hotels) at the medinas (old parts of the cities) is part of the experience.  In Marrakech we stayed at 72 RIAD which is maybe the best of all the riads in which we stayed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wow what a beautiful hotel. After just arriving in Morocco this was our first stay. After walking down a couple of narrow streets we came to our desired address. After being greeted at the front door by a wonderful hostess we were led into a large courtyard that was just stunning. Everything about this place was fantastic. The rooms were as great as the courtyard. The breakfast in the courtyard was equally 5 star. This place is a must if you are staying in Marrakesh.

Review_Date: Ronnie Habich wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: 72 Riad Living is simply a fantastic hotel. Our stay was amazing!  The staff was very kind and helful with all our needs.  Delicious food at the restaurant very comfortable rooms and beautiful decor overall.

This is a gorgeous riad in an excellent location within the walls of the medina and walking distance to everything. Its on a quiet side street off of the main road so I found that this helped to keep it quiet safe and peaceful when walking to and from. We had a deluxe room that had its own private rooftop terrace. The staff was wonderful from the moment we were picked up at the airport to the moment they dropped us back off to go home. Breakfast while simple was delicious! We opted for the fast track option at the airport and they helped to arrange this on our behalf. I highly recommend you get it as the lines can get gnarly at security and we were able to breeze by the crowds with the fast track option.    Stay here! You won't be disappointed.

Riad 72 was beautiful the entire staff was very warm friendly and helpful. The rooms were adequate size. The food taste and quality was excellent among the best in all the restaurants in Marrakesh we ate at. The terrace restaurant and the central courtyard had great ambience! The manager seemed slightly curt and stressed at times but that was minor quibble in what was a fantastic stay overall!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Cathy M wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Stayed at Riad 72 for 4 nights and cannot recommend this highly enough.  From the minute we arrived we were looked after by exceptionally friendly staff for whom nothing was too much trouble. We were lucky enough to be offered an upgrade on our room to a deluxe XL which was beautiful and spacious. The simple but delicious breakfast was served within the stunning relaxed courtyards again service was attentive but not intrusive.  If travelling to Marrakech this is definitely the place to stay.  A big thank you to all the staff for making pure holiday truly memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Luciana B wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Gorgeous property with delicious food and attentive staff
Review_Text: I came across this property on Tablet which curates boutique hotels around the world. I was looking for something upscale but still true to Morocco. I was very happy with this Riad. It has a very good location inside the Medina with a short and relatively simple walk to the taxi stand and as you walk through the door you get an immediate feeling of warmth and relaxation. With two internal patios that are gorgeously appointed and punctuated by chirping birds and a wonderful 360 degree view of the Medina from the rooftop terrace there are multiple options to relax. The food is superb and you should ensure you leave some room for that! Bedrooms are beautifully done although there are some at courtyard level that open directly to the patio and have less privacy. I would ask for an upstairs room although you would need to be prepared to climb upstairs (it is the Medina after all!). The only thing missing is a pool to cool down at the end of the day but I am told this is in the works...

Review_Date: Alan A wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Fantastic home away from home in Marrakech
Review_Text: Riad 72 was an incredible experience. Stefania and her team took care of all our (many) needs without a blink. The rooms were amazing the food fantastic and the staff as good as one could possibly ask for. It truly was our home in Marrakech. We cannot wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Rachel M wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: With the large amount of Riads in Marrakech we were unsure of where to stay. Luckily we chose Riad 72 and were blown away by the entire experience! From the incredibly warm welcome and the entire team making you feel like family we were so sad to leave! The food and drinks were delicious my room was immaculate help was always at your finger tips everything was perfect. We can’t recommend this Riad more!!! Thank you all for making us feel like the most special guests you’ve ever had!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a Riad located on a narrow street deep within the medina. The interior is beautiful and well appointed. The inner court yard is quite charming and a good place for a cozy dinner. Note it is not an outdoor courtyard. The only other amenities besides the dining were an outdoor rooftop terrace. So if you contemplate cooling off poolside between excursions this riad would not be a good fit.  My concern is the steps. Many of the rooms are accessed only by 2 flights of winding stairs. Our original room was a very tiny 2 level space with the bed and bath up an extra level. Fortunately we were able to upgrade to a lovely suite with 2 rooms and 2 baths. It totally changed our experience into a positive one.  The staff was incredibly wonderful professional and caring. The manager Steffania was attuned to her guests and went out of her way to insure a good stay. Her support staff included Maria and Ahmet who were equally committed to supporting the guests and assisting in all ways possible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sarah Y wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Our stay at Riad72 was wonderful. Polite and friendly staff very accommodating. Spacious room and good food. loved the fact that there a few rooms and the personal touch. I would absolutely stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lucilla C wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Stunning Riad right in the Medina. Beautifully decorated no fuss no TV but full of little luxuries you couldn't have imagined. Choose your own soap when you arrive from a selection of hand-made soaps and it will be put in your room. A phone loaded with helpful hints tips recommendations free wifi etc - to take out with you for the duration of your stay in case you get lost or need to call a cab (we didn't but it was great to be able to use the maps and call UK - for free). Nespresso machine Bose bluetooth speaker private roof terrace with hot tub.    Perfect level of service - all the staff were so attentive but not fussy always there but not in the way.    Food was delicious local fresh.    Need to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Brilliant Riad. We stayed in one of the rooms surrounding the red tiled courtyard and had a stunning room and bathroom with everything you would expect from a luxury riad. The service was consistently very good with breakfast and drinks served wherever you fancy them. We also received great well informed advice on restaurants bars experiences pool days and hammams.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: George R wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Riad 72 is a wonderful property that is right near the Medina. The walk to the markets was a good distance so that you had some separation but only took 15 minutes or so. We were in the top floor suite and the room was beautiful with plenty of space. Every piece of service we had was very good. If I am going to nitpick then it would be that the hot tub was not really ready to go but it didn't impact our vacation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: small hotel in the middle of the medina    At night we were dressed to the restaurant  First room very small  Second room very loud.  everything else recommended  staff in particular Maria very engaged and always approachable
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Mike H wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: This is probably by far one of my most memorable boutique hotel experiences. Riad 72 wowed us in almost every way from the wonderful staff to inteioror design to its own restaurant. Stefania the manager and the entire staff was extremely courteous and understanding of our every needs. Very patient and helpful. The riad was more than a place to stay it's both a showcase of morrocan art and a home away from home. We are so glad to have chosen Riad 72 as our introduction to Moroccan culture.    Tips: the Riad's restaurant is comparable if not better than Moroccan restaurants in the city. The location of the riad is very convenient right outside the entrance to Souk and one of the royal Palace so it's extremely safe!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A VERY LOVELY STAY AT RIAD 72
Review_Text: Having never been to Marrakech before I spent hours reviewing different Riad accommodations and found it challenging to make a decision where to stay with so many choices. Riad 72 was the perfect choice. Intimate chic and comfortable Riad 72 exceeded all expectations. The staff was excellent. Stephanie the stylish and gracious Manager welcomed me with an introduction to the Riad and an explanation about Marrakech. Throughout my stay the staff went above and beyond to make me feel welcome and comfortable. I stayed in a combination. of rooms including the classic double and the Grand Suite which was only available two of my four nights. If at all possible select the Grand Suite! It is absolutely gorgeous and WELL worth the extra expense for a truly memorable stay. As I said I labored trying to determine the best place to stay. I'm confident I made the right choice with Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Clarissa A wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We very much enjoyed our stay there. The hotel staff helped us arrange transport to the riad and from the riad to the airport. The hotel is centrally located and close to the main markets and tourist attractions. I would also highly recommend the hammam!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Family Tunnisen wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Great place to be, superb hospitality and service by staff at Riad 72,
Review_Text: Enjoyed our stay at this beautiful Riad. Stefania and team very focused to ensure you feel at home after 5 minutes leading to a delightful holiday for us this year.Super location in the center of Medina. For sure a great place to be !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Stefania and Maria were amazing. They took care of every little detail. There was not a single time when things has been forgotten etc. It was wonderful to sit back and relax at this Riad after a hot day in the medina. Their professionalism and hospitality was outstanding. I should also mention that the housekeeping was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we truly enjoyed the hotel and the staff. we had great meals and drinks on the rooftop. the view was incredible and the rooms were very clean. the hotel is in a great location and feels very safe and secure. highly recommend!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Hotel & Very Well Located. Staff were top notch.
Review_Text: We had a great time at this hotel. We were a group of 9 couples/friends and couldn't really fault anything about our stay (though would have loved a pool). The hotel was overall awesome. Great food very friendly staff and rooms were very comfortable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Worth K wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Wonderful Food, Atmosphere, Service, and Decor
Review_Text: Our group of two couples had a wonderful stay at Riad 72 in late May 2019 (during Ramadan actually). The cool and quiet of the courtyard was a welcome contrast to the bustle of shopping and the medina. On our second night tired from explorations we decided to just eat at the riad instead of going out - and it turned out to be one of the best meals of our 11 day trip. Morning breakfast was fine - and punctuated by visits from songbirds in the courtyard. Staff were wonderfully helpful and room accommodations were classic Moroccan decor but with modern plumbing. A great place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kevin OLeary wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Beautifully decorated  Relaxing and tranquil  Very clean and well looked after  Friendly and welcoming staff  Great food for both breakfast and dinner  Romantic escape from the Medina  Highly recommended  Would go back in a heart beat
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marcel Mueller wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Really beautiful Riad with fantastic service at excellent location
Review_Text: Stayed for 4 nights end of May. Enjoyed warm caring atmosphere through very friendly and helpful staff. Very nice authentic yet stylish rooms. The courtyard is simply gorgeous for delicous breakfast and dinner.  Location is very conveniently located in inner Medina. Central but very quiet location.  Surely a Riad to come back and enjoy again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hidden down twists and turns this riad is top quality. Very comfortable (the AC is a must in the Spring/Summer) and authentic we felt very welcome immediately and the tea was delicious.    Would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel itself is beautiful and modern while still has its historical details and charms. The location is convenient with walking distance to major sightseeing spots. Rooms are clean and always smell nice. Comfy bed delicious breakfast nice shower high-quality toiletries and very importantly friendly staff...It's definitely a high-quality hotel in many ways. We enjoyed our stay here very much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I believe this riad sadly fell a little bit short of the reviews in media and online… Such as the Telegraph newspaper.    The riad offers transfer from the airport however despite having book this and sending them a reminder the same morning to reconfirm the driver was nowhere to be found as we exited the airport. After two phone calls and I tiny bit of confusion on their behalf the driver showed up and we made it to the hotel fine.    On the plus side despite arriving before noon we only had to wait 20 minutes for a room to be ready. Check-in is in mid afternoon. We had room number five. I wouldn’t recommend this room necessarily. The glass door to the bathroom was quite heavy and was perpetually stuck which seemed a little bit dangerous. The bathroom was quite warm so you had to keep the door closed in order to keep the AC working well in the bedroom adjacent.    The wooden stairs to the entry-level below were a little bit precarious but manageable. A room opened up onto the courtyard but with direct sun for a good portion of the day it was too hot to sit outside. The rooftop is comfy and nice but nothing special… The view of the mosque is great that said. The hotel does not have a pool or even a plunge pool… So if you’re looking to cool off you’re pretty much confined to your shower unless you get a room with a pool and a tub. It was hotter than Mars on the first day we were there so a plunge pool would’ve been nice.    Food and beverage service was awkwardly chaotic at times although the staff were quite cheery and pleasant. Riad 72 goes out of its way to promote its restaurant but we found the food somewhat uninspired and bland.    This trip was a special occasion for us and it was a little disappointing that this hotel under delivered despite getting good reviews elsewhere. I would look around at other places before recommending this to anyone frankly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter A wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay at the lovely Riad 72. Everything was perfect; the house (palace) the roof terrace our room the restaurant. Nothing was a problem for your personnel - fantastic service from whoever we contacted.    Thank you again for looking after us so well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Another glowing review for this amazing property
Review_Text: Riad 72 is a luxury boutique hotel with all of the amenities. The owner Stefania is personally engaged from the minute you arrive until your departure. Our experience began at the airport where we were met and transported to the Riad. After a nice welcome and sit down with Stefania we were shown to our room on the second floor w/ a terrace overlooking the interior of the Riad. Two things that Stefania provided that were super helpful were the detailed map of her design outlining restaurants shopping etc. and a mobile phone that was preprogrammed with relevant numbers sights etc. of Marrakech to use during our stay. Daily breakfast were delicious as were the cappuccinos. We dined at the Riad one evening and it was one of the best meals we had during our 24 days in Morocco. A special thanks to Maria for assisting us w/ dinner reservations as well. We plan to return to Marrakech at some point and we will definitely plan on staying at Raid 72! Thank you Stefania and team for a wonderful three days.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A beautiful place to call "home" while in Marrakech!
Review_Text: We received top-notch service right from the start. Along with the table-side hand washing in the sunny atrium lobby and delicious mint tea and cute pastries upon our arrival the very professional and warm property manager Stefania personally welcomed us. She sat down with us to explain the Riad's many ammentities as well as the miriad of sites in the city. But the entire staff was truly great - always full of smiles and willing to help us. The attention to detail was evident everywhere.....the ultra-fresh gourmet meals served in their on-site restaurant the chic design elements in our our room and throughout the property the breakfast and roof-top bar serivce - all wonderful! Housekeeping was meticulous with their daily routine as well! It is located within easy walking distance of the main square and souks through charming back alleys where kids were always playing! But a good night's sleep was had because of how quiet it was there. And extremely safe too. DO request a pick-up at the airport from Riad 72 plus the porter service (the taxi cannot go that far back into the narrow passages). It is a wonderful convenience (a minimal charge) and can be confusing your first time there if you try to do it yourself.  Even upon checkout Stefania was there again giving us a hug and thanking us for our visit letting us know Riad 72 will always be our home while in Marrakech! She waved goodbye out the front door as we bid adieu to our holiday!  This is a very special place and we were so happy we chose it as our "home" while in Marrakech! If you do too you will not be disappointed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad 72 for two nights and found this hotel to be a beautiful peaceful retreat in the midst of the medina. Upon arrival we were greeted with tea and cookies and enjoyed sitting in the beautiful courtyard. Our rooms were spacious clean and decorated in a modern Moroccan style and were very comfortable. The staff were all very friendly and happy to help and the food was delicious!    The staff also arranged for a "fast track" arrival at the Marrakech airport as well as a car transfer which was very helpful.    I highly recommend Riad 72 for your stay in Marrakech. It was a terrific accommodation!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Luke A wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: We had a fantastic experience at Riad 72. The service and attention to detail was incredible. The staff made our trip very special. Food interior design facilities and location all excellent. Thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My daughter who is 21 and I stayed here in mid-April 2019 for 4 nights and loved the accommodations the food and most especially the service. The manager and the staff were readily available and assisted us book excursions make dinner reservations arrange for transfers etc. The excursions they booked for us were great. Highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Robert S wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: I was very happy with my stay at Riad 72. Every time I walked by anyone regardless if it was a server an admin or the cleaning crew I was greeted with a smile and asked if I needed anything. Excellent staff all English speakers. One of the best things: we were provided a cell phone with 3G so that we could use it for maps etc and in case of problems. They really think of everything!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Arien B wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We spend 2 nights in this beautiful riad out of 9 nights in Morocco. Family of 5 and we all said this was our absolute favorite. Rooms are clean and comfortable and customer service can't get any better. We also tried the couples hamam and massage and i would strongly recommend after a day of touring the souks .  Will definitely being staying here again and again!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sonia S wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We loved our 3 night stay at Riad 72. The staff are wonderful and if it wasn't for the Smartphone they provided we would still be somewhere in the Medina! Highly recommended this beautiful property. Thank you Riad 72 for having us - hope to return one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: David H wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We had a great time staying at Riad 72. Very welcoming staff and good service. Lovely rooftop for breakfast. Good barman. Many pleasant additions like the hand washing ceremony. Comfortable rooms. Overall very enjoyable and hope to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We are a family of 6 (4 adult children) who stayed at this beautiful and elegant Riad for 3 nights.    No request was too much for the staff. Service was beyond imagination. We requested a private spot for dinner our first night there. They set up a perfect spot for only us to have a private dinner. Breakfasts and afternoons on their terrace overlooking the rooftops of the Médina is a site to be seen.    The complimentary cell phones which are equipped in each room was a perfect way for all of us to stay connected throughout the day in addition it gives a great sense of security (not getting lost in the city with its google maps).    The location is nice since the Riad is tucked away in a quiet alley but close enough to the “souk” in the Medina (only a 7 minute walk). The Famous Square “Jemma el Fnaa” is about a 15 minute walk away. We felt this location suited us well.    Breakfast were very good. You can request eggs to order and cappuccino. Unfortunately we discovered this out only on the last day.    I highly recommend this fabulous Riad with high class service and a great location.    Thank you Riad 72 for making our stay in Marrakesh unforgettable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kristin D wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Riad 72 was a great place to stay- off the beaten path enough to have a little more quiet while still being within walking distance of the Médina. Each room was provided their very own smart phone which was awesome as we traveled throughout town using its GPS! The staff rooms/accommodations and food were all exceptional. I would highly recommend Riad 72!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed 3 nights and explored the Northern Medina from Riad72. The provided Smartphone was extremely helpful to find the way though the Souk's labyrinths.  The roof terasse is marvelous and the staff extremely pleasant and helpful! Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We absolutely loved our two night stay at Riad 72. The Riad is stunning and our room with private terrace and jaccuzi couldn't have been better. The staff are super helpful and the food for breakfast and dinner was top shelf as well.    We will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Mohammad N wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Luxurious, personal service for an amazing Riad
Review_Text: I cannot say enough good things about this Riad. The location is just tucked in right outside the Medina. Complete peace and quiet from the outside hustle and bustle.    Stefania greeted us upon arrival and personally checked us in. She gave us a quick rundown of the city and she was so charming. The Riad kindly took our luggage from the street to our rooms and let us decompress with some delicious mint tea while we checked in.    The rooms were absolutely comfortable. The bed was dream inducing the bathroom spacious and beautifully decorated. The breakfast was healthy fresh and plentiful.    I highly recommend staying here if this is your first time in Marrakech....or even if it’s your tenth time :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We LOVED this hotel. Not only was it beautiful and super conveniently located the service was incredible. My boyfriend and I joked that everyone at Riad 72 spoke perfect English - except somehow none of them ever learned the word "no." Everything we asked for - breakfast later than usually served dinner reservations at a hard to get into restaurant dinner (which was also delicious) and tea upstairs on the roof deck when everyone else was being served downstairs - was met with a joyful "yes of course!" Stefania the host was lovely as was every member of the team from restaurant to guard to spa to desk. From the moment we arrived a few hours before check-in time (on a fairly early flight) and were immediately whisked to a table and served a lovely breakfast with a side of Marrakech tips - to the moment we left and hugged Stefania (twice) we felt like we were at home. Can't recommend this place enough (also try the hammam!).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A truly special place to stay
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived and were greeted at the airport to the moment we hugged manager goodbye this oasis in the old city was truly amazing. The staff is excellent taking care of every detail and consistently available to answer questions and anticipate your every need. It's not often you find a place with this level of customer service. The modern touches in the courtyards and rooftop patio (watch your head the entrance is short) are well done and beautifully maintained. The food is very good and our room was well put together. They provide a smartphone free of charge to keep you connected give you access to google maps and give you some peace of mind you will actually find your way back from the labyrinth of the medina. I have a hard time imagining what the staff could have done to make our stay better. I will recommend Riad 72 again and again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: nathalie r wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: This beautiful little oasis of calm  peace and friendliness in the bustle of the ancient medina of Marrakech ! It was so lovely - the service is by far the best I’ve ever received anywhere . We had a beautiful suite with our own private veranda and plunge pool . You are greeted and treated like Kings !!!  I recommend to all to dip into this amazing place - your home in Marrakech .  Truly lovely people
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We liked Riad 72. It's a small boutique hotel so everything felt very personal. The owner / general manager greeted us everyday. Staff was very tentative.  Room was large and comfortable. With big open bathroom just exactly we need after a busy day.  Roof terrace was good too. Unfortunately we didn't use that much as it was raining while we there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Eimear Kenny K wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad 72 for two nights and it was amazing! We were greeted by Stefanie and she was so welcoming. The staff at this Riad cannot do enough for you. The rooms are fabulous. The location is great for exploring the Medina and Marrakech. I cannot wait to visit again! Thanks to Stefanie Ahmed Abdul and all at Riad 72!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We loved Riad 72! Everyone was so welcoming and it was a relaxing respite from the busy city. The interior design and comfort of the surrounding made for a peaceful stay. My friend and I were traveling together on our own and the phones loaded with maps information and call service added an extra layer of comfort for us and our safety. Can't wait to go back for another visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Karin A wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: The riad is located in a quiter area in the outskirts of the medina which was a benefit for the soul after the stressful visit to the souks  The interiour is a mixture of morrocian style and hot design very elegant.the patio is a greneny with bananapalms and birds and a waterfountain. The terasce is well furnished and a nice place to sunbathe or dine.  The food is delicious .  The service is excellent the whole staff are so friendly and helpful.  You feel very much at home
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Loved this Riad Stefania and her team were outstanding. I cannot fault the service they made our stay straight forward and simple providing a WIFI connected device to find our way around the Maze of Medina ( which is a necessity) whilst always being on hand when needed for questions or services . it was a calm beautiful environment. probably a touch more modern than other Raids this one was well appointed  with good services and facilities. Both my wife and I had a Hammam and Massage and both were excellent. Thank you Stefania and Team
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fantastic stay at a beautiful Riad 72 in the heart of Marrakech. Welcoming and friendly staff delicious food and beautiful surroundings. Would 100% recommend Riad 72 for weekends and longer stays. Thank you to everyone who so graciously hosted us and made us feel at home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeff P wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Riad 72 was an oasis in an exotic busy city
Review_Text: We loved Riad 72. My 12 year old slept in our room and my older son had his own room. The rooms were very nice and very clean. Our room had a skylight/cupola that was gorgeous. We had dinner there the first night and it was excellent. The beauty of Riad 72 is that they will allow you to eat anywhere. We chose to have dinner and breakfast in the roof. The weather was beautiful in March. Our hosts met our every need. Really great location. Proximate to the nice stores in the souks.  Surprises of the trip. How kind everyone was across the country. How great Moroccan wine is and how fun it is to shop there.  Spring is a perfect time to go. We went to Hawaii last year and were really disappointed with the March weather.  Thanks friends at Riad 72. Jeff and family
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Staffs are perfect rooms are clean and arab-style and atmosphere is great. Breakfast in the patio with birds is unforgettable for all of us three.  スタッフは皆フレンドリーで親切、部屋は伝統的かつ清潔、雰囲気は最高. 　小鳥のさえずりを聞きながらの中庭での朝食は大変印象的でした。
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Donna B wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Riad 72 is a fantastic place to base your stay in Marrakech. The staff is friendly and welcoming. The Riad is absolutely stunning. The roof top is the perfect place to relax after a hectic day in the Medina. Don't miss out on a treatment at their hamam.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Todd B wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: My family spend two weeks traveling around Morocco and Riad 72 was my favorite place. The location is perfect very close to the souls and a quick walk to the main square. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was perfect and the one dinner we had in the Riad was delicious. One suggestion for the owners get a turtle!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Home away from home...actually it's even better
Review_Text: We absolutely loved our five day stay at Riad 72! This place was absolutely amazing...everything from the service/staff to the accommodations the attention and detail was superb. Breakfast every morning was fresh squeezed orange juice and a different array of homemade pastries and bread every morning with a different surprise each day (could be pancakes or eggs). I love that they took care of every detail making the transport between the airport and the Riad as easy as possible. Highly recommend the cooking lesson with the head chef and the hammam and massage experience.    All in all...we loved this place and would come back again in a heartbeat. A beautiful oasis from the daily hustle and bustle and it was made even more special with the people who work here that treated you as family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Paul C wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Great Place, more attention to details needed.
Review_Text: It would be more helpful to have a choice for breakfast say a buffet. The breakfast was very good and the service excellent. Doors to toilet and shower both made a very loud snapping noise which was not corrected despite asking. Smoking was allowed outside our room in the courtyard which should be unacceptable. All staff were helpful and pleasant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad is a perfect place to stay at and just completes the magical experience of Marrakesh! It is beautifully designed down to the smallest detail and offers such a effortless combination of heritage and modern comfort.The breakfast was delicious as was the afternoon tea on the rooftop terrace overlooking the city.  All in all an excellent experience made possible by the very friendly staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: southern hospitality in the middle of (fun) chaos
Review_Text: unexpexpected impeccable service. the building itself is pure luxury and the restaurant was the best we visited the entire 10 day trip around Morocco. the staff is very helpful and certainly made a group of "fish out of water" Americans feel at home
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: An oasis calm in the Medina
Review_Text: We spent an enjoyable week at Riad 72 which is in a great location for accessing the Medina as well as Gueliz. We took a few taxis (do try and agree a price before you travel) though found we could walk to all the main sites as well as some great restaurants in the Gueliz area. Stefania and her team made us very welcome and we would recommend Riad 72 as a great place to stay. The breakfasts were very nice with a good selection of breads and fruit and we enjoyed the restaurant for its excellent food if a little quiet. They say the best compliment is would you stay here again - the answer is yes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Francisco Baettig wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Everything was perfect.  We had some health issues with one of the member of the family and they were super helpful.  Stefanía is just great.  The food is excellent and the place is so beautiful  We’ll come back for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Piotr R wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Very good location close to the main market Street in the old Medina. Not far away from the YSL Museum. The Service was friendly and helpful. One of the top restaurant therein. High quality breakfasts.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Andy D wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: A really nice Riad with a good menu for dinner. Nice breakfast of bread fruit yoghurt and pastries. Comfortable clean rooms although the piped music outside can get a bit loud and go on too late. Staff are exceptional very hospitable. Complimentary afternoon tea with biscuits is a nice touch. Lovely large rooftop terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul C wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: We stayed at Riad 72 and could not fault the service that we received. The room was very comfortable and spotless.
Review_Text: Stephania and her team were always very charming and could not do enough for us. Anything we wanted we were given straight away. The free mobile was a great bonus to use while we were there.  The food in the restaurant was top notch. Excellent quality and cooked to perfection.  We will certainly return. It has a great location and is extremely "authentic" rather than a bland chain hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Travel O wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Definitely a great place to stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: We arrived Marrakech and met our driver from the Riad. He quickly drove us to the location - about 20mins away from the airport. We had to walk about 5 mins from the drop off location as there is no easy route for an vehicle. We were met by a luggage attendant who walked us to the Riad. Pay attention to landmarks and they don’t use street names at all. Now I had never stayed at a Riad before and it more than exceeded my expectations. From the way it looks outside it’s hard to imagine how gorgeous the inside is. It’s amazing. With beautiful wildlife gardens inside and amazing colors. Fantastic. The staff was amazing. They take care of the luggage for you while you wash your hands in orange blossom water. Then you sit for Moroccan tea and pastries. While relaxing a nice person comes to offer you a soap of your choice for use in your room. The bars smell lovely and are handmade with no chemicals. Once we were shown to our room we were more than impressed. We had a family suite and it was perfect for our group. There was one large room with a queen bed full shower and bathroom. The other bedroom (mine) smaller but nice with a twin bed and a bathroom with shower. Perfect actually. We had two terraces overlooking the inside of the hotel. And our favorite part was our private terrace with our private jacuzzi! Not very big but awesome for the chilly nights. We could overlook the city as it was rooftop. And the price was crazy good! I can’t believe how affordable this place was something like 700 euros for the two nights. Now we split this by three which made it a great deal. We didn’t have any meals at the Riad but the ones we saw looked very good. Great place to stay in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We were so excited ... what a wonderful Riad. The rooms like from 1001 nights lovlingly decorated and super clean. Also the beautiful roof terrasse was exellent.  The staff was very helpful and amazing our special thanks to Ahmed this gentlemen on the reception desk was there to refine our stay and made it unforgettable by organizing our amazing trip to the mountains and a special relaxant hammam and massage treatment then taking care of my mom just to make us feel at home  asma & Khalid were so helpful too  really stefania deserve having this unbelievable stuff .  The Riad is centrally located in the Médina all sights can be reached after a short walk. Everthing smells of roses it was a perfect stay. We will hope to come back soon  we highly recommend riad 72 .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Amazing and romantic stay at Riad 72
Review_Text: This is an absolutely amazing place to stay while in Marrakesh! The staff and management are attentive friendly and considerate while the Riad itself is beautiful and luxurious.    My wife and I stayed in one of the ground floor rooms which was wonderfully comfortable and beautifully appointed.    We also indulged in a private hammam at the Riad which was a relaxing and enjoyable experience.    This really is a top class place to stay with amazing food facilities and staff and we would not hesitate to come back to "our home in Marrakesh".
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Whilst in Marrakech my friend and I stayed at Riad 72.    We arranged the airport transfer directly with the Riad and from start to finish we could not fault the service provided by the management and staff. We were greeted at the airport by our driver who were very knowledgeable and gave us a history of the city whilst travelling to the Riad.    When we got to the destination a porter was there waiting for us to take our bags through the narrow little windy roads to the hidden Riad.    Upon arrival at the Riad we were sat down at the courtyard and provided with fresh mint tea and pastries to unwind. We were then joined by the manager Stefania who gave us really helpful information on the things we can see / do at Marrakech.    Our room (junior suite) was amazing and we had our own private balcony with a jacuzzi bath. What we found really helpful was the handy mobile phone the Riad provided which gave us gps and internet access whilst we were out and about. We used it a lot!    We had dinner at the Riad on the first night and the food was lovely. We also took advantage of the facilities and had hamman and a massage.    Our two nights stay was bliss we couldn't have asked for more.    The Riad was wonderful and the view were amazing. The staff were impeccable. I would definitely stay here again and couldn't recommend it highly enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Farron F wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Best Riad right in the heart of the Medina. Everyone went above and beyond to make my trip so fantastic. Yassin took such good care of us every night when we'd come down for dinner or drinks. He also went out of his way and served us on their gorgeous rooftop. I can't say enough great things! Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: You can really tell the workers take pride in their jobs. Every single employee was extremely helpful and friendly at every encounter. The location was prime within walking distance to the Medina and the new city. The room was excellent; it was very large and spotlessly clean every day. I even saw a cleaner one day moving a lamp to clean under and around the base; something you would never see at a normal property. Finally the on-site restaurant was delicious. We actually ate there every night and enjoyed every meal. They were also quite accommodating with our sleeping infant and served us meals on the terrace directly outside our room. I would highly recommend Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: GWEN F wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: It was my daughter and my first visit to Marrakesh and we couldn’t have picked a more perfect Riad ! The entire staff couldn’t do enough to make sure our stay was wonderful. Our meals were amazing and even their choice of private drivers and guides were incredible. We had a wonderful experience at their in-house hamman with wonderful massages. The rooftop deck was the most beautiful setting to view the Médina and have an evening cocktail.  Perfectly located near the souk were were able to walk there and then take easily available tuktuks(open air vehicle) back to the Riad after shopping. Our room was great and all of the modern conveniences were available. The beds were comfy and the wonderful white linens were of great quality! We are spoiled travelers who wanted for nothing during our stay. We will definitely return!! Hopefully sooner than later!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A really nice Riad with a good menu for dinner. Nice breakfast of bread fruit yoghurt and pastries. Comfortable clean rooms although the piped music outside can get a bit loud and go on too late. Staff are exceptional very hospitable. Complimentary afternoon tea with biscuits is a nice touch. Lovely large rooftop terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul C wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: We stayed at Riad 72 and could not fault the service that we received. The room was very comfortable and spotless.
Review_Text: Stephania and her team were always very charming and could not do enough for us. Anything we wanted we were given straight away. The free mobile was a great bonus to use while we were there.  The food in the restaurant was top notch. Excellent quality and cooked to perfection.  We will certainly return. It has a great location and is extremely "authentic" rather than a bland chain hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Travel O wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Definitely a great place to stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: We arrived Marrakech and met our driver from the Riad. He quickly drove us to the location - about 20mins away from the airport. We had to walk about 5 mins from the drop off location as there is no easy route for an vehicle. We were met by a luggage attendant who walked us to the Riad. Pay attention to landmarks and they don’t use street names at all. Now I had never stayed at a Riad before and it more than exceeded my expectations. From the way it looks outside it’s hard to imagine how gorgeous the inside is. It’s amazing. With beautiful wildlife gardens inside and amazing colors. Fantastic. The staff was amazing. They take care of the luggage for you while you wash your hands in orange blossom water. Then you sit for Moroccan tea and pastries. While relaxing a nice person comes to offer you a soap of your choice for use in your room. The bars smell lovely and are handmade with no chemicals. Once we were shown to our room we were more than impressed. We had a family suite and it was perfect for our group. There was one large room with a queen bed full shower and bathroom. The other bedroom (mine) smaller but nice with a twin bed and a bathroom with shower. Perfect actually. We had two terraces overlooking the inside of the hotel. And our favorite part was our private terrace with our private jacuzzi! Not very big but awesome for the chilly nights. We could overlook the city as it was rooftop. And the price was crazy good! I can’t believe how affordable this place was something like 700 euros for the two nights. Now we split this by three which made it a great deal. We didn’t have any meals at the Riad but the ones we saw looked very good. Great place to stay in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We were so excited ... what a wonderful Riad. The rooms like from 1001 nights lovlingly decorated and super clean. Also the beautiful roof terrasse was exellent.  The staff was very helpful and amazing our special thanks to Ahmed this gentlemen on the reception desk was there to refine our stay and made it unforgettable by organizing our amazing trip to the mountains and a special relaxant hammam and massage treatment then taking care of my mom just to make us feel at home  asma & Khalid were so helpful too  really stefania deserve having this unbelievable stuff .  The Riad is centrally located in the Médina all sights can be reached after a short walk. Everthing smells of roses it was a perfect stay. We will hope to come back soon  we highly recommend riad 72 .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Amazing and romantic stay at Riad 72
Review_Text: This is an absolutely amazing place to stay while in Marrakesh! The staff and management are attentive friendly and considerate while the Riad itself is beautiful and luxurious.    My wife and I stayed in one of the ground floor rooms which was wonderfully comfortable and beautifully appointed.    We also indulged in a private hammam at the Riad which was a relaxing and enjoyable experience.    This really is a top class place to stay with amazing food facilities and staff and we would not hesitate to come back to "our home in Marrakesh".
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Whilst in Marrakech my friend and I stayed at Riad 72.    We arranged the airport transfer directly with the Riad and from start to finish we could not fault the service provided by the management and staff. We were greeted at the airport by our driver who were very knowledgeable and gave us a history of the city whilst travelling to the Riad.    When we got to the destination a porter was there waiting for us to take our bags through the narrow little windy roads to the hidden Riad.    Upon arrival at the Riad we were sat down at the courtyard and provided with fresh mint tea and pastries to unwind. We were then joined by the manager Stefania who gave us really helpful information on the things we can see / do at Marrakech.    Our room (junior suite) was amazing and we had our own private balcony with a jacuzzi bath. What we found really helpful was the handy mobile phone the Riad provided which gave us gps and internet access whilst we were out and about. We used it a lot!    We had dinner at the Riad on the first night and the food was lovely. We also took advantage of the facilities and had hamman and a massage.    Our two nights stay was bliss we couldn't have asked for more.    The Riad was wonderful and the view were amazing. The staff were impeccable. I would definitely stay here again and couldn't recommend it highly enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Farron F wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Best Riad right in the heart of the Medina. Everyone went above and beyond to make my trip so fantastic. Yassin took such good care of us every night when we'd come down for dinner or drinks. He also went out of his way and served us on their gorgeous rooftop. I can't say enough great things! Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: You can really tell the workers take pride in their jobs. Every single employee was extremely helpful and friendly at every encounter. The location was prime within walking distance to the Medina and the new city. The room was excellent; it was very large and spotlessly clean every day. I even saw a cleaner one day moving a lamp to clean under and around the base; something you would never see at a normal property. Finally the on-site restaurant was delicious. We actually ate there every night and enjoyed every meal. They were also quite accommodating with our sleeping infant and served us meals on the terrace directly outside our room. I would highly recommend Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: GWEN F wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: It was my daughter and my first visit to Marrakesh and we couldn’t have picked a more perfect Riad ! The entire staff couldn’t do enough to make sure our stay was wonderful. Our meals were amazing and even their choice of private drivers and guides were incredible. We had a wonderful experience at their in-house hamman with wonderful massages. The rooftop deck was the most beautiful setting to view the Médina and have an evening cocktail.  Perfectly located near the souk were were able to walk there and then take easily available tuktuks(open air vehicle) back to the Riad after shopping. Our room was great and all of the modern conveniences were available. The beds were comfy and the wonderful white linens were of great quality! We are spoiled travelers who wanted for nothing during our stay. We will definitely return!! Hopefully sooner than later!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Piotr R wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Very good location close to the main market Street in the old Medina. Not far away from the YSL Museum. The Service was friendly and helpful. One of the top restaurant therein. High quality breakfasts.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

The free mobile was a great bonus to use while we were there.  The food in the restaurant was top notch. Excellent quality and cooked to perfection.  We will certainly return. It has a great location and is extremely "authentic" rather than a bland chain hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Travel O wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Definitely a great place to stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: We arrived Marrakech and met our driver from the Riad. He quickly drove us to the location - about 20mins away from the airport. We had to walk about 5 mins from the drop off location as there is no easy route for an vehicle. We were met by a luggage attendant who walked us to the Riad. Pay attention to landmarks and they don’t use street names at all. Now I had never stayed at a Riad before and it more than exceeded my expectations. From the way it looks outside it’s hard to imagine how gorgeous the inside is. It’s amazing. With beautiful wildlife gardens inside and amazing colors. Fantastic. The staff was amazing. They take care of the luggage for you while you wash your hands in orange blossom water. Then you sit for Moroccan tea and pastries. While relaxing a nice person comes to offer you a soap of your choice for use in your room. The bars smell lovely and are handmade with no chemicals. Once we were shown to our room we were more than impressed. We had a family suite and it was perfect for our group. There was one large room with a queen bed full shower and bathroom. The other bedroom (mine) smaller but nice with a twin bed and a bathroom with shower. Perfect actually. We had two terraces overlooking the inside of the hotel. And our favorite part was our private terrace with our private jacuzzi! Not very big but awesome for the chilly nights. We could overlook the city as it was rooftop. And the price was crazy good! I can’t believe how affordable this place was something like 700 euros for the two nights. Now we split this by three which made it a great deal. We didn’t have any meals at the Riad but the ones we saw looked very good. Great place to stay in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We were so excited ... what a wonderful Riad. The rooms like from 1001 nights lovlingly decorated and super clean. Also the beautiful roof terrasse was exellent.  The staff was very helpful and amazing our special thanks to Ahmed this gentlemen on the reception desk was there to refine our stay and made it unforgettable by organizing our amazing trip to the mountains and a special relaxant hammam and massage treatment then taking care of my mom just to make us feel at home  asma & Khalid were so helpful too  really stefania deserve having this unbelievable stuff .  The Riad is centrally located in the Médina all sights can be reached after a short walk. Everthing smells of roses it was a perfect stay. We will hope to come back soon  we highly recommend riad 72 .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Amazing and romantic stay at Riad 72
Review_Text: This is an absolutely amazing place to stay while in Marrakesh! The staff and management are attentive friendly and considerate while the Riad itself is beautiful and luxurious.    My wife and I stayed in one of the ground floor rooms which was wonderfully comfortable and beautifully appointed.    We also indulged in a private hammam at the Riad which was a relaxing and enjoyable experience.    This really is a top class place to stay with amazing food facilities and staff and we would not hesitate to come back to "our home in Marrakesh".
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Whilst in Marrakech my friend and I stayed at Riad 72.    We arranged the airport transfer directly with the Riad and from start to finish we could not fault the service provided by the management and staff. We were greeted at the airport by our driver who were very knowledgeable and gave us a history of the city whilst travelling to the Riad.    When we got to the destination a porter was there waiting for us to take our bags through the narrow little windy roads to the hidden Riad.    Upon arrival at the Riad we were sat down at the courtyard and provided with fresh mint tea and pastries to unwind. We were then joined by the manager Stefania who gave us really helpful information on the things we can see / do at Marrakech.    Our room (junior suite) was amazing and we had our own private balcony with a jacuzzi bath. What we found really helpful was the handy mobile phone the Riad provided which gave us gps and internet access whilst we were out and about. We used it a lot!    We had dinner at the Riad on the first night and the food was lovely. We also took advantage of the facilities and had hamman and a massage.    Our two nights stay was bliss we couldn't have asked for more.    The Riad was wonderful and the view were amazing. The staff were impeccable. I would definitely stay here again and couldn't recommend it highly enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Farron F wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Best Riad right in the heart of the Medina. Everyone went above and beyond to make my trip so fantastic. Yassin took such good care of us every night when we'd come down for dinner or drinks. He also went out of his way and served us on their gorgeous rooftop. I can't say enough great things! Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: You can really tell the workers take pride in their jobs. Every single employee was extremely helpful and friendly at every encounter. The location was prime within walking distance to the Medina and the new city. The room was excellent; it was very large and spotlessly clean every day. I even saw a cleaner one day moving a lamp to clean under and around the base; something you would never see at a normal property. Finally the on-site restaurant was delicious. We actually ate there every night and enjoyed every meal. They were also quite accommodating with our sleeping infant and served us meals on the terrace directly outside our room. I would highly recommend Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: GWEN F wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: It was my daughter and my first visit to Marrakesh and we couldn’t have picked a more perfect Riad ! The entire staff couldn’t do enough to make sure our stay was wonderful. Our meals were amazing and even their choice of private drivers and guides were incredible. We had a wonderful experience at their in-house hamman with wonderful massages. The rooftop deck was the most beautiful setting to view the Médina and have an evening cocktail.  Perfectly located near the souk were were able to walk there and then take easily available tuktuks(open air vehicle) back to the Riad after shopping. Our room was great and all of the modern conveniences were available. The beds were comfy and the wonderful white linens were of great quality! We are spoiled travelers who wanted for nothing during our stay. We will definitely return!! Hopefully sooner than later!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Piotr R wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Very good location close to the main market Street in the old Medina. Not far away from the YSL Museum. The Service was friendly and helpful. One of the top restaurant therein. High quality breakfasts.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Andy D wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: A really nice Riad with a good menu for dinner. Nice breakfast of bread fruit yoghurt and pastries. Comfortable clean rooms although the piped music outside can get a bit loud and go on too late. Staff are exceptional very hospitable. Complimentary afternoon tea with biscuits is a nice touch. Lovely large rooftop terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
