We had to walk about 5 mins from the drop off location as there is no easy route for an vehicle. We were met by a luggage attendant who walked us to the Riad. Pay attention to landmarks and they don’t use street names at all. Now I had never stayed at a Riad before and it more than exceeded my expectations. From the way it looks outside it’s hard to imagine how gorgeous the inside is. It’s amazing. With beautiful wildlife gardens inside and amazing colors. Fantastic. The staff was amazing. They take care of the luggage for you while you wash your hands in orange blossom water. Then you sit for Moroccan tea and pastries. While relaxing a nice person comes to offer you a soap of your choice for use in your room. The bars smell lovely and are handmade with no chemicals. Once we were shown to our room we were more than impressed. We had a family suite and it was perfect for our group. There was one large room with a queen bed full shower and bathroom. The other bedroom (mine) smaller but nice with a twin bed and a bathroom with shower. Perfect actually. We had two terraces overlooking the inside of the hotel. And our favorite part was our private terrace with our private jacuzzi! Not very big but awesome for the chilly nights. We could overlook the city as it was rooftop. And the price was crazy good! I can’t believe how affordable this place was something like 700 euros for the two nights. Now we split this by three which made it a great deal. We didn’t have any meals at the Riad but the ones we saw looked very good. Great place to stay in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We were so excited ... what a wonderful Riad. The rooms like from 1001 nights lovlingly decorated and super clean. Also the beautiful roof terrasse was exellent.  The staff was very helpful and amazing our special thanks to Ahmed this gentlemen on the reception desk was there to refine our stay and made it unforgettable by organizing our amazing trip to the mountains and a special relaxant hammam and massage treatment then taking care of my mom just to make us feel at home  asma & Khalid were so helpful too  really stefania deserve having this unbelievable stuff .  The Riad is centrally located in the Médina all sights can be reached after a short walk. Everthing smells of roses it was a perfect stay. We will hope to come back soon  we highly recommend riad 72 .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Amazing and romantic stay at Riad 72
Review_Text: This is an absolutely amazing place to stay while in Marrakesh! The staff and management are attentive friendly and considerate while the Riad itself is beautiful and luxurious.    My wife and I stayed in one of the ground floor rooms which was wonderfully comfortable and beautifully appointed.    We also indulged in a private hammam at the Riad which was a relaxing and enjoyable experience.    This really is a top class place to stay with amazing food facilities and staff and we would not hesitate to come back to "our home in Marrakesh".
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Whilst in Marrakech my friend and I stayed at Riad 72.    We arranged the airport transfer directly with the Riad and from start to finish we could not fault the service provided by the management and staff. We were greeted at the airport by our driver who were very knowledgeable and gave us a history of the city whilst travelling to the Riad.    When we got to the destination a porter was there waiting for us to take our bags through the narrow little windy roads to the hidden Riad.    Upon arrival at the Riad we were sat down at the courtyard and provided with fresh mint tea and pastries to unwind. We were then joined by the manager Stefania who gave us really helpful information on the things we can see / do at Marrakech.    Our room (junior suite) was amazing and we had our own private balcony with a jacuzzi bath. What we found really helpful was the handy mobile phone the Riad provided which gave us gps and internet access whilst we were out and about. We used it a lot!    We had dinner at the Riad on the first night and the food was lovely. We also took advantage of the facilities and had hamman and a massage.    Our two nights stay was bliss we couldn't have asked for more.    The Riad was wonderful and the view were amazing. The staff were impeccable. I would definitely stay here again and couldn't recommend it highly enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Farron F wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Best Riad right in the heart of the Medina. Everyone went above and beyond to make my trip so fantastic. Yassin took such good care of us every night when we'd come down for dinner or drinks. He also went out of his way and served us on their gorgeous rooftop. I can't say enough great things! Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: You can really tell the workers take pride in their jobs. Every single employee was extremely helpful and friendly at every encounter. The location was prime within walking distance to the Medina and the new city. The room was excellent; it was very large and spotlessly clean every day. I even saw a cleaner one day moving a lamp to clean under and around the base; something you would never see at a normal property. Finally the on-site restaurant was delicious. We actually ate there every night and enjoyed every meal. They were also quite accommodating with our sleeping infant and served us meals on the terrace directly outside our room. I would highly recommend Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: GWEN F wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: It was my daughter and my first visit to Marrakesh and we couldn’t have picked a more perfect Riad ! The entire staff couldn’t do enough to make sure our stay was wonderful. Our meals were amazing and even their choice of private drivers and guides were incredible. We had a wonderful experience at their in-house hamman with wonderful massages. The rooftop deck was the most beautiful setting to view the Médina and have an evening cocktail.  Perfectly located near the souk were were able to walk there and then take easily available tuktuks(open air vehicle) back to the Riad after shopping. Our room was great and all of the modern conveniences were available. The beds were comfy and the wonderful white linens were of great quality! We are spoiled travelers who wanted for nothing during our stay. We will definitely return!! Hopefully sooner than later!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Luxury & relaxation at the perfect distance from the Medina
Review_Text: Wow what an amazing stay I had at Riad 72. From the moment I arrived I was astounded by the warmth and helpfulness of all the staff. After a long day of travel the warm welcome with water to wash my hands and warm tea and pastries was fantastic. The entire location and the rooms completely exceeded by expectations! This truly is a stunning boutique hotel and it has SUCH an intimate feel and relaxing atmosphere - exactly what you need after a day of exploring Marrakech! The room was so clean and comfortable and I especially appreciated the AC! The breakfast was a treat too - Moroccan pastries yogurt fruits and more... with the utmost attention to detail! OverallI would say Riad 72 is in the perfect location as it's just far enough from the craziness of the markets but still within walking distance to everything. I can't say enough about this Riad! The managers and staff are all SO friendly and helpful and everything is elegant tasteful clean and peaceful. I can't wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We enjoyed every minute from our stay in this beautiful Riad.  Everybody was so helpful sincere and kind.  The room was very clean and welcome after visiting the medina.  The breakfast on the rooftop is wonderful.  Thank you to the entire team for making our stay so magical!  Tom and Sascha
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury retreat in the Medina of Marrakech
Review_Text: Calm and peaceful small island in the Medina of Marrakech. Elegant tastefully furnished clean comfortable rooms and restaurant and excellent service from a super helpful and friendly team. Great roof terrace. Our suites were excellent spacious and one had a private roof terrace. Hamam and massages were delicious in small spa. Would always visit again when in Town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Very good riad with a very helpful and friendly staff
Review_Text: Riad 72 is a beautiful riad in a quiet area of the medina. The managers and the staff are all very helpful. My wife became ill during our four-day stay and the riad staff did everything possible to make her comfortable including bringing special drinks making special food and going out to buy medicine. They even followed up with an e-mail after we left the riad asking about my wife's condition. Our room was spacious and well designed. The meal areas are very pleasant and the rooftop area is very relaxing and provides a nice view of the city. Reasonable rates. Nice people. Good food.  Highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Geraldine L wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: I was greeted by my cheerful Riad 72 staff member at the taxi rank of Dar El Bacha which i later discovered to be an excellent location.Arriving at the black door i had no idea of the warm welcome that awaited me.My hands were washed with orange water and i was offered mint tea.Stefania checked me in and offered me a map in order to familiarise myself with the area.During my stay i felt that i was part of a family.Nothing was ever too much trouble.The food in the restaurant is delicious.My bedroom was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean.I WILL RETURN!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Nina G wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: A cozy, chic and quiet oasis between all the hustle and bustle!
Review_Text: An absolute must when searching for a chic and quiet accomodation in Marrakech. Very helpful and friendly staff beautifully decorated rooms and the more than central location is great too! Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An Oasis at the Marrakesh Medina
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time at Riad 72. The location is quite good (walking distance from all the main attractions) and the team provided a top quality service. We stayed in the junior suite that provided us all the comfort and relaxing atmosphere - well needed when you spend the day getting to know the city mainly walking. The private terrace and jacuzzi were simply phenomenal. Thank you again for making of our stay a memorable experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed staying at a Riad 72 during our stay in Morocco. Everybody was so kind helpful and lovely. The whole staff goes above and beyond for you. The rooms are amazing AND comfortable.We especially loved the rooftop terrace dining and our hamman/massage. Another plus is the location. It was very easy to navigate the souks from the hotel. This hotel made our Marrakesh experience totally enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for 5 nights and it was a hidden gem nestled in between the chaos of Marrakech. After an early morning flight from the U.K and a long wait at the airport the pick up organised by the Riad was great. A swift meet and greet and then the short 15-20 min drive to the Riad. We where aware that we arrived before the normal check in time but was delighted that after a light refreshment of tea and pastries and an introduction given by Stefania we were able to check in. Everything was explained tours breakfast Riad policy hamman etc..    Our room was traditional decorated and the best thing of all is the staircase that lead to our private terrace/balcony with Sunloungers and an outside shower which I think is the only one in the Riad. The only issue is that if there is music playing on the roof terrace it can be heard from the room but after midnight it was switched off so it was ok for us. Breakfast was a small selection of fresh bread and pastries with tea/coffee fresh orange juice. The Riad itself is wonderfully decorated with the flowing water centrepiece in the tranquil courtyard. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and always willing to assist with any questions. We booked the Hamman and massage which after a stressful day navigating the souks was much needed. The Hamman lady was a local which gave the experience an authentic feel. She did not speak a word of English but she was great and made the experience comfortable and had us in stitches from laughing so much. And the massage after was that added touch. A tip please drink loads of water before the Hamman because it gets very hot inside.    We ate lunch on the rooftop terrace which was a beautiful setting and the burger 72 was a delight after eating tagine and couscous for 4 days. The food was tasty and had flavour. We did not eat dinner at the restaurant but can say the restaurant was full almost every night we were there.    We had a mobile phone given to us for the duration of our stay but it was not needed but good to have in case of any emergencies which I think is an added touch thought of by the Riad.    Overall a wonderful stay at the Riad!    Thank you to Stefania and the whole team of staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This lovely riad is well located in the medina on a quiet street. The manager Stephania met with us upon our arrival and gave us a map with helpful directions. Our room was large and beautiful and we had our own private deck area. Breakfast were very good and you can order additional items to the continental fare. We ate at the restaurant one evening and it was delicious.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury & relaxation at the perfect distance from the Medina

The managers and staff are all SO friendly and helpful and everything is elegant tasteful clean and peaceful. I can't wait to return!

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Prior to arrival at this wonderful Riad Stefania the manager had been in contact via email offering help with any requirements we may need from airport pick up to restaurant and activity bookings. The Riad is in the medina in an area that has no car access it’s a 5 min walk from drop off area to the Riad. Behind the door awaits a wonderful oasis. Lovely greenery cool furniture and wonderful smiles from all the staff. We had a family suite with private rooftop terrace and jacuzzi...luxurious! You have a choice of having breakfast in the terrace in your room or the communal area. Food here is all freshly prepared and delicious. A detailed map and phone is provided which was very helpful. Without any hesitation I highly recommend staying here. They contributed to my new love...Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We enjoyed our stay in the Riad 72 very much: excellent service a beautiful room rooftop terrace with a nice view above Marrakech and a lovely breakfast. We will definitely come back to this magical place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mikkel Eggen wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Amazing riad with a very good restaurant, and super nice staff.
Review_Text: We had the pleasure of staying at Riad 72 for 3 nights and stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite in the new section of the hotel. The rooms are chic and modern very clean and have very comfortable beds. Our suite also had a fantastic private terrace with its own jacuzzi which we enjoyed every day.  We are very happy to have stayed at the beautiful Riad 72. The staff was wonderful and very helpful they made an effort to make us feel welcome. Stefania the manager is super nice and gave us a lot of useful information about Marrakech on the first day. The hotel also provided us with cellphones in case we got lost or needed any assistance. Luckily we did not have to use them but it made us feel safe. Breakfast was tasty and fresh and we also had dinner at the restaurant the first night The food was delicious and we would definitely recommend having dinner there. If we go back til Marrakesh we will absolutely stay here again. The Riad 72 is located centrally in the Medina and lies a short distance from many of Marrakech´s most famous sights.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: From the moment we arrived we stayed 4 nights and until departure the service and the staff were impeccable.  Perfect riad within the Medina to explore Marrakech.  Only 5 mins walk to the soul ( heart of the Medina)and easy for transfers tours and taxis to drop off and pick up. Most roads are located in alleyways were cars cannot get to and this is a 2 min walk out of the riad into a place where the cars can get you which is really important.  The room layout decor was beyond what I expected and very luxurious.  Really nice terrace where you can order drinks.  No bar but despite that you can order a drink anywhere in the riad making it really feel like home.  Bed is really comfortable and the food is amazing as well.  Would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Marrakech. I have travelled to many places and stayed in many hotels and this is definitely more comfortable and luxurious than staying in a 5 Star hotel. It has all the amenities of a 5 Star hotel but a much more relaxed atmosphere with intimate service!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cleo V wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Sleek modern riad with a nice restaurant!
Review_Text: This is a beautiful riad. It's styled in a more modern moroccan way which is a nice contrast to some of the more traditional riads we stayed in. The restaurant seems like a popular choice for visitors so expect outsiders around dinner time in the riad. Our room was comfortable but it was a loft style and would not recommend for those who can't climb steep stairs ask for a single floor unit. The terrace is absolutely lovely. I would certainly stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Charming, comfortable,and hospitable. A home away from home.
Review_Text: The Riad was charming as we expected but we also loved Stefania our host and the rest of the staff who were both helpful and made us feel completely at home. Our "family room" was elegantly furnished with lovely Moroccan accents and well laid out with a completely separate children's room with accompanying bathroom. We highly recommend Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Amazing service, perfect Hamman, great food
Review_Text: I am so glad I chose the Riad 72 I am working in a 5 star hotel in Canada but I was wowed by the servie in Riad 72. We were served with morrocan hand-wash snacks and mint teawhen we first arrived in the hotel. The hotel has a great location and easy to access every attractions. The Riad has security every night from 7pm to 1am he could walk guest to the souk if he is available. The best thing I found in the Riad was the phone provided to the guest it was fully charged and make us much easier to contact Riad whenever there is an emergency But the area is safe i was impressed by their hospitality. During my stay our housekeeper did amazing job the room was very clean and we were provided with turn down service every night. Breakfast was great and had great varieties( fresh juice fruits). The last night we booked hamman massage and dinner. It was exceptional hamman service spa massage was very relaxing dinner was very tasty( please make sure to reserve first the restaurant is always fully booked)    I have to mention one of employee( I forgot his name) he is dark and tall always working long hours he Is new to hotel about 3months ago I think he might be one of the managers he is always very patience to answer all the questions we had the last day he helped us to contact Ben Youssef college and let us know it is still in renovation it saved lots of time during our trip.    Please don’t hesitate to book with Riad 72 you will have a great experience with them
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had arranged a transfer from the airport and that worked perfectly a 20 minute drive and then a man with a cart met us to walk us through the narrow streets to the Riad 72. We were greeted by Stefania and a lovely man provided us with a hand wash mint tea and fresh pastries. Our room was absolutely beautiful spotlessly clean a huge bed and top quality bedding towels etc. It was useful to be given a mobile phone (with pre-loaded numbers in for the Riad should we need it). The staff were so polite - provided a first class service at all times. The room was cleaned and towels changed (every time we used the bathroom). The shower was fab too - very hot water and nice and powerful. Breakfasts were amazing - loved the fresh orange juice and the freshly made pancakes! My husband and I had a Hammam and a full body massage....you so have to do this! My skin has never felt so good. I was sad to leave the Riad and I really do hope to return. Marrakech was beautiful and our trip was enhanced by choosing to stay at this Riad. Thank you Stefania and your fabulous team!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephanie V wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: It was my third time staying at the Riad for the past few years. From the first time I found it perfect! Yet they don’t stop to amaze how they can make your experience even more perfect  Starting from the beautifuly desigbed rooms and space having many quiet areas in the Riad that you can always hang out at the Riad space and yet to have intimicy.  The immaculate service! The kind staff the amazing food. I could never say enough  Don’t forget to have a Hammam with Aisha!  Can’t wait to go back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: sarah p wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: I was a little nervous about visiting Marrakech with a girlfriend however this was a brilliant trip. Riad 72 was more than I could have expected. The rooms were very comfortable and nicely furnished. The staff were so helpful and welcoming we found the offer of a mobile phone very reassuring and used the security guard to walk us to and from our restaurant on one evening. We did not feel threatened or unsafe however the restaurant was slightly out of the way and at 10pm it felt a little late to be walking alone as females silly to take unnecessary risks. We ate breakfast on the roof terrace which was very nice with fruit yogurt and sweet and savoury cakes and pastries each morning we also ordered an omelette to share at no extra cost which was very tasty. My only disappointment was dinner in the Riad it was rated as No 2 in Marrakech and sadly we found the meal disappointing and lacking in flavour it maybe the chef had an off day or was not on his normal game. The atmosphere of the restaurant which is in the main courtyard is super with running water and lovely candles I fear we may have built ourselves up too much for a super meal and were disappointed We had planned to go out with the chef on morning to purchase ingredients and cook a lunch time meal with him later in our trip but because of the evening meal we decided not too. Instead we had a Hammas Salt Scrub and massage which was absolutely brilliant and much more enjoyable I am sure than cooking and very reasonabley priced. Be prepared that this a complete body scrub and hair wash for about 50 minutes in total. I have never had anything like it before but a carried out so well by the staff in a super warm wet room with hot stones that you sat on my skin felt super soft for weeks. The massage afterwards lasted an hour and was fab too. Would highly recommended this if you have time during your stay. I would definitely go back to Riad 72 that location staff and hotel facilities were perfect for the stay and everyone was extremely helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Wats O wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Wow ! What a magical place.. Amazing
Review_Text: We arrived at Riad 72 late on Sunday evening and was blown away with a warm and friendly welcome! After a short 20 minute ride from the air port we soon arrived to the top of the street where we were met with a man from the hotel who carried our bags to the Riad. Welcomed in with mint tea and biscuits we were relaxed and made to feel at home in front of the cosy fire!    Breakfast was always with a smile and fresh fruits breads jams. The rooms were immaculate the ladys must have come in to clean them four times a day - literally! Fresh towels every day and dressing gowns and slippers we could not have asked for anything more.    Ahmed free of charge guided us around Marrakesh on a evening taking us site seeing and booked day trips for us leaving us to relax.    Riad 72 is 5* and we would love to come back soon! Thank you to you all and especially the manager and Ahmed - you looked after us perfectly!    If anyone is thinking about staying in a RIAD its a must as it adds to the feel of the country instead of a standard hotel that can be found in any other country. Also free WIFI with a great connection and a free MAC to use as i had to do a little work unfortunately!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Maria P wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: I highly highly recommend Riad 72. Everything was incredible from the staff to the lovely modern unique rooms to the food (breakfast tea time and dinner!) to the location. Stefania was willing to help us with anything and provided great recommendations for what to do and see in Marrakesh. You almost don't even need to leave the Riad it's so beautiful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from Riad 72 and we had an amazing time. From dealing with Stefania in the lead up to our trip we knew we were going to be well looked after. She helped with transfers activities for our group and meal bookings. The staff who worked there were hands down the most accommodating and nicest people I have encountered in hospitality. They looked after everything our group needed with little fuss. The Rhiad itself was clean and stunning. The rooftop area was an absolute winner. We ended up cancelling one of our activities to spend more time there. We appreciate everything that Stefania and her team did to make our weekend one to remember! Loved it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Malaika M wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Peaceful and beautiful oasis in the midst of the medina
Review_Text: I have almost no words to describe how wonderful my stay was at Riad 72. I went there with my mother for a 3 night stay in Marrakech. We arrived in the evening and organised to have an airport transfer back to the riad where we were then greeted with a lovely welcome mint tea and hand washing with orange blossom water. Stefania the owner and manager of the Riad then came to greet us also and explained how the riad worked and gave us some tips on what to see around Marrakech.  We had booked our dinner there in advance for the night we arrived and it was delicious and fresh I would definitely recommend eating there at least once on the trip. The gorgeous fresh breakfast are also worth mentioning!  On our first full day of exploring we booked a guide for the medina through the riad which we found incredibly helpful for getting our bearings in the city.  Our room was one of the standard rooms in the new section of the riad and was absolutely perfect! Incredibly clean the design was modern but with a Moroccan touch. On the whole very comfortable a perfect place to return to after a long day of walking around the medina! (Special shout out to the super cozy fireplace in the courtyard also!)    All in all my mother and I could not be happier with the level of hospitality we have received while at Riad 72. Stefania and her team were truly wonderful and incredibly knowledgable and we could not imagine staying anywhere else when we do return to Marrakech (which will hopefully be sooner rather than later)!    Malaika & Alessandra ✨
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Clive F wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: IT'S LIKE THE BIGGEST DIAMOND, HARD TO FIND BUT PRICELESS
Review_Text: We were only here for dinner but wished we had stayed here as well it's absolutely beautiful friendly professional staff treated us like their best friends even produced a surprised birthday cake which was as good as Riad72. You'll be met by their own staff at the taxi rank and escorted there and back.  Thank you all    Clive ValDavid and Hilary
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Escape from the hustle and bustle
Review_Text: We had an excellent stay. We organised a transfer to and from the airport with them and that went like clockwork. The taxi can't get next to the Riad so you are met by a member of staff who will walk you back to the Riad with your luggage which is about 5 mins walk. The Riad is in an excellent location about 10 mins from the souks but far enough away that it is peaceful and mentally you are escaping the hustle and bustle. A lovely greeting and our deluxe room with a roof terrace was super and like the pictures (The only negative like others have mentioned is that the shower seems to soak the floor). We ate in the courtyard the first night. Stefania was not around during our visit and we didn't get an introduction to the hotel where things were how we could get for example mint tea when we got back during the day. We managed to on our last day but getting the guy doing building work to call out. We did have a nice time and would stay again but we opted to go to other places instead of our hotel because of that. The Riad is what you picture when you think of a stay in Marrakesh. Breakfast was nice and the staff were always polite.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad 72 is a oasis of tranquility and calm in the medina in Marrakech. Located perfectly for both the newtown and the old town ( 10 mins walk to each) . The rooms are a mix of traditional Moroccan with some tasteful modern touches . The only issue for this class of property is the sound of the plumbing albeit this is not a rarity in Morocco. Breakfast is beautiful with light as a feather pastries and cakes ( the honey is fabulous) . Final mention has to go to the hamman which was a wonderful traditional experience and leaves you feeling refreshed and relaxed we had our just before our flight home ( room provided afterward for changing and freshening up)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we arrived to when we sadly had to leave this oasis of calm in the middle of the Medina was just wonderful. The lovely welcome we received from Stefania and her staff was more than we would have expected especially having experienced the delays getting out of the airport. They seem to have thought of everything from the wonderful welcoming mint tea to the personal mobile phone they insist you carry with you in case of any problems you may have out in the Medina. The food was excellent and we also experienced the excellent Hammam spa and massage. Our room was like none we have stayed in before and one of the best beds I have slept in other than my own.  The position the setting and most of all the friendly and attentive staff made Riad 72 the perfect place to explore Marrakech from. I would highly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Greg Cust wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: The reviews I read before booking we're good but barely did Riad 72 justice. Right the heart of the Medina of Marrakech this unassuming building was a delightful sanctuary. The staff could not have been kinder cannot find any fault.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Caroline J wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: We arrived in the evening and the walk through the alleyways to the riad was slightly intimidating even though we had been met at the taxi rank by a member of staff. However once we entered the riad it was like an oasis of calm. We were welcomed with the delicious mint tea that is the national drink. The staff were all very attentive and our stay was made very enjoyable and relaxing.  I would recommend this riad to anyone thinking of visiting Marrakech. It is a crazy city and it was lovely to return to the calm and beautiful surroundings of the riad after the hectic pace of the outside.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we booked through Expedia we received an email from Stefania thanking us for our booking and details about the Riad. If I have a tip for any traveller staying in the Medina it would be to have the Riad pick you up from the airport yes it may cost 50 Dirhams more less than £5 but it's worth every penny saves you getting lost and frustrated. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay which was for my husband's Birthday which I mentioned in my email to book the transport. Everything was wonderful about our stay from the moment we were collected at the airport and greeted by Stefania on our arrival to the day of departure. The rooms are lovely and the shower is great power shower with lashings of hot water. That thing about never enough coat hangers we had loads...the roof terrace is great for catching the sun and we had lunch served on the terrace one day. The staff are SO helpful we had a mobile just in case given to us nothing is too much trouble. Worth having a meal in the evening at the Riad we did twice and it was great. Great Location everything in walking distance and lots of good restaurants close by. They even recognised my husbands Birthday whilst we where there and presented him with a breakfast surprise. We have stayed in many Riad's over the years and this one does deserve the excellent rating it has.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Most amazing stay, you can’t beat this!
Review_Text: We had the most amazing stay in this Riad. Our room was stunning quiet and spotless! We even had our own sunbathing terrace. The breakfast was awesome and even a cappuccino was specially made for us with no charge. Excellent location with a short walk to the main square and the souks as well as only 25 minute walk to the amazing Yves Saint Laurant museum and gardens. The staff could not have been more helpful. They picked us up and dropped us off at the Taxi square we were even given a little mobile in case we got lost! Of all our travels this rates as one of the best hotels run by happy and cheerful staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ellen S wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Amazing place and amazing staff. Perfect located in the Medina. Beautiful design with discreet elegance and an oasis of tranquillity and peacefulnes. Stefania and her crew were so helpful and gave us the best service we could get. The food was delicious homemade and organic.  When in Marrakech this is the place to stay you will not regret  Thanks to the Riad 72 team for a fantastic stay. See you next time in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Our 3 night stay at Riad72 was divine. Stefania and her team embraced us like royalty from the moment we arrived. Perfect location in the medina. Our 2nd floor suite with private terrace and jacuzzi was sumptuous and kept spotless by the hardworking staff. We slept like logs awoke to the magical sounds of the muezzin ate delicious hearty breakfasts of fresh fruit homemade yoghurt fresh squeezed orange juice and tasty Moroccan pastries. Our couples Hammam and massage at the hotel spa was an experience! We loved it. It left us relaxed and soft-skinned. Late one night a staff member walked us to our restaurant in the heart of the medina to make sure we didn’t get lost. I would absolutely stay at Riad72 and couldn’t recommend it more!! Thank you to everyone at Riad72 for the magical stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Linda R wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Beautiful setting and comfortable rooms but the best feature is the warm and helpful staff. Food was excellent. We looked forward to a yummy dinner after a day of adventuring. It is a Riad experience so there is some noise in from the courtyard in the evening.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We just spent a week at Riad 72 and just fell in love with it. The Riad is in mint condition and provides an oasis of tranquillity offers beautiful niches terraces and gardens to retreat to and our suite was always spotless clean. The staff was very friendly and made us feel at home immediately. Despite landing with delay we were awaited at the airport and guided to Riad 72 (otherwise very difficult to find!). Its location in the medina is perfect all spots are within 10 min walking distance. We got good support organizing an excursion breakfast was always excellent and dinner enjoyable. Many thanks to the Riad 72 team for a fantastic stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This small Riad is really well located and amazingly comfortable. The management really understand how to make you feel welcome and relaxed and couldn't have tried harder to make our stay enjoyable. Comfortable quiet room private roof terrace and consistently excellent service. The hammam was fun and the massage was super relaxing. Great value and we will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lotta W wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Simply amazing! If we ever travel to Marrakech again no doubt we would choose to stay at 72 Riad Living! Lovely Riad and a friendly Team! Great Service with Taxi Transfer and Mobile Phone during our stay. Rooftop breakfast not to mention! Thank’s for unforgettable days in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: berthy s wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: We travelled with group of 18 and stay for 3 nights in Riad 72. All services is excellent. The welcome drink Mint tea and Pastry the staffs all good.Special thanks to Stephanie a very stunning lady who always ready to help us start from the beginning to the end even only simple thing she tried to fulfill it. The breakfast and dinner also very good especially dessert.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Me and the groups have 3 nights stay in the Riad and all of us have an incredible experience during our stay. The rooms are homey and roomy with a very good facilities of WIFI and super excellent breakfast with fresh ingredients. One thing that really amaze me is the hospitality from all of the staffs! They are so helpful and doing everything sincerely. Maybe that also the reason you are not away from home. Definitely enjoy and so happy. Hope to see you guys again and take care! 4 thumbs up for Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Vera E wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: This is a beautiful hotel very well situated in the medina with very friendly staff and great service. The rooftop terrace is amazing! And they serve a delicious breakfast in the morning.  I will definitely be going back soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Mauro A wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Small beautiful riad in the old medina. The service is amazing from the airport pickup to the wonderful breakfast and gorgeous terrace.  The perfect place for a romantic getaway.  The manager Stefania will make sure you will have the perfect time in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad 72 for three nights in January and had the loveliest time. The Riad itself is beautiful - a tranquil oasis away from the madness of the souks - and the staff made us feel comfortable looked after and as if nothing was too much trouble.    Our room was as nice as the pictures looked (the bathroom with an insanely huge and deep bath was my favourite in particular).    Breakfasts were delicious and varied every day and on our first night we had dinner served to us in the impossibly romantic private dining room at the back of the Riad - highly recommended.    Thank you Riad 72 team - if we return to Marrakech it will definitely be to you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Stay in a Great Location
Review_Text: We completed a great stay at Riad 72. It is a really cool blend between modern and traditional Riad living! The rooms were very comfortable and we found the service (especially the full-time security guard) to be fantastic. The Riad is a great quiet location that is close to all of the major attractions of Marrakech. The manager and host is really accessible and was quick to rectify any situation that arose. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Catherine C wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: My best friend and I had the perfect 4-night stay at Riad72! The property is absolutely stunning and pristine. The staff is beyond friendly and helpful. The restaurant is delicious. It truly was so lovely.    From the moment we arrived at the Marrakech airport we were greeted by a driver from Riad72. When we arrived near the property a staff member met us to carry our luggage to the property which is about a 3 minute walk from a busy intersection. The location of Riad72 was perfect -- just a few minutes walk away from the center of the bustling medina which was very nice to stay away from the center as it gets quite hectic. The property also has a security guard outside of the entrance of the riad at night which made us feel incredibly safe.    Our room was beautiful the amenities were fantastic and the hotel staff kept our room incredibly clean throughout our 4-night stay. There is also a spa on-site where you can experience a traditional hammam treatment that was great. The breakfast lunch and dinner was so delicious -- one of my favorite places we ate during our stay in Marrakech.    Stefania and her team are absolutely lovely and I highly recommend this property to anyone and everyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Most beautiful restaurant. Food was good and service amazing. We visited a 2nd time and service was so bad as they had a group booking and could not give any attention to us at all. Felt sorry for staff as they were literally running!    Will judge overall on the first visit as it was one of the highlights of of our dining experiences here in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Beautiful Riad very well maintained and in a great location very close to all markets shopping and many restaurants. Very near to taxi stand so that places outside of the medina are easily accessible. I can't say enough about the staff- incredibly professional kind and helpful. Hassan Yusuf asma and everyone else were so very kind - with stafania at the helm our stay was smooth and glitch-free. The property itself is very clean beautifully decorated and fosters relaxation with its water fountain calming scent and comfortable furniture. Additionally there is security around the riad also who makes sure you get back correctly and safely after a late evening. I highly recommend this riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad 72 is the perfect get away place. Romantic and cute. The staff was also really nice and Stefania gave us really good tips. The room was absolutely wonderful and we slept really well. Great location not in the center of the Medina which helps a lot. Great Wine as well. Thank you!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alana Carolina R wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: My friends and I had the best experience in Riad 72.  First of all the reception is great they make you feel welcome and home from the moment you step in the Riad. Stefania is the best she is so kind and thoughtful! They even give you a phone so you can contact the Riad and even the personal number of Stefania anytime you need. We used it a few times to call the Riad because we wanted them to help us make reservations at restaurants for dinner. Worked out perfectly!  The room was soooo beautiful also. The decor was really elegant. And the breakfast is great we loved having it at the rooftop one of the days. By the way the rooftop is awesome it has such a great view!  Everything was perfect and we couldn't be happier with our choice of Riad. Definitely recommend it :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Becca H wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: We were made to feel perfectly relaxed from the moment we stepped through the door. The riad is so calm and quiet despite being just a few minutes walk from the souks and main square. Having such a relaxing base meant we were able to enjoy the bustle of the city all the more.    Our room was very comfortable and beautifully decorated but we also felt able to make ourselves at home in communal areas of the building.    Every member of staff we spoke to was helpful and friendly. We were given information about the city a custom map and a mobile phone in case we got lost.    I can't wait to return to Riad72 to see it in the sunshine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Peaceful Atmosphere and Modern Design make this riad an exceptional
Review_Text: We loved staying at Riad 72. Stefania the manager and all the staff were so welcoming serving us mint tea fantastic breakfasts and marvelous lunches and dinners which were among the best we had in Marrekech. Our room was gorgeous a great mix of modern and unique Moroccan touches. We even had our own private roof patio. Riad 72's location was perfect a mere 5 minutes from the taxi stand and less than 10 minutes by foot to the souks. We can't wait to return!

Review_Date: G J wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at Riad 72. The ambience and rooms are gorgeous with beautiful architecture and tasteful decor. The restaurant on location offers unique dishes with a strong Moroccan influence. We are vegetarians and found plenty of choices to pick from. The location is ideal as it's close to most of the main attractions within the Medina.The manager Stefania and the staff are extremely helpful and they made us feel right at home. They helped us plan trips around the city which made it a memorable experience for us. We highly recommend Riad 72!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lisa C wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: A lot of other Riads are quite cold as the inner yard is open. This one is covered and it has a lot of nice and beautiful places to hang out. Fantastic service and hospitality. The breakfast fast excellent and we also had a wonderful marrocan Christimas-dinner there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Julia B wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: Perfect oasis, lovely staff, excellent location
Review_Text: Beautiful riad in excellent location in Medina. The decor and design was lovely our suite was HUGE and beautifully decorated and furnished. Great rooftop with 360 degree views. All the staff were welcoming friendly and helpful. Delicious food. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Riad 72 was our base for 3 nights. The property is lovely; all the restaurant housekeeping and other personnel were exceptional--except for the manager and unfortunately our experience with her left me with a dislike for this property.    We had communicated multiple times over the months leading up to our trip because I explicitly reserved a room with two beds--and confirmed that reservation. (I was traveling with my adult son and sharing a bed with him is just not something I want to do.) The manager greeted us with a breezy "I have some good news and I have some bad news. Your room is not available but we have upgraded you to a lovely room that you will LOVE!!" Well we didn't. She blew me off when I asked for a different room. We were tired and I caved.    The next day I spoke with her to see if we could get a room with two beds. She said "But everyone LOVES the room I put you in!! It's special!! Families love it!!" I had to really work to get her to stop telling me how wonderful the room was and repeated my request. Well as it turns out there was a room available with two beds. Why weren't we put there to begin with? Beats me.    Our third night we wanted to go to a Mediterranean restaurant for a mezze. She insisted there were no such restaurants in all of Marrakech. She said: "Madame you are in Morocco. We serve Moroccan food. We do not have any restaurants with a mezze." So we instead headed out to a purportedly hip restaurant. And ... the first 4 pages of the menu were a mezze. Labelled as "mezze." Why wasn't this restaurant recommended? Beats me.    There were other similar incidents. She kept talking over me and arguing with me maybe hoping to wear me down? I am giving the property a "very good" rating because of the other staff and the beauty of the facility. But when I go to Marrakech it won't be to Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: It was perfect we absolutely enjoyed our stay here! The crew was very caring they took care of just everything. The cooking classes were really cool too. They also offer hammam and massages. Our room was nice and clean and the whole riad just wonderful - it also has a fabulous terrass. Would definitely recommend Riad 72.

Review_Title: Excellent hotel, excellent staff - style & design at it's best!
Review_Text: We stayed in Riad72 during our 5 day trip to Marrakesh in December. For us it was the perfect experience and a wonderful homebase in a bustling city.    Riad72 is located in a more quiet part of the medina still you can reach everything by foot. To the souks it is just a 10 minute walk to the new YSLaurant museum is is a nice 15 minutes walk...    The design of Riad72 is stunning - everything just fits. We actually spent quite a lot of time in the hotel - just enjoyed sitting in one of the 2 patios reading or on our roof terrace. You calm down as soon as you enter the door - relax-mode on.    The staff is exceptional. Everyone (!!!) is always there to help they organise trips or guides also on short notice they give recommendations. Stefania the manager has an answer to all your questions - and if not she finds one and comes back to you. You really feel they are taking care of their guests - it is more than what you usually experience in a hotel more personal but still so authentic.    We also had dinner several times at the hotel restaurant La table du Riad - what a pleasure! You sit in the quiet patio candles everywhere the food is fresh and delicious. We really enjoyed tasting us through the menu. We did not feel the need to try more restaurants outside if the good one is so close :)    Usually I do not really write recommendations but this time I really felt it necessary to tell the world of this fantastic place. We will for sure come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of calm and refinement
Review_Text: My wife and I spent four wonderful nights at the Riad 72 in late November and can't recommend it too highly. From the moment we stepped through the unprepossessing outer door into the first courtyard we felt cared for and relaxed. The ambiance is calm and uniformly aesthetic - both in the public spaces and in the rooms. We were upgraded to a junior suite in the new wing of the hotel which surrounds a second courtyard. Though only a couple of months old this new space preserves the traditional style and our room was exceptionally tasteful and welcoming - the tone throughout the Riad72 is good taste without fussiness or excessive decoration and the result is harmonious and soothing. The abundant greenery in the first courtyard makes it possible for many guests to have breakfast a drink or an excellent dinner in the same space while feeling somewhat secluded in one's own corner of the courtyard. There is also a lovely rooftop space - perfect for viewing the sunset and with vistas over the entire medina and to the silhouette of the Atlas mountains. The staff could not have been warmer or more solicitous. We also tried the haman and the massage service which were expert and revivifying. We would be eager to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nina T wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: We had three lovely days at the Riad. The rooms are lovely and nicely warm - which was nice returning to in the evening as we there there in December when it gets quite cold in the night. Stefania and her team was all very welcoming and friendly. We enjoyed the hotels breakfast. The location is great - and very central. Just a few turns from the busy market - very quiet and we felt very safe in the area. Would love to return on day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ana A wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Not enough words to describe how amazing our stay in Riad72 has been.  Starting with the lovely people working there continuing with the awesome oasis - riad itself (it is a huuuuge relieve to enter the tranquil riad after a crazy day in the souks) and ending with the kindness of Stephanie who actually helped us with a problem we had with out transport to our next destination.  It has been a pleasure to get up every morning in such a nice and quiet palace with the water murmur and the delicious breakfast.  Everyone very attentive and willing to help. Thank you for making my first trip to Marrakech perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen T wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad with amazing staff and customer service!
Review_Text: Love love love this Riad! My trip was seamless. From the airport pickup arranged by the Riad to the welcome from the friendly staff that included delicious Moroccan tea and cookies to Stefania and her team covering all you need to know about your stay the city and options for sightseeing. The room was beautiful and arranged per my request. It also had a beautiful bouquet of roses on the table!! The bathroom included a very large tub approximately 6 feet in length! A pleasure to soak in after a long day shopping in the medina. The location is perfect as it's just a few minutes walk from many of the sights and sounds of the markets. The rooftop offers gorgeous views of the city with several mosques in view. Hearing the call to prayer from the rooftop and standing and looking out over the city kicked the stay off just right. It's a mesmerizing feeling to just take in the sights and sounds as you begin your vacation. The room comes with a preprogrammed house cell phone that you can use should you get lost or need assistance from the staff as you explore the city. They also not only provide you with the key to your room but a key to the front door of the Riad. "Our home is your home" while here and everything you could ask for was provided. The rooftop offers lounge chairs to relax and enjoy the sun and a beautiful mafraj or sitting area to relax and unwind after a day on the town. The staff frequently checks on you to see if there is anything you need. From brining you wine snacks dinner or whatever you'd like to blankets and wraps as the night begins to chill. Breakfast is served each morning until 11 and includes fresh fruit yogurt coffee or tea breads pastries jams jellies honey and butter. Each day there was a new pastry to try. Your room also comes with daily bottled water fruit and a small candy snack at the end of day with turn down service. Excursions can be booked through the staff and they will arrange your taxi or transportation needed. They take care of it all and let you know when your driver has arrived. At that point one from the staff will walk you through the few small streets and alleys to Dar el Bacha to your awaiting transportation. I would highly recommend a stay at Riad 72 to anyone. I hope to be back someday! Special thank you to Stefania Aziz Rachied Hassan Yousef You guys are the best!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: D B wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Staying at the Riad 72 was a wonderful experience. From the warm welcome to the "house cell phone" we could take along with us in case we got lost wandering around the Medina (we did not get lost but it was good to know that we had a back-up in case we did). The atmosphere was cool and relaxed with a number of different seating areas from the roof to a library to the courtyard atrium it was easy be alone or among other guests. We will stay here again on our next visit to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ariana N wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Riad 72 went above and beyond our expectations. We arranged for airport transfers (210 dh) and the service was friendly and prompt. I highly recommend you do this at least being picked up from the airport as finding the Riad otherwise will be extremely difficult. It is a large property hidden in the streets of the Medina- walking distance from every sight you would want to see (we walked to Jardin Majorelle Bahia and Badi Palace Ben Youssef etc.) and also very easy to take a cab from. On arrival you are treated like royalty with Moroccan mint tea and a scented hand wash. The staff is attentive and friendly and Stefania is welcoming and helpful from the start. We only spent two nights there but Stefania and her team made us feel very welcome. We are a young couple (which in some places in Marrakech wouldn't be able to stay in the same room) but the Riad was more than welcoming. They even did a Hammam treatment for the two of us (highly recommend- very amazing experience in the convenience of the Riad. Would also recommend doing the massage afterwards as well). We stayed in a Classic room (the smallest/cheapest option) but was still an incredible space with a large comfortable bed beautiful carved wooden ceiling and an open bathroom. I have travelled all over the world and stayed at some of the best 5-star hotels and this easily compares. The intimate feel of the Riad makes the experience personalized and romantic. Stefania had lots of recommendations and make sure you feel really comfortable and safe- you are given a local phone just in case with numbers to the Riad. We also had the free breakfast there every morning (delicious selection of pastries fruit tea/coffee/fresh OJ) and dinner in the the restaurant (which was a romantic experience in itself). I cannot stress enough how amazing being in this Riad was. Marrakech is a very hectic but enchanting city and our trip wouldn't have been as successful and enjoyable had we not stayed here. Will definitely come back if I ever visit again. Thanks again to Stefania and her team for an incredible stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A great stay in a beautiful oasis!
Review_Text: We really loved staying at Riad 72 - a welcome relaxing place in the middle of the busy Medina! The staff was wonderful and accommodating - making us all feel safe and cozy and right at home. Breakfast was delicious and the rooms were fantastic - unique cozy and comfortable. We absolutely loved staying there over other accommodations due to its quiet and small nature unique and unique/relaxing beauty! Some of us had massages at the spa and they were wonderful as well. Don't stay anywhere else in Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A tranquil Oasis amidst the chaos of Marrakesh!
Review_Text: We stayed in this Road for 4 nights and had such a lovely time. You're greeted from the airport/bus station depending on how you arrive by taxi and taken into the city where a porter meets you and leads you down the winding Marrakesh alleyways. A massive wooden door in the wall opens up into a stunning Raid where you are greeted by Stephania and her wonderful team. You're given some Moroccan mint tea (of course!) and some yummy little homemade treats. We had a 'deluxe' room which was lovely and looked out to the internal courtyard (there are only 1 or 2 with the private balcony so not always guaranteed). The bed was huge and very comfortable and there is enough room for storage for a few days worth of clothes the shower and bathroom are lovely. All the staff are excellent the breakfasts are divine and for the first time in a long time we also booked an evening meal in our hotel rather than eating out every night and it was a great move. We booked the Tanjia (they need 6-8 hours notice) and it was simply fantastic and the internal gardens make for a great setting to have dinner.    I also booked to have a massage in the hotel. If you look on trip then there are 2 hamams that rate very highly and are close by but honestly I don't think you need to leave the Riad. The rates are more or less the same for an hours massage it was really excellent (and I speak as a professional masseuse) plus you get to leisurely stroll back to your room in your robe and collapse in a relaxed heap!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We just stayed at Riad 72 for our first trip to Marrakech and we cannot day enough amazing things about this special place! The property is absolutely gorgeous romantic and luxurious. Every room is so cozy and homey while still being elegant and exotic. The rooms and bathrooms are extremely clean and that is a huge deal for someone like me :) We were going to stay at the La Mamounia Resort but we’re advised to stay in a Riad because it makes the whole experience more special and I’m so glad we did :)! The entire staff not only are at your beckon call but they are gracious and absolutely amazing! So sweet and caring and helpful! The manager aka concierge Stefania was one of the most amazing people we had ever met! She was extremely professional and set up absolutely everything we could’ve ever wanted each day and night! She set us up with the perfect excursions for many of the days and made us reservations for the perfect upscale and relaxed restaurants for night! We ate two nights at the Riad itself which was also absolutely delicious and so romantic and cozy! Also very easy to just go downstairs :) There are honestly not enough good things that can be said about this very special place and we can’t wait to get back here hopefully very very soon! Thank you for absolutely EVERYTHING!!!!!! You hold a very special place in our hearts!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nigel C wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: This was our first visit to Marrakech and the walk from the taxi drop-off point to Riad 72 felt like we had landed on a different planet. The noise the smells the shops and stalls and all the people !! Our luggage had been unloaded from the taxi into a hand car and one of the Riad 72 staff was weaving his way through streets and alleys. This was our first contact with the wonderful Riad 72 service.  The Riad itself is set behind a very heavy door in a quiet alley and entering it is like escaping to an oasis of peace after the bustle of the Medina. Even though we were very early and hours before check-in our room was ready and after an efficient and warm check-in process we were given a guided tour of the wonderful Riad 72. Our room was a good size with everything you need to relax and slow down. One major bonus - no TV in the room !! We had our first lunch served on the roof terrace by possibly the most efficient and courteous waiter ever !!!  When we finally got to leave the Riad to explore the Medina we were given an "emergency mobile phone" for the event that we got lost. A nice touch although Google maps was our saviour.  Breakfast is a treat - every morning a different variation on a theme with daily variants of bread and pastries fruit salad and so on. Eggs on request. The service and courteousness of staff was a thread throughout our stay.  On the last night we ate at the Riad - specialty dishes that required six hours of preparation. Great food and I know I'm sounding like a broken record with great service.    We were only Riad 72 for 3 nights but we will bw back next year for a longer stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad 72 is an absolutely fantastic place to stay. The welcome the staff the room the shower (wow) the breakfast the roof the location... all faultless. I absolutely loved it and recommend it to all visiting Marrakech. It’s location suits those who want to try equal measures of the old and the new Marrakech which I recommend most should and it becomes a fragrant oasis in the heart of it all when you’re there.    Stefania was incredibly welcoming and her team so helpful and friendly we wanted for nothing and got everything.    Thank you so much for an amazing stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Azzis meets you at the taxi drop with a cart for your luggage. You follow him down several narrow alleyways to the door for Riad 72. You enter from the alley into a magical oasis. Lovely room. Great breakfast. Beautiful rooftop lounge and restaurant. Peaceful sunset with call-to-prayer drifting over the city. On top of all that Stefania is a lovely knowledgable helpful manager. She organized perfect tours/guides.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: adrianne k wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: We loved our stay at Riad 72! What a beautiful and peaceful oasis. The courtyard of the Riad has a beautiful central water feature and lovely plantings. At night we enjoyed dinner there as it provided a candlelit retreat from the activities of the day (the riad is centrally located for seeing the medina palaces and medersa). We cannot say enough good things about the attention and kindness paid to us by the Riad 72 staff. Stephania Rachid Asma and others were wonderfully helpful and unfailingly kind. they went well above and beyond in helping us with anything that we asked. Our room was very comfortable and decorated in traditional Moroccan fashion. The room included a private roof-top balcony where we could have breakfast or dinner. This is top notch in our travel stays.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Saima A wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Excellent stay, the staff were so warm and lovely
Review_Text: We loved our 4 day stay here the breakfast was delicious and the room was very pretty and clean.    The staff specially Hassan was so warm and took such good care of us. They were so mindful of our little one's asleep that they stopped some repair work during his nap time. Excellent location close enough to the souks but still in a quiet place.  would highly recommend it
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Riad 72 exceeded all our expectations and was in our eyes the perfect place to stay in Marrakesh. Just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the souks it really was an oasis of calm and peace. Beautifully designed and decorated it felt high end and absolutely worth paying a little more for. Although we only stayed for 2 nights it was such a memorable time. Would HIGHLY recommend the hammam experience and the massage. The staff are lovely as well - best breakfast and evening meal we had in Morocco. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anil R wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Miraculous in the center of it all
Review_Text: Located about a 10 minute walk from the Souks this hotel is one of the most unique experiences we have ever had  Upon arrival early in the afternoon we were greeted by our staff who gave us light refreshments and proceeded to promptly check us in. Note that streets aren’t typically marked clearly to there is lots of potential to get lost knowing this we were provided with a map and cellphone in case we got lost  The atmosphere inside the lobby is indescribable - I’ve never been to a hotel that smells so good!!!  It is so quit calm and serene in contrast with the bustle right outside  A taxi stand Is located about 350m away. We were really well looked after during our stay. The hotels and rooms are accessible by old school keys. Wireless is decent but who wants to stay inside anyways. There is a Mac desktop in the lobby located in the library- this is equipped with a printer. The staff replenishes your water and supplies and makes up the bed each time you are out  Our package included breakfast which is served from 0800. Breakfast consists of tea coffee fruit yogurt and some sort of pastry. It was different each day. Not buffet but definitely more than sufficient.  Each room is unique . This hotel has 2 suites and 6 rooms.  We stayed in the basic room which more than met our needs. Each room had 2 lounge chairs  - table several lamps and a very large bed the bathrooms had large marble tubs ( I’m over 6 feet tall and fit in !)  probably one of the largest bathtubs that I’ve seen  The highlight of this hotel is the staff which really bend over backwards to make your experience second to none.  I would highly recommend this hotel solely based on the experience we had

Review_Date: Cecilie L wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: One thing is the riad itself. lovely courtyard super roof terrace and inspiring quirky rooms - all very different. But the best feature of the riad is Stefania and her staff. i have been to Marrakech a few times (staying in different places) but I have never experienced such a dedicated and friendly staff. I can also reccomend the food at the hotel dinner at the roof terrace was lovely! The riad is also in a nice part of the Medina quite easy ti find and a good starting point for your adventure in the souks. i will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Unbelievable Service, Fabulous Stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: The staff was so friendly and accommodating I was sad to leave! The rooms are decorated beautifully comfortable bed and the terrace view overlooking the city is wonderful. I had dinner one night and the food was excellent. I would highly recommend a stay here and would gladly come again the next time I'm in town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We arrived at Riad 72 by the sunset and were welcomed in the stunning courtyard with a fresh mint Tea. All employes are incredibly friendly and courteous and make you feel like home.  After passing a day in the souks of marrakech coming back to the riad was like coming home to your calm living room.  There is no buffet for breakfast but the lovingly prepared breakfast that is served in the different courtyards is way better than any buffet.  We once had dinner in the "table du riad" which is on the rooftop with an amazing view. Ask for the menu in advance as everything is totally fresh and some dishes take up to 6 hours (!). The food the service and the whole ambiance were amazing.    Summed up I would recommend Riad 72 to anybody! We felt like experiencing the real Marrakech thanks to all people working for Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We have stayed at several luxury hotels worldwide previously but have never experienced a hotel with a staff so dedicated service minded and extremely friendly as at Riad 72. Stefania and her staff made us feel at home for the whole week we stayed there. Stefania met us at arrival. She even gave me some toiletries since my suitcase was lost. She is a lovely women always smiling and committed to ensure that we had a truly unique stay. Moustapha Rashid and Hassan where kind smiling and always went out of their way to help. The service is outstanding!    This is a high standard riad. It is lovely coming in from the busy Medina and feel the calm atmosphere. The roof terrace is lovely with a nice view over the city and the Atlas mountains. Dinner at the roof terrace can be recommended. It is very good situated in the Medina with walking distance to most of the things. The rooms are very nice. The staff changed towels sometimes twice a day and cleaned the room nicely. Clothes where even fold.  Another fantastic service gesture that made us feel safe throughout the stay were that we were given a cell phone. So if we got lost or needed anything we could give them a call.    Thank you so much everyone at Riad 72 for making our week in Marrakech a fantastic stay.  This is our home in Marrakech and we would like to come back.

Review_Title: Beautiful stay- amazing service and food!
Review_Text: When we started planning our trip to Marrakech it took me a few weeks to decide where to stay. After so much research I decided to book Riad 72 for my husband our 3 yr old and my self.    We had a wonderful time in Marrackech and the Riad was just the perfect match. Beautiful and calm setting incredible clean amazing fresh food perfect location and the best was the service. The staff in the hotel its incredible they go beyond your expectation you dont find this level of service in any hotel. I felt very calm and confident with our boy around in the Riad and the staff was really nice with our little one.    We had a room facing the courtyard and we where able to put our toddler in bed and have dinner the two of us in the courtyard literally facing our room door!.. This was a plus for us.    The food... anyone visiting Marrakech should try this restaurant. Its fresh fine cuisine and very authentic. Beautiful presented and the ingredients at its best quality. Breakfast was something to look fwd every morning! as everyday you get something different!    Next time we visit Marrakech I wont take long to book as I know now the best place to stay!    Congratulations to all the team for your outstanding work
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Diana S wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Everything was impeccable and we were welcomed so warmly by everyone in the Riad. It was a joy every moment and we couldn't recommend it enough for value beauty and the rooftop is a must! We were so centrally located you could walk everywhere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in the suite for 5 nights and it was phenomenal. The riad and suite were beautiful! What really made this an unforgettable stay were the small touches. The hand wash and mint tea and pastries upon our arrival was a great way to start our holiday. Stefania showed us a map of Marrakech and talked us through places to visit. We were given a mobile phone with numbers of people at the Riad in case we got lost or just needed someone to escort us home. Staff were incredibly friendly and attentive (they remembered that I like coffee with my breakfast and still water for dinner!). We had the hammam and massage at the end our trip and it was quite literally the best thing ever.    The riad is located to many sightseeing spots and souks. It's hard to believe you're so close to the souks because the riad is so quiet. The riad is also only a 20 minute drive from the airport.    If you have never been to Marrakech before or have been many times I highly recommend staying at Riad 72. The staff are amazing the riad is absolutely stunning you will feel like royalty staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Savage B wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Listen up fellas    I am a man from Texas and I felt at home here. Do not look at any other RIADS. This is THE place to stay. Upon arrival (when I say upon arrival literally within the first minute) my wife and I felt like the King and Queen of Morocco. Service is phenomenal food is great RIAD is comfortable safe quiet (minus the mosque that have their call to prayer)(that is everywhere in the city) clean and private. The team at RIAD 72 has thought of everything. They can book any adventure you want at the same rate you will find on this website. Literally let them take care of you. We did the traditional Moroccan bath and the massage at the RIAD in their private rooms. I'm not going to make this review longer because words cannot describe this place. Go ahead and book this and let the team at Riad 72 take care of everything else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachel L wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Riad72 is an absolutely stunning riad with excellent service. The room was small but the accommodations were everything we needed - comfortable bed luxurious shower and beautiful garden for breakfast. Although just a short walk away from the main square the riad was very quiet and had a very relaxing atmosphere. When we left we were taking a trip to the desert then were returning to Marrakech. Stefanie assured us that she was just an email away and if we needed anything once we were back in the city she'd be happy to offer help or advice. The one drawback is that there is no reception so sometimes when we were looking for something/someone no one was around.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Karl G wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Hard to tell from outside what to expect but when you go in it's like another world. Very beautiful. The food in the Hotel was amazing and the portions were generous.  Congratulations to Stefania and her staff especially Hassan and Rachid!!  extremely professional kind and helpful.    Thank you so much for your hospitality!  Nadia & Karl
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A fantastic week staying in an oasis of calm just a short walk from the souk and all the major sights. The whole team are dedicated to ensuring everything is perfect for you whether that is remembering your drinks preferences at breakfast in the courtyard during a very tasty dinner on the roof terrace or offering somewhere to change and shower on the afternoon after checkout because you have a late flight home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad 72 is the perfect venue for a wonderful stay in Marrakech - and any event you may want to plan! We invited our 30 guests to celebrate and booked up the whole riad. The Saturday night event was nothing short of magical thanks to the immaculate service of Stefania and all of the Riad 72 staff who went out of their way to make us feel like we were at home.
