If you are considering a wedding a big birthday an anniversary or any other milestone in Morocco then put Riad 72 at the top of your list. We are already planning how we can get back there soon!    Also the breakfasts and all food was wonderful. The rooms were fantastic. The calm oasis inside of the riad was perfect as Marrakech can overwhelm the senses. Additionally the location is very convenient for shopping taxis and exploring the city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Better service than a Four Seasons!
Review_Text: There are not enough words to describe how lovely and amazing Riad 72 is. It is truly an oasis and one of the loveliest places I have ever stayed. But beyond how beautiful the riad is the level of service is superb. Stefania and her incredible staff are attentive to every single detail to ensure that your stay is perfect. Also I was there for a friend's wedding and it was one of the most beautiful weddings ever- if you are considering getting married in Marrakech then definitely go to Riad 72. It was a gorgeous celebration on the rooftop terrace under the moon light- I felt like I was in a movie!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Emma D wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: We have just had a four night stay in Riad 72 and very much look forward to returning to it. An oasis in the desert the Riad is has such a sense of calm and serenity about it you almost don't want to leave. Stefania and the complete team were so welcoming efficient and charming in equal parts. Each room is differently decorated with unique pieces making it feel more like a home than hotel. The roof top terrace as in a lot of places in Marrakesh is an interesting place to while away some time we had drinks and a delicious dinner whilst watching the sunset.  We look forward to staying again.
Reviewer_Location: Emirate of Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Review_Text: Very helpfull and supportive staff. Clean. Great food. Good location in medina. They do well spending time with you and making arrangements for day and side trips. Prices fair. Nice rooftop terrace. Secure
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Severin S wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay in this beautiful Riad in the very centre of the Medina. All the historic sites are in walking distance and there is this dreamlike garden (Jardin Secret) 5min from the Riad.    The room food (beautiful rooftop) and the service were EXCELLENT (at this point: thank you Stefania Mustapha Khalid and Rahjid). I would 100% recommend the Riad72 for a relaxing stay in Marrakech.    We will come back soon ;)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claudine T wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: An oasis perfectly located in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: This was my second visit to Riad 72 and I found it even better than my first stay 4 years ago. The riad is well located in the medina near the Dar El Bacha palace where there is a taxi stand that can take you easily where you want to go. It is also easy to walk into the souk and explore the narrow winding alleys and shops.    The rooms are very stylish and comfortable and the whole place is well kept and clean. The central courtyard is full of greenery and you can sit around little tables here and enjoy a cup of mint tea after a busy day of shopping and sightseeing. The roof top terrace is another wonderful place to relax and spend a few hours or to have a dinner. We ate twice at the riad and found the food very tasty and well presented.    Frederica the Italian manageress and her team look after guests attentively. One feels very much at home here and I would not hesitate to recommend it to others and will definitely go back and stay the next time I am in Marrakech.

I was looking at some of the 5 star accommodations in town and did a ton of research and i found this lovely Riad on Mr and Mrs Smith who I always trust for beautiful hotels. We booked the Karma Suite and it was so amazing- it was a really big room and decorated so well! I was really proud of this find because I knew our room was so much better and bigger than a little one we would have gotten elsewhere and for half the cost! We also felt so special only having a few other rooms in the Riad.  The Riad was so beautiful and it was so relaxing to step in the door at the end of long days it was immediately relaxing! It was in such a great location which was close to all key medina attractions yet also very private quiet and safe. The service was excellent in particular cleaning service who did another full clean at turn down as well the best turn down we had all trip!  I highly recommend it in particular the suite especially if you are only in Marrakesh a few days and are not needing a pool. (Although we saw the suites in the new part of the Riad which looked lovely had private jacuzzis on the roof.)  Great find!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cosette T wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: Amazing gem in the middle of Marrekech
Review_Text: I can't say enough great things about Riad 72. The location is perfect the staff attentive the breakfast delicious. We took advantage of their private hammam and massage services on site which I also highly recommend. If you want to feel like you're staying in a private authentic beautiful home while in Marrekech I highly recommend Riad 72. I'd go back to Marrekech just to stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: michael Angarita wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: this has to be the best service I have had in my life... I will always come to riad 72 when in Marrakech...the most perfect food service AND they really made me feel like I was part of the family......i will recommend everyone to stay at riad 72....I LOVE IT.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: I came to Riad 72 with a friend in mid August. It was the perfect sanctuary we needed from all of the hustle and bustle of the Medina outside. It was quite hot this time of you and as soon as you walked into the beautiful courtyard at the Riad everything seemed to slow down and cool off. We were upgraded when we arrived to a beautiful room with a private terrace looking over the rooftops of Marrakech. We had dinner twice at the restaurant and would highly recommend it if you are staying here. The service is impeccable and cannot be faulted. We also had a hammam which was a funny experience but the massage after was pure bliss. Cannot recommend this place to stay highly enough and will tell anyone I know going to Morocco to stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Last month I visited an intimate and welcoming hotel Riad 72. The hotel is a stunning paradise isolated from the outside hustle and bustle where relaxation is key and looking after number one is a top priority.    We wanted an authentic Moroccan experience and that is definitely what we got. When we arrived we were greeted with mint tea and traditional cookies. Immediately afterward we met Stefania a charming humorous knowledgeable highly experienced woman who simply did everything humanly possible to make our stay a stress free memorable experience.  Stefania gave us an entire briefing. She sat down with us asked us what we wanted from our trip and then helped us to plan our day to day activities including lunch and dinner reservations. We were given a cell phone so if we got lost or needed anything we could give them a call.    The hotel staff were lovely as well. Every single person who works at the Riad 72 excels in the commitment to ensure that you have a truly unique experience. From the moment you get up for breakfast to go to bed you are treated like royalty. They are like a constant ray of light and the sunshine that bathes your days in this beautiful place and wonderful country.    I had the pleasure of staying in a wonderful room a Classic Room with stucco and wood carving. Our room was on the 2nd floor and was nice & quiet. There was plenty of space for two people. The room was lovely with an open plan bathroom comfortable bed and most importantly air conditioning. It was well over 40 degrees during our staying there so the air con was very much needed. Mostly I enjoyed curling up in a super comfy king size bed with a book after a long day of shopping.    The hotel restaurant was lovely and served delicious food we only ate there once but would go back. Likewise breakfasts in the exotic green courtyard were fabulous and offered a fresh plentiful selection of foods each morning to cater for all tastes.    The solarium on the roof at Riad 72 was the perfect spot to start our day. They’ve thought of everything to make the rooftop an ideal place to unwind. Hanging out of the rooftop is something of a tradition in Marrakech and it’s a perfect way to pass the time when you need to get off your feet. I spent a couple hours every afternoon on the rooftop soaking up the sun and taking in the amazing calls to prayers for Ramadan that ring around the city.    Overall This was an amazing experience from the very first email to the moment we had to leave. However even when we left the Riad the assistance did not stop. We were accompanied to places of interest or to a taxi. We were able to contact them at any time via a phone that was provided to us by Stefania.    I left Riad 72 feeling relaxed at ease and ready to conquer the world once I got home. I will definitely be back very soon for a week of relaxation and isolation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: From the moment we arrived and every single minute spent in this Riad was amazing. There is no other place that wonderful in Marocco !!! Before you come here you've never experienced what true service and wonder is when traveling. Book this place with no hesitation and fast before it's booked. The rooms and commun areas are like the 1001 nights tales the food is so exceptional you won't want to go out and most of all the service of Rachid Aziz and Asma will leave you speachless !! I will come back always and recommend to all family and friends. !!! thank you!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great hospitality and wonderful stay at the Riad
Review_Text: We stayed at this wonderful riad and as far as comfort and hospitality was concerned could not have asked for more. Stefania and her staff took care of everything from the moment we landed in Marrekesh and to our departure for home. The room was spacious and comfortable with the AC working well even though it was very hot outside. The breakfast was excellent fresh and filling. The complimentary mint tea late evening was refreshing after a day out in the hot summer sun. The staff (Rachid Khalid Aziz) to name a few did their level best to make our stay memorable and nothing was too much for them. The riad is well located and walking distance from important tourist attractions.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Simplicity in design, mix of traditional Moroccan architecture and modern Italian
Review_Text: We spent a week in Marrakesh in a 1930s-inspired riad instead of a hotel. Riads traditional Moroccan houses with interior gardens are designed like a mini castle with multi-story high perimeter walls fencing off intruders. Windows are not faced outside to protect the residence’s privacy. The unique architecture also helps with air circulation to keep the heat out in the summer but warm in the winter.    Our riad is located in the medina near Dar el Bacha. Leading up to the riad we need to pass through narrow streets like a maze. The streets are filled with pedestrians bicycles and e-bikes with shoppers and merchants of many mom and pop stalls selling bread pastries produces butcher and handcrafts.    You can’t miss the riad’s entrance. First it’s a heavy over-sized metal door with layers of Arabic shapes. Second the door frame is shaped like the top of a mosque. Third there is a visible ledge you need to leap through similar to a traditional Chinese palace.  The entrance way has a fair amount of usage of expansion and contraction. Once you step in to the small foyer you can smell the Italian perfume then after a short corridor you are taken to an expansive welcoming interior garden with tall banana trees and water features in the courtyard. The area is decorated with many low lounge tables reminding you of its luxurious Moroccan style.    Looking down the floor is laid with the modern polish concrete floor and red lime stone polish concrete chair rail. Looking up you can see balconies a black painted wooden bridge and a black painted wooden bay window structure overlooking the interior garden. The black wood frame reminded me of Thai architecture.    We visited in June with a daily high of 45C (113F) but without the need of any air conditioning the interior garden is at least 10–15C (50–60F) cooler. With the courtyard’s water feature it’s an ideal spot to read a book enjoy a glass of rose or have a siesta!    Another remarkable design is noise reduction. Within the riad it’s impossible to hear any bike engine noise traffic or any chatter in the Medina. It’s as if the riad is hidden providing a secluded place to relax and enjoy Marrakesh.    Behind the palm trees are three small rooms with high ceilings the one on the left brings us to the tiny concrete room for Hammam a Moroccan sauna with a full body scrub. The room is dark but kept at a warm temperature. The one on the right is for a Swedish massage. The room in the middle is relaxation room to have Moroccan sweet mint tea with local cookies.    We stayed at Riad 72 what makes it unique is their simplicity in design earthy colour tone and an interesting mix of traditional Moroccan architecture and modern Italian influence.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Doris R wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: My daughter and I recently stayed at Riad 72 for five nights. It was paradise. The people working there are so gracious friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious and it made us want to linger a little longer in the exotic green courtyard. We watched the sunset and the sunrise from our private rooftop overlooking the city. The mint tea and Moroccan cookies every afternoon made us feel like we were in another world and in a more relaxed and ancient time. The location is perfect for everything you can do in the Medina and in the new city. Everyone should go to Marrakech at least once in a lifetime and if you go stay at Riad 72!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had a wonderful couple of days. The hotel is located very well for trips in to the medina. All the staff were attentive and friendly and always on hand to provide anything needed during your stay.  The hotel was lovely and quiet a great base to enjoy the we both the adventures of Marrakesh and the peaceful location of the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul T wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: A haven of calm in the center of Marrakech
Review_Text: My wife and I had 5 rooms in the Riad for a long weekend with our recomposed family of 4 daughters with their husbands / boy friends and grandson. Stefania and her very friendly team made us feel at home in a calm and private setting only minutes walk away from many of the Marrakech Medina's main sights.    Every morning we would wake to their lovely breakfast (each day bringing a new delicious offering). We would then go around Marrakech with the ease of returning to the Riad for our grandson's afternoon nap while other family members could continue their sightseeing. At the end of the day we would have a relaxing drink on the Riad's rooftop lounging area from where you can have magnificent views of the sunset over Marrakech. And one night we had a excellent typical Moroccan meal in the rooftop eating area knowing the our grandson was quietly sleeping in his room below.    Stefania's team were always at hand for our slightest need in this perfectly run haven of calm. Well done !!    We highly recommend the Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kate A wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: We had the most wonderful stay at Riad 72. The accommodations and service were absolutely perfect. Honestly the staff was 5 star hotel level - we were so impressed and happy with our stay there - we can't wait to go back!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Heaven in the Marrakech medina. Look no further can't get much better than Riad 72. I have stayed at many luxury hotels but nothing compared to the hospitality and attention to detail that Riad 72 provides. From the moment your luggage is whisked from your car in a wagon you know you are in good hands. Stefania and the staff at Riad 72 make you feel at home. Luxury without pretension. Service attentive but not over bearing. The courtyard was fantastic both day and night. A place to unwind and truly feel relaxed. The complimentary breakfast served daily was varied and fantastic; fresh fruits breads pastries Moroccan pancakes jams coffee and fresh juice. The rooftop was stunning. The view was fantastic with sweeping vistas of the whole medina. Want a drink or lunch on the roof? No wish is too grand for the staff of Riad 72. I recommend lunch or dinner rooftop overlooking Marrakech. The room was modern yet comfortable with turndown both am and pm. Fresh roses fresh fruit bottled water what more could you ask for. Peaceful tranquil a respite from the excitenet of the city outside the Riad walls. The showers have excellent water pressure and abundant hot water. La Table du Riad (the onsite restaurant) was divine. I ate lunch once and three dinners. The service was exceptional. The cuisine was Moroccan with a modern twist; all beautifully served and carefully crafted. Rashid and Khalid were fantastic waiters and were most attentive. I highly recommend the lamb cooked for 6 hours in the farnatchi oven! The mint tea was out of this world amazing! The massage room and massage therapist was so relaxing and must do during your stay. Stefania (the hotel manager) went out of her way to make my stay in Marrakech seamless. She booked excursions arranged drivers and suggested places to visit (even helping book an overnight excursion in the mountains). The cooking class at the Riad is a MUST and Chef Mustapha was an excellent guide in the kitchen. It was such a rewarding experience. It was a true pleasure having the opportunity stay in such a special place. If you don't stay at Riad 72 you are missing out on a truly exceptional experience. Treat yourself to feeling like royalty even if only for a night!

Review_Date: Jack M wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: Very friendly and attentive staff during our wonderful stay
Review_Text: Me and my partner had a fantastic time at this Riad. All the staff were so so friendly and helpful the place itself is amazing. Stefania gave me lots of help and and advice prior to our stay which was very useful. We had a wonderful time and would definitely reccommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our stay at Riad 72 was amazing. Marrakech has been on my bucket list for the longest time and we finally decided to go this past week. Riad 72 was fabulous and the property is so welcoming and gracious. The food is fantastic and even better than Maison Arabe or La Mamounia (we had dinner at both properties). The service was so gracious and I thought also better than the other properties. A quiet elegance. Thank you Riad 72 for making our anniversary such a memorable experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Teresa Q wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: My family and I came to Marrakech to celebrate our parents' 60th birthday and we could not have had a better weekend at Riad 72. The Riad itself is beautiful and the rooms are very well decorated. The hotel staff without exception were incredibly helpful and pleasant to deal with and were very patient with our large group. The breakfast was excellent and the roof terrace is the ideal place to spend time at the end of the day. We will come again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Tamara G wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: I stayed at the Riad 72 for 5 nights everything since day one was perfection the location is great the hotel itself is beautiful a perfect blend between traditional moroccan architecture and new luxury the room was super comfortable the food delicious and the staff is simply amazing everyone is very attentive and helpful. Would definitively recommend it and will definitively go back every time I'm in Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed for four nights in June. Everything about our stay in Riad 72 was marvellous.    Upon check-in you are seated given some mint tea and some scented water to wash your hands. We were then taken to our wonderful room to settle in. The rooms are elegantly furnished and the bed firm but very comfortable. Our room had an enormous bath and the provided toiletries were naturally made and of the highest quality.    Breakfast every morning consisted of coffee/tea breads pastries fruit and yoghurt. It was delicious and everything was very fresh.    The staff were amazing. Nothing at all was too much trouble and it was almost like they had already anticipated your request and were just waiting for you to ask for it. Something which is very hard to get right.    We are at the restaurant one evening and it was sublime. Everything was delicious.    Stefania is an excellent host and I'd like to thank her and all of the staff for making our stay so special. I have no doubt we'll be visiting again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Palatial Retreat with Exquisite Hospitality, Attention to Detail
Review_Text: We arrived shortly after Ramaddan break the fast and yet we were warmly welcomed and offered whatever we wanted to drink and eat. They upgraded us to the most sumptuous and palatial room either one of us has ever seen. It was the perfect retreat after each hectic and somewhat stressful day fending off the guides in the souks (we are two women so we were particular targets unfortunately). The hammam (ritual bath where you are scrubbed within an inch of your life) and massage are STRONGLY recommended. Again the practitioners came in during the hardest part later afternoon of their Rammadan fasts. Finally we felt welcome by all staff Stephania in particular as two married women--this was a big deal for us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Thomas O wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Riad 72 was an incredible experience. The property is gorgeous. The interiors and rooms are beautifully appointed and so comfortable. The courtyard is an oasis as is the rooftop lounge. What an experience it is to return to the riad after an exciting day of taking in the souks and the energy of the medina. Perfect location for the avid shopper. I think though that above all the best part of Riad 72 is the incredible staff. Stefania is so pleasant accessible and knowledgeable. Our breakfasts were truly memorable due in part to the wonderful food but also because of the wonderful service. And dinner at the Riad is not to be missed (rooftop of course). Cocktails at dusk were also super fun and once again the most pleasant service imaginable. I have to also mention our porter who seemed to be at the Riad 20 hours every day and was so helpful. Also the gentleman providing security was a wonderful person super sweet and never hesitated to be of service. All around fabulous stay !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Joana Q wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: We spent a long weekend at Riad 72 and it was absolutely heavenly ! The Riad is beautiful and very stylish . Location extremely convenient for the historical sites. The staff is very attentive and kind . We were there as a large family group with a toddler and we could not have been better looked after . Stefania the manager  was always around to answer questions and offer helpful advice . Finally  the food was delicious . We had various delicious meals in the rooftop! Highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Truly the only place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: I just cannot say enough about Riad 72. It is one of the finest hotels in which I have ever stayed.    My flights and travel getting to Marrakech were utterly miserable. However after 10 minutes at the Riad I forgot all about it. The atmosphere décor and most importantly the staff wiped every thought of the previous day out of my mind. I was immediately struck by a sense of calm and welcomed with hospitality I've rarely if ever experienced in a hotel before.    Riad 72's location is ideal. It is literally at the base of the souk but still a short walk to the main square if you want to bypass the souk altogether. While the mazes of alleys and streets of Marrakech are often confusing getting to Riad 72 is very easy.    Speaking of the maze that is Marrakech and its souk I should point out that Riad 72 provides each guest with a cell phone with pre-loaded numbers for different staff members of the hotel. If you get lost call the Riad and someone will come to find you and lead you home. If you need a ride call the Riad and they'll send someone. If there is any problem while you are out in the city you can use your phone and call the Riad. They also have a hotel guide who will walk you around the city if you are unsure of where you are going or if you don't want to walk around alone at night.    The building itself is a dream. While very traditional with carved woodwork deeply carved tiles arches and railings it also has a chic modern atmosphere. The subdued lighting at night and recessed sitting rooms and tables off the courtyard provide privacy and a sense of having the place all to yourself.    My room took my breath away. I booked one of the smallest if not the smallest of rooms. When I opened the door and saw the room I actually thought they made a mistake. There was nothing small about it. Incredibly high ceilings with heavily carved woodwork and tiles. Shelf and counter space abounded all around the room which is good for travelers. The closet was very large and fit all my clothes and empty luggage with lots of room to spare. A modern bathroom with plenty of open area cabinetry space and shelf space was located toward the back. The bed was so comfortable and the room so quiet I slept like the dead. I would recreate the room at home if I could. Utterly unlike any hotel room I have ever had.    Then there is the rooftop. It's expansive with two large sitting areas and a space with lounge chairs for getting some sun. We had breakfast up on the roof. The setting and fare made it hard to leave breakfast and move on with the day. We also had dinner on the rooftop which was spectacular in its presentation and setting. Which brings me to the food ...    I was fortunate to have two dinners at Riad 72. From what I learned their restaurant is noted as a place one must go and I see why. The food was just wonderful from appetizers to dessert. While they do have traditional fare they also offer international choices.    The second dinner I had on the rooftop was a dinner for 27 people. As I mentioned before the setting the presentation and the atmosphere was magical. The food was prepared and served flawlessly. So much so that I had to have a second serving which I never do. I don't know how they timed and served everything so well.    Which brings me to the staff. I'm afraid to even write this part of my review for fear that I shall not do them justice. I can't explain how I felt an utter sense of welcome and "home" during my stay at Riad 72.    Nothing I asked for was ever a problem. Service was fast efficient and always with a smile. I waited and wanted for nothing. They were patient and always went above and beyond what I expected. One day I had a very bad day out in the city. I got to the door and was greeted with a smile and I felt like I was home. Again the misery of the day was wiped away by the staff within minutes.    We had a large birthday party on Saturday night. Our group of 27 people from all over the world descended upon the Riad. The staff made it seem like we were a party of four. They made taking care of us serving dinner and granting every one of our wishes seem so easy. I should add that our party lasted until 4:30 in the morning. Of course it was no problem for them - or so they made it seem.    While I wouldn't recommend staying up until 4:30 am if you have a special event with a large group of people I URGE you to arrange a rooftop dinner at Riad 72. It will be a night you will never forget. Trust me on this.    In short the only place to stay in Marrakech is Riad 72.    On the day I left as the staff walked me to the door to say goodbye my heart ached a bit. I suppose that pretty much sums up my opinion of Riad 72. You will love the Riad you will love its food and you will love the people who make it a home. Leaving Riad 72 will break your heart a little.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Brian C wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Couldn't Be Happier With Our Stay
Review_Text: Riad 72 blew away our expectations. Yes there are nicer accommodations but for the cost we were very pleased.    Pros:  - Staff are amazing! The service was on par with some of the leading hotels in the world that we have visited. Kind and always went out of their way to help even when the requests were probably out of their job description.  - Location in the medina was great. Far enough outside the craziness to have some relaxation but within walking distance of everything.  - Providing a local mobile phone to use in a pinch was a great help (though we didn't need it luckily).    Cons:  - No pool. This was almost a deal-breaker when booking and on a hot day after walking around it would have been perfect.  - Other reviews mentioned noise from other guests which we didn't find to be too much of a distraction. Even with a room that opened up to the courtyard where there was a lot of foot traffic. Maybe it was just a quiet week.  - It is very difficult to find with little to no signage so you have to be a bit adventurous and remember where to go. Staff and security are always there to help though.  - We wished the kitchen was open later but understand they can't wait around all night with only a few guests.  - Depending on the time of day and how many people are staying in the riad it can take a bit to find a staff member. We either waited called or just knocked on the kitchen door to find someone in a pinch. During normal hours there was always someone walking around however.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Before make a reservation I was asking questions some times. Owner Stephanie gave me quickly and detailed answers. The other staff also are very kind. If you want to some question don't hesitaite!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo
Reviewer_Location: Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of the Congo

Review_Text: I can't give Riad 72 enough praise. Staying at there is one of the best choices I've made in a long while. It was a highlight of our whole trip. It was really hot when we were there and when we came back early in the day it was such a soothing experience. The whole staff seemed to be at our disposal to bring us tea and answer our many questions. Instead of feeling alone in an unfamiliar city we felt we had a home where everyone was dedicated to taking care of us. I want to go back to Marrakech just so I can stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Chris H wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: A Jewel in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: This place is magical!! The staff is over the top awesome the rooms are beautiful and serene the food is fabulous. I whole heartedly agree with all the other reviews and would add that the thing that truly makes this place special is the level of service and attention that you receive from every person on the staff. It is an effortless willingness to take care of their guests. It is almost like they anticipate your needs and take care of them before you even realize you need it. One last thing the Hammam and Massage are an Absolute MUST!!! The best experience EVER!! Stay here and don't think twice!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just read two recent reviews and am wholeheartedly in agreement with Jo H that this is probably one of the best managed Riads. With prior notice they will collect you from the airport and walk you and your luggage to the door. Rooms come with a mobile which you can use to call the Riad if you get lost need security etc. Stefania is very helpful and has chosen great staff. I chose a deluxe room one up from standard which gave us lots of space and a huge bath. On the first night I was woken by the call to prayer from a nearby mosque but didn't hear it on the subsequent night. I think probably hard to avoid in the old town and copious amounts of alcohol before bed always helps... I would definitely stay again. There is no pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo H wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: An amazing choice for a special birthday surprise
Review_Text: On recommendation from a close friend and the excellent TripAdvisor reviews I decided to book Riad 72 as a special surprise for my (young) husband.    Turns out it was the best decision I could have made!! From start to finish our time there was amazing. Initially I booked a standard room but decided to upgrade to one of the suites. It was spectacular.    The room was huge and the decor stunning. The bed was wonderfully large and comfortable. If you are partial to a long soak in the bath this place doesn't disappoint. Not all the rooms have bath's but the one's that do are amazing!! Our suite had a huge square bath that surprisingly didn't take too long to fill!!    We were given a phone (no charge to use when contacting the numbers in the contact list) to keep with us during our time in Marrakech and told if we needed any help to call the pre programmed numbers any time. As the Riad was just off a couple of side streets and inaccessible by car you had the option to call the lovely security guard and he would walk you back round the corner from the taxi drop off to the Riad. To be honest we felt so safe we didn't need to ring him but he was so lovely we rang him so we could chat and then tip him when we arrived back at the Riad!!    The Riad has a lovely quiet roof terrace which we used on our arrival and one early evening. We sat and read and enjoyed the quiet.    The roof terrace also has a small dining area (5 or 6 tables) where you can enjoy breakfast or dinner. We didn't take an evening meal at the Riad but we did have breakfast there one day and it was lovely and quiet with stunning views.    The other 2 mornings we took breakfast in the courtyard which was really great. Breakfast for us was perfect and beautifully presented. Breakfast is light but filling. Do not come expecting a big greasy fry up!!! Every day they make a different style of pancake served with a different bowl of finely sliced fruit (one day Galia melon one day water melon and one day nectarine) and a serving of natural yoghurt. This is served alongside a selection of 3 different breads and patisseries with beautiful Conserves. You are also offered a choice of fresh eggs which I must say are seasoned and cooked perfectly. Fresh orange and coffee (ask for fresh coffee) are served. It was such a pleasure to eat breakfast without the waft of greasy fried meat!!    The Riad is in the Medina (within the perimeter walls) but not too close to the bustle of the market. Once you have sorted your bearings - not so easy in Marrakech as nothing is actually straight and roads don't seems to have names - there is a straight road that takes you straight into the Souk. About a 15 minute walk. We also walked to the Mellah district and spent a morning looking round there.    All in all a brilliant choice. We will definitely be returning.    Stafania Medhi and the team are absolutely amazing. You will not receive a kinder or warmer welcoming.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Catherine M wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: This was our first visit to Marrakech and Riad 72 was a perfect base. A beautiful environment that was the perfect mix between original antique features and luxury. Wonderful helpful staff pristine clean rooms delicious breakfasts and a peaceful calm place to unwind after days spent exploring the Medina. It was great to be able to have a hamman and massage in the riad and Stefania arranged a day tour for us to the foothills of the Atlas mountains. Wonderful location in easy walking distance of the souks museums etc and access to taxis but tucked away in a quiet corner of the medina. Thank you Stefania Mehid Aziz and all who made our stay so special. We look forward to staying again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Our stay at Riad 72 was amazing to say the least. The Riad is a historical building and is in prime location just outside the craziness of the souks and center square. The Riad is private beautiful and truly first class (really the nicest place I have stayed anywhere in the world). The management staff of Stefania and Mehdi are very approachable and helpful with providing recommendations on day excursions as well. The staff are the best all very nice. It made our trip special being able to talk to them and learn about their lives and experiences in Morocco and have given us a desire to return to Morocco and experience other cities and towns throughout the country.    Side note if you go to Marrakech a trip to Ourika valley is a must. Beautiful Berber villages along the river and amazingly nice and genuine Berber people. Do all your shopping in Ourika as the goods are genuine hand made and much less expensive than Marrakech (where most of the goods are Chinese/Indian machine made).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent location. Walking distance to everything you want to see in Medina and outside.  Once you are in Riad it’s easy to find it. When arriving the Riad sends a guardian to carry your luggage and walk you to the Riad. The Riad also provides a cell phones to guests with pre-programmed numbers to call for assistance. Not as I personally needed it but I am impressed how thoughtful they are in making guests feel safe and comfortable. Narrow deserted derbs of Medina are not really dangerous but might feel intimidating for some travelers especially after dark so they will send a guardian to accompany you to the Riad from the nearest taxi stand if you come late at night. Never even heard about such service!  Comfort of the room. Although I was staying in probably the cheapest one it was great: extremely comfortable and clean. Not to mention tasteful decoration of the room and bathroom.  Piece and quite of the Riad. Once you stepped in you are in the different world. After spending a day in very noisy Marrakech I did enjoy a quiet time with a glass of wine in the courtyard or rooftop terrace. Highly recommend Moroccan wines especially “grey wine”.  Excellent breakfast. Moroccan pancakes were my favorite and I would stay there just for them.  Very very personal service. You are called by your first name from the moment you stepped in to the very sad moment when you have to depart. Stefania and her team are example for friendliness and excellent service.  TIP TO GUESTS: Prior to arrival Riad 72 will send you a map with instructions where to drop you ask to call them 5 minutes prior to arrival. They will send a uniformed guardian with the cart marked “Riad 72” who will know your name. Stick to the instructions. DO NOT accept any offers at taxi stand to accompany you to the Riad from anybody who claimed to be sent by “Riad 72”. They will accompany you to the Riad and then quite aggressively demand “a tip” for fraudulently offered service. You don't need that. Or even better book you pick up with Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Beautiful beautiful Riad very well located. The rooms are spectacular (and each one different combining the beautiful old architecture with some modern touches). The rooftop terrace is lovely with lounges and an outdoor dining area with spectacular view over the city and to the snow-capped High Atlas. The service is outstanding - extremely friendly welcoming and efficient. Stefania and her team go way out of their way to provide the absolute highest level of service. Hammam and massage also excellent. A very Zen place in the middle of the intensity of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I travelled over Easter weekend with my 2 daughters ages 12 and 16. From the moment we arrived we knew this was a very special place. We were greeted in such a lovely fashion with traditional hand washing fresh mint tea (the best anywhere in Marrakech) and beautiful homemade biscuits.  Our room was beautiful comfortable and quiet.  The breakfast with every item homemade was incredible and served to us as if we were guests in their home.  Stephania was an absoute delight ~ so fun to come home to and share the days activites.  We cannot say enough good things. We will be back and will stay only stay with our friends at Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Nicole P wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Riad 72 pioneer of new luxury - best Riad in Marrakech!
Review_Text: Riad 72 is intoxicating in the best possible way. The peace the smell the smiles surrounding you every time you leave your room.  We stayed two nights and tried La Table du Riad which offered a lovely Maroccan Italian menu impeccably served on the rooftop terrace. Breakfast is a delight fresh fruit different every day Moroccan delicacies and the traditional mint tea served with a varied selection of pastries!  We also tried their traditional hammam and had a lovely massage - amazing job done by the therapists!!  On top the beautiful design of the Riad the quality of the food and the peace you can find right next door to the Medina what really positively surprised us was the kindness politeness and spontaneity of the staff. Everyone seemed genuinely happy to be there and they took pride in serving the guests at their best. We will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter G wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: We had a seamless stay in Riad 72 from the welcome to the departure. We were picked up and taken to the Riad without any issues able to check in to our room early which was stunning (we had one of the suites). The room was spotlessly clean and having a mobile phone for emergencies is a great idea.  Every morning we had an amazing breakfast which we could have on the roof top if weather permitted they did something slightly different every morning and was quite refreshing not having a buffet.  The Riad organised a bike tour with 'Insiders' and a great cooking course in the Riad everyone was so friendly and personable!  Great location near to everything but also quite quiet and serene away from the craziness!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Erin O wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: We stayed here on our honeymoon and they go above and beyond to make your Marrakech experience magical. Stefania is always on hand for help/advice and the staff are excellent. The rooms/terrace and food are all exceptional like the photos. Highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We recently stayed at Riad 72 and were blown away! We were taken care of by some of the nicest people you will ever meet - super accomodating warm and friendly. Riad 72 is like a hidden oasis - peaceful clean modern warm comfortable and romantic! The rooms are spacious gorgeously decorated and super comfortable. AC great bathrooms great water pressure and soft sheets. There are so many neat areas to relax at the Raid (both on the main level and on the roof). They also had a wonderful spa which we didn't partake in but I've heard nothing but amazing things about the services they perform. Don't be offset by your walk from the taxi drop-off to the front door of the Riad as it is situated within the middle of the Median. It may seem overwhelming as they lead you down small alley ways but well worth it when you walk through the front door. It's like another world.    We were greeted by the wonderful Khalid and Aziz both of whom are on another level in terms of customer service. So polished respectful and accommodating. I'm not sure I've ever stayed somewhere where they were so genuinely concerned at whether you are comfortable and happy with your accommodations. It was so refreshing.    We had the option of eating our meals in the gorgeous seating area inside or on the roof (choose the roof every time!). In the mornings we were greeted by Asma who is so sweet and friendly. During our days we would also run into Rashid who again was the nicest man!    Stephania (the manager) was super gracious and helped us set up some day trips (we highly recommend the Atlas Mountains and Essaouira). She was super helpful in showing us where to go within the Medina as well as introducing us to some hidden gems. She gives you an easy to read map that really does help you get from A to B b/c the Medina can be overwhelming. Thanks to her tip we found some incredible rugs!    The food is delicious! They provide breakfast every morning - fresh bread and pastries fresh squeezed orange juice jams and eggs made to order. They also have lunch and dinner available (both of which we took advantage of). Everything was delicious - true authentic Moroccan fare!    Turn down service twice a day and free wi-fi - they really go out of their way to make you feel at home!    We just can't say enough great things and would highly recommend Riad 72 to anyone traveling to Marrakech and we will definitely be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neni K wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Road 72 was such a great place to stay especially if it's the first time you visit Marrakech.The hotel stuff was sooo warm and welcominggently and discreet that made as feel at home immediately and were there for us with every question that we had.  Stefani the Manager was on top of everything making sure every little thing was met according to our request.  The rooms are super. We had the suite and the beds the towels the linens everything was super!!The breakfast was everyday a pleasant surprise with fresh fruits breads  croissant selection of marmalades eggs.  Finally and mostly importantly the location of the hotel is one of the best locations to stay in the Medina 2' away from the high end stores of the souks!I recommend your stay at the Riad with my eyes closed!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: During my many travels I have never been looked after by such charming friendly and attentive staff. The hotel's food is excellent the décor splendid the interior courtyard exquisite. This hotel and its staff made our holiday in Marrakech special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emily U wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Home away from home in Marrakech!
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I just spent three nights at Riad 72 and couldn't have asked for a better experience. The riad is a beautiful oasis conceniently located in the Medina. The central courtyard is a lovely place to enjoy mint tea or a meal but the rooftop was our favorite spot to take in the views of the city. We enjoyed our breakfast and pre-dinner wine each day on the lovely rooftop terrace. Our room was equally lovely- lots of space large comfortable bed fresh flowers and a huge bathtub.    The staff at Riad 72 could not have been any nicer. Everyone knew our names provided excellent service and really made us feel right at home. The breakfast each morning was the perfect way to start our day. Delicious pastries and various spreads as well as and an egg dish of our choice and great coffee and tea were offered. We also ate dinner at the Riad our first night there and the food was superb. We wanted to try other restaurants for dinner for the two additional nights we were there and the staff was very helpful in providing excellent recommendations (although the food at Riad 72 was just as good if not better than the food at those other restaurants).    We would highly recommend Riad 72 to anyone traveling to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robert G wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Top service and an intimate oasis of calm in the Medina
Review_Text: We just returned from a week at the Riad 72 – our first trip to Marrakech. The Riad is in a fantastic location near to Dar el Bacha which is one of the more elegant sections of the Medina but equally close to be able to walk to all destinations and for exploring the souks and the main square.    Stefania and her team at the Riad were amazing. Before arriving we exchanged emails with Stefania who made sure we were met at the taxi drop-off and escorted to the Riad as it is down a series of very narrow small alleys (but with the benefit of permanent on-street security to make you feel very safe at any time of day or night). We also booked our first meal at their in-house restaurant (Le Table du Riad). Do take up the ability to have Stefania email you the menus so you can pre-order as the food is by far the best we had on our trip and there are a number of dishes where the chef needs 6-10 hours notice as all is made to order.    With Riad 72 it is all about the details. There is a beautiful central courtyard with alcoves and places to sit amongst lush vegetation. We stayed in one of their smaller ‘classic’ rooms which was perfectly fine – tastefully decorated with loads of original features and accessed off the open walkways around the courtyard at first floor level. We had a chance to see a few other rooms and all were equally beautiful. The Riad also has most fabulous roof terrace that sits slightly above the surrounding houses and provides an extraordinary panoramic view of the city and the surrounding Atlas Mountains. It is a great place to come back after a hectic day in the Medina to sit and have a drink and watch the sun set (and was also wonderful for breakfast).    The Riad provides you with a mobile phone so you can ring them at any time and if needed one of their staff will come and collect you. We actually had them escort us to and from a restaurant deep within the Medina as it was otherwise quite difficult to find. This was a real help to us and seemed no trouble for them.    They serve a lovely fresh breakfast every morning (either in the courtyard or on the terrace) – and the ladies serving were incredibly friendly and helpful. We also ended up eating dinner here 3 times during our stay as the food was so good – traditional with a fresh modern twist and served in such an intimate and relaxing environment. All the staff were great and really made you feel like you could treat the Riad as your home. We send special thanks to Rashid and Khalid who took such good care of us.    Stefania also organised a day trip for us with a driver and guide to the Atlas Mountains – including a modest trek between 2 villages (including waterfalls) followed by a traditional Berber lunch at the Kasbah Toubkal (with breathtaking views of the tallest mountains in the range). They offer various other trips to suit all tastes and it was a real treat of the break.    We are generally quite picky about where we stay and Riad 72 was a true oasis of luxury and calm and we very much look forward to coming back.

I booked Riad 72 after seeing it consistently rank among the top recommended Riads on various travel blogs and websites. Shortly after making my booking I emailed the hotel regarding an airport pickup on the date of our arrival. I received a swift response from the hotel manager with a fair quote. I also inquired on various activities available since we had an open schedule in Marrakech.    After exiting the arrivals at the airport our driver was there waiting for us. He shuttled us to the Hyundai mini van and pointed out various sites on the way to the Riad. Once at the drop off point another hotel employee met us with a cart to collect the luggage and guided us through the tiny streets and alleyways to the Riad.    Once at the Riad we were seated in the courtyard and offered some mint tea. The staff greeted us by name and collected additional details. They then gave us a tour of the Riad that culminated in a nice view from the rooftop.    Our booking was for a Classic room that was very spacious and included high ceilings. We had a queen bed. Toiletries are all locally sourced and included bars of black olive soap. An AC was in the room. One of the unexpected features was that we were provided with a brick phone that served as a hotel/room phone should we need anything as well as a source to which we could make local calls from. This could be used throughout your stay and taken out of the Riad. We had daily room cleaning as well as turndown service. We were provided with bottled water daily. We had excellent sleep although we did wake up a few times during the early morning due to the call to prayer over the loudspeakers across the city. This will happen anywhere you stay in Morocco and not a fault of Riad 72.    Breakfast is included with the stay and changed daily. We had various pastries bread with an assortment of jams butter and honey scrambled eggs and crepes.    We were also shown an activity book. We ultimately did not book activities through the riad but we appreciated the gesture. Lunch and dinner is available at the Riad. The riad could also convert one of the courtyard rooms into a hammam with advance notice.    The riad also had a security guard at night who watched the entrance of the riad. We always felt safe throughout our stay.    Throughout our stay we were continually greeted by the staff by name. This was definitely unexpected for me in Morocco and a level of service that I appreciate.    Our checkout experience was a breeze and they even held our bags for us for a few hours.    The Riad itself is located about 10-15 minutes walk from Jemma-el fnna. Taxis are about a 2-3 minute walk from the riad where the local roads meet the main road.    In summary we thoroughly enjoyed our stay with Riad 72. The service was top notch and the experience was one to remember. Although Riad 72's prices are higher than other riads in Marrakech the level of service is unmatched. I give my full recommendation to Riad 72 for anyone interested in making their Marrakech trip a memorable one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jay S wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Riad 72 is a combination of beautiful rooms/architecture incredibly delightful staff refreshingly healthy food and is the ideal location. The perfect place to stay when visiting Marrakech.    Rooms are quintessential Moroccan with plenty of room. The staff are at your beacon call to support all of your needs. The food was fresh creative and at a good price. The location is perfect being a short distance from the Souks and also the new modern Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Beautiful stylish riad in a great location. The rooftop was my favourite place. Fresh orange juice in the morning glass of wine in the afternoon. The food amazingly fresh and tasteful. The staff was welcoming friendly interested and warm. The best! Don't forget the inhouse Hammam unforgettable. Perfection was in the details: a cellphone for use around town security service to take you to the restaurant in the evening a birthdaycake on my birthday. We will for sure be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A paradise in Marrakech. Riad 72 is THE place to be in this amazing city. Great place excellent service and management in the most charming area of the city. The Medina. We will certainly be back. For the 4th time !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We very much enjoyed staying in this quiet small Riad in Marrakech. It was right in the centre of town and very easy to walk to many of the sites. Regrettably we were only there for a weekend but we were extremely well looked after. The night we arrived we chose to eat dinner on the roof and were personally served by a waiter our absolutely delicious meal ( we had ordered in advance). The breakfast each day offers a cooked surprise with fresh fruits and pastries serviced in the courtyard. Our room was extremely spacious with a high domed ceiling with extraordinary wooden panelling and we were able to chose our own soap for our bath and shower an added nice touch. We were given a mobile phone with useful numbers on so that we could call for help if we got lost. We were confident we wouldn't but we did! The souk looks very different at night when all the shops are closed. We were relieved to see our rescuer arrive on his bicycle and escort us back. Marrakech itself is a very interesting place and I would definitely recommend Riad 72 as a place to see it from.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Can't praise this hotel enough from the onset the staff were super friendly helpful and welcoming. The hotel was beautiful with so many little touches. Our room was exceptional and very clean and atmospheric ! The breakfast and lunch were outstanding sadly as we only stayed for a couple of days we chose to eat outside of the hotel. I suspect we missed out by doing so had we stayed longer I would have definitely eaten at their restaurant. The guide we arranged through the hotel was perfect and we also sampled a Hammam with massage at the hotel and this again was outstanding !!! The Riad 72 is situated perfectly and we were able to walk to all the attractions which was fab and a great experience !! Throughout our time the staff were friendly very helpful yet unobtrusive and when at the airport and I realised I had left my phone in the room Stephanie (Hotel Manager) responded swiftly to help an organised a taxi to bring my phone to the airport !!! Which I was so grateful for. I would rate this hotel an 11/10 would strongly recommend it to friends and family and would have no hesitation in returning when next in Marrakech thank you Riad 72 for a wonderful break !!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We loved this place. The location the rooms and the service were excellent.  The staff was very helpful and super welcoming.  The rooftop area is exceptional with its amazing views across Marrakesh. Absolutely recommend this Riad!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: First class hospitality. Amazing staff and location. Not to be missed.
Review_Text: I don't do reviews. This is in fact my first review prompted by the sheer quality of our experience at Riad 72.    The Riad is beautifully conceived a very welcoming with an air of class and refinement. It really was a lovely place to come back to after days spent exploring the medina. Every single member of staff was so friendly and welcoming. I was practising my terrible french as often as possible it felt like being among friends. It was great to meet all of you! First class hospitality as the title says.    This particular Riad is perfectly situated within the Medina of Marrakech. Blissfully quiet at night and walking distance to everything although if you do need a taxi it's only 3 minutes walk from the Riad.    Stefania was amazing throughout and helped us out at every turn. We were made to feel very comfortable in our surroundings and had the entirety of Marrakech explained to us and were given an incredibly useful map of the place with summaries recommendations restaurants everything you could possibly need in your pocket! We were recommended dozens of places to go and I'm sure there are plenty more. Stefania took us through everything whenever we needed it and organised and amazing private trip for my wife an I to the Ourika Valley within the Atlas Mountains. Quite fantastic. Mindboggling. Awesome. And that's just one of the options!  We are guaranteed to come back there's so much to see and to do in Marrakech. Stefenia has created an amazing environment from which to start the adventure. From the comforting aroma of sweet figs in the entrance to the local mobile phone pre-loaded with useful contacts should we need any assistance. I thought that was a really great touch. When we first arrived within moments our bags had been swept away to the room chairs drawn up and we were sitting in front of the banana trees sipping mint tea with biscuits accompanied by the sound of running water. Stefania had arranged a great dinner for us for after we had made ourselves comfortable (despite our very late arrival). It was a really great way to start the trip. Really made to feel at home from the very beginning.    I could say good things about our time in the Riad alone for hours and for days about Marrakech. I'll probably add to this review over time... I can't say enough good things about the whole experience. Thank to Stefania and all her staff for a truly memorable anniversary experience. I would highly recommend Riad 72 to anyone. We'll be back as soon as we can!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Tranquility in the hustle and bustle of the Medina
Review_Text: My wife and I booked this Riad for our 4 night stay in Marrakech after our usual TripAdvisor research. Our expectations were very high and we were delighted that they were more than exceeded. We received a warm and informative welcome from Stefania over some Mint Tea and Moroccan biscuits in the beautiful relaxed surroundings of the courtyard. This high level of friendly and attentive service was maintained through our visit by all the very personable staff and Stefania remained the perfect hostess throughout our stay.    The setting of the Riad is perfect being within the back streets of the Medina but in a quiet area and a short and easy walking distance to all the sites. It’s reached by a few small winding streets and felt perfectly safe at night. There is always a security guard at the main door and the hotel provides you with a personal mobile phone with a range of pre-programmed numbers if you get lost and would like to be escorted back or need any help. We never had to use this but it was a great to know that this contingency was available.    The interior of the Riad was simply stunning; elegantly and traditionally decorated and furnished with a beautiful large open air courtyard with banana trees and a sumptuous traditionally decorated red dining room. There is also a wonderful roof terrace where you can soak up the sun or dine if you wish. We had requested the deluxe room with a private terrace and it was superb being simply beautifully and warmly decorated very comfortable and large enough for our needs with ample storage and a safe. The bathroom was great and the complimentary luxury spa toiletries were of the highest quality. The room had some stairs up to its own personal sun terrace with 2 comfortable sun loungers and a table and chairs and even its own outside shower. A welcome pack of fruit was left for us on our arrival and each night there was a turn down with 2 bottles of water.    Breakfasts were served in the courtyard but could also be served on the roof terrace (although when we stayed the mornings were a bit chilly). The breakfasts were simple but with the highest quality local produce with fresh fruit orange juice and yoghurt a different dish each day (such as pancakes omelettes etc.) and local bread cakes and soft cheese. We also ate in the restaurant for Dinner and the service and relaxed ambiance was so wonderful after a full day exploring the hustle and bustle of the Medina. The Moroccan salads and slow cooked dishes (which have to be ordered 6 hours in advance) were delicious (especially the lamb) and we sampled the local Moroccan beers and wine.    We spent 2 full days exploring Marrakech and on the 3rd day booked a trip to the Atlas mountains through the hotel which I can also highly recommend. We travelled up to Immil (which takes about 1.5 hours) stopping at a few interesting places and after a 2.5 hour trek in the mountains had lunch at the Kasbah Du Toubkal which was a fabulous place to soak in the sun and views.    On our last day we booked a Hamman and massage in the Riad and it really is a tremendous and highly recommended experience and a great way to finish off our relaxing break. As we booked this at 11am for 2 hours on our last day and we were in a quiet time we were kindly offered to check out late so we could leave directly for the airport at 3pm. Again it was such great service and an extra 2 hours in the sun on our terrace with a book following our Hamman was the perfect way to finish our break.    Riad 72 is a delightful comfortable and luxurious boutique Riad away from the hustle and bustle of the rest of the Medina but close enough to get everywhere by foot a real oasis of tranquillity in what can be a very busy city. Stefania and all the staff clearly pay a huge premium on providing a personable and warm customer service and nothing is too much trouble for them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a beautiful way to start our adventure in Marrakech! This is by far one of the best hotels i have visited. Such amazing staff who took care of our every need gorgeous rooms that we did not feel like leaving and the yummy food! We were greeted by Stephania the hotel manager who took us through a few details. Surprise was to have a staff wash our hands with orange blossom water! Never expected that! But how royal we felt! The best part of our whole experience was the upgrade of room that we got. Truly one of my top picks when it comes to hotel recommendations.  Thank you to all at Riad Living 72. Loved every minute of it...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Our room was a little small but we chose the cheapest room so that isn't a complaint. Overall great staff they provide security guard to walk you to restaurants that are hard to find. Delicious breakfast. Beautiful rooftop. In great location in the center of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful and stylish interiors personable staff and all-round fantastic service what's not to love at this wonderful gem located in the beating heart of the Medina?    Everything at Riad 72 exudes a feeling of warmth and attention to detail from the way they serve their food and greet their guests to the stunning simplicity by which the hotel is decorated. The moment you step into Riad 72 a warm welcome from Stefania and the staff makes you feel comfortable and at ease. This was especially appreciated after a long journey and an unfortunate incident of lost check-in luggage.    The food at the in-house restaurant is especially delicious and shouldn't be missed. I'd recommend their Moroccan salad selection and the slow cooked meals which should be ordered at least 6 hours in advance; the lamb is to die for. The breakfast spread is also fantastic and they provide little variations for each day of the week such as different kinds of pastries and fresh fruit.    A mention for the staff must not go amiss particularly for Khalid Aziz and Stefania who stood out during our 5-day stay and not only provided stellar service but were particularly charming and affable and made our stay a memorable one.    If you're looking for a comfortable and luxurious stay in Marrakech but want to avoid the high-priced grandeur of the Mandarin Oriental or the Four Seasons then Riad 72 is your best bet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: It was my fourth trip to Marrakech and every place has been very good - but overall Riad 72 would be my favourite. Arrived on a super early flight with my teenage daughter - had our room ready and a hot breakfast waiting - a nice complementary surprise! Upgraded our room and overall were there for our every wish without being nosey or intrusive. - rates were a tad more than others I was shopping. - however upon checking out - dinner lunch driver to mountains hamman treatment etc... were extremely reasonable and a great value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We were greeted by Mehdi on arrival and was stunned by the sheer beauty of the Riad. The design of the Riad had a stunning simplicity to it everything was just right. The food on offer is simply delicious. The staff work very hard to provide each and every guess with a highly personable and comfortable experience. Highly recommended.

Riad 72 is a stylish boutique hotel within easy reach of the souks in the Medina ideally located for a short stay in Marrakech. The hotel porter accompanies you down little alleyways to the Riad where you enter a beautiful courtyard with a water feature and huge banana trees - when you go through the door it is like entering Dr Who's tardis. This interior courtyard offers visitors a wonderful sense of calm after the hustle and bustle of the Medina. Our room was spacious and stylish but our one disappointment was the shower: we didn't manage to get hot water during our three day stay (it was either completely cold or tepid) and the shower seemed to drain towards the rest of the bathroom rather than down the drain requiring considerable mopping up. Apart from this everything was perfect. Service was impeccable the roof terrace where meals can be served was beautiful. We had several meals in either on the roof terrace or in the opulent downstairs dining area which were good. Breakfasts which we had in the courtyard were also very good.  The Riad should be singled out above all for the excellent team who run it. Bravo to all of them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A wonderful (quiet) and relaxing stay in an incredible property
Review_Text: After spending what was likely HOURS researching Riads in Marrakech we finally settled on Riad 72 and booked on TripAdvisor. We could not have been happier. The location is excellent - down a quiet and hidden lane but close to the everything. Access was very easy - the staff was happy to meet us at the taxi drop off point and get us settled in. We liked being a bit away from the main square and the associated noise and chaos but just a 10-15 min walk away.    The riad itself was lovely with a tremendous amount of space for so few rooms. There were nice quite public areas a hammam massage room a great roof terrace (a bit cold however when we were there!) and a quaint lounge that turned into the restaurant in the evening. Our dinner here (reviewed separately) was also delicious and highly recommended for a try!    The room was stunning. We were upgraded to a very large suite with incredible architectural detail. It was wonderfully quiet and comfortable! We looked at the other rooms as well and all looked great!    Staff and service could not have been more friendly and welcoming.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steven P wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: When you enter this Riad a sense of peace fills your body then puts your mind in to a meditative state. The staff are very hospitable and polite the food is very nice and my room was a delight to stay in. I hope to stay here again when I visit Marrakech in the future. Thank you Stefani
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Jonathan C wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: This was my second stay and after four years the accommodation and service were still excellent. The location close to the Souk is very convenient and my 70-year old mum was delighted with the whole experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Tony B wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Title: Stylish Riad , great location, great staff.
Review_Text: Just stayed here for 4 nights  first time in Marrakech and the glowing reviews for Riad 72 are justified.  Stefania is a fantastic manager  and the staff are uniformly excellent. Nothing is too much trouble and you are treated with courtesy and respect at all times. The food in the restaurant and the lovely breakfasts on the roof terrace are also exceptional. The room was stunning and the ambience in the riad is really peaceful and relaxing. We thought the location a very good one just a 10 minute walk into the hustle and bustle of the Markets and only twenty minutes by taxi from the airport.You can walk to most of the major attractions. An ideal first time choice if your visiting the city. I'd be very happy to stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stefania and the Riad 72 team were all terrific! The accommodations and breakfast each morning was great and they were extremely helpful arranging transport and day excursions even with last minute requests. Highly recommend Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Angela W wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: We totally enjoyed our stay in Riad 72 beautiful decor with a great ambience especially at night with candles lit in the courtyard. Food served by the onsite restaurant is so delicious that we had 2 dinners there!! Very friendly and helpful team as well! Highly recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lisa L wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: Very clean & peaceful space, amazing Riad, lovely staffs,
Review_Text: I stayed there with my mom for 5 nights and we just loved everything they offer. This must be the best Riad in Marrakech - very authentic & peaceful that you feel like you're in another world yet still modern and functional you would never find anything uncomfortable. The room is super clean and their rooftop is amazing.    Their food - both breakfast and special menus for lunch & dinner - is fantastic.    The streets from Medina to the Riad 72 are very very safe and the the nearest street even has its own security guard 24/7 for tourists.    The staffs (including the lovely manager Stefania) are a.m.a.z.i.n.g. We were very well taken care of and they are really there to help guests with heart. Btw the staffs even gave us a mobile phone with a local number so we can call them if we get lost in the countless / nameless streets.    Anyway if you want to experience a real life of Marrakech this is the place. If I visit Marrakech again I'll definitely come back to Riad 72 for sure!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Thierry V wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: Perfect Riad to stay in the Medina, Marrakech
Review_Text: This is the best riad to stay in the medina in Marrakech. The staff is excellent: Stefania Mehdi all the rest of the team. My wife and I will return. Thank you for making our wedding week unforgettable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Laura B wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: Lovely modern unique property, great foyer, nice staff
Review_Text: Riad 72 was definitely beautiful with interesting decor great old foliage with a nice veil of hospitality overall. It is clean and well appointed. However because I had just stayed 4 nights at a different place I had really high standards and expectations for hospitality. For example when the owner sends a welcome email says they would love to have you for a welcome dinner they have an onsite restaurant and they of course charge you for this so the welcome dinner isn't so much a welcome dinner as a dinner reservation. The suite we chose was fun two floors with interesting decor. However little things such as shower head (water leaking all over the floor that we had to mop up w towels) or the super high bathroom counter strange sinks ... it's like the decor is fun but to look at but not entirely functional. Again I had just spent 4 nights in an almost perfect place so am comparing. Another example I had brought some champagne from Spain and had asked if they would mind chilling it for me and then they charged me a corkage fee ... totally understandable but we just simply wanted to enjoy this special bottle in the privacy of our room....The last place I was at would have been thrilled to chill a special bottle of wine for us. When I approached the owner about this at payment time she made me feel like I was some kind of free-loading leech and unfortunately she made me feel a bit uncomfortable at this point ... as far as hospitality goes it would have been SO simple for her to just waive the fee as a gesture and I might be leaving a different review right now. Overall this Riad was lovely but felt like much more of a business than a home away from home like we were only customers and they looked for all opportunities to charge for every service. Airport transfers not included like other places either - for example there were three of us so we were charged three times the amount to all go to the same place. The warmth just wasn't as authentic as I had already experienced at Dar Assiya...  Several pluses however the location is really excellent so I think maybe they have to be so money-focused because they have more overhead because of their onsite restaurant and prime location. Keep in mind you will have outside people coming into the Riad to have dinner which feels a bit invasive. Kitchen staff and the manager Aziz were always very helpful. Nice breakfast included. Wi-fi not great here. I was also having some email trouble and they let me use the computer in their office which was very nice of them. They welcome you with tea and offer you a nice little organic soap. This place was very pretty and while I probably wouldn't stay here again don't let this this review discourage you from choosing it ... if I hadn't had such a wonderful stay at Dar Assiya to compare this place to I would have been much more impressed by everything.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Monifa P wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: Perfection! Amazing wedding week in Marrakech
Review_Text: Our stay at Riad 72 was amazing. Stefania and her team are a true team and work effortlessly towards making the guest experience amazing. We stayed at Riad 72 as part of our wedding week. To curate the perfect experience for our wedding guests I recommended my guests to spend part of their week in the Médina.
