Riad 72 and Riad Due did a great job accommodating our guest's requests and making them feel welcome as well as helping them coordinate their outings around town. My guests shared with me that their trip to our wedding was an amazing experience. I believe the teams at Riad 72 and Riad Due were a major contributor to this.    The rooms are beautifully designed and decorated. It's the perfect combination of local architecture and modern design. And in my opinion neither is sacrificed. They blend together perfectly! The breakfast is amazing. And it is the perfect way for guests to start their day. The lunches and dinners are devine....seriously....the have rabbit tagine. I can't wait to go back for it 😀.    My husband and I have already decided that we will go back for our 1 year anniversary and I just hope that I can wait that long!    Thank you for my making my wedding week magical.    Monifa
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: For a special birthday celebration I booked out Riad 72 for three nights. Myself along with 14 close friends had an amazing and memorable trip to Marrakesh made all the more special by our time in Riad 72. With seven rooms we were able to have exclusive use of the Riad making the most of the roof terrace and courtyard. Many of us also used the spa and Hamman. This event had been in planning for a number of months with Stefania and her team being more than just helpful in planning. We had champagne and cocktail on the roof terrace just before sun set followed by a traditional meal in the courtyard. Following a cake accompanied by a very special happy birthday song from the staff we danced the night away in the salon. I can't give enough praise and thanks to Rachid Asma Aziz and Stefania for a care and attention they gave us all during our stay.    For anyone looking to do the same in Marrakesh I highly recommend Riad 72. The design of the riad and bedrooms is traditional yet modern space with all the comforts you’d expect of a five star hotel. We’ll be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: An amazing place to stay in the centre of the old Medina in Marrakesh. The staff location and surroundings are exactly as advertised. They were so kind and helpful throughout our stay. We had a fabulous meal with drinks together on the second night of our stay. I would highly recommend this when staying at the Riad
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Aoife W wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: On arrival to Riad 72 we were met by Stefania and her wonderful team who welcomed us to our "home in Marrakech"; and they did everything to make us feel at home for the duration of our stay. What a beautiful Riad centrally located (yet you would never know as it is so peaceful inside) spotlessly clean and truly excellent service. Sunset on the rooftop terrace is not to be missed and breakfast is fresh and delicious. Stefania and her team were so helpful and are always at hand to answer a query or help you book a taxi or arrange a tour guide. I have already been singing their praises to friends and family and I hope to return again in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Orla B wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: *******Firstly more stars are needed here****** The most beautiful building and rooms i have ever stayed in. Once you step inside you are immersed into a feeling of tranquility and relaxation. We were very well looked after by the charming and beautiful Stefania Manager who left no stone unturned. She was superb! All the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough for us. There is a massage parlour on site along with laundry service. Breakfast was amazing every morning. There is a stunning rooftop terrace which we took full advantage of specatular views of the city also. Location is ideal for wandering up to the Medina & Souks and a vast amount of restaurants and tourist attractions. I highly recommend the Riad 72 you won't be disappointed and like me you won't want to leave!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lennart H wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: The third time we have stayed at the Riad 72. Each time surpassed expectations by the amazing atmosphere and the excellent service given by the staff. If you´d stay somewhere in Marrakech Riad 72 i s the best place. Stefania staff gives you an experience you will never forget
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: So peaceful in a busy city
Review_Text: This Riad is so peaceful and quiet especially for being in the Medina. We loved the comfort the food and the team especially with all the help the manager Stefania gave us. They elite team there treated us like family. Oh and their restaurant is super with really refined Moroccan food. For sure if we are back in Marrakech we will stay here again. Great Riad in a great city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect choice for a first-time visitor
Review_Text: Location was ideal for getting to the Souks or getting anywhere in fact (taxi pickup very nearby). We were received very charmingly by the hostess Stefania who took time to sit down with us and explain everything about Marrakech we felt very welcome and looked after. The staff was genuinely friendly and were always around when you needed them. The Riad itself was absolutely spotless tasteful and with lovely attention to detail. Overall I cannot imagine a more pleasant experience and stay in a Riad and would recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxed friendly and also stylish couples get-away :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maeve M wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights in Marrakesh with friends and family . I had been recommended Riad 72  and it did not disappoint.  Stefania ( the manager ) described it as ...' your home in Marrakesh ' ... and that's how it felt . All the staff were lovely and could not do enough to help . The building and rooms are beautiful . The Riad is well situated near the souks . One night we enjoyed an amazing dinner on the roof terrace ...... just magical !  We would love to come back .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is a lovely little riad within the medina of Marrakech. There are a number of rooms with varying styles so make sure you look at their website and choose the room you want when booking. Ours was maybe not one of the nicest (being cheaper) and had we been willing to pay more the rest of the riad was virtually empty and other rooms were free. The biggest issue with our room was the lack of door on the bathroom which meant that you have to be very comfortable with your travelling partner...  Service was excellent and the food and drink served was first-rate. As mentioned it is an oasis of calm in a very hectic busy city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Samantha S wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Simply Perfection, our high expectations were exceeded!!!!! Outstanding.
Review_Text: We booked this riad after reviewing the trip advisor reviews. This was a romantic wedding proposal weekend away without the kids for the first time so a lot was riding on this so our expectations were high and were truly exceeded. Everything about this riad and the customer service and welcome you receive is so amazing I don't know where to start! Our welcome was fantastic with everything well organised from our airport pick up arrival and so much else. Stefiana and her team are true professionals and our every whim was catered for with a smile. Special thanks to Rashid Asthma Aziz the security guard who escorted us to some restaurant reservations always on time when you phoned him and very friendly the whole team are outstanding. If you don't like impersonal large chain hotels and want the boutique luxury with a personal feel this is for you. I know my now Fiance contacted Stefiana prior to arrange a few things for our big night which all went seamlessley we had a private meal on the rooftop terrace all to ourselves which was excellent and also had a hammam and massage which were to die for. The food is excellent I tried the riad burger also which is recommended the breakfast is awesome (we don't have a particularly sweet tooth and being true brits we fancied fried eggs one morning which were catered for with no hesitation with additional sides of french toast). Our room was delightful with everything we could possible need bed comfortable and I loved the luxury spa toiletries which I had to take all home with me. We had a deluxe room with a private terrace offering amazing views of the city. The whole riad smells amazing is quiet and calming and is a true oasis in the heady hustle and bustle of the medina. I could go on more but would like to say I have travelled extensively and this is the best hotel I have ever had the pleasure of staying in I cannot recommend this riad enough to anyone thinking of staying. Thanks again to the Riad 72 team for making a life event even more special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The best place we have ever stayed at.    We were met by Aziz from the Riad. The welcoming at the Riad was something we would never have expected. Stefania welcomed us personally explained all the main sites to visit. Showed us the room which was very clean and welcoming.  As for the views from the terrace amazing. The Hammam treatment is well worth the wait.    Stefania and all the staff could not have done enough.    We would recommend this Riad to anyone.  Next time we will try the suite as this time we were in the classic room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad 72 far exceeded our expectations! It was a beautiful Riad very well located with the nicest and most attentive staff we've come across in a quite while.  Everything ran smoothly from the pre-arranged pick up at the airport right through to the end of our trip with everything in between well thought out and taken care of. With all manner of things at your disposal; emergency phone guides Hammam AMAZING food! etc  We went as a family with our 11 month year old but would recommend this place to anyone it was great!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Oasis of calm coupled with excellent service
Review_Text: In the heart of the city down side streets reached only by luggage carried on a wheelbarrow is Riad 72. Initial trepidation is swept aside once entered. Calm friendly superb objective advice in terms of what to do/see/where to buy.  Room (suite) was perfect. Charismatic and quiet.  Marrakech a very interesting city. I went to buy a carpet: returned with 4 - and had a great experience of the lively city in the process. In this city you need an oasis.  Riad 72 is ideal.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: A fantastic central place to base your visit to Marrakech
Review_Text: Marrakech is an incredibly vibrant and bustling city with something to see around every corner and at any angle. When you've reached the end of a long day exploring you're going to want a place like Riad 72 to escape to relax and recharge. It's a restored classic Riad—a building with a beautiful open-air courtyard surrounded by a few rooms which open up to balconies. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The manager Stefania lent us a cell phone to use to contact her or their staff at any time and although we didn't take her up on it she also offered one of her staff to escort us to any of our dinner reservations or evening excursions. The hotel itself only has about 7 or so rooms so it's intimate. They offer their own spa services and have a restaurant in the lobby. They serve breakfast each morning which we chose to take up on the roof. And because this particular building is just a bit higher than those surrounding it has amazing views. It's located right inside the old medina or city center and is easily within walking distance of pretty much all of the major tourist locations. The design is modern and comfortable while feeling very authentic. We were told that in the near future they'll be restoring buildings on either side of the Riad with an expanded restaurant a few more rooms and a pool. We look forward to returning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful riad. Great location. Wonderful people.
Review_Text: Everything about our experience at Riad 72 was first rate. The space the location the people.    First the space: modern and classic. Definitely feels like a Marrakesh/Riad experience rendered with simplicity and classic elegance. It was an oasis of tranquility at the beginning and end (and sometimes middle) of each day. The rooftop as the perfect place to relax over breakfast or a glass of tea (or wine) at the end of each day. Our room was... magnificent. We stayed in a suite and it was... magnificent. I don't know how else to describe it. Big and beautiful with every comfort.    Next the location: Right in the medina. We walked nearly everywhere but it's also easy access to taxi dropoff and pickup.    Finally the people. Stefania and her team at Riad 72 were perfection. Kind helpful attentive friendly. We were sorry to say goodbye.    We hope to stay again and next time we'll try the food (which smelled amazing) and the hammam which looked beautiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The people that worked there were very nice and informative especially Musi Sabri took the extra steps to make our stay fabulous. Breakfast was great place was beautiful. You must eat the food at the restaurant on the top. Beautiful view and the food was fabulous. Very relaxing in a city that can be intense at times.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sabrina G wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: This was a beautiful riad with 5 star service! Stefania & her staff were so welcoming & could not do enough to make our stay special. My daughter had Morrcan henna tattoos done by Asma a staff memer on the top terrace & it was the most beautiful design ever. We had great massages & amazing dinners at the riad. Highly recommend it & would definitely go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The service received was great really friendly staff and management at the Riad 72 nothing was too much trouble and facilities ordered through the Riad were of high standard we ordered food twice and both times we ate on the roof terrace meals were very enjoyable as so was the massage Hamman we ordered.  The room was cool but a little dark had our own personal terrace that was terrific great place to chill after a walk around the souks. The location of the Riad was good and only a short walk to main square. If you wanted an alcoholic drink then you need to order through Riad or use hotels. Nice bar and restaurant suggested Café Arabe with in walking distance from Riad 72. Although be aware of locals sending you in the wrong direction rely on your own map or ring the lovely security man from the Riad 72 it was no trouble for him to walk with you to your destination or when you are returning back to the Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephen M wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Visited Marrakech for the first time earlier this month & service attention to detail & friendliness of everyone at Riad 72 topped off a brilliant trip. They simply couldn't do enough us.    The quietness of the Riad is just perfect when you've had a busy day in the souks so we will be returning for sure the next time we head back to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Could not have been more perfect
Review_Text: This may be one of the most amazing hotels we've ever stayed at. Stephanie was so helpful and kind the entire staff was so accommodating and kind they will wait on you hand-and-foot. The Riad is impeccably decorated with an excellent eye for detail. The food was delicious and the rooftop terrace offered a perfect place to watch the sun set and rise. We had to make changes to our reservations but booked the non-refundable rates. They weren't able to make the requested changes however they upgraded us to a beautiful room with a private rooftop terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: During our stay we travelled in a big group which enabled us to rent the entire Riad 72 but I'm sure regardless of the size of your group you'll have the same kind of experience we had. Personally I was blown away by firstly the interiors and themes that varied from room to room. You could really see that someone had gone that extra mile to find that pillow or that chandelier to add the cherry on the cake. Secondly the service inside as well as outside of the Riad was first class. Stefania and team always made us feel safe and looked after 24/7. For myself who had never been to Marrakesh before I found I felt completely relaxed for this very reason. They organised cabs to take us wherever we needed to go as well as picking us up and we were all given emergency phones in case we ever needed assistance. Stefania also arranged restaurant bookings suggested shopping destinations and other activities throughout our stay which was super helpful. Some of us also visited other Riads only to come back home feeling very content about our choice of living. I absolutely loved my time there and would for sure recommend anyone considering Marrakesh as their next destination to stay with Stefania and team for a stylish stay with a perfect balance of chill and fun.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Charlotte B wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Title: Wonderful stay! Praise to Stefania and team!
Review_Text: We had a large group of friends visiting over the weekend and everything was PERFECT.  Stefania and her team were wonderfully attentive yet never overbearing and left us to socialise together as friends.  They knew exactly who we were (we rented the whole Riad) and which rooms we were staying in so our bills were already sorted when we came to check out which was extraordinary.    The Riad itself was beautiful well maintained clean and the rooms are spectacular. A variety of sizes and styles which compliment the traditional yet modern style of the building.    The only flaw (and this is purely down to personal preference) would be the lack of eggs in the morning 😊 a traditional breakfast was served and it was lovely but eggs or a choice in the morning would have taken our spoiling to the next level.....    Housekeeping was flawless the bathrooms were modern and have great showers. The in house spa (I had a Hammam) was AMAZING.    Highly recommend this Riad to anyone who wants a luxurious Marrakech experience with a fabulous in house team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Just returned with my loved one from Marrakech last week after a four night stay at Riad 72 and the sensations of a wonderful experience are still present.    A lot of attention has been put into the interior design of the rooms and facilities the result being a chic and delightful atmosphere. I loved getting back from the chaos of the souks and being welcomed by the candle light and relaxing music in the patio.    Stefania and her staff are providing an outstanding service and you really feel you’re catered for. Stefania was very kind and helpful explaining how to get to all the places we wanted to see and provided us with a local mobile phone to use it anytime we needed help. The small details in the service like a welcome fruit basket fresh roses in the room sweets left on the nightstand and bottles of water provided daily are making a huge difference. Not to mention the cleanliness of the room which was done twice a day.    The food was delicious; fresh tasty and beautifully served. We recommend couples to ask for a romantic dinner on the rooftop terrace.    We also had a pleasant massage. The only thing that was missing was a pool and sauna to relax in the evening but as Stefania told us these are to come in the following years. Will definitely want to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lorelay B wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at the Riad 72 for 4 nights and we LOVED it!!! the staff was wonderful very welcoming and diligent and they made us feel very welcomed and comfortable during our stay. We loved Rasheed he was stellar and very nice. The restaurant was also very good and we loved how much variety there was in the menu I loved the vegetarian options and the cuisine was sublime! Breakfast was great too! WE would go back to Riad 72 if we come back to Marrakech. We definitely recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: First trip to Marrakech - truly wonderful!
Review_Text: This lovely riad encompasses everything that Marrakech should offer. It's in a very quiet location and once through the front door you feel completely at home in the courtyard surrounded by the guest rooms. My son was on crutches during this visit and the staff headed by the wonderful Stefania could not have been kinder or more helpful. We loved the large airy room and eating on the roof terrace both at lunchtime and especially in the evening was magical. I will definitely stay there again if I return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Mariane K wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: The Riad itself is located in a great location on the heart of Medina.  The Manager Stefania and all the workers there couldn't be best! they make everything you can possible imagine to make yourself comfortable and have a remarkable holidays.  We highly recommended and for sure will be back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Riad 72 is unique, if not in it's interior beauty of design, then most certainly in it's team and flawless service.
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed for 4 nights and a day.  We were welcomed by Aviv stepping out of our Riad 72 private taxi who escorted us to the hotel from Dar-el-Bacha (a useful taxi waypoint).    Stepping through the black cedar entrance door you are greeted not only by pleasant staff but a serene ambient courtyard shaded by the swaying green leaves of a banana tree. Under which you are asked to sit at a table where staff present you with Moroccan Mint tea & Pastries served in wonderfully ornate silverware. The tea glass being topped up you receive the keys to your room and shown the Riad's layout.    Before arrival we had already booked dinner a 'La Table du Rhiad'. All food from the Kitchen is freshly prepared made to order and served exquisitely. The roof of the Riad is perfect for an aperitif a romantic meal for two or to dine with friends.    The rooms- no words can describe them their roofs nor individual character.    The first morning we choose a table where staff promptly arrange it for breakfast. Fresh fruits pastries yoghurts honeys crêpes sweet breads - just a sumptuous variety of food. The Staff are attentive enough to remember your seating preference alongside how you take your coffee/tea and genuinely personally endearing towards you.    Stefania!! Shortly after breakfast we are greeted by Stefania (the Owner) who spares no expense of her time or sincerity in making you feel at home and your needs catered for.  With her professional insight we were able to plan an itinerary at short notice that very same morning and arrange trips to the Atlas mountains for later in our trip.    Guests are provided a phone with useful telephone numbers the Riad 72 team Stefania security taxi escorts. An reassuring sense of security and safety.    The Riad 72 is situated PERFECTLY in the Heart of the Medina so Stefania talked us through incredibly designed and easy to read pocket maps and from there you are ready to embrace the bustling Souks to the contemporary spacious Jardin Majorelle.    After a long last day and to finish our stay we treated ourselves to Hammam body scrub steam and massage. Followed by a bask in the sun upon the roof. Which was utter bliss.    Due to a rearrangement in our flights we were allowed a late check-out at the discretion of the hotel (for obvious reasons).  This only added to the unequivocal feeling of luxury and professionalism by Stefania and the Riad 72 team.    Riad 72 is unique if not in it's interior beauty of design then most certainly in it's team and flawless service.    J & K :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Seamless service and a true paradise
Review_Text: This Riad is the most incredible hotel I have ever stayed at. From the warm reception we received when we arrived right down to the tiny day to day details.    Breakfast was amazing every morning as was the many lunches and dinners we had here (the best food we ate in marrakesh for sure) . Everything is very fresh and locally sourced you can taste the difference. Lots of variety for breakfast.    Stephania was amazing from the first email booking our stay to the last moments before we left. She accommodated our group of four very well and all the staff felt like family by the time we left.    We truly thought of the riad as our marrakesh home. The security guard walked us anywhere we wanted after dark and came to meet us and walk us home after. The porter woke up at 4am to walk me to my taxi which was all arranged.    The rooms were incredible the suite we stayed in was a amazing huge room with a fantastic skylight and charming touches. To top it all off the riad has its own hamman and massage room with excellent services.    I would return to marrakesh just to experience staying here again. Well worth the price
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Eric K wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: Travelling by arranged taxi the staff was waiting for us by drop off point and led us through to the riad. We were very impressed upon arrival. The design is so ambient inside the riad; giving such a big contrast from the busy street. We were welcomed with mint tea and biscuit.    We booked the room with a terrace and it is over my expectation. Room is clean air conditioned and well decorated. The bathroom is spacious with walk in shower. Terrace has table sun beds cooling shower etc. All were what we need. Room is cleaned and fresh towel change twice. The soap and shampoo are nicely selected. The only thing is slight dim in the room but we find it ok as giving us more chilling from the hot weather. Wifi signal is good in the room but slight weak in the private terrace.    For the on site restaurant we find that it is one of the best meal in Marrakech. We recommend to try the made to order dishes. The cous cous dish gave us a total new image of what it really should be. It was fragrant and moist. The Tangia meat is tendered and well spiced.    Breakfast changed daily on the main dish.    People talk about hammam in a traditional spa but we would say the on site hammam and message have to try. It is relaxing less hassle with mint tea served after.    Once again thank you to all the staffs and manager Stefani. Service is excellent friendly and attentive. Also praise to the driver (for the excursion) you partner with. He is patient and friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hidden behind a very non-assuming door this riad is a secret gem. The courtyard is filled with lush greenery with tables scattered around for breakfast lunch or dinner. The team lead by Stefania were so smiley polite and welcoming nothing was too much trouble. Our room was stunning with beautiful grey tadelakt surfaces and our own private roof terrace – a real luxury in Marrakech. Evenings were spent having a gin and tonic on the terrace and admiring the view. We did not eat at the restaurant but it looked amazing be sure to book.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John T wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: A haven of tranquility as soon as you walk through the very unassuming front door
Review_Text: I'd seen the reviews of this place and I have to say it was amazing. First trip to Marrakech so we didn't really know what to expect but as soon as you walk into the courtyard this place is very special.    Stefanie from the Riad had got in touch the day before and organised our transfer. Porter to meet us at the taxi drop off and collect our bags and everything was set up perfectly. We booked a deluxe room so that we had a terrace looking onto the courtyard and I would advise checking if you want this. I think it makes a difference to be able to sit out but most of the rooms have this. Fantastic bathroom split level room with a separate sitting area the whole thing felt very authentic.    The staff were all terrific. Highlight of the stay was sitting on the roof terrace eating breakfast looking out over the roof tops to the mountains and listening to the morning prayer call.    This Riad is great since it's not right in mad centre of the Medina and the Soukhs. It only takes about 3 minutes to walk there but you also feel like you are escaping the frantic pace of the Medina a little when you get there.    I can't fault this place. Crisps with the sea bass was the only oddity but the food was great overall and it looks very stylish. And I can't speak highly enough of the Staff. Seen Richard C's post on style over substance but I could not disagree more. This is a cool place to be where we were really well looked after. We also left a couple of items behind and Stefanie sorted it straight out.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robert T wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: Everything we could have asked for
Review_Text: I normally do not take the time to add a long review but in this case it is worth it. Stefania and her staff were outstanding. The room we had was big comfortable and had multiple air conditioners...a must in the heat of June/July. The staff helped with guides taxis maps recommendations restaurants...most of the time we did not even need to ask they seemed to be one step ahead of us in anticipating what we wanted. After the first day they knew what we wanted to drink when to prepare for breakfast everything. If i am fortunate enough to have a return trip i have no doubt I will be staying here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard C wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: This self proclaimed boutique hotel is rather a let down - there is no denying that everything looks lovely but it's a case of style over substance. Maybe as much effort should have been made getting the showers and air conditioning to work.  We booked three rooms - two standard and a deluxe - the deluxe had a kami kaze staircase up to a sleeping platform that would have given anyone who works in Health and Safety nightmares. We declined the deluxe room and had to take a suite (at extra cost) - 'suite' meant it had a sitting area but you couldn't swing a cat in it!  We ate one night at the much hyped restaurant but again the views were fantastic but for some of us the food was the worst we had in Morocco. The Beldi chicken in the tagine described as having more tasty meat is in fact anorexic and little more than bones. The Tanjia had been so over cooked it was drier than the Sahara and had long lost any taste.  The are lots of Riads to choose from that give a much better and more authentic experience at a faction of the price.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I visited Marrakech with 2 friends and I have to say that beyond just amazing amenities this hotel went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one! As soon as we checked in they served us an amazing breakfast spread that would put the Four Seasons to shame. Then after giving us time to settle they handed us a mobile with the hotel # the manager's # and security all preprogrammed to ensure we always felt safe. Lastly as 3 girls we worried about walking around after dark but Riad 72 took care of this by providing us with an escort to and from our dinners. Literally the best service I've experienced in a long time at this adorable boutique hotel with a tremendous rooftop view. Be sure to check it out - you won't regret it. Thank you Riad 72 - you're hospitality did not go unnoticed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Five Star Staff in a Very Peaceful, Secure and Relaxed House Hotel.
Review_Text: Riad72 was a bit of a change in our usual holiday experience as we usually stay at the upper end of the hotel market as the service industry is part of our work and we use these opportunities to see how other people/cultures/countries are providing services to guests/clients.    I'm not always comfortable in the intimacy of a House Hotel but Riad72 had some of the best staff I've come across in some of the world's leading hotels. I can say with great conviction that Stafania the hotel Manager's attention to detail and organisation skills are among the best I've encountered - and she was on holidys when we were there - her replacement Medhi was outstanding. Warm friendly and full of laughs really went beyond our expectations. Aziz and Moustaffa (apologies if this is spelt incorrectly) provided excellent service also excellent table waiting from Moustaffa - he is an asset to the hotel and Aziz was permanently busy with making sure everything was running smoothly.    I strongly recommend the restaurant it was quiet when we were staying which was what we wanted - note that some dishes need to be pre-ordered as they're true handmade traditional dishes. Delicious Moroccan wine on the menu. The breakfast was outstanding delicious fruit cocktail and an array of pastries all very yummy. Soft cheese butter and mouthwatering trio of preserves always including delicious Moroccan honey.    The roof was my favourite part especially in the evening - it was often very quiet (apart from the Friday when patrons from outside the hotel visited the bar its seen as a bit of a hotspot I think) you can use the phone to order drinks on the roof. this was my only criticism and it really is a miniscule attention to detail that I'd recommend having perhaps a camera to show the waiting staff that someone is on the roof and perhaps would like a drink as using the phone was a little hit and miss in terms of being understood in our order.    Other than that and it really wasn't an issue just a bit of a reccomendation our stay was excellent. Thank you all at Riad72!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A wonderful place to stay. Recommend!
Review_Text: We stayed here during the June heat and it was perfectly cool and quiet. The rooms are spacious comfortable and beautifully decorated and there is a lovely sunset view from the terrasse. We had breakfast outdoors as well as lunch in the courtyard - the food was delicious. The staff were very helpful and thoughtful. We would be happy to stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alison d wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: A truly magical charming and traditional place. An oasis to return to after exploring Marrakech. Amazing breakfast and roof terrace. Charming authentic room and friendly hosts. All the staff could not do enough for us. Collected us immediately from taxi drop off.Effective air-con and extremely comfortable beds. Hamman and then dinner on the terrace was wonderful. A most relaxing stay.Could not recommend this more highly.A pool would have been a bonus.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Great rooms but food could be improved
Review_Text: Rooms are a good size comfortable and spacious. The Riad is beautiful and in a good location.    We had dinner in the Riad one night whilst some dishes were great (the seabass) other more traditional dishes (chicken tagine) were disappointing and could be improved.    Breakfast was a little limited and samey after a few days.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Richard C wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: We came here for our honeymoon and was blown away by the effort Stefania and her team went to to make our stay special. We arrived in the evening to a candle light dinner on the roof overlooking and Marrakesh and a beautiful room covered in candles and rose petals.    Stefania was super helpful from the first booking enquiry until the day we left the Riad. During our stay her team were always on hand and super helpful. We had delicious breakfast on our own balcony over looking the courtyard. I would defiantly recommend the Hamman here and the hour long massage after!    If you come to Marrakesh then stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neil M wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: What a place to have dinner. Great service great ambience great food. Going back in 48 hours for our last night. Getting there is an adventure where going down a dark alley does not make you think there will be such a fantastic ending. Well worth a visit with a top class dinner with wine for £40 pp.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pauline H wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: Lovely Peacefull Riad away from all the hustle and bustle
Review_Text: Lovely room with own private terrace excellent food and wonderful staff. The staff couldn't do enough for us and were really helpful as to which sites to visit. We were even given a mobile device to telephone. the hotel if we got lost which is very easy in the maze of streets.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo M wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: Stunning riad, great location, amazing people!
Review_Text: We stayed in Riad 72 for 3 nights to celebrate a birthday and wedding anniversary. The staff there couldn't do enough for us without being 'there' (in our face) they were always there for us if that makes sense! They almost sense when you need them. We literally felt like we were in our own home it was so relaxing and friendly. The hammam on site was awesome. Riad 72 is in a great location easy walking distance to the Jemaa El Fnaa and the fantastic souks. Breakfast was lovely lunch and dinner here were also delicious. The rooms are modern and comfortable we stayed in the Menara deluxe room which has it's own sun terrace but we also got to use the suite to freshen up before we left for the airport both of a fabulous quality. We would not hesitate to come back to Riad 72.......just utterly brilliant!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jin L wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: We stayed in this Riad for only a couple nights which I wished we were there longer! It was absolutely beautiful and the staff were incredible. The rooms were clean and beautiful and the food was fantastic! I would suggest to have dinner on the rooftop as you get such a spectacular view of the sunset. We would definitely stay here again!

Review_Date: Sean L wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: A really grand riad with a great lounge and good location
Review_Text: Traveled with my wife daughter and son in law and their two children. We originally stayed in the sister riad but there was an issue with hot water which meant a move to this one. The rooms are smaller and the terraces are OK . Breakfast is varied and an eclectic mix of French and local cuisine. The management dealt with our issues well after we had expressed our dissatisfaction over the hot water situation and provided a generous refund. Overall as a short break it is ideal but beds are a little hard
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Elegant, exotic boutique with great people
Review_Text: We enjoyed the wonderful atmosphere supported by a great staff original style and excellent food. Perfect for non-locales looking for an authentic experience with all the niceties of a high-end boutique. This place is one of a kind.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My partner booked this Riad as a surprise for immediately after our 3 day trip into the Sahara. We arrived feeling exhausted after an 11 hr minibus trip so stepping through the doors of Riad 72 very nearly made me cry! The welcome from Stefania was wonderful having our hands washed in rose water & then being served Morrocan pastries and mint tea whilst our paperwork was completed was lovely. We were lucky enough to receive a room upgrade which gave us a stunning room with a private roof terrace on which we had breakfast both mornings of our stay (17 & 18 March 2016).    The interior of Riad 72 is very chic and relaxing. The staff are eager to help you & very polite. Stefania ensured we knew how to find our way to and from the Riad & also provided us with a mobile phone in case we got lost or needed help! (Thankfully we didn't need it!)    Our meal on our first night was delicious & had my partner not been feeling so ill (tonsillitis!) I'm sure we would have eaten in the Riad again.    If you are looking for a special place to stay then Riad 72 is highly recommended! Unfortunately we didn't have time to try out the hammam offered ... perhaps next time?!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mohammad Q wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: We stayed in Riad 72 for 5 days for our baby moon the first two in Karma suite and the remaining 3 in Aman deluxe room both of which had their distinct character. I would have liked to stay at the suite for our full stay but unfortunately the room wasn't available for the full duration but it wasn't a bad thing in the end since Aman was a brilliant experience in its own right.    We had the most amazing time in Marrakech and I can't thank the staff at Riad 72 enough for their amazing hospitality and great recommendations ranging from places to visit in Marrakech to the foodstalls to go at Djame el fena which could be quite a daunting task for tourists.    We also tried their restaurant which was a great experience with freshly sourced ingredients and food cooked to order. Don't miss out their special Lamb or beef Tangia but be aware that you need to place the order 6 hours in advance but then patience pays with exquisite dining experience.    Finally my wife used their spa for massage couple of times and was very happy with the masseuse who specialized in pregnancy massages and was called by the management especially for her. Another example of details they took care of to make our stay wonderful.    I can't recommend Riad 72 highly enough and hope to be back in Marrackech soon to enjoy the experience again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rita F wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: You are in Marrakech enter in the shabby narrow streets of the Medina but then you enter through a small door.... into a paradise...  Really charming Riad amazing service.  Recommend a relaxing wine and cheese for lunch or before dinner in the patio..also the marroco salads and breakfast are great.  Only one problem: no swimming pool :(
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the beginning to end of our 5 night stay Riad 72 was heaven. The food in their restaurant was delicious (made even more so by their chef catering for my rather tricky allergies with such thought). The staff were friendly and so very welcoming and the decor was so stylish and yet traditionally chic. They made our stay extremely special. I would thoroughly recommend and I'm already looking for an excuse to come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a gorgeous 3 night stay here back in February. Stefania and the rest of the staff were absolutely wonderful always cheerful and nothing was too much trouble. The Riad itself is beautiful and calm we stayed in the Amal suite which was cosy and really pretty and the huge bath tub was a bonus! We had dinner in the riad on the first night which was delicious especially the starters and lamb tagine. Have breakfast on the roof terrace if the weather is good it's so nice up there! We also had massages and a hammam one evening which were fantastic and so relaxing.    Getting to the Riad itself through the narrow winding streets can feel a bit intimidating in the evening. The Riad gives you a mobile and there's a security guard who can accompany you in the evening if you need it - we took advantage of this a couple of times when we came back late after dinner out it's a great touch.    Wouldn't hesitate to come back here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were greeted warmly in this beautiful and authentic Riad. The cuisine was very good and I especially liked the breakfast. The room was comfy and tastefully furnished. The location is central and makes it easy to enjoy Marrakech at its fullest potential.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights in one of the classic rooms which was compact but had everything we needed for the two of us and was very comfortable. We had never stayed in a riad before but i would highly recommend it as an authentic way to experience Morocco. The building is beautiful and transports you to another world. The service was brilliant; especially the lovely lady that served our breakfast every morning. Our room like the whole riad was spotless and we loved the breakfast. I wish i could have the recipe for the Moroccan pancakes and umm symon (that spelling isn't accurate!)  The location was perfect as the riad is tucked away down a quiet alley but only a few minutes walk to the souks and main streets. The access to a local mobile with details of important contacts such as the riad's main number and Stefania's mobile number was a great idea. The only things that would have improved our experience were to include the return airport transfer in the booking as the journey there is included. The one other thing is to perhaps have a small fridge in the room as all of the water is room temperature and on a hot day you really need a cold drink!  On our last day we booked a hammam followed by mint tea which was so relaxing - we would recommend this to anyone! We would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A calm and paradise-like oasis in the heart of the vibrant medina of Marrakech. From the delicious breakfast to the sunset on the rooftop terrace we have enjoyed every moment of our stay. A contemporary design that is perfectly combined with the architecture of the historical Riad. Outstanding service; warm helpful and very professional.

My wife and I have just retuned from 4 nights at Riad 72 and it was a fantastic choice.  The room and bed were comfortable with very effective air conditioning and a large bathroom. All public areas were calm and the rooftop terrace has more than enough seating for all the occupants though it never had more than 4 people up there.    Best of all though was the service which is both attentive and thoughtful. Nothing was too much trouble Stefania and her staff really know how to makes their guests feel pampered and comfortable. The meal we ate at the hotel on the first night was very good and matched any of the restaurants we tried. Do not hesitate if you are considering Riad 72. It's location service rooms and food are all as good as we could have hoped for. They arranged our airport transfers too which ran smoothly and removed the hassle of finding a taxi.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from four nights at Riad 72. The Riad was peaceful with a tranquil courtyard away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. We stayed in one of their classic rooms which was lovely and we were provided with bottles of water and fruit in our room each day. The only slight issue we had was with the water pressure in the shower.    Each day we enjoyed breakfast on the terrace and after a day of exploring the Medina it was lovely having a bottle of wine and delicious nibbles on the roof overlooking the city.    Stefania the Manager and her team including Asma and Mustafa were absolutely amazing and were always on hand if we needed anything. They arranged transport to and from the airport which we recommend taking up. With only seven rooms we got to know the staff well and it really felt like home!    We felt very welcome and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Riad 72. We would recommend it to those thinking of going.    Thank you so much Stefania and the team!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christina S wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: Would stay again in a heartbeat
Review_Text: After having spent the first half of our week at the very trendy and popular El Fenn I can say with the utmost confidence that Riad 72 is far better in quality service and...everything.    Every single staff member greats you with a smile and hello and asks how your day was. After feeling like a number at El Fenn this was very appreciated. The decor is stunning. Modern/Minimalist Moroccan. Monochromatic with pops of color.    If you can stay in the Karma Suite. It is worth the splurge. The room is enormous with a wooden ceiling with a carved out skylight. You feel like you're in a palace.    The breakfast was fantastic. The rooms are quiet beds are beyond comfortable. The location is perfect in quieter back alley and only a 7-8 minute walk from the busier souks. It's a nice escape from the insanity.    The only thing that could be improved is the bathroom in the Karma Suite - the mirror above the sink is really hard to look into if you're tall. Therefore making it almost impossible for a man to shave during his stay.    I would stay here again when back in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fiona M wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Just returned from a 3 night stay in Riad 72. Highly recommend as a choice for your stay in Marrakech. Everything was perfect. The Riad includes free airport pick up and they arranged an early check in for us as we had a very early flight. From the minute we arrived at the Riad the welcoming service from Stefania and the rest of the team was above and beyond. Stefania made us feel so at home. When we arrived she sat down with us (after being served refreshing towels mint tea and pastries of course) and provided maps recommendations and info on the Riad's facilities. They even provide you with your own mobile phone for your stay. This is pre-loaded with the manager's number if you need anything and also the hotel security guard's number if you ever needed assistance not that we ever did but it was a nice touch to know we were so looked after. We enjoyed dinner and drinks on the roof terrace - food was excellent. Breakfast was included and was lovely a selection of pastries fruit juices and coffee. You can enjoy this in the courtyard area or on the roof terrace. Hammam and massages were also a fantastic experience we were glad we chose to do this at the Riad rather than an outside spa as we could sit in the relaxing room in the courtyard area and sip on more mint tea after our treatments and then slope upstairs to our room in our robes. Room was extremely comfortable with plenty storage space and free wifi. Could not recommend this place enough! It was such a lovely calm oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the outside streets. Great location to everything in the Medina too. Just perfect!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We absolutely loved our stay at Riad 72. Stepping into the riad off the bustling streets of Marrakech is like stepping into a luxurious oasis. We were welcomed by fresh mint tea and Moroccan pastries and a lovely welcome by Asma and Stefania. There were so many really nice touches to our stay and absolutely nothing was too much trouble for the staff. On our first night we ate at the riad's restaurant and it was absolutely delicious. We also chose to take advantage of the riad's hammam and massage offering. Would absolutely recommend Riad 72 and would love to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Matthew L wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Very welcoming and helpful people at Riad 72. They could not help us enough. Fantastic roof terrace and courtyard. Great map and advice provided on arrival. Lovely breakfast. We will return when we come back to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Meg L wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: Luxurious calm in a great location!
Review_Text: I researched lots of riads before choosing Riad 72 and we definitely made a great choice! I wanted something with a rooftop terrace and the overall reviews for Riad 72 made me think that it would also give us a central location excellent service calm and tranquility and a bit of chic sophistication. It gave us all of those and more! It was our first visit to Marrakech and getting the transfer from the airport to the riad made it so easy to find our way and get settled in. We were met by Asiz and he took us through the little streets to the riad entrance where we enjoyed the mint tea and pastries in the lovely courtyard. Stefania and the whole team treated us so specially throughout our visit as I'm sure they do to all their guests. Our room was one with a private roof terrace which was lovely to have an afternoon nap on and listen to the sounds of the birds and the call to prayer. Breakfast was great with pastries fresh orange juice eggs homemade crepes fresh yogurt and we also had dinner one evening on the main roof terrace - Mustafa tended to our every want and it was a lovely way to enjoy delicious Moroccan cuisine in a tranquil setting but knowing that the heart of the medina was just a few minutes walk away. Stefania arranged a camel ride for us which was great and we also took advantage of the hamman in the riad which was truly wonderful.  Overall a great stay at Riad 72 and we hope to come back to relax and enjoy Marrakech again! Thank you to Asma Asiz Mustafa Stefania and all of the team who made our stay great!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: An absolutely fabulous weekend city break away in Marrakech brought about by the superb Riad 72. Stefania and her team could not do enough for us. Their level of service was exceptional. The Riad itself had the best location was a piece of heaven right in the centre and had a lovely clean contemporary feel about it whist still maintaining an authentic Moroccan decor and ambiance. The food (both breakfasts and dinners finished off the perfect weekend away. Will definitely be back to Marrakech and definitely stay in the Riad 72 again. A Huge Thank you to Stefania and all her staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent stay with my (same sex) fiancé at Riad 72 lovely room great shower very comfortable bed. Staff were very helpful breakfasts were delicious though possibly could benefit from a bit of variety. Lovely setting very quiet beautiful building and about 5-10 minutes walk from the main souk area. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed only two nights could have stayed a month! This was a perfect location in the Medina. The lady running the place was super friendly offering many suggestions of where to go and also restaurants to eat. Rooms good size and super clean. Breakfast was plentiful as well! Would recommend to anybody!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived at the start of the Medina and we immediately thought we would loose ourselves looking for the hotel. But instead there was Asiz waiting for us and ready to bring us to a breath-taking hotel.  When we entered our eyes were amazed to see the remarkable entrance and were filled with the sparkling light which came from the very particular water fountain. The guests arrive and are welcomed by Stefania a beautiful and joyful woman which brings even more color to your stay at Riad 72.  She accompanied us to our room called Amal. It was only when Stefania opened the door that we understood what an astonishing work did the owner do.  The days passed and our stay got better every day. We went to the Medina which is pretty easy to arrive to since the hotel is practically in it.  Stefania was also so kind to tell us restaurants and shops of the place.  When the last day approached we were so demoralized that we decided to stay 2 days more. Thanks to Stefania we were able to stay in the same room.  One of the most stunning hotels I have ever been to!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A warm welcome greets you in this enchanting jewel of a hotel in the Medina.
Review_Text: My daughter and I spent 2 nights at Riad 72 we had a wonderful stay our room was delightful comfortable and peaceful. The very friendly personal service given by Stefania and her team was exceptional . Breakfast was fabulous and not the help yourself kind but a variety of delicious food served to our table. Great traditional Morrocan food served in the very classy restaurant. We highly recommend Riad 72 and would like to thank Stefania especially for making us feel so very welcome.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jon H wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: The Only place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: The perfect location. Great food. Brilliant rooms and the best host - Stefania. This is the only Riad to stay in if you are visiting Marrakech. This was my second visit in as many years to Marrakech and Stefania did not disappoint once again. Helpful even before arrival - on email Stefania is the perfect combination of friendly and professional and this filters down through into every element of her wonderful Riad. And the delightful staff each have the magic touch. You will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: We couldn’t be happier of our choice
Review_Text: We just spent a wonderful Easter weekend in Marrakech and the main reason of this feeling was our stay at Riad 72.  We couldn’t be happier of our choice regarding all the time we spent on the Internet and guidebooks searching for the perfect location in the city.    Ideally located in the Medina you can visit the major attractions on foot. To give an idea the Jemaa el-Fna square is about 10 minutes’ walk. The venue is amazing lovingly and tastefully decorated with a perfect mix between Moroccan and Italian refinements. Our room was spacious pristine well-equipped not to mention the huge and fancy bathtub.    Stefania and the staff are very courteous helpful attentive yet discreet. Thank you very much to them for welcoming us in such a great way!    If you happened to be interested into the restaurant and the massages you should definitely go you won’t regret it.    Next time we will surely staying at Riad 72!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mustansir A wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Riad 72 is a boutique hotel priding on customer satisfaction - you truly feel "special" in the hotel as there are only 7 rooms and we are glad we didn't go for a corporate type of hotel. Location is excellent only 10 min from the main square and you feel you are far away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Food was amazing and the hammam and the massages were excellent. The waiting staff are very hospitable and attentive. Would definitely reccomend staying here for a unique experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicholas M wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: We wanted somewhere that would be comfortable yet sophisticated hospitable peaceful and personal....my family experienced all that and more when we stayed at Riad 72. What Stefania and her staff do so very well is those personal touches that come from the heart. They think about their guests and what they can do to make the stay a special one (right down to baking my daughter’s favourite cake for her birthday and having it there at Breakfast complete with her name stamped on...). The food and wine cannot be faulted the rooms are spacious clean and very well appointed. This is why I want to shout out to the world if you are in Marrakech give yourself a well deserved treat and stay in this beautiful and tranquil setting. Thank you so much Stefania for welcoming us into your Riad 72 family and will see you again I am sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: william j wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: We have just finished an amazing 3 days in Marrakech staying at Riad 72. The hotel was perfect for a special birthday treat for my wife.    The location is excellent in the Medina but in a quiet well kept derb with plenty of local families. The facilities were great and the interior design was just right a perfect blend of traditional Arabic and simple elegance.    The staff were wonderful throughout and were attentive and helpful without ever being pushy the breakfasts were delicious with fresh strawberries and raspberries and freshly squeezed orange juice a welcome accompaniment to traditional Moroccan pastries and pancakes.    Marrakech is a fascinating city which I found surprisingly progressive and full of contemporary art and design blending traditional artisans skills such wood and leather work with modern design and ideas.    I will definitely be travelling to Morocco again to see more of this fascinating country and when I'm back in Marrakech I'll definitely be staying at Riad 72 again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I booked a weekend in Marrakech as a surprise to my wife to celebrate our wedding anniversary. I spent a lot time researching the riad's within the medina and we were not disappointed.  When you arrive by taxi you will have a two minute walk to riad 72 through traditional alleys. Don't be concerned no hassle whatsoever you are escorted by porter you need him to find the riad.  Once behind the front door your are welcomed in traditional Moroccan style and the look and feel was everything I was looking for. Our room was superb very comfortable breakfast served in the courtyard was excellent and the roof terrace very relaxing after a couple of hours walking the medinas. Strongly recommend the traditional Hammam bath. (Ive never felt cleaner) In addition all of the staff were extremely helpful and always on hand which would lead me to strongly recommend this very traditional and friendly riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad 72. A charming heaven hidden behind the hectic alleyways of the city. As soon as you enter there is peace and calm and a wonderful warm welcome by the management and staff. They really do go out of their way to make you feel very special and nothing you ask is any trouble. On arrival we enjoyed fresh mint tea and cake followed by a chilled out lunch on the roof terrace. With transfer to and from the airport and even a personal guide if required to see you safely to your destination through the alleyways streets we always felt in very safe hands. And then there is the food. Simple yet complex and definately a treat especially breakfast. Only one small issue. Room doors have wonderful hand made iron bolt however in such a calm and quiet environment they do make a bit of noise. Perhpas this will be reviewed and then you have a perfect sanctuary.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: An oasis as you walk in you are captivated by the beauty all over. Welcoming hospitality cleanliness superior dinning and top spa treatments. This Riad is absolutely stunning: it is one of the most beautiful hotel that I have ever stayed at. Everything about this hotel is perfect. The staff was very helpful fantastic accommodating and courteous. I wish I could have stayed longer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad 72 is beautiful- we had a very warm welcome from Stefania and the wonderful staff at the riad.  We treated ourselves and stayed in the Karma suite which had very high ceilings a beautifully carved skylight and a lovely big square bath- we even got to chose our own soaps!  We had (very generously sized) breakfasts in the lovely inner courtyard with banana trees fountains and little birds; and enjoyed great views from the roof terrace. It was my boyfriend's birthday during our stay and the staff brought a cake out for breakfast and sang him happy birthday! This was such a sweet touch and much appreciated. We would love to come back again and I'd recommend booking directly through their website as we found it considerably cheaper.  Thanks for making our Marrakech trip so memorable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Incredible staff. Everyone was so friendly. They made great recommendations for food and activities. Although I could have never left the hotel and been entirely content.  The view from the terrace was breathtaking. The location is ideal- very quiet and serene but an easy walk to the souk.This is by far the best hotel around. The rooms are great each with a different feel to them. They are comfortable and spacious. The breakfast every morning was delicious. Such a great experience!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anna H wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: Fantastic riad with great service.  I have now stayed at both Riad 72 and Riad Due can highly recommend them.  Good location with a nice roof terrace.  Breakfast and dinner at the riad are top good.  Thank all serviceminded staff and Stefania.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anne Sukrita wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: An beautiful oasis in the middle...
Review_Text: Staying at Riad72 has been one of my most wonderful experiences ever!    Where to start?... The staff....You'll feel like they almost know your every need before hand. Always ready to assist you or give you good advise about the city - you can ask for everything and they will try to help.  The Riad is beautiful and has an exceptional calm vipe which I very much appriciated. I got up every morning to do yoga on the top terrace overlooking the city watching the sun come up.  The food:  We had dinner several very good places around the city however the best dinner we had during our stay was at Riad72 - the cook makes exceptional tasty courses - and it is beautifully arranged.  They can also arrange guided private tours for you - we went to the Atlas Mountains - The valley of Ourika one day: It included: Private driver a 2 hours guided track in the hills... afterwards great lunch overlooking the beautiful landscape and a visit to a bio-garden on the way home. It was wonderful!!!    I will most definetely come back one day - it's a little paradise that you can not miss! :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I cannot recommend this place enough. The rooms are gorgeous the staff are so incredibly lovely and the location is excellent. The in house hammam and massage are great but the is an amazing larger spa next door as well. This was my second visit and I'm already planning my next stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were little disappointed as our expectations we're pretty high. Room was small and dark air conditioning didn't work properly. For the money you pay it could be better. There are many riads in Marrakesh which offer you more convenient stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: the highlight of the trip was staying at the Riad 72. the food was glorious the staff super helpful and the rooms were spacious and charming. i would highly recommend the Riad 72 for a weekend getaway.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ingrid J wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: Beautifully designed riad with friendly staff
Review_Text: We had the room with the private terrace which was spacious and very comfortable. The staff was welcoming and friendly. The rose water to wash our hands after arriving was quite lovely as was the mint tea and cookies. The courtyard while not huge was a decent size. We had a bit of a problem with our shower as it had a handheld sprayer and an overhead rainwater shower head but the overhead one would not stay on consistently. The location was quite nice close to the main action in the medina but down a quiet side street/alley. We probably should have scheduled a tour with a guide as we got lost almost every time we left the riad! We also had dinner at the riad twice once on the rooftop terrace and once inside and it was quite good. Stefania Aziz Rashid and all the other staff were great. The views on the roof are fantastic as well. Overall quite a pleasant retreat in a good location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lori Z wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad, with a great location and staff.
Review_Text: My family spent 5 nights at Riad 72 in mid-January. It is really a lovely spot that is beautifully appointed. With 2 young adults in tow who have traveled all over the world I am always worried if my lodging picks will pass muster. Riad 72 surpassed everyone's expectations. We have stayed in many different types of hotels. If you are willing to deviate from a 5 star resort hotel and are after an experience try Riad 72. You will be very pleased!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Linda Stray H wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: Outstanding beautiful and quiet Riad with great location in the Medina-an Oasis!
Review_Text: A perfect place to stay!  Wonderful design delicate and autentic! Comfortable and quiet rooms roof terrace with great view of the city and the Atlas mountains court yard with banana trees evenings with candle lights all over the place! Every detail is thought through!    They offers to pick you up at the airport (recommended!) cell phone to call for assistans if needed at any time security guard to walk with you if desired. Nothing is to much trouble they organize everything you want!    Breakfast is delicious yougurts is served in jars butter and cheese wrapped with bows. Warm bread fresh juice and wonderful coffee! Dinner is exellent with good wine..    But above all this.. The staff! The staff is the best!! Increadibly friendly an helpful smiling and with a good sense of humor! They give you the feeling beeing familiy! I can not give them enough credit for the service and attitude!    So all thanks to Stefania the manager and her staff: Aicha( thanks again for the beautiful Henna painting!!) Laila Asma Mustapha Rachid and Aziz! Every one of you made this stay a wonderful experience!    This Riad absolutely exceeded the expectations- and more than that!    Highly recomended!!!!    Linda and Roy Norway
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rob D wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: Stayed here for three nights and loved every minute. Didn't want to leave. From the detailed and informative checkout (including a special hand washing abs fragrant tea) the picturesque rooftop lush indoor courtyard and pond delicious breakfasts and relaxing Hammam treatment.    Our room was fun exciting and romantic. The bathroom was Devine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Escaping the Canadian winter we enjoyed NYE at Riad 72 this year. Great atmosphere and cool music refined decorations candles and lanters flickering in every corner faboulous food and champagne. At midnigh we rang into 2016 to a soundtrack of gnaoua musicians and belly dancing of the highest quality . The evening ended with everybody dancing guests and staff as well like a 40 people big and happy family. Reasonable price to have lobster prawns salmon glazed duck champagne especially since it was NYE. Great time and great people at Riad 72. Excellent accommodation and a dedicated team to ensure you the greatest experience. Thanks to Stefania and her team. We definitely go back!    grazie mille
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Again wonderful stay at Riad 72.  Arrival super welcoming beautiful room fragrant and fresh fruit water and tea to get you settled while you fill out your registration forms.  massages amazing breakfast a mixture of continental and Moroccan and more than plenty :-)  Restaurant: Moroccan cuisine at its best.  As always a 'home for home' with hotel mobile supplied so that if you get lost in the souk or need any form of assistance you can call them to help you out.  One of the most stunning riads and whilst in the middle of the souk an oasis of calm and relaxation...will always return with pleasure ...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing service, peacefull location , excellent food
Review_Text: Third time in this Riad charismatic and unique.  Very nice ad big room ( and bathroom!) personalized and attentive service breakfast completely fresh (all hand-made) and Stefania always ready to satisfy your needs.  I love this Riad !!!!!!  The food a la Table du Riad is superb.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Fantastic all round. The staff in particular were absolutely super - always smiley and nothing is too much hassle. The location rooms food and surroundings were also brilliant. Very much looking forward to returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Marrakech is a bustling and magical city - spend your day absorbing the tumultuous energy and then feel the need for calm and idyllic surroundings Riad 72 is heavenly. Breakfast to live for. Beds huge and luxurious. Nothing is too much for their amazing staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Genevieve L wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: One of best hotels ever stayed in
Review_Text: Beautifully designed and decorated fabulous staff and breakfast. Truly at the very top of my list of best places I have stayed. Can't fault it.    We had a two story bedroom with little lounge area and dressing room very spacious and beautiful bed. Ate in one night and hugely enjoyed. Try out their mojito and also soft wonderful Medallion wine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great service and hammam not to be missed
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed there in Sep 2015. The manager Stephania and other staff were very helpful and kind. We arrived very late at night partly due to the train delay but there were there to help us and served dinner. It was very nice as we were too tired to go out.    The location was close enough to Jemaa el-Fnaa so we were able to walk there. There are some small alleys to get there but the staff helps you when you arrive with luggage.    Last but not least is their hammam. It was so thorough and nice. Even though the lady didn't speak English too much and we didn't speak French at all we somehow communicated during the time. We felt so refreshed and clean afterwards. It was just so very good!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: How one thing can ruin a stay... FRAUD!
Review_Text: What a shame. Riad 72 was doing so so well. Having traveled to some of the best hotels in the world I was very sad to experience what we did on our last day. The stay was great - the room was ok (we had the loft room a bit strange but fine) the staff (apart from the manager) were charming attentive and lovely and the food delicious.    On the last day when checking out the card machine said to have 'failed' the transaction of our card twice. When contacting our bank to see what the problem was they told us that the first payment had been processed. Stefania the manager of Riad 72 was insistent that we were wrong despite our bank manager speaking to her on the phone.    She was rude patronizing and quite frankly obnoxious in the way she handled matters. Thank goodness for the man who was working with her in the office. He was kind and helpful. The matter is still to be resolved and our bank says the have committed a fraud here so DO watch out.    Also DO NOT listen to her dinner recommendations. She recommended AQUA for supper - we walked up and turned away immeditly. It is soul less - and NOT what one wants when in Marrakesh. Try Le Jardin Nomad Al Fassia....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: After an amazing stay over Christmas last year we decided to return to Riad 72. From the minute we set foot inside we felt like we'd returned home - such beautifully warm and attentive service in the most amazing surroundings. Stefania kindly upgraded us to one of the suites and it was perfect. This is by far one of the best places in the world we've stayed in and the service surpasses most five star hotels by far. What is especially important for us (as a gay couple) is that we feel comfortable and secure. Riad 72 couldn't do more to ensure this - to say we felt welcome would be an understatement. Cannot recommend it highly enough - it will now become an annual pilgrimage for us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Staying at Riad 72 was an absolute pleasure. It is ideally located in the Bab Doukala district which is within 10 minutes walking distance from all the main sights and very easy access to the new city.  There was street parking available at a nearby mosque which was fairly reasonable in price.    Reaching the Riad has that charming experience where you walk through some dimly lit and unassuming alley ways until you come across a sign that says 72 and a simple wooden door in a wall. And then you step inside and it takes you by surprise!  I enjoyed the interiors of the Riad. It kept true to the local theme while not overdoing it on the zelij and arabesques as in some other Riads. It's was all very quiet and tasteful. The courtyard is a calm place to sit and drink some sweet mint tea and read a book while the water feature a sculpture of sorts gives you some calm background noise.    The dining room is notably different in a dark red tone with some unique paintings and European furniture. It's a good setting for a romantic dinner and the food was very good.    What really sets this Riad apart though is the service. It's the quality of service that many 5 star hotels aspire to where the staff are well integrated an capable of providing the guest with whatever service they need whether it's their responsibility or their colleagues. The answer is always positive and accompanied with a warm smile.    Stefania the hotel manager also does an excellent job of checking on guests regularly to ensure their stay is going well. She is also very knowledgable about the town and made some excellent recommendations for our sightseeing.    For lovers of breakfasts...
