This Riad had some of the best I've ever experienced in a hotel setting. All of the Moroccan pastries were freshly prepared that morning for you to enjoy and some even made to order. Alongside were some beyond excellent local jams or deferent flavours and rich honey. The local labneh cheese served in a sort of wax paper I could not get enough of. I also strongly recommend ordering some eggs cooked to perfection. Fried eggs with a topping of 'khlie' a kind of Moroccan salty dried beef cannot be beaten. The tea and coffee was good as usual.  There is the option to have breakfast on the terrace should weather allow. The view over the medina and the Djama El Fna mosque is stunning especially in a clear day when you see the snow capped Atlas Mountains in the background.  Be prepared to contend with some honey bees though who will slowly swarm around your breakfast in an effort to steal some honey. This might bother some people as it forced us to move down stairs. A large party nearby was comfortable so again it depends on individual squeamishness.    Each room is unique in its space and design. Ours was split over 2 levels a ground floor living room where you entered the suite and a mezzanine of sorts where the bedroom and bathroom were located. In the bathroom there was a very little door to sneak out onto the terrace.    The beds were very comfortable and the room was beautifully designed quiet and calm. The perfect retreat after a day of souk shopping haggling and sightseeing.    The spa facilities might have been a bit overstated. The hammam room is a traditional one with tadelakt walls with heat coming through them. However it's quite small and didn't really suite 2 people at once. The woman who carried out the treatment managed well however leaving us satisfyingly clean at the end of it.    The massage that followed was a bit disappointing. It didn't seem bedded in any technique and at times the masseuses made a poor effort to maintain personal privacy. The disposable underwater was also frustratingly small flimsy and see through. For those not used to getting massages regularly it can be quite discomforting. I wouldn't probably try the spa somewhere else next time.    The hotel feels very secure. The staff are very trustworthy and there is a guard al hours of the day. We were also kindly given a utility phone to contact the hotel should we need any guidance tips or in case of an emergency. I thought this was a nice touch.    I would certainly stay there again on my next trip to Marrakech mostly for the great service and the cool style of the Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As someone in the travel industry I've spent time in world class hotels and can honestly say that my time at Riad72 did not pale in comparison. Stefanie Mehdi and the rest of the team made the riad feel like a home away from home in a foreign land. I felt comfortable and well taken care of from the moment I stepped through the doors. They also provide a local phone pre-programmed with staff numbers which further reinforced my feeling of safety and security while traveling on my own. Riad72 is a truly special setting with impeccable decor delectable food and incredible views - a place of serenity in a fast-paced city. It also couldn't be more conveniently located in the heart of the the medina just a stone's throw from authentic Moroccan shops and minutes from the famous Djemma El Fnaa Square. If you have the opportunity to enjoy breakfast on the rooftop take it as there are few better ways to start a morning in Marrakech. You simply cannot go wrong with several nights at Riad72!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Wonderful family run boutique - with a brilliant chef (Fatooma)
Review_Text: I stayed here back in June 2012 (only writing this review now in 2015 and can't figure out how to show I stayed prior to Jan 15)    Absolutely loved my solo 4 day stay at this place the rooms are wonderful mine was overlooking the courtyard and the bathroom was to die for; all earthy stone understated luxury - my idea of heaven. Great place to relax and disconnect met 2 lovely travellers from Japan. The staff are super friendly organized airport transfer when I first arrived and when I left extremely prompt in their emails. If you don't get a chance to stay you must visit for the food - their chef Fatouma is brilliant I still can taste her wonderful spiced carrot soup and tagine I asked if I could get a class and the hotel graciously arranged for me to join Fatooma whilst she cooked up her magic a lovely Berber lady with whom I managed to converse in Arabic and broken French! They have a small library room mainly old French/English books that appear to have been left behind by previous travellers but nonetheless a nice welcome refuge. There's a wonderful dining room downstairs which lovely art I was told they've hosted many weddings and I can definitely see it as a great location for a small family/friends holiday gathering. Would definitely visit again :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Neal C wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: Riad72 - Stefanie and her team are 1000% behind making your dreams come true in Marrakash
Review_Text: All the staff from maids to chefs are fabulous💥  Stefanie the manager has really does get the service and follow through right we celebrated 20 years of marriage there and not once disappointed.    Thanks again again for making our first trip so memorable Stefanie.    The Hammamm and massage are a must!! Thanks Neal & Carol
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: An oasis of calm in the hustle of bustle of Marrakech - a really great place to return to after a day exploring. The interior is interesting and historic and there is a lovely roof terrace with views over the city. The food was very good. Staff friendly and helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Great attention to detail and attentive staff
Review_Text: Stayed at Riad 72 at the beginning of December. The staff were helpful polite and friendly. The environment was beautiful. Rooms spacious and attractive with lovely finishing touches such as dressing gowns fruit basket water and plentiful toiletries.    The hotel provided a mobile phone for our use should we need it which we did not. We were also offered the security guard to escort to and from the taxi rank should we feel insecure or have difficulty navigating the streets. Whilst we didn't require this service it is a thoughtful extra.    Breakfast in the courtyard was both relaxing and yummy.    I would highly recommend this Riad and am sure I will return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: What more can I say about this amazing place that hasn't been said.... We went on our honeymoon and every moment we were so glad we had the opportunity to stay there. Wow. A stunner.    Also chef was awesome. My wife has celiac disease and can't eat gluten so the chef was very accommodating and made her food journey super! Breakfast everyday was a feast and the selection was incredible!    The staff was tremendously kind the owners have a ton of pride in their Riad and we had a great trip. Thank you for the life long memory and making our honeymoon a story we love to tell.    Anna and Corey Rollner
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: P W wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: We had a fantastic long weekend at Riad 72 which was made even more enjoyable by the wonderfully friendly staff and excellent food. Mehdi was always on hand to offer useful advice and our room (Karma) was of quite honestly epic proportions! We would certainly return and spend a great deal more time in this lovely place.    Riad 72 is very well located for the souks and a quick jaunt down to the main square. There's plenty of decent restaurants locally as well and they'll quite happily collect you from the airport whisking you through the traffic and to your tranquil room in no time. Highly recommended! Thank you Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Margaux V wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: Security Escorts for Your Evening Activities
Review_Text: Riad 72 was spectacular! Everyone has already said how it is a little oasis in the craziness of the Medina but one of the best things that the hotel has not received enough credit for is the services it offers to look after its guests. The hotel gives each guest a cell phone to call the hotel for assistance if ever needed and provides a security guard to walk you to and from destinations in the evening. We were 3 women traveling by ourselves so the security escort enabled us to continue our adventures into the evening and explore some of the amazing dinner spots the city has to offer. The staff is also always willing to help with a smiling face and breakfast became a highlight of our day with delicious little yogurts served in pretty little jars and cheeses wrapped with bows. Riad 72 will not disappoint!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed for 2 nights for my wife's birthday. We had the smallest room - Lile - but it was still great. Very attentive service excellent food. Id recommend to anyone really is very very good. Will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nabil A wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: Everything from the checkin to the checkout was perfect. The manager upgraded us to the suite and took care of the check in procedure while they served us with tea. All the staff and manager were very courteous and took care of all our needs. They even provided us with a local mobile in case we needed help when we were out and about.    The breakfast which was complimentary varied for the two days we stayed there and consisted of fresh homemade stuff. But the best thing was their dinner menu. We tried 3 different tagines and absolutely loved each one of them. The one with lamb pomegranate and roasted almonds was my personal favourite.    The Riad had a hammam and massage place as well which we didnt avail though in hindsight maybe we should have.    The Riad had a rooftop terrace as well on which you could enjoy beautiful views of the mountains while sipping a cup of Moroccan tea.    Cant recommend it enough. Absolutely 5 star!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachael H wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad 72 for 4 nights this November to celebrate my 30th birthday and can’t recommend it enough.  The Raid itself is beautiful calm and clean as well perfectly located within the Medina. I stayed in stunning Karma Suite which was stunning huge and perfect for a special occasion. It came equipped with a Nespresso machine hair dryer Bluetooth speaker and everything you could need. Our group of four also booked the Amal Delux Room with twin bed which was a smaller room but came with its own terrace overlooking the courtyard. On arrival we were offered a rose water hand wash which was a lovely way to refresh from the flight and a choice of soaps which were then placed in our room. The bottles of water and fresh fruit that were also provided in our room everyday were also a nice touch.  The main square souks were all only 10 minutes’ walk away but the moment you stepped into the Riad you felt far removed from the hustle and bustle - the central courtyard with banana trees and water feature was a great place to relax. With only 7 rooms you nearly always felt you had the place to yourselves. We loved wandering past the local shops just around the corner from the Riad a few times a day– it made you feel part of the community and the woodwork shop was amazing!  The Riad had thought of everything and all the little touches such as the personalised map transfer from the airport a cell phone to use during your stay and a security guard who could come meet you from a taxi if you wanted (not at all necessary but a nice touch) really made us feel relaxed and welcome. The complimentary mint tea and nibbles were delicious and very welcome after busy days exploring the city.  Stefania and all her team were all very friendly discrete and efficient and even made me a birthday cake and sang to me on the morning of my birthday which was very sweet. Nothing was too much trouble and they were happy to host us for breakfast and dinner on the wonderful roof terrace (which has great views from its high vantage point) with hardly any notice. We had to meals at the Riad in addition to the great and varied spreads at breakfast and would highly recommend eating in the restaurant at least once.  It was my first trip to Marrakesh and I would not hesitate to stay at Riad 72 when I return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Alma Z wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: A wonderful stay in Marrakech thanks to the staff at Riad 72. Stilish rooms and common areas fantastic staff and hospitality. Great attention to every detail fresh fruits and flowers customized artisanal soap mint tea with homemade pastries anytime you like. Highly recommended! Sure we'll come back the next time in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: andrew f wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad 72 for 3 nights in November which was a brilliant choice as we had a great time. Even before we arrived I had conversed with Stefania who was very helpful and always got back to me promptly. When we arrived we were greeted by her with biscuits and mint tea which is very tasty she went through everything we needed to know about our stay including places to visit and gave us a mobile phone in case we did get lost and couldn't fin dour way out of the Medina which will happen but fortunately we found our way back. The Riad is positioned in a perfect place not in the heart of the souks but 5 minute walk to them which gives you that nice feelign of relation when you're back. We organised a trip through the Riad to the Atlas Mountains which was great and a must in my opinion. We also used the Hammam and Massage facilities at the Riad which were also great. We ate at the restaurant a couple of times and the food was delicious and very reasonable for what you get plus the breakfasts were always plentiful and tasty. The roof top is also a lovely place to chill out with shade if you needor loungers to chill out with a dip pool. I would thoroughly recommend this Riad for a stay in Marrakech. The staff and owner Stefania were the perfect hosts.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ben L wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We loved the really friendly and genuinely helpful staff. Guests are given a local mobile phone with the numbers of the manager and security guard pre-loaded in case of getting lost in Marrakech's labyrinthine streets or needing any other assistance. The location was great just outside the main throng of the souks but still close enough that it's easy to wander in and out. The central courtyard of the Riad has a lovely calm atmosphere and we enjoyed the offerings of the kitchen - both food and drink! Try the grey wine.  Don't expect to have a great view from your room - ours opened out onto the courtyard as I think many do so we had people walking past our windows but could still get privacy with shutters and curtains.  Overall we loved it and would definitely come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed at the Riad for 3 nights in November. A real gem. Beautiful rooms that are all unique and different. The service is genuine and efficient and you will feel like family when you leave. Excellent roof top terrace with great views. Breakfast and dinner equally brilliant on the patio.  The Riad is exceptionally clean. They offer transfers from the airport with booking as it is a bit difficult to find and you must enter by foot but once you open the door to the Riad it is magical. Stefania and her team will not disappoint. Book early.  We will be back next year!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: If you don't enjoy superlatives then look away now....
Review_Text: We spent three nights at Riad 72 at the beginning of October. It was one of the most pleasant and enjoyable stays that we have had anywhere ever. Riad 72 is a friendly oasis of tranquility that is perfectly located for exploring all that the Marrakech medina has to offer. The level of service is outstanding with Stefania and every member of her staff contributing to a fantastically friendly and relaxed atmosphere and providing a feeling of luxury that is at odds with the superb value (we paid less than £100 per night to stay in the beautifully decorated Lile room).  Each of the (currently 7) rooms is unique and beautifully decorated and the communal spaces from the courtyard (dominated by a giant palm) to the roof terrace (with fantastic views over the medina) all provide lovely spaces to relax over a glass of wine or mint tea. The fact that breakfast can be taken anywhere in the Riad is a lovely touch made only better by 'breakfast from 8am until whenever..."    Shortly after we booked Stefania contacted us to arrange transfer from the airport and as we would be arriving in late evening included a menu so that we could pre-book dinner on arrival. Our outbound flight was delayed by over two hours and despite arriving at approaching midnight our transfer was there to meet us at the airport and on arrival at Riad 72 there was a table laid in the stunning courtyard orange water brought to the table to wash our hands and a delicious meal provided with a very welcome bottle of wine...    If you have never been to Marrakech then Stefania provides a fantastic 'induction' to the city and all it has to offer and the Riad has produced a very useful custom map. For anyone feeling overwhelmed by the prospect of the assualt on the senses that Marrakech can be Riad 72 will arrange guides and even an on-call security service to walk you back to the Riad at night. Although I have to say we just dove straight into the city and found it to be one of the most entertaining non threatening and friendly places we have been whether by day or by night.    Marrakech is hot dusty and fascinating and after a day wandering the souks or a night in Jemma el Fnaa Square Riad 72 is the perfect place to relax and unwind. Oh did I mention that the food was fantastic too?    Will we be going back? Yes we certainly will.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad! Perfectly located and very attentive staff!
Review_Text: This Riad was lovely. 5 minutes from the Souks 10 minutes walk from the main square. And 1 minute from the Heritage Spa for the perfect Hammam. The rooms were lovely clean. Very quiet peaceful and tranquil which was welcoming after the busy day in the City. The staff were friendly and very attentive. Nothing too much trouble. It was great to be provided with a mobile phone incase we needed to ring the Riad. Isham the security guard walked us to our restaurant one evening and suggested we ring him at the end of the evening where he walked us back! Lovely. Highly recommend this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Top Riad in Marrakech. Superb Hospitality
Review_Text: Of course there is a lot of Riads to choose from but if your are looking for the ultimate level of service and attention this is definitely your choice. Most of the Riads are beautiful designed and the Riad 72 is no exception. But what this one has to win all the honors is: service. Service in terms of hospitality. From the moment you get there everyone makes you feel like home. They follow a very high level of quality commitment. Example: Second morning at the Riad our daily host (they change turns daily) already knew that the day before I had coffee no tea before breakfast and from that moment on coffee was offered the EXACT way I asked for it the very first time. And then just apply this to everything! All these incredible people Mustafa Rashid Asma were amazingly close in every request we had. I personally thanks the Raid manager Stefania amazing job she is doing in the top Riad in Marrakech. She was always around with advice and making every possible option the pamper ourselves and enjoy Marrakech: dinner reservations top massages in the Riad the Hamam Bath experience expeditions out of the city... name it and she made it possible! Amazing.    If all of the above can't convince you here is the cherry: I think greatest and pleasant surprise you will recieve (or maybe you got the tip too) is the underestimated cooking at Riad 72. Super Chef and great guy Mustafa makes magic at the kitchen where their menu is constantly changing offering traditional moroccan cuisine with a twist. If you don't believe me try it for yourself. We got so amazed that we even took a cooking class and had a blast of fun!!! (a must for foodielovers btw). Thanks Stefania Asma & Mustafa again. Mint tea forever!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joanna C wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: A Quiet Haven in the centre of Marrakech
Review_Text: We were looked after from the moment we arrived in Marrakech..we were picked up from the airport met by the porter who took our luggage we stepped into the Riad and it was stunning! An instant feeling of tranquillity and calm and just what the doctor ordered! Our room was lovely with a private terrace where we could relax.. Riad 72 is an ideal location where you can explore the excitement of Marrakech. Stefania and Mustafa were most helpful and gave us advice of where to go and to eat..we also ate lunches and a dinner in the Riad..along with our amazing breakfast each morning met by Azma who was so attentive and sweet. Overall I would have no hesitation in recommending this Riad to all my friends and family my husband and I had a wonderful break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emma W wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: We booked a weekend in Marrakech at Riad 72 hoping for a relaxing break and we were not disappointed. Stefania and her team looked after our every need in a very thoughtful yet subtle way. We contacted the hotel before we left the UK and asked them to arrange a taxi from the airport. This cost the equivalent of about £15 and the taxi took us to the nearest street to the hotel where we were met by a porter who helped us with our luggage. The Riad itself if stunningly beautiful. A square shaped building with a central courtyard with banana trees and a water feature. Our room was beautiful and we had our own private terrace which was a lovely place to rest after a hectic day out exploring (and getting lost). Providing guests with the use of a mobile phone is a nice touch although we didn't need it again it was nice to have. The food was exceptional and we enjoyed lunch on our terrace on the first day and also had two evening meals here down in the courtyard. We were mostly served by the ever thoughtful and friendly Mustafa who was very attentive.    This hotel has the whole package - beautiful rooms outstanding service and great food - look no further.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ade O wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: With so many Riads to choose from we took a bet and went for the glowing reviews of Riad 72. It really was everything we hoped for. From the impromptu mini tour intro by our transfer driver and warm welcome of mint tea and bites by manager Stefania and co to the amazing meal on our last day. All the staff made our stay stress free and enjoyable. The room was spacious quiet and full of traditional character. Stefania an amazing host offered top recommendations within and outside the city walls. This was my third trip to Marrakech and by far the most comfortable stay. If you're looking for a great boutique Riad in a fantastic location look no further than Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I will admit I did a lot I mean a lot of research on where to stay in Marrakech. Not quite sure how I found Riad 72 but I am sooooooo happy I did. This hotel did not disappoint. We were greeted at the taxi stand and our luggage was hand carted through the streets to the Riad. Upon entering Riad 72 I was blown away. The pictures do not do it justice. We were seated at a table in the courtyard and served tea and treats. We booked the Omnia Suite. Apparently when you book a suite you get to choose the soap you want. We were presented with a tray of soap in the log form. They asked us to smell each and we each got to choose which soap we wanted. They cut it and it was placed in in all soap dishes in our bathroom. When booking I had to choose between the Omnia or the Kharma Suite. I was told the Kharma Suite is very popular. But for some reason I was drawn to the Omnia Suite. It is a 2 story suite. Sitting room on the first floor. Bedroom huge closet and large bathroom upstairs. Not as bright and open as the Kharma Suite but much more warm and private. We had a lunch and a dinner on the roof. The food was good. The service was awesome. Nagir and Rachid are always there when you need something. We used the loungers and dipping pool. They do not have umbrellas for the loungers but the dipping pool is very refreshing. Stefania was always around to help with anything we needed. We were given a cell phone in casse we got lost in the medina. We used it twice. Once because we went to he Cafe Arabe instead of Maison Arabe and then when we really really got lost. Eshaham the security guard from the hotel came to our rescue both times. Nothing better then see him coming to rescue us. My husband and I can't say enough good things about our stay. Even the location was perfect. Look no further then Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tom H wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: What an amazing place! Perfectly located just on the edge of the souks and medina. The staff are incredible always smiling and there to help. The rooms are beautifully designed to every detail. Couldn't recommend this place more
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We enjoyed our stay at Riad 72 in October 2015. The entire staff was amazing from Stefania who helped facilitate our visit to Rachid who always asked if we needed anything to the Hammam scrubbing from Aisha. We had a wonderful stay...a definite must in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: David H wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: A fantastic Riad in a great sector of the Medina. Everything from the very warm welcome we received from Stefania and her team the high quality aned interesting rooms and the overall feeling of calm and peace in your own homely oasis contributed to making this a special holiday. It's a happy house where nothing is too much trouble for Asma Rachid Rachid Mustapha and others who seem to delight in providing the best service delivered with warmth personality and humour. Stefania is a wealth of knowledge when it comes to finding good spots to shop eat and can arrange trips to just about everywhere. We would certainly recommend going to The Atlas Mountains for a day not too far and very beautiful.  Marrakech felt safe despite the crowds filling the narrow lanes in the Medina and walking is the best way of getting about. It's great to just wander about and explore and when it all gets too hot return to your temporary home to refresh relax and just enjoy the environment.  We would love to return to Marrakeck sometime (probably during spring) and would certainly stay at Riad 72 again.  David & Jacqui
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our first visit to Marrakech and we were so fortunate to have chosen Riad 72. Stepping through the door the attention to detail is immediately obvious. Every member of staff is kind warm and professional going out of their way to make your stay perfect. Stefania arranged trips to the Atlas Mountains and Palmeraie for us both of which exceeded expectation. We stayed in the Manar room which is beautifully decorated with the benefit of a roof terrace to enjoy the stunning sunsets. Food is extremely good you can choose to eat on the roof terrace and enjoy the view of night time Marrakech or in the centre of the Riad by candlelight. We also had a hamman while we were there would definitely recommend that too. Finally a special thanks to Asma and Rachid they certainly could not have done anymore to make this such a special holiday - thank you.    Dave and Eve.

We stayed at Riad 72 for 5 nights and had the most amazing experience! This was our first time in Marrakech and definitely won't be the last. From the moment we arrived at the riad we were made to feel at home it was like living in a home and not a hotel. We were greeted by the lovely Stefania who is the manager there. She sat us down and gave us mint tea and Moroccan treats whilst explaining to us how everything works etc. Stefania was extremely thorough with everything and even explained where everything is locally on a map. A truly professional and very personal manager she is great at what she does! The staff at Riad 72 are all amazing and very hard working people. We were looked after mostly by Asma. She would be there as soon as you wake up to serve the most amazing breakfast and Asma always had the biggest smile on her face! Anything you wanted or needed Asma would do it! We didn't have to lift a finger!  We were a little bit nervous about venturing out to restaurants on our own at night so Stefania arranged for their security guard Icham to escort us and collect us from wherever we needed. Icham looked after us perfectly what a lovely guy! The riad also supplies you with a mobile phone so you can always reach them and feel safe when you go out alone.  The room was beautiful and spotlessly clean! The sheets smelt AMAZING! A few things that might be better in our room though would be the lighting in the bathroom (although I do understand that all riads are pretty dark) It was a little difficult to put make up on in that light! some shelves in the bathroom would of been good to put your cosmetics on but it didn't bother me that much that I wouldn't stay again! And also a full length mirror in the bedroom would of been helpful. The decor was absolutely beautiful though and very traditional.  All in all Riad 72 is a 5 star place with 5 star service 5 star food and 5 star smiles all round!! Would highly recommend to anyone going to Marrakech!!  Many thanks to Stefania Asma and Icham. You were all absolute stars!!  Ems and Kim.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: we got to Marrakech at about midnight. took a taxi to hotel. the driver stopped in front of some old buildings no lights any place. he said this man would show you the way to hotel. we walked down alleys for a 1/4 mile and got to a big black door. a man opens door. it was like an oasis. we went straight to our room and went to sleep. the next morning I went to the roof top. the sun was coming up it was wonderful. went down to main floor for breakfast. meeting stefania the mgr. gave us a cell phone to use if we needed her. see was very helpful on what to do and see. the food at the hotel was great. be sure to eat dinner on the roof top. room and service was outstanding.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Jewel in the Marrakesh Medina
Review_Text: From the moment you arrive at the Riad you feel welcomed and treated like royalty. The manager Stephania is there to greet you  answer your questions give you a map and information about the medina. Throughout your whole stay the staff is always friendly attentive and there to help you with anything you need or want. All the staff is terrific but we have to specially mention Sliman Asma Aziz and Rachid. The morning breakfast is a great start to the day. The dinners are also delicious and authentically Moroccan. We highly recommend the tagine dinners. It was wonderful coming home in the evening and sitting on the rooftop patio drinking a beer and listening to the call to prayers from the nearby mosques. The Riad has an authentic Moroccan ambiance and has a quiet atmosphere amid the chaos of the medina. We highly recommend Riad 72 for anyone visiting Marrakesh. Michael and Diane
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed 4 nights at Riad 72 and had a great experience. It is ultra stylish boutique hotel but with only 7 rooms feels like your own house. The location is easy walking distance into the souks and many of the attractions within the medina.    What I loved most were the different places within the riad where you could spend time - the sunny courtyard to have breakfast the rooftop terrace to have dinner or watch the sun set the library to read a book inside or just the landing space outside your room to relax. I also had a massage which was wonderful.    The staff were pleasant and tried their best to accommodate and the manager Stefania was wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We stayed three nights in the Riad72. This was a very well appointed hotel. The staff was very friendly and courteous answering all of our questions and helping us when we needed it. We will definitely be staying here again and will recommend to both friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Everything you could want and more
Review_Text: Well it was our first trip to Africa and not my choice but our daughters for her 21st. Found through Mr & Mrs Smith. Thankfully we chose Riad 72 and we certainly weren't disappointed. From initial email enquiries to our stay Stefania & her staff couldn't have done more to make our arrival stay & experiences any better. The rather inauspicious approach to the property seems quite normal as these Riads are often tucked away down narrow streets there was never any problems even when returning late at night. Asma looked after us so well bringing breakfast delights mint tea & even decorating us with her wonderful Henna skills she always had time to chat & smile what a charming lady. Rashid was a really great head waiter again happy to chat and explain life in marrakech so interesting to hear his tales and always there with drinks and service with a lovely smile. The food was outstanding we've eaten at some great restaurants around the world but this definitely held it's own. We enjoyed a lunch and 2 dinners during our stay and were never disappointed. Our last night we celebrated our daughters 21st and having already delivered chocolate cake for breakfast an amazing meal was served on the roof terrace on a table sprinkled with rose petals wonderful memories. Stefanias recommendations were great for days out and restaurants to visit. The roof terrace was delightful day and night. Simply outstanding.

Review_Date: carol h wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: My first Trip advisor review ever !. A gorgeous Riad small and beautifully decorated.  The service from all the staff was excellent.Nothing was too much trouble. Really stunning rooms. The food was delicious  I will definitely return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: located in an incredibly central area in the old medina makes it perfect to explore the city on foot. The decor is the perfect mix of modern and traditional Moroccan the rooms are gorgeous clean and cool thanks the air con! The staff are all incredibly friendly happy and there to help you with anything you need. The food is of a high standard and very tasty. The hostess of the riad is particularly helpful and makes you feel at home straight away and always goes the extra mile to ensure your comfort. Overall an incredibly pleasant and comfortable stay perfect little sanctuary within the bustle of the old medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stunning Riad 72 - What More Could You Want
Review_Text: I stayed at Riad 72 for four days and it was the most wonderful experience. From the most welcoming and kind staff gorgeous and comfortable room to delicious and healthy organic food. It is such a peaceful and tranquil location and Stefania who runs the Riad will do whatever she can to make your stay as comfortable as possible and organise anything you need from recommendations of bars and restaurants to day trips etc. We stayed in the Omnia Suite which was just stunning - comfy spacious and beautifully decorated. We were also left a mobile phone in our room to use should we get lost out and about in the souks. Stefania also arranged for a cake to be made for my mums birthday the morning after we arrived which was a beautiful surprise. I would absolutely recommend this riad and would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My friend and I stayed at the beautiful Riad 72 for 4 nights. We were welcomed by the courteous Stefania who was the ultimate host. She was very informative about the city and was at hand for any request we had. We indulged in a Hamman and massage at the Riad which is an absolute must!! The breakfasts were varied and a great selection of fruit pancakes and pastries. We ate dinner at the Riad twice and on both occasions the food was amazing and the service especially Rachid second to none. Nothing was too much trouble!! Last but not least the rooms at Riad 72 are exquisitely designed in traditional and contemporary Moroccan style. They are all individually designed to the highest standard. I would definitely recommend a stay at Riad 72. It is definitely an Oasis!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Excellent "Design" Riad close to the Medina
Review_Text: Go for Riad 72 if you would like to stay in an authentic up-scale Riad that is nicely appointed with (Italian) design. Very thoughtfully decorated with lots of antique furnishings.    Service is very attentive and helpful (especially thanks to manager Stephania) and the staff is always at your disposal. They'll give you a Moroccan mobile phone with all relevant numbers in the contacts (Riad manager Service staff night porter) and they really take care of you.    Very delicious breakfast served to your table either on the courtyard or on the rooftop.    Rooms are large and outstandingly decorated. I had the "Lile Classic Room" which comes with some very nice wall carvings and an old wooden ceiling. No wishes remain open!    Location is quiet ensuring good sleep however not really downtown in the Medina (10 - 15 min walk to the Djeema el Fna).    Only drawback during my stay were road construction works directly in front of the hotel resulting in some noise during the day and Problems with tap water provisioning on the first day. However the staff was very helpful and allowed me to use another room for taking a shower when water supplies were erratic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: AA C wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Title: The service was excellent and staff very friendly
Review_Text: This beautiful Ryad is very clean and hygiene is of paramount importance. The room with private terrace was wonderful. We came back and we heard no noise despite the location of the ryad. Our compliments go out to Asma Stefanie and Aziz have welcomed us all warm. The service is really excellent. We will definitely go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Reto F wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: From the moment you sit down and get your welcome intro from the charming manager you feel at home and at ease in this beautiful little oasis. Well located just outside the full hustle of the medina Riad 72 pleasantly combines traditional character with modern design elements. The courtyard is a little gem the rooms individually appointed and very comfortable and a dinner on the lovely roof terrace a must. A pleasure to re-enter every time. We hope to come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nick W wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Title: Just spent a great week at this Riad.
Review_Text: My first visit to Morocco so I had to stay at a Riad it is a nice Riad everyone there is very helpful and go out of there way to accommodate your needs with me it was organising Excursions. Breakfast was very nice continental style with a good selection.  Location was perfect for me and very quiet. I would definitely stay again.  Also has free and strong wifi.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We all had such a lovely time at Riad 72. Stefania and the other staff at the Riad were very welcoming and made sure we were looked after very well.    The Riad is close to all that Marrakech has to offer but provides a peaceful retreat from the heat and hustle and bustle.    Would definitely consider Riad 72 for another visit.    Many thanks again to Stefania and her staff.

After all the riads we stayed in Riad 72 was without doubt the best.  The reception upon arrival is most welcoming and warm the Riad itself one of the most beautiful and the service and staff exceptional.  Dinner was superb despite our delay regarding the arrival.  Overall it could not have been better and we are returning next month 👍
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Imagine stepping into an oasis that is tranquil inviting and relaxing...this is Riad 72. Every second we spent within the walls of this stunning Riad felt like a dream. Upon arrival we were greeted with kindness and hospitality. A free upgrade was offered to us and the room as nothing short of breathtaking.  The staff cater to your every need in a kind and helpful manor. The farm to table restaurant prepares meals that are mouthwateringly delicious.  The couples Hammam spa treatment was relaxing and enveloped within a room of heated stone walls.  This Riad is stunning but the staff are what truly makes it a special place.  Thank you Riad 72 for an unforgettable stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Really well maintained Riad with lovely and helpfull staff. The big suite with high ceiling is amazing. Good beds. The rabbit tagine in the restaurant may have been the best tagine we ate in Morocco. Good breakfast. We mistakenly thought the Riad had a pool. There is a small dip pool on the roof but no larger than a large bathtub. Walk to Jamma el Fna is not more than 15 minutes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hannah M wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon journey through the middle east. They offered us a free upgrade on arrival and decorated the room ready for our arrival. The riad is peaceful and tastefully decorated. We have stayed in quite a few of riads including "El Fenn" and we personally felt the staff really made the perfect stay. All members of the team were just delightful and were some of the most friendly people we have ever meet. All members could not do enough for you and it felt genuine. We would love to return again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights. We loved the quiet roof top terrace and our great room. The food was delicious and we only wished we had more time! Next time we would have a roof-top meal also. Riad 72 was a lovely haven in the midst of fabulous Marrakech madness!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 4 wonderful nights here and it's the perfect Riad very close to the Souks but feels a world away when your inside the beautiful courtyard or sitting on the terrace the food is also excellent. The best thing is the lovely staff who couldn't be more helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a wonderful oasis hidden away in Marrakech.  I spent 3 glorious nights in the Karma Suite with my husband and 4 year old twins and the suite was enormous well designed with lovely beds and a great bathroom.  The breakfast and dinner were delicious and a real treat for food lovers as every bit of food was exquisite.  All the staff were fabulous and looked after us so well their kindness level of service and hospitality could not be faulted. Well done to all the staff for making Riad 72 an outstanding place to stay and one that should be enjoyed by each and every person young or old who are lucky enough to come through your door.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: John W wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: Absolutely fantastic. An old mansion in the middle of the Medina. A true taste of Morocco but done in style. Stefania  the manager was gracious helpful and simply wonderful during our 4 day stay. Rashid Asma and the other staff were a delight. We had dinner there 3 nights and we wish we had stayed for dinner the fourth as well  probably one of the best kitchens in Marrakech. Cocktails in the Courtyard ; breakfast on the rooftop; what a delight. The rooms were simply gorgeous clean comfortable and a good size. Highly recommended for couples .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It's all true!! Welcoming immaculate elegant peaceful luxurious relaxing high end and the most accommodating staff who genuinely made us feel like part of the family. Can't wait to go back!!! Oh and I have to mention the food - just fabulous!  PS: try the cooking lesson and take a little bit of Marrakech home with you; it's definitely worth it!!

I travelled to Riad 72 with my niece Tessa and we had the most wonderful time. It was her first time in Marrakech and my fifth visit and I can honestly say it was the best place I've ever stayed there.    As soon as we arrived it was Heaven on earth. Every detail was perfectly thought out and the riad was beautifully decorated in the most exquisite style. It was five star service from the moment we stepped through the door and were greeted by the manageress Stefania who attended to our every need and made it a wonderfully relaxing four days.    We arrived early evening and were treated to a delicious mint tea and handmade biscuits to welcome us. The riad itself was absolutely beautiful - every detail was considered. We felt like we were Princesses!    When we ordered our evening meal through Stefania we had the most amazing selection of fresh organic Moroccan salads followed by rabbit tagine which was delicious. We were served by the charming and friendly Rashid who looked after us with great care and made us feel utterly relaxed.    We stayed in the "karma" suite which had the most beautiful interiors a huge bed with fine bedding and soft pillows that sent you into a blissful sleep. A breakfast of homemade breads and jams was worth getting up for the next day!    Stefania was on hand to organise everything we wanted including excellent restaurant recommendations and visits to beautiful country clubs where we relaxed by the pool and enjoyed the lovely weather.    We didn't want for anything during our trip. The riad was the perfect place to relax after the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. I have travelled the world and this is definitely one of the most beautiful places I have ever stayed. I am already dreaming of returning and would highly recommend staying here to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Joanne B wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: I recently stayed here with my husband and a friend. It is a beautiful place to stay. We were given a warm welcome by the manager Stephania a lovely Italian lady. We had dinner at the Riad the food was very good. The staff  Asma and the waiter  whose name escapes me were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them to do for us. The room was amazing . Very spacious and clean. We would have loved to stay there longer two nights were not long enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Absolutely beautiful experience - from the second you step inside you feel as through you've escaped the chaos of Marrakech and entered an oasis of calm. The manager greets you by your first name - there is no formal check in process rather you sit for some tea and pastries in the atrium style courtyard of palm trees as you're taken through a brief history of the area and points of interest. You're given a mobile phone in case you need anything while you're out exploring and then you're shown to one of your rooms (being a Riad there are only a handful of them so you feel like you're a guest in someone's home) We stayed in the MANAR deluxe room - stunning! The decor is so true to Morocco with all the furniture beautifully appointed and a private terrace on a dual story. The service is friendly but discreet with our room being made up to perfection and then turned down in the evenings. Breakfast can be served in the courtyard on the rooftop or on your terrace it's delicious and unique to the area (they have a farm to table food philosophy) as are the meals and cocktails... With only a small kitchen the staff were unbelievably accommodating (we flew in late after their kitchen had closed but they still managed to put something delicious together for us and acted as though it was no trouble)  It was elegant but understated and exactly what we were looking for on our weekend getaway cannot recommend it enough nor can we fault it and will most definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful property topped by exceptional service
Review_Text: Riad 72 is such an excellent experience I almost want to keep it a secret! Not only are the rooms beautifully appointed with all the comforts and attention to detail you'd expect from a luxury hotel but also every single one of the staff are delightful and so helpful. You're greeted with a big smile every morning they go out of their way to ensure you're happy and comfortable and help set up siteseeing and restaurant bookings as well as organising hotel pickups and taxis. Can't recommend this place highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Jax E-H wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Gorgeous Riad with a wonderful team of staff who made our stay utterly lovely:)
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at this beautiful hotel travelling with our 4 year old sun. We stayed in the Karma Suite - a huge gorgeous room with the most incredible roof light. Stefania and her fantastic team (especially Asma who took care of us) are so attentive and knowledgeable - made for a perfect stay. It's very central a short walk to the Souks and Jemaa El Fna Sq. We had a lovely dinner the night we arrived and the breakfasts are amazing; we will definitely be staying here again when we return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The Riad 72 Hotel is a haven of peace and calm in the bustling Medina of Marrakesh. Beautifully decorated and furnished throughout it exudes a coolness that is both refreshing and rejuvenating. The staff could not be more welcoming and display genuine pleasure in providing an excellent service for their guests. Breakfast lunch and dinner were all first class freshly prepared and served with the utmost care. A truly wonderful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent only 2 nights in this beautiful riad but it was a great welcome to Morocco. All of the staff including Stefania went out of their way to make us feel at home. Our room was beautiful and so quiet. Meals were fabulous - don't bother eating anywhere else in Marrakech. We will definitely stay here again on any return trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a week at the end of March and it was arguably the most opulent experience that we have had. Our host Stefania was very attentive and made us feel at home from the beginning. Before even going to our room she'd run through the map of Marrakech and shown us the sights while explaining the riad's facilities all with a lovely cup of mint tea from Rashid. While in our room it was very romantic and the ambiance from the riad in general was exceptional. Throughout our trip we were treated impeccably and wanted for nothing. We were also very pleased with the surprise roses in our room on the second night. All the staff were outstanding and seemed to anticipate our every need even holding the kitchen open for us on our first night after getting in on a late flight (with some of the best food we sampled on our trip). We will most certainly be back in the future and look forward to seeing everyone again! We cannot recommend this riad enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Ten (10) days in early May. Four (4) adult sisters traveling for a Birthday celebration. Riad 72 Karma Suite was just great for us. The Karma suite besides being beautiful is spacious enough to accommodate 4 twin beds with a sitting area. Was perfect for us. The Riad is just lovely. Beautifully decorated simple and stylish. We particularly enjoyed the rooftop terrace. Breakfasts were great and don't miss the opportunity to eat dinner as well.  The location is good. Well located for exploring Medina & surrounds. Arranged for a guided tour to north part of Medina one half day and another half day tour to the south the next day. After that were well oriented enough to explore souks and square on our own.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Nathalie M wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Perfect place for a weekend away....
Review_Text: Just come back after a girlie weekend in Marrakech where we stayed at the Riad 72. This is my 2nd stay in 3 years and I can't recommend it enough. Stefania and her team are lovely and couldn't do enough for us and are all very friendly. The attention to detail really pays off I loved the mobile phone which you can take with you when you go out and about. I have stayed both in the Lille Classic and this time in the Kamer suite which was lovely.  It's the perfect location if you want to soak up some sunshine during the day on the rooftop and enjoy the sounds of a busy Marrakech and be on the doorstep of the Souks and other places of interest when you want to venture out.  Can't wait for a return visit soon!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Caroline B wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: My daughter and I travelled to Marrakech for a long weekend in April. Marrakech was everything I hoped it would be ... and more.  Riad 72 is in a perfect location ... walking distance to all the action in the Medina. The Souks Jemaa El Fna many historical buildings and maybe the highlight for us ... the beautiful Majorelle Gardens.  Riad 72 is an oasis of calm. As soon as you enter there is a feeling of peace ... cool birdsong.  The staff are equally calm courteous polite friendly and very helpful without being over formal ... probably the best service I have ever experienced. They made us feel at home.  Riad 72 is stylish individual traditional very tasteful and comfortable.  On our first night we had dinner on the rooftop terrace overlooking the city. A beautiful setting with delicious freshly prepared food. Wonderful tagine.  The breakfast served in the courtyard was perfect healthy and so elegantly served.  A totally calming experience ... hopefully I will be back again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lynette E wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Wonderful staff, delicious food, lovely rooms!
Review_Text: I really enjoyed my stay at Riad 72 the staff could not do enough for us they were very attentive but not overpowering We were provided with a map of the surrounding areas and given lots of tips on places to see and restaurants to try.    The food at the Riad was so delicious definitely worth tasting and they gave big portions. We did discover it was more expensive than other places but worth a try! Breakfast was also delicious and a lot of attention to detail made it extra special.    The roof terrace provides a lovely area to sun bathe and relax and view the sunset with some drinks. I would definitely recommend this Riad and i would love to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: dawn l wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: My friend and I have just come back from a 3 day 2 night stay in Marrakech at the Riad 72. This boutique getaway is an oasis of calm and tranquility in the centre of the city. The staff within are charming and attentive and enhance the beauty of the building.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My husband and I have just got back from a 4 night stay at Riad 72. We could not be happier with our choice of hotel. The place was absolutely perfect and I wish we had gone there for our honeymoon as it was such a romantic place. Our room had a private balcony which was lovely to sit on relaxing with a drink in the sun but we had a look at a couple of other rooms and they were amazing too. I don't think you could go wrong with any room here. The breakfast is brilliant with fresh fruit salad and yoghurt alongside pastries. The staff are extremely attentive and we would say on par with a recent stay at 5* hotel.  We both booked a hamam at the hotel which was lovely and relaxing which we followed with a nice romantic meal in the hotel restaurant. I would definitely recommend doing this at least once during your stay.  I can't recommend Riad 72 highly enough and will most certainly be staying here again on our next trip to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stylish, beautiful, friendly, clean and very welcoming !!!!
Review_Text: We had the pleasure of staying one night in this beautiful and stylish riad hotel.  The rooms have very stylish interior and extremely comfortable beds!!!! Clean :-)  We tried the in-house hammam massage and the restaurant and all are highly recommended.  Staff and managers were smiling kind and always helpfull.  Position is very good and easy to find.  The whole ambiance of this riad hotels is very friendly and we would absolutely go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: jenny T wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: My husband and I have just returned from a weekend break to Marrakech and Riad 72 made our stay perfect. From the minute we arrived until we reluctantly left their hospitality was second to none. Our room was beautiful the food delicious and sitting upstairs under the bamboo canopy bliss. The whole team were so helpful and friendly it was clear they took pride in the Riad and enjoyed working there. Stefania is lovely and goes the extra mile to ensure your stay is special. A special thank you to Asma who had a permanent smile on her face and always willing to help. It was my birthday whilst there and when we went down for breakfast happy birthday music was played and Asma had cut out 'happy birthday' in rose petals to put on the table. The chef then baked me a chocolate fondant and brought it out with a candle. I was completely taken aback and they made me feel very special all day. My husband had arranged for candles and rose petals in our room that night and again Asma made the room look absolutely beautiful - so much so that I was reluctant to get into bed and spoil it all!    If you are thinking of visiting Marrakech Riad 72 is a must. Very central but also very quiet they create the perfect atmosphere after a busy few hours around the souks etc. I cannot wait to visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Charlotte M wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: An amazing location to stay, right in the hustle and bustle of the Medina, a real hidden charm!
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad 72 for three nights in April and it was truly a fantastic stay. On arrival to the Riad we were met by lovely staff who washed our hands and served mint tea and biscuits whilst briefing us on the local area and giving tips and advice for navigating around the Medina. We were then shown around the Riad and shown to our rooms where we had a bottle of red wine and a fruit basket waiting for us (courtesy of booking through Mr & Mrs Smith). The Riad is like a calm oasis hidden behind a huge door you would not realise you are staying somewhere right by the hustle and bustle of the Medina it was extremely quiet and peaceful. We stayed in two different rooms during our stay – the Maha Classic room (two nights) and the Zahwa Deluxe Room (one night). Both rooms were a great size for two people had nice comfortable beds and good size bathrooms (although the Maha Classic room could probably do with better lights in the bedroom as it was quite dark even with all the lights on). The Riad had a lovely courtyard area dining room and roof terrace where you could have breakfast/ lunch/ dinner and the food at the Riad was lovely. The staff at the Riad could be described as a close-knit family who couldn’t do more for you to ensure that you enjoy your stay they thought of everything down to the last detail and were extremely friendly providing service with a smile at all times. We also had treatments during our stay – a hammam and a body massage. The hammam was a truly amazing experience which we would tell anyone to have whilst in Marrakech and the one we had in the Riad was fantastic. It leaves your skin extremely soft like a new skin! Overall we couldn’t recommend this Riad enough and we will certainly be going back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Åsa M wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We can strongly recommend this beautiful and stylish riad. We stayed in two different rooms during our week in Marrakesh and liked both a lot. We were so happy with the total experience that we choosed to come back after a trip to Richard Branson's fabulous place in the Atlas mountains Kashba Tamadot. The nice facilities played a role of course but even more the personal and friendly managers and staff who enriched the experience and made it very special and memorable. Last but not least the food is excellent - and much better than at Branson's place. Don´t miss to eat there!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband & I have just returned from a 3 night 4 day trip to Marrakech staying at the Riad 72. We just wanted to say that StefaniaAsmanRashidAziz and the rest of the staff couldn't have been more helpful & polite nothing was too much trouble for them. On arrival we were greeted with peppermint tea & biscuits. The room was very clean & tidy with clean towels twice a day also fruit & water in the room & plenty of toiletteris. We also had a meal in the hotel which was delicious.The souks were great and if we told the sellers we didn't want anything they left us alone. We didn't feel under any pressure to buy anything or feel unsafe at any time even when we went to the square in the evening.. All in all we had a fantastic time and would certainly recommend the Riad 72 and Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I made a reservation with Riad 72 in December 2014 for a 2-night stay in January 2015 through Expedia. Called the hotel to cancel the reservation as my plans had changed but was told that there was no reservation in their system. Called Expedia to cancel the reservation and confirmed the cancellation. Ended up getting charged $490 on my credit card for the 2 nights I never stayed at Riad 72. Called the hotel again and was told that the reason I was charged was a no-show even though I had cancelled the reservation. Looks like a fraud to me.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Mauro A wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: Simply amazing.  The hotel facilities are top notch and the restaurant food (and breakfast) is to die for.  ...but what really set it apart is its service which is spectacular.....from cleaners to waiters to the manager.  Everybody is there to make your stay something you will never forget!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful small Riad well placed near the souk. Good management friendly service. Nice restaurant with delicious food. Lovely roof terracce and rooms are great and authentic and great decorated. Will surely recommend for romance but also family trip.

Review_Date: Clare H wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Well looked after - nothing too much trouble!
Review_Text: Not sure what to expect as we arrived in Marrakech but right from arriving in Riad 72 we couldn't have been more delighted. We were made to feel at home from the start and nothing was too much trouble. Riad 72 was well located for exploring Marrakech. It was a real oasis and even slightly unseasonal weather didn't spoil our visit. I would definitely come to stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: After traveling through the Atals mountains and Sahara desert for a few days we arrived at Riad 72 which was recommended by our fantastic driver. We entered into a space of quiet relaxation and the friendly greeting of the riads manager. It's conveniently located in the Medina. The staff is always available to direct you to a taxi as you get around Marrakech. Our room was dramatically beautiful and spacious and it included a lavish bathroom. We ordered wine and Artisanal cheese into room in the evenings which were an excellent treat! We also enjoyed a hommum bath and massage there which was delicious. We recommend this riad to all who are looking for a five star experience in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Georgina S wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Arrived As strangers , left as friends!
Review_Text: if you are searching through trip advisor for a fabulous place to stay in Marrakech you're search has come to an end. We have stayed in amazing 5 star hotels around the world but have never encountered service like this.  Firstly the facilities-  Arrival is through a big wooden door leading to a wonderful fresh courtyard housing full size Palm trees & a modern soothing fountain. This is an oasis only 5 minutes from the hassle of the souks.  We literally booked a few days before and had the last room . It was a deluxe double with a lovely walk in shower bathroom . Best part of this room though is that it has its own private staircase leading up to a private terrace. We took tea here everyday morning & afternoon & it was bliss. There is also another larger terrace with very comfortable sun beds. Very high up so not overlooked this is quite a consideration in a Muslim country. I had a look at several other rooms & each one is completely individually decorated in a modern Moroccan style to the highest standard. On the ground floor is the restaurant & the hammam. We ate here on the first evening & spent the other 5 evenings trying to find a restaurant as good. Wish we'd eaten here every night. The food is simply fabulous the table was strewn with rose petals & the service phenomenal without being intrusive. You can take breakfast anywhere you wish but the courtyard seems perfect for it. It consists of something different everyday day starting with juice yogurt fresh butter & goats cheese fruits several different cakes or french toast etc.  The hammam can be pre booked & a girl comes in & does the scrub. Never felt so clean!  The staff- what can I say ? From the beautiful Stefania the manager who looks like she stepped of the pages of Italian Vogue to Asmas big smile & Rashids impeccable service. Medo  my friend! These people are trained by the Italian owner to second guess what the guests will want without being intrusive. I don't think you could ask for anything that they wouldn't try to accommodate.  We were very sorry to leave after 5 days & I can't wait to revisit with my daughter. We arrived tired & weary & left happy & warm.  Ladies be respectful  skirts to the knee & covered shoulders .  Marrakech is a completely safe country to be in never once felt scared or threatened . Clean with wonderful street food & lovely people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we stayed in the karma suite for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. the riad is so beautiful and intimate and such an oasis in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of the medina. the staff were so attentive and went beyond the normal expectations of hospitality. the food was excellent and nothing was too much. i fell in love with the musk room diffuser scent and tried unsuccessfully to locate some to take home but Simon sorted this out for me. It was the perfect place to stay - ideally located so that you could walk everywhere. For those who like small and intimate this is a great place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you are a curious first time visitor or seasoned veteran of the Souks Riad 72 is the perfect accompaniment to any trip to Marrakech. Ideally positioned as an entrance to the bustle of the Souks the must see Jmaa el finna and the nightlife of Guerliz the riad is a perfect example of refined elegance. The entrance leads you to a beautifully tranquil courtyard complete with high rising palm trees sheltering the hidden alcoves and the amazing grand salon which comes into its  own at night especially when candlelit. The rooms are spacious with high ceilings and finished with a mix of locally sourced objects and European vintage furniture with the Amal and Karma suites both being great examples. Another of the main draws of Riad 72 is the service everyone has a smile and always a willingness to help all this adds to the overall ambience and charm that the riad excudes. An understated delight that should be discovered and experienced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marina S wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We arrived at Riad 72 with my husband's arm bleeding. Simon applied much care and attention to his wound better than a medical centre. We had no expections for our stay but the dinner breakfast was simply outstanding with so much attention to presentation and detail. Staff so helpful friendly. Thank you Mehdi Simon and crew.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing boutique Riad in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed for 1night only in the Riad72. But the experience was amazing!    From the booking (via the hotel's website) the arranged pick-up @ the airport the personal and very warm and welcoming reception by Stefania in the breathtaking courtyard to the amenities in our well designed room we felt taken care of 100 %.    The owners of this little gem paid particular attention to every little detail when converting the old Riad into a boutique hotel.    We weree greeted personally by lovely Stefania who answered all our - even unspoken - questions about Marrakech and all whereabouts you should know as a first time visitor to Marrakech. Personally I was impressed by the mobile phones provided in every room with the hotel's number on speed dial! (Not sure if this kind of opposed the confirmation by our host that the city is totally save... I guess it's more about the dangers of getting lost in the labyrinth of the Souk whilst hunting for some treasures to take home with you.)    The rooftop is another bonus point for this place - with a 360 degrees view of Marrakech up to the Atlas mountains.    We will definitely come back. Next time we have to try the restaurant and the hammam too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Donal M wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Stayed here in Feb 2015. We stayed here for 4 nights and couldn't find the staff food and ambiance more pleasing. Enjoying a drink on the roof is a must. We will certainly return one day. One personal pice of advice Marrakech is best enjoyed with the kids :-).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael O wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Riad 72 was incredible. The staff were outstanding. Especially Aziz Asma Medhi and Stephanie. They went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed and even though our stay was short we felt really well looked after. Definatly recommend this riad close to jmaa el finna souks and new town. Despite being in a great location it's incredibly peaceful and calm in the riad. A hidden gem in the heart of Marrakech.

Review_Date: Anna b wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad 72 for 2 nights in January.  We ate in the restaurant on our first night and felt very special! we were also given a nice breakfast coffee and fresh orange The staff are accommodating and thoughtful .  We had a fantastic 2 nights at Riad 72 and would definitely recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at Riad 72 for 5 nights in January to celebrate a milestone birthday. We researched countless riads before picking Riad 72 and we could not have been happier with our choice.    The lovely Italian manager Stephania and every member of the stellar staff were truly delightful exceptionally helpful and made us feel at home right from the start. The service was impeccable. The riad is very well located - we walked absolutely everywhere - and we were glad to find it was in a quiet part of the medina. It is also very clean unlike some other riads that we saw that were a bit on the shabby side. The breakfasts were to die for and the intimate restaurant is sublime. We ordered the 6 hour tangia and lamb barbecue which were absolutely delicious. Waking up to birds chirping was so very calming as was the hammam with Aisha which was one of the highlights of the stay.    The best part of the entire experience was the room - the Karma Suite. With sky high wooden ceilings with a carved cupola that lets in little slivers of light it is incredibly spacious and beautifully designed in a Morrocco -meets -Italy sublime sort of way. The room is absolutely vast but is still incredibly intimate with countless seating areas which was very important to us as my husband often preferred to lounge in the room while I was off shopping in the souks. The room is an incredible value. We had gone to the El Fenn riad for lunch and actually saw their top of the line pool suite (which is more than twice the price of the Karma suite) and found that the Karma suite was not only more spacious and clean but it was much more beautiful as well. Stephania told us that it is one of the most photographed rooms in Marrakech and for good reason! It is the ultimate in relaxed luxury. All the other rooms in the riad are beautiful as well you can't go wrong with any of them but if you can book the Karma suite.    We plan to go back to Riad 72 (or their sister property Riad Due) someday next time with the entire extended family. We are very grateful to Stephania and the wonderful staff in making our stay such a special one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful time in Riad72 a few weeks ago good location superb accommodation friendly staff and perfect service. The manager Stefania has made our stay just perfect!  the restaurant is super good too!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our first time in Marrakech. This is the perfect base for exploring the city and it captures the very best of the city's character. We were looked after wonderfully from the moment we arrived by the delightful hotel staff. Food was wonderful breakfasts in the beautiful courtyard a pleasure and the suggestions for areas and sights to visit were spot on. Our room was huge and very comfortable with several complimentary bits and pieces. They even served birthday cake for breakfast on my husband's birthday. Come here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wonderful Riad well located very cosy and intimate.  Service very attentive to all details thanks to Stephania that helped us to plan our new years eve and the visits in the city.  Marvelous breakfast. Very few and genuine rooms.  Nice terrace upstairs.... Riad was just perfect!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Siofra B wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: We've just returned from Riad 72 and are so so pleased we booked it. It's a truly lovely place with fantastic staff so friendly and attentive. We've travelled quite a bit and this was definitely the nicest place we've ever stayed.    We stayed in the karma suite which is amazing the photos just don't do it justice. We were there for my 30th birthday and as it turns out engagement I would highly recommend for a special occasion it's absolutely beautiful and bigger than our London flat!    The location is very good circa 10 minutes walk from the attractions in the old town and also within walking distance of the new town. We didn't need to get a taxi other than to and from the airport.    We will definitely be recommending this Riad to our friends and family many thanks to Stefania and her team for a very special and memorable stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at the Riad 72 for one week. Service was great. We would especially like to thank Stefania and her whole team including Rashid Asma and Asis for making it a great stay (sadly we weren't able to memorise the names of the rest of the staff). Location is good: in the Medina but close enough to the walls to enable an escape for a run or visit to Gueliz. We stayed in the smallest room but enjoyed spending as much time as possible on the terrace. Breakfast was good although could perhaps have been a bit more varied. Lunch and dinner at the riad can be recommended. All in all we very much enjoyed ourselves!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deborah W wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Title: Words alone cannot do this amazing place justice!
Review_Text: My partner an I were very delighted when we were chosen by the Riad staff as winners of a recent competition to stay in one of the new suites for three nights with a wonderful dinner thrown in!  This was to be our 20th trip to Marrakech and it turned out to be a visit like no other!  I had my first ever experience of eating octopus (marvelous it was too) cooked by the very talented Riad chef Mustapha and served by the lovely Rachid.  We stayed in one of the new rooms Omnia Suite complete with the biggest deepest bath I have ever seen and a wondrously comfortable amply sized bed  Breakfast was an ample feast of pomegranate with thick yogurts local cheese preserves and breads all washed down with fresh orange juice and good strong coffee (a must for me in a morning)!  The Riad is so accessible by foot with minimal risk of getting lost but at nighttime it's so quiet that deep sleep is easy to achieve.  All in all  we had a great time and would love to stay there again!  Many thanks to Stefania and her amazing team  Hope to see you all again in 2015!  Happy new year
