Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John H wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Title: Riad 72 - Real Luxury in the Real Marrakech
Review_Text: My wife and several of her friends had previously dined at Riad 72 and were so impressed that we took a short pre-Christmas break with my business partner and his wife at the Riad.    In my opinion Riad 72 is certainly luxury but I would call it real luxury rather than the pretend glitzy hotels like La Maison Arabe. It's feels more solidly old money than new money. Special. Memorable. A feeling of the real glamour and style of Marrakech.    The Welcome  After being whisked from the airport to the corner of Bab Doukkala by Riad 72's own private taxi you are met by the ever-trusty and friendly Aziz (who also ensures the complete security of the Hotel at night) and then it is a trundle through the nearby streets and passageways to the Riad which is like an oasis of calm and privacy within the city. They greet you with fresh (and it is properly fresh !) mint tea and biscuits and Stephanie provides a tour of the hotel and provides whatever information you need.    The Hotel  An old Riad with the classic central private 'atrium' sporting mature palms banana plants and cactii. The rooms are all very private and blessedly the morning call to prayer cannot be readily heard through the thick walls. By contrast the roof terrace of the Riad is probably the best in the city as it is higher than any other around and you get a fascinating buzz of You can relax there all day if you want soak up the sun in privacy and eat delicious salads and cakes whilst getting a wide view of the the souks the Atlas Mountains and the rooftops.    The Rooms  All very individual with a smooth almost marble-like interiors (but with radiators putting out fine heat in winter!) - comfy large beds and on all but perhaps 'Amal' extremely quiet (though Amal does have the biggest bath I have ever bathed in - you actually float as if in a small swimming pool). Plenty of towels and toiletries a very useful wifi and 'docking' station no TV (hurrah!) and areas to sit and reflect with a glass of wine or two. The central atrium allows the local finches to chirrup in the morning as they pick at bananas - a great sound.    The Dining  Probably the BEST bit. As Stephanie the Manager explained to us the italian owners insist on Head Chef Mustapha and his assistants using fresh ingriedients and I witnessed myself the attention to detail in the kitchen. Event he vegetables are just incredible - succulent Courgettes crisp potato and carrots and the tagine is a proper 6 hour job cooked in an earthenware pot. The background music is cool and sassy. Go with Rachid the Maitre'D and his suggestions - especially on wine. We did venture out to the Maison Arabe (it's a 10 minute walk) and whilst that offers a different evening atmosphere the food is not as good as Riad 72.    Many thanks to Asma Rachid Mustapha the Chef Aziz and Stephanie the Manager.    We will be back for a week next time and cannot wait to try the rest of the menu.    A extremely friendly private and special experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Bruno L wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: We absolutely loved the whole feel of the place - the rustic minimalistic decor and ultra calm ambience. The attention to detail was amazing. It had a very friendly and a helpful staff who made you feel part of the family and the place. Excellent breakfast (delicious pancakes and pies yoghurts and cheeses juices and coffees) and a very romantic dinner with lots of fantastic dishes to taste. Thank you for leaving great memories of this elegant riad! This is one of the best we've stayed in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Charlotte M wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: We've just got home after a short stay at Riad 72. The service exceeded expectations and our every need was catered for without even asking!  We flew in early morning on Friday and although check-in wasn't until later the staff were able to get our room sorted whilst we enjoyed a delicious breakfast of pomegranate and yoghurt and range or pastries and pancakes. We certainly weren't expecting breakfast so it was a nice way to begin our mini break. We were given a tour of the Riad some sight seeing recommendations and a phone should we get lost or need anything whilst we were out and about.  Our suite was stunning absolutely massive high ornately carved wooden ceilings and tastefully decorated. We also liked that there was no tv which is a rarity these days in hotels. We ate in the restaurant on our first night and felt very special as were the only ones dining! As we flew out early on Sunday morning we were also given a small breakfast coffee and fresh orange juice which was much needed! It's these kind of touches that show how accommodating and thoughtful the staff are.  We had a fantastic 2 nights at Riad 72 and would definitely recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spend 3 nights at the Riad and it could not be better. Wonderful stay amazing place and better room. The lavish hot tub in Amal room is fantastic and the breakfast is delicious. All the staff is really kind and helpful. Special thanks to Rachid he was helping us everyday and that made our stay even more satisfying. We had a lovely time we definitely recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great stay and excellent staff and chef!
Review_Text: What an amazing place and experience. My traveling friend and I were only in Marrakech for a short 2 night stay for inspiration for our restaurant concept. We were kindly greeted by Stefania when we arrived weary from traveling and presented with tea snacks and a quick tour of the property before making our way to our magnificent room. I have been fortunate enough to travel to many destinations and this was certainly a top notch room and staff. They also scheduled us (upon our request) to cook with there in house chef and staff in order to learn some of the unique flavors and cooking techniques of the region. The amazing room atmosphere hospitality food and experience sets this place apart. Our only regret is that we could not stay longer…we will simply have to make another trip!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: The Road exceeded all of our expectations. Have stayed at la Mamounia previously so was expecting a step down from there however I would rate our room and the service well above that of our previous accomodation.

Riad 72 was a fantastic stay. From the greeting with Aziz at the start of our journey and the enthusiastic welcome we received at the Riad (which was very welcome after our trek in the Atlas Mountains) to the fantastic room and yummy breakfast. We had a lovely time and would definitely stay again when in Marrakech. It is a perfect home away from home. Cosy interiors and waking up to bird chirps every morning were truly unforgettable.  Emma Lindsay  Head of Interior Design  InterContinental Hotels
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicki G wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: My partner and I have just returned from a short break in Marrakech staying at Riad 72. We stayed in the Amal deluxe room with a huge kind size bed. The bathroom was well appointed with a large bath and 'his and hers' sinks. We booked a taxi to collect us from the airport (very worth while as would have been difficult to find otherwise) and as we were arriving late had ordered dinner to be ready for us. We have the fantastic tasting menu well worth it and the breakfasts were also superb. From my initial e-mail contacts with the owner through to having henna applied by Asma (one of the staff) everyone was faultless in their service. I cannot recommend Riad 72 highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lea R wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: A slice of heaven in the medina
Review_Text: Riad 72 is one of the best hotel experiences we have enjoyed in our many travels. A tranquil oasis with a sunlit courtyard opening to the sky. The rooms were incredible in every detail mixing the modern with the old. Beautiful carved wood ceilings and adornment yet mixed with modern details and fixtures. Besides being a beautiful place to stay they have a beautiful roof top terrace with sunset views and one can dine on the roof under the stars or in two additional areas in the lower courtyard. In addition this Riad has the best staff we have ever encountered. Rashid was there to help with every detail from serving our drinks and dinners to helping us with answers to every question. The house manager is a lovely Italian woman Stephana who helped to make this our best yet hotel experience in Morocco. If there was a rating higher than five stars they would qualify.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Gail G wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: Mysterious on the outside, charming inside
Review_Text: An experience not to be missed. The nearest car access is a short walk away. After negotiating narrow alleys and through a large door you enter a sublime courtyard oasis. Rooms are off the atrium at several levels. You are in good hands with the staff especially with luggage handling. Breakfast service is fresh and impeccable. Fine rooftop patio. A perfect place to escape the hubbub while still being in the middle of it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ailiya a wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: Probably the best Riad in Marrakech
Review_Text: Me and my boyfriend tried different Riad in Marrakech and I can tell that Riad 72 must be the best so far.  The service was great the view on the rooftop is amazing the food is very good and the SPA too.  Also the location is good .  I will definitely recommand this place .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: olivia p wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: We stayed for a week at Riad 72 and had an amazing experience.    The building is beautiful and is a real oasis within the medina. The courtyard is lovely and the roof terrace is particularly nice to enjoy a nice drink and watch the sunset. The riad is more contemporary than your average riad but it still retains some traditional features. We stayed in the Amal room which I would highly recommend; the bed was huge very comfy and the linen was lovely quality also the air-conditioning worked great bath robes provided and towels for use on the terrace and perhaps the highlight of the room was the most amazing bath I have ever seen made from traditional Moroccan tadelakt and about 8ft long! Nice touches like the fresh white roses left in our room along with fresh fruit that was replenished each day were lovely. The handmade ghassoul soap and the other complementary toiletries were more than the run-of-the-mill stuff. The housekeeping was the best I have experienced - the room was cleaned beautifully each day. The free bottles of water were much welcomed. Breakfast was good and consisted mainly of fruit yoghurt preserves and a variety of moroccan cakes pastries and bread. We enjoyed it although perhaps a small negative was that after a few days the heavy and sugar laden breakfast started to become a little hard to eat and we would've preferred something a little lighter and savoury.  I think the main point to make about this riad is the service - Stefania is a fantastic manager who is very enthusiastic to help you in whatever way possible. We were given a mobile phone with the numbers of Stefania and the riad on - although we didn't use it it was nice to know we had it as Marrakech medina can be very daunting and difficult to navigate. It was little touches like this that made our stay. The staff could not have been any better particularly Aziz and Asma who worked so hard to ensure we were happy and felt at home.    Thank you Riad 72 for a fantastic stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Quality service doesn't come better than this. Stefania the Italian manager of the property (it is also owned by an equally charming Italian lady) is a delightful caring and resourceful leader of a truly outstanding staff team. We were amazed by the consistently high levels of warm caring service we received. The staff were all in their different ways truly a delight. Riad 72 is in the heart of the Medina. This is important because the heat and activity of the Medina can be taxing oppressive even exhausting - however fascinating and stimulating in other ways Marrakech can be. In our view circumstances like these demand an oasis. We certainly found one in Riad 72. The Riad is beautiful calm and wonderfully hospitable. The food (unlike much of Marrakech be warned) is very good - freshly and imaginatively prepared and graciously served. The building itself was once a palace. The courtyard is especially lovely and the few rooms are large nicely appointed comfortable with welcome and effective air conditioning. The fine quality linen is changed every day and a great deal of effort is taken by the staff. We had fresh fruit and large vases of red roses to adorn our room. Another very nice and much appreciated touch was the offer of chilled mineral water on demand and without extra charge. In the very hot weather day and night this is all part of the oasis experience. Thank you to Stefania Rachid Asma in particular and the other kindly people on staff. Thank you too to Secret Escapes for introducing us to a truly outstanding Marrakech experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad 72 is a nice B&B inside the Medina of Marrakech. Like all other Riads the location is a little difficult to get to at least initially. Hence they send a car to pick you up at the airport. But once you enter the Riad it is an oasis of beauty and peace. The staff members led by Stefania are excellent. Fully devoted to customer satisfaction!! Stefania goes way beyond words to ensure that the guests have a comfortable stay and have an excellent vacation. Food is excellent though we only had lunch and continental breakfast. Rooms are clean and airy. All the major attractions are within walking distance and if one takes a day trip outside Marrakech Stefania arranges with very little fuss.  Great Riad and will always have pleasant memories of the stay.    Thanks Riad 72
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Krystle v wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Text: During our trip in Morocco we stayed in some nice places for low prices.  While in Marrakech however we decided to spend a bit more and stay at Riad 72 - and we didn't regret it for a second!    Riad 72 is perfect. The location is close enough to walk to anything you want to get to but far enough away that you don't feel like you're walking out into the thick of it the moment you step out the door.    Our room was gorgeous. The bathroom was our favourite part - the bathtub must have been 7 feet long - and everything down to the soaps and shampoos made our stay absolutely perfect.    The rooftop patio is the perfect spot to have a glass of wine and watch the sunset which we did a couple of times.    The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and we felt like we were being welcomed home every time we returned.    Highly recommend Riad 72! We will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tony G wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: When I decided to book a room in a riad. I looked them up on the internet and I saw all the riad's where the same. Then I came across the Riad 72 patio.  It has a very big patio with palm trees alongside banana trees and a monumental fountain in the center. I felt like a king in my own palace. The terrace is higher than the rest so there is an incredible view of the mountains & the medina. Enjoying the sunset I was drinking an aperitif & eating some local cheeses.  My spacious room was designed with the guests needs in mind it was a perfect place to relax. I needed that! I spent 4 unforgettable days thanks to Giovanna and the complete staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: stephan g wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: from the minute you walk in the staff makes you feel wonderful and your eyes keep on wondering around ....looking at every tastefully selected elements of the decor    A wonderful experience from breakfast to diner on the tallest roof top of Marrakesh .    We loved it all!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: J M wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: My partner and I (gay couple) stayed at Riad 72 for 3 nights and loved it. Our room was gorgeous the daily breakfast and tea were delicious and the staff very welcoming and helpful. We were picked up promptly from the airport and made to feel like we were enjoying our own private paradise. Would highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: João Vilaça wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Very good Riad at Marrakech with an excelente service. We feel relaxed with all attention possible. Highly recommended for a nice two days in Marrakech. Nice breakfast and very nice room. Managing is overwhelming helpfull!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived down the alley and walked in the door to heaven. Our cases vanished to our rooms (thanks Aziz!) and we sat under the banana tree in the courtyard where our hands were washed with warm water poured over from a brass jar over a basin before we were given mint tea to relax us. We then got a brief info of our location and what was nearby and what to do where to go where to eat etc.  There are only 4 rooms in this riad and so it was really peaceful. Sadly we only had 2 nights and so did not get to do the cookery course we could have done as the food here was amazingly good. Everyone was so helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We also stayed in El Fenn and while we loved it too both experiences were totally different. We would return to both for different reasons. This was a place of calm with amazing food and would be lovely to take over with a group of friends as it is so small.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: I G wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: We had booked to stay at their sister Riad. Due to some problems with the booking the Riad could not accommodate us in our booked room. They arranged us to stay at the Karma Suite easily the most beautiful rooms we ever stayed.    The service was very good through out. Selecting our own soap at the start was a fabulous touch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Yes it really is a haven in the bustle of a crazy city. Helpful and kind staff look after you well in French if not English. It's not a hotel really - much more like someone's house so don't expect telly or a lot of info about what happens when (cooks night off for example!) and the stairs up to your bed in Zharma are steep and sway slightly plus even if you ask for breakfast at 0800 it probably won't be quite on time.. But on the other hand the style and atmosphere is like no hotel ever achieved you are right in the Medina with a rooftop to dine on and look out to Koutoubia mosque... So what's not to enjoy?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kristel V wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: In the middle of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech you can find Riad 72 an amazing traditional Moroccan multi-story house with nice interior gardentop-roof terrace with lounge seats beautiful rooms and yummie food @indoor hammam. When travelling the people you meet can make the difference... Inspiring where the staff at Riad 72: Asma Aziz and Rachid thanks for your kindness making us feel 'at home' and so welcome in Marrakesh. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A sanctuary amidst a chaotic city
Review_Text: Before arriving in Marrakech I read the reviews and thought "what are people banging on about?" when they spoke of their riad being a peaceful haven in a crazy city. Surely everyone was being a touch dramatic? How wrong I was. Marrakech is one of the most frantic bustling overwhelming and (at times) difficult places we have visited. It can be tiring but it's not without its compensations. Make no mistake this is a place that can assault your senses and live your head spinning. So all the more reason to choose your lodgings carefully.    Riad 72 was virtually perfect in every way. From start to finish we were treated with respect and kindness. Met at our car our luggage was loaded into a small cart and pushed through the manic scenes of the medina. In less than five minutes we were in and sitting down in the peaceful courtyard. Replete with banana trees shrubs and a fountain we sat down and were welcomed with Moroccan tea whilst small birds landed on our table in the hope of getting a crumb or two from the delicious homemade biscuits. Matteo then explained to us everything we needed to know using a map to show us some good restaurants and sites of interest and highlighting the best routes to and from the riad.    Our room - the Karma Suite - was somewhere we could really unwind. A great skylight that added atmosphere. A place where we could sit with a book and let time pass. Not that we did that too often but it is important to have a place to rest before heading back out into the city. If you have one of the smaller rooms there are still plenty of spaces to relax such as the courtyard or the rooftop terrace (which on a clear day affords spectacular views across the city towards the Atlas Mountains).    The food in the riad is particularly noteworthy. The breakfasts (with slight variations on each of our mornings) really set us up for the day. Fresh fruit salad yoghurts breads and fantastic cheese. Different kinds of pancakes too. We ordered two dinners during our stay and didn't regret it. Slightly more pricey than some parts of town but you get what you pay for. And you don't need to order too much (we had a starter each and shared a main and then had dessert and felt satisfied). There are plenty of options in the town (and some good recommendations from the riad) but do reserve at least one meal on site.    We were given assistance to arrange a day trip to Ait Benhaddou (a world heritage site some way to the south... a long drive through the mountains and then desert but a good place to go). All completely open and transparent - there was no secret that the cost was higher than had we gone to the main square and arranged through a tout but we were assured that the guide would be competent and that the transport would be safe clean and modern. It ticked all the boxes and we were very grateful for the staff at Riad 72 for arranging everything we wanted at such short notice.    Overall a great place to stay. The city will not be to everyone's taste but we were glad we came and experienced everything on offer (the good and the not so good). What was beyond reproach was Riad 72. Every member of staff was friendly and couldn't do enough to help. Most spoke English (very helpful if French or Arabic are not in your repertoire). We would recommend the place without hesitation and would stay here again should we ever head back to Marrakech. If you are heading this way give this place a go... you're unlikely to be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeff Jerden wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Our stay in Riad 72 was excellent and I would highly recommend it to anyone wishing to stay within the Marrakech medina. Unlike some of the other riads we visited during our stay in Marrakech and throughout Morocco Riad 72 has a sleek sexy feel to it. Rooms have poured concrete showers luxury bath products and very comfortable beds. The bathroom in our room was open to the the bed area so I would recommend that anyone bothered by having both bathroom and bedroom combined select a room with a separate washroom and toilet. Service here could not have been better. All of the staff was extremely gracious helpful and among the frendliest that we encountered throughout our trip. Breakfast was superb and the onsite hammam was a welcome break from trekking around the dusty souks.    Thanks to all of the staff at Riad 72 for making our trip in Marrakech a success!    Jeff + Rodney
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lex D wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Title: A peaceful haven from the madness of the souk
Review_Text: I've stayed here a couple of times and have always found it to be a luxurious and relaxing experience. The staff are attentive and the food is delicious.    As with most things in Marrakech you need to settle in and expect the unexpected. 72 is a wonderful place to retire to...I will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: eric f wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Absolutely wonderful place to stay. The staff were amazing and very helpful. All was very attentive. He helped in anyway possible when needed. Great views at breakfast on the roof terrace and it made Marrakech an even more wonderful place to visit. Will be back again...thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We booked this hotel very late as another reservation was cancelled at a much bigger much worse hotel. This riad is lovely with only 4 rooms and absolutely friendly kind and attentive staff. I was greeted with mint tea and biscuits and explained everything I needed to know about Marrakech - I asked to be walked to the nearest taxi point and M. Rachid had no hesitation - I don't believe the other review about impersonal service: I would come back to Marrakech even just to stay in this Riad. Breakfast was out of this world delicious room (I stayed in the smallest one) was beautiful. It made my stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: THINK TWICE BEFORE YOU BOOK WITH RIAD 72.
Review_Text: I booked this hotel for my family and without warning they canceled my reservations. They notified me THREE weeks after I paid and booked with them. No sorry. No call. No refund as of yet. Just a cold email saying the MISMANAGED their reservations. They are completely unprofessional. DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!! THEY JUST CANCELED MY RESERVATION without even a concern. THINK TWICE!!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: On arrival we were greeted and shown to the wrong room and we only knew this as we had seen pictures of the right one! We had booked the karma suite which was beautiful. The attention to detail was outstanding and the housekeeping was exceptional. However having previously stayed in 4 riads we were expecting to be welcomed into a home rather than treated as if we were in a hotel. We were given the briefest of instructions and left to our own devices. No assistance was given for dinner reservations or help getting to and from restaurants. We had dinner on one night in the riad and pre ordered fish. When we sat down we were not offered a starter or a desert and just given the fish and veg. We were totally left alone!!! The cooking was very average although the breakfasts were really excellent. We never saw or heard from the owner unlike all the other riads we have stayed in
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent Moroccan Riad with Modern Twists
Review_Text: We had an excellent stay at Riad 72 I completely recommend them. The whole Riad is so carefully thought with such high quality furnishing.  The staff are extremely friendly willing to tell you the best things about Marrakech as well as ensuring that your stay is perfect.  The food is amazing here as well they need to keep their chef! We decided to have dinner in the Riad and it was absolutely delicious. Gorgeous Moroccan food with just small twists to make it very special just like the whole Riad actually.  Breakfast was also another excellent affair fresh pastries bread really good jams and then cake to finish.  Location wise was also good just 10mins from the Jemaa El Fna. Definitely take the map they offer and ignore the signs in Souks first time it took us around an hour to get there due to getting lost many times but we were on holiday and that's the fun of the souks.  We really did have a good time here and can't wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jessica B wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: Intimate Oasis in the Middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: Stepped out of the busy city and into this tranquil 4 room oasis! The blend of modern minimalist design and traditional Morrocan architecture is so gorgeous you can't stop taking photos and video. In fact my family started calling me Steven...aka Steven Speilberg because of this! I highly recommend Riad 72 for guests wanting a break form western distractions such as t.v.'s. There is always a friendly staff member who speaks multiple languauges in the office ready to organize any site seeing or restaurant reservations for you. Among the most memorable were the chirping birds that occassionally visited our room making the lush trees in the courtyard their home the roof top terrace that provides a surreal view of the city and the hearty breakfasts served with a smile. Which brings me to the BEST part of Riad 72...THE STAFF. So welcoming eager to help and filled with smiles. Thank you Medhi Esma Aziz Rashid and those who's names I did not get for making our stay at Riad 72 so enjoyable and easy! It was definately a main highlight in our trip to Marrakech that we will remember forever!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Riad 72 is a paradise! The location is great inside the medina but just a few steps out in case you wanna get out of medina's hustle. The decoration and architecture of the riad is just perfect. The service provided by the staff was incredible! We'll definitly go back and highly recommend. Thanks to Mehdi and Gael Asma Rachid and Aziz! (Sorry for the speling).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Craig M wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Title: One of the best meals i have had a fantastic experience
Review_Text: We visited here in 2011 and i have been meaning to write a review as the food was excellent. This was recommended by a friend who stayed here previously and i am glad i took him up on the recommendation.    We went as a family whilst there on a break and were seated in the dining room to ourselves. The Chef Fatuma prepares a menu daily based on what she has found whilst shopping in the markets and every course was delightful. I am a carnivore and think meat needs to be in most courses but even the vegetarian course she prepared were amazing. We enjoyed some drinks with the meal and the price overall for this i could not believe due to how reasonable it was.    I am thinking about another trip back to Marrakech just so we can stay here and eat here again it was that good. If you are in Marrakech and even if not staying here see if you can book to eat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Just back from a beautiful long weekend stay in Riad 72. The service food and accommodation were all exceptional. I cannot recommend a stay here enough.    We stayed in the suite which is a huge room and very comfortable. We also ate several meals in Riad 72 and every one was perfect. Breakfast was a treat every morning.    The location is in the middle of the medina with a short walk to a varied shops and stalls.    I cannot speak highly enough of the staff Rashid Asma Mehdi and Rashid were all friendly welcoming and helpful.    It's a short walk from Riad 72 to anywhere else in the Medina and to some of the interesting places just outside.    The roof is a perfect place to go for some sun. Take a book and get some local Rosé.    I can't wait to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Gorgeous riad in a fantastic location. The decor was a lovely mix of Moroccan and modern inspiration. The private hammam is small but intimate and great. The people working there are helpful and kind. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. Plus the mint tea and complimentary breakfast are delicious! We will certainly stay here again if ever back in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The boutique hotel lover's boutique hotel. Well strictly speaking it is a Riad which as the discerning traveller knows is a courtyard with luxiorious plants and foliage surrounded by cloistered paths and balconies and often with roof terraces. Riad 72 is all of this and more at the top of the range.  We booked a package which included room huge marble bathrom balcony hammam and massage dinner collection from the airport and champagne on arrival. It wasn't cheap but worth every penny we spent as the quality of everything was just superb. There are only four rooms well room does seem an understatment so we considered oursleves lucky to have got in for the exact time we wanted.  The welcome is just great. Walk out of arrivals at Marrakech airport and there is a driver waiting for you to take you in some comfort to as near as possible to the Arset Awzel. You're met by a handsomely kitted out porter who loads your cases onto his handcart for the 3 minute walk to paradise. Marrakech is all about narrow streets and what we'd call blind alleys but left right and left and we're outside a front door. It's seemingly one of many and the thought goes through your head about all those pictures from the website and the space. Fear not they are there for Marrakech is Moroccan for magic and quicker than saying "Ali Baba" the luxury the sights the space and the comfort wrap themselves round you like a luxorious soft blanket.  Over mint tea we are given the potted guide of the Riad and what we can look forward to. There are helpful hints of sights to see and things to do. Maps are given out and guide books and we head up to the roof balcony for our first nocturnal view of the city. The lights shimmer for us in the evening heat and the tall towers of the mosques soon become evident.  We found the meals all brilliant. Breakfast is a leisurely served feast of local fruits juices and yogurts with breads sweet and savoury cakes and pancakes and rich strong coffee. Dinner is a choice of tagines but beware they are huge with easily enough for two people in one dish. It's worth booking the dinner when you can to give the staff as much notice as possible. They are all so nice and keen to please and are so pleased when you ask for their help with language and customs. It's a bit like being in a family home for everyone.  One little warning though you are in an Islamic country and the Riad is close to a number of mosques with regular calls to the faithful to prayer. These can be in the very small hours of the morning well night then but you soon get used to them. There is the added bonus of being gently woken by the dawn chorus of birds who have the decency of hour to nudge you into the day arond breakfast time.  The Riad highlight? The hammam and massage. It is an experince worth the trip and was like nothing else we've ever had in the UK. The whole experience was enervating cleansing and exciting. It is a must.  All in all this was like the trip of a lifetime with the best of the best of hospitality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a charming relaxing and very friendly destination! Our party of four stayed for a week and could not find fault even if you paid us to. Only four bedroomsso an intermate relationship with the staff and management is forth coming. Every need and request is completed with a smile. The bedroom sheets and towels replaced every day. The calm sanctuary is an oasis tucked away in such a hectic environment a great escape. Thank you All for a wonderful time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Riad 72 exudes class and calmness. A less is more design ethic that is refreshing compared to the ornate repetitive nature of the cities many other Riads (not that we didn't enjoy visiting them too - it was just always a pleasure to come home to Riad 72). The traditional furniture and elements are still all there just more carefully curated... Each of the four rooms is unique- the smallest is still elegantly furnished comfortably sized and with unique and special features. Anybody would lucky to stay in any of them!    The roof terrace is beautiful and the cool water plunge pool (like a large bath) is an awesome feature when temperatures were around 35- 40 degrees. The roof terrace is the highest of any of the properties for some distance giving fantastic views and a sense of privacy and quiet in an otherwise vibrant city. Great for reading relaxing and breakfast.    Service is great - all front of house staff and the chef were amazing to us - making every experience special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Cheryl S wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: This is a heavenly place run by beautiful people who are gracious generous and kind. The attention the food the rooms and the overall service are outstanding. We feel so lucky to have stayed at Riad 72 and will return here without question.

I took my parents and aunt to Marrakech (They are around 70 years old and I thought It's gonna be tough trip for them!). However this riad relived their anxiety for this trip. We loved the decollation of our room and the reading space. Even towels were nice moroccan style!    The stuffs are so kind and they had great hospitality as 5 stars hotel!    We had lunch in here but my parents and aunt are not used to eat short pasta. The stuff went to buy a spaghetti and they cooked our lunch as tender.  When my father fell and cut his arm deeply they gave him first aid very quick.  I very much appreciate your kindness that made our trip perfect!    この様なホスピタリティあふれるリヤドはモロッコでは珍しいかと思います。  食べやすいスパゲッティを買ってきてくださり、少し深い傷の手当もして頂き、両親も不安ではなかった様です。  お酒もありますし、夜は静かで、とてもリラックスできました。外に出ると旧市街の土色の町並み、そして日常があり、とても楽しい場所でした。
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Excellent location  Excellent service  Excellent rooms  Excellent food    Riad 72 is a beautifull refuge in the amazing chaos that is Marrakech.    The staff were all great especially my man Rasheed.    I suggest a chicken tagine dinner with the local beer Flag on the tallest roof in the medina!!    I recommend Riad 72 100%

Review_Date: Valerie Newton N wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: Our very generous friends booked Riad 72 in May 2013 so 4 couples had the Riad to ourselves and what an amazing property it is. Collected from the airport the porter waiting to take our bags through the narrow alleyways; bags put in our fabulous rooms and mint tea and delicious biscuits served in a beautiful courtyard surrounded by palm trees; after months of miserable weather in the UK to be in the warm with clear blue skies - heavenly!  Superb attentive service at all times. Delicious breakfasts with jugs of freshly squeezed orange juice. Clean and very comfortable rooms. We enjoyed the roof terrace where we had supper on the first night and as the evening was so clear we could see the Atlas Mountains in the distance. I would definitely recommend Riad 72 for adults who want to get away for a long weekend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Marcello B wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: Service fantastic welcoming environment a wonderful experience. we enjoyed our stay here as the staff was great and the property top class. The staff was always available and courteous.  As a result we had a great visit to marrakesh. We will be sure to return to Ria 72 the next time we visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: gemma b wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: We had a fantastic stay at Riad 72. The service was above and beyond and they made us feel very welcome especially providing us with tea and biscuits on entry. The riad was very clean with an amazing roof top and wonderful staff. Look forward to a return visit soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Apparently all good things come to those who wait and in this instance must also apply to those who walk around in circles trying to find Riad 72.After some false starts from 'helpful" locals we were in no doubt as to why the maze of alleys would in years bygone have confused would be invaders into moving on to an easier place to ransack.Close to exasperation and exhaustion we finally got some directions that worked.Once we had found it we never had any problems finding our way back.  What a beautiful sanctuary and what fantastic staff.So helpfulcaring and utterly charming.They all worked so well as a team to make our stay so memorable.  This was our last place to stay in Marrakesh having stayed 4 nights at La Mamounia and 3 nights at El Fenn.Both the places were exceptional but Riad 72 just had a simple yet elegant charm and serenity to it.  The internal central courtyard is tastefully decorated with a Moroccan influence and Italian eye for style.We sat and enjoyed a very refreshing and by this time necessary bottle of chilled water and cool hand towels whilst we checked in.We had left our luggage at El Fenn and the staff at Riad 72 arranged for it to be collected and delivered to our room.  Our room was a loft style room and you need to be reasonably sure of foot to climb the stairs that don't hav handrails.The bed was firm but comfortable. The bathroom well proportioned and functional but a bit light on for storing toiletries.Everything was very clean.Airconditioning was quiet and effective.  The roof top terrace whilst not as expansive as El Fenns' was still a very enjoyable spot to be.There was a very small plunge pool but we didn't take the plunge.  Breakfast and dinner can be taken on the terrace and we did both.Breakfast had the standard fare which included delicious croissants  baguettes fresh orange juice.  Dinner was absolutely magnificent on the two occasions we dined in.We had the terrace to ourselves on both occasions.A beautiful old lady prepares the meal and you can request you favourite Moroccan dishes or leave it to her to design a 3 or more course dinner.The kitchen is in a room off the courtyard and you can see your meal being prepared from mid afternoon.Like everything elsethe kitchen is spotless.It was so memorable being on the terrace as the sunset commenced and the enchanting evening prayer calls began resonating from the various towers within our view.It is worth staying just to enjoy this experience of quintessential Moroccan cookingsights and sounds.  We wanted to have a hit of golf and the staff booked us in at Royal Marrakech Golf Course and arranged for a driver to take us there and back with a bit of a sightseeing tour on the return.  We liked some of the linens and decorations at the Riad so much that we asked the staff if they could be bought locally.Fortunately they could and within a short walk we were taken to an amazing 3 storey Aladdins Cave stocked with furniturerugslightscooking utensilswall hangings and more.It was not your typical tourist trap.It was not signposted and unless you knew what was behind the non descript solid wooden front doors you would have no reason to enter.Fortunately we were shown inside without having to utter"open Sesame".Inside the emporium were mainly locals .We bought a few things but would love to have had the luggage space to buy more.Hopefully we will get the chance to do so one day.  Within the riad there is a small hammam.My wife enjoyed the hammam whilst i had a massage.The massage was pretty standard but my wife thought the hammam was an amazing experience . Whilst the surrounds may not have been as opulent as the hammam she enjoyed at La Mamounia the overall treatment was superior and more authentic.  Would certainly not hesitate recommending Riad 72 and hope to return one day.Although the labyrinth of souks are within a couple of hundred metres which is greatit was fantastic to be able to return to serenity from the hectic hustle and bustle of the souk and El Fna.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from a fantastic visit to Marrakesh.  Everything and everyone at The Riad 72 was perfect for us.  There is a calm spiritual atmosphere....such detail so stylish!  We saw three of the four rooms.  They are quirky and tastefully decorated. Comfort and style....everything was thought of.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After being dropped off from the airport we were lead along a few dusty alleyways and stopped at a the rather plain door of No 72. This looks nothing special from the outside but opens into a veritable oasis in the heart of Marrakech. The Riad has four double rooms dining room central courtyard (complete with dining areas palm trees and water feature) and a sun terrace including a plunge pool and covered dining area. The whole Riad is stylishly furnished and decorated with a combination of classical and contemporary furnishings and fittings. The staff could not be more helpful and the food (breakfast and evening meals) was fantastic. Despite the many temptations of Marrakech I could happily spend 2 weeks in this Riad without venturing outside - a wonderfully relaxing place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad 72 for a few days in April. What a wonderful experience for our first visit to Marrakech and Morocco. Christian the manager and all the staff were excellent the service they provided was faultless and caring. The Riad provides an atmosphere of great calm after the buzz and energy of the Medina it is much larger than we imagined. Our room was very quirky and on two levels it had everything we wanted. The courtyardroof terrace and other areas were excellent. We had dinner in the courtyard of the Riad on the first night and we highly recommend it superb food and service. Breakfast in the courtyard was an enjoyable experience every morning. Good location in the Medina and easy to find after a day out. Riad 72 is excellent and highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: charlotte m wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: a sea of tranquillity in an explosion of excitement
Review_Text: It is impossible to convey the level of service you get in this fantastic Riad. Nothing is too much trouble There are only 4 rooms in this beautiful palace like building so you feel like you have the place to your self a lot of the time.It feels like you are at home in your very own mansion being waited on hand and foot.    The food is second to none and the wine is also good. Contrary to a previous review you do not have to have a full 3 course meal and can choose how many courses you want. In my opinion the service surpasses that of a five star hotel. Only the smallest room was left when we booked but even that was lovely.    It is far better to stay in the Medina because you acclimatize yourself to the the bustle and excitement that is Marrakesh and can enjoy it rather than being overwhelmed. So Riad 72 is perfect. It is in a less touristy area with its own little souk and you can get an idea of real life in the city. Yet is is bang smack next to all the action. Don't listen to people who tell you to stay in the modern part of the city. You will really miss out on the experience if you don't stay in the Medina.    The hotel organised an official guide for us on the first day and I would really recommend this. It was brilliant we saw all the sights without being hassled and after that we had got our bearings and could navigate around like seasoned travelers.    Alcohol is not on general sale in Marrakesh so if you like a drink it is essential to stay somewhere like this that serves alcohol.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in Riad 72 for a few nights and it was wonderful. Excellent food and friendly service and a perfect location close to everything but quiet and peaceful once you step inside. Dinner on the rooftop terrace on our first night was a perfect way to start our trip. Great value for money and absolutely beautiful rooms with lots of common space to relax in when the streets outside get a bit too hectic.    While it doesn't have a pool a lovely water feature in the courtyard and a little pond on the terrace to dip your feet would help keep you cool.    Not a great deal of privacy for the bathroom but comparable to many other places of the style.    Would definitely recommend to my friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Laura B wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: A remarkable riad. We had a wonderful stay here. Food was amazing in particular the incredibly generous breakfasts we had on the roof terrace......a wonderful start to our day. The service we were given was faultless. Amazing location. Would always recommend this to friends and family heading to explore Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A vertiable oasis in the middle of the medina in Marrakesh
Review_Text: From the moment we stepped into Riad 72 we knew that we were in for something special. There is a real sense of tranquility that owes as much to the refined tastefulness of the refurbishment of the riad as it does to the outstanding personlised service of all the staff. This is a boutique hotel at its best. No request however small was too much trouble. The strawberries that we brought back from the market which we asked to be washed appeared beautifully prepared moments later with a home made orange syrup and artisan yoghurt on the side. Dinners were outstanding and breakfast served on the rooftop terrace overlooking the medina and with spectacular views to the snow capped Atlas mountains was the perfect way to start the day. Time spent in the kitchen one afternoon with Habiba learning how to create some of the Moroccan dishes she serves was a highlight. Cristian who manages Riad 72 was extremely helpful and informative providing not only valuable advice on where to go and what to see but also offering insights into the cultural and historical aspects of Morocco. The room we stayed in although one of the smaller rooms was extremely tastefully appointed with everything we needed...again the attention to detail was exquisite. No hesitation in recommending Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel has a good location in the old town just north west of the main souk. The staff are very helpful and several of them speak good english. It's certainly worth organising airport transfers with the hotel as it is not on a main street and would be difficult to find particularly if like us you are on your first visit to Marrakech.    Inside the hotel is an oasis of cool tranquility much needed after a morning in the souk! The decor is quirky but classy and the rooms are comfortable. Of note both the rooms we stayed in had only a curtain to separate the sleeping area from the bathroom. Probably not a place for new couples on a first holiday!    Breakfast is continental however many of the pastries are deep fried which becomes hard work after a few days. I would advise avoiding the evening meals in the hotel. Although the food is of a reasonable standard it was not made clear at the time of booking or on the menu that eating in involves a set menu of three courses this works out to be very expensive indeed. It is certainly possible to get better Moroccan food elsewhere for a better price.    Overall this is a comfortable reasonably priced hotel in a good location ideal if you want to stay somewhere a bit different and not break the bank. I would however advise avoiding evening meals in the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our first trip to Marrakech and the staff service and surroundings of Riad 72 truly made it such a special trip. We can't emphasise enough just how beautiful and tranquil Riad 72 is an oasis of calm against the hustle an bustle of such a vibrant city.  The rooms are fabulous each with there own unique features from a bath that you could fit a group in to an elegant mezzanine suite. We slept like babies in our huge bed surrounded by fluffy pillows lulled to sleep by the rustle of banana palms and song's of birds outside in the courtyard.  We chose to eat our first breakfast on the roof and what a delight it was an array of pastries fruit breads and homemade preserves served with our choice of fresh orange juice and mint tea; all whilst we gazed over the views of the city with the Atlas mountains off in the distance.  We ate at the Riad for two of our three nights in the city as the food was so delicious Fatima and the entire team really do go above and beyond and made each meal a delight.  We really can't thank Christian and his team at Riad 72 enough. We can't wait to return to Marrakech and especially to the warmth and tranquility of Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: As wonderful as when we first visted 8 years ago!  Whether arriving for the first time or returning from a day of Marrakech madness from the moment you step through the huge wooden door you are transported to an oasis of calm and beauty. The Riad is beautiful in every detail. It doesn't try to recreate the feel of the kasbah in the way some of the riads do it reflects the taste and style of its Italian owner with an influence of Morrocco fine art and luxuary.  Eat at the Riad. Tables are prepared in the courtyard of the riad but you can also choose to eat on the roof terrace or in the lounge. Fatima prepares wonderful traditional food in the little kitchen adjacent to the courtyard. You don't choose your menu you are treated to a succession of tasty dishes. I have eaten in a number of good restaurants in Marrakech but the food and atmosphere in the riad is the best.  The food is matched by the quality of service which is sublime.  Marrakech is an expereince not to be missed but the conversation on the way home was all about the riad the food and the lovely people at riad 72.  Thank You Cristian and your great team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Riad 72 - an ideal oasis for an extended weekend
Review_Text: Riad 72 is the perfect place to combine tranquility excellent food and superb service. Located behind a wooden door at the end of a labyrintic ally this Moroccan-Italian Riad is an ideal oasis for an extended weekend in this intriguing city.    When you have enjoyed your late night cocktail at the Mamounia followed by a dinner at Le Foundouk be sure to save a night to dine at the Riad 72. A truly magnificent experience where a never ending marathon dinner is created on simple basics.    Riad 72 was a truely genuine experience not least to the ever assisting staff Rashid Aziz Aicha Habiba Mehdi Naima and the hotel manager Christian.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Never been to Marrakech but it was fantastic and the service and food at Riad 72 will be reason enough to go back. It's a beautiful place tucked away in the Medina maybe 10 minutes walk from the crazy chaos (in a good way) of the main square...and it's a welcome oasis of calm to return to after tramping around the souks. Our room (the Karma suite) was huge with a beautiful high wooden ceiling.    The fantastic Christian and his capable team (Aziz Rashid and others) have perfected the art of of low key but attentive and friendly service. English is spoken but if you're a French (or Arabic) speaker then obviously even better. Absolutely nothing was too much trouble for them the ever smiling Aziz even walked us to one of the main restaurants when we were fretting about finding it. I was pleased he came we would have got lost! If I had a minor criticism it would be that to order a beer on the roof terrace you had to go all the way to the bottom to find a member of staff. But that sounds incredibly lazy now that I've read that back.    And finally the food- it's really really good. In fact I'd say we didn't eat as well as we did in the Riad so make sure you book. The lemon olive and chicken was really great. And to top it all the breakfasts: we didn't eat the same thing twice and it was all made in house. Drinking fresh OJ on the roof terrace overlooking this ancient city will be a memory that long stays with me. Will definitely come back and stay in the peaceful beautiful place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve G wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Title: A slice of tranquil heaven in the middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: Within a five to ten minute walk of the Central souqs. Riad 72 is tucked away in the narrow alleyways of a quiet part of town. Thankfully a taxi was arranged to pick us up as there was no way we would have ever found it without local knowledge. I am in truth loathe to recommend this riad as I fear it will become "too" popular and may spoil but here goes .... the riad itself is a fantastic old building with just four suites. We were lucky enough to spend three blissful nights in a tastefully decorated suite boasting a massive kingsize bed and an amazing bathroom with a tub that easily accommodated my 6 foot frame (stretched out)!. The fact that this place gets the basics right is only the start. The little touches like fresh red roses in the room high end boutique pillows rose petals on the dinner table etc. make a real difference. For me there are three main reasons why Riad 72 should be the only option in Marrakech Due to its size and intimacy it really feels like you have the place to yourself most of the time which is fantastic for such a top class establishment complete with massive roof terrace which is ideal for taking breakfast. This brings me on to point two which is the food - the home cooked freshly prepared food here is amazing (I am a big foodie but could not bring myself to eat anywhere else for 2 of the 3 nights) Fatima serves up phenomenal treats and her meatball and egg tagine is world class not too mention freshly prepared pastries freshly squuezed orange juice and premium coffee every morning for breakfast - Superb! Lastly the service all the staff are very attentive helpful and polite but special mention to Christian and Rashid who were always on hand to offer advice and to ensure that we had a great stay.  A superb place to stay and please do not change a single thing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alessandro Sarno wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: I had the luck of being recommended Riad 72 by a friend who stayed there recently.  My holiday ( one week) has been simply perfect. The Riad is a safe quite and luxurious haven. You cannot ask for a better place after having walked around the Souk and the Medina.  It's like entering a magic world. Service very good the room beautiful attention to every details always fresh flowers new artisanal soaps great breakfast and mint tea anytime you like it.  Sunsets in the roof top are amazing especially if in the company of your beloved girl and a cocktail...They also organize tours and give you customized suggestions on restaurants and things to do and see. Well done Viva Riad 72 and thank you guys!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christopher R wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: I stayed here with my partner and a couple of friends for a mid-week break in February and loved every second of it. We stayed in the Amal room which was beautiful and had the biggest bed and most amazing stone bath. Little touches like bottles of water and fresh fruit and flowers added extra comfort. The roof terrace is fantastic and on our first day we had a delicious traditional three course lunch served shortly after we arrived (book ahead) in a beautiful covered dining area overlooking the atlas mountains with intermittent calls to prayer breaking the distant sounds of the city. There is plenty of room for sunbathing a lovely little plunge pool to cool off. Breakfast was amazing and consisted of fresh juice and more freshly baked pastries and breads then you could ever eat. All food was cooked by Fatima the in house cook who is incredibly talented. All of the staff and the manager were so friendly and helpful with nothing being too much trouble. The Riad is perfectly situated for exploring all of Marrakech's attractions but hidden enough to provide welcome relief from the constant outside bustle. I would definitely recommend this Riad to anyone visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Molly D wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Title: Hidden Luxury in the Heart of the Medina
Review_Text: I cannot say enough about Riad 72. Riad 72 was a luxurious safe haven from the chaos just beyond its walls in the Medina. First of all the riad itself is one of the oldest and most well-known in the city. Its decor gardens and terrace are so perfectly decorated that one feels immediately calmed while simultaneously experiencing the charms of Moroccan decor: color pillows iron work palm trees justting up thru the ceiling. With only 4 rooms the hotel truly starts to feel like one's home. A fact that the charming and incredibly warm staff will remind you of constantly " you are home whatever you like."    The unexpectedly fun aspect of this riad truly was the staff. They take the word "doting" to a new level and went above and beyond to ensure we felt at home. As two American women we felt a bit nervous when going out from time to time and Rashid and Norman were always more than willing to escort us call taxis arrange guides etc. We were always welcomed back from our day with warm mint tea and cookies and a smile.    Even having spent a day at La Mammounia the premier luxury resort in Marrakech I still suggest everyone stay at Riad 72.    As a side note speaking French (even a few phrases) will go a long way at the hotel and in the city in general.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Martin R wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: Our holidays at Riad 72 was a real pleasure.The service was great - thanks to Habiba Aziz Thouria Rachid and Cristian. Fine cooking a terrace with a fantastic view to the Atlas mountains and a hammam. The Riad 72 is perfectly situated in the Medina. We really appreciated our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Due to adverse weather conditions we ended up staying four nights here rather than the original two. The riad is beautifully decorated our room was lovely with a huge comfy bath. My partner is 6"4 and he really liked having a bath he could lye down in. All the staff where really friendly and helpful going out of their way to help us on many occasions. We ate in the riad a few times and the food was always great much better than any restaurant or market we went to. The location is very central and close to all the main sights.  We would very much recommend staying here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gary S wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: This has to be one of the best secret treasures in Marrakech. Have spent several long weekends of relaxation here with good food and wine as a bonus. The building is stunning with amazing views from the roof top terrace. The plunge pool is not big but we got 6 people in to cool of which was fun especially as the wine was flowing.  One tip is to ask Fatima for her Orange soup..it is amazing and if she ever gives you the recipe please tell me.  The staff will make you feel welcome and there is nothing too small that they will not assist you on even escorting you to other restaurants.  You will have the best time here especially if you and your friends want to hire the wholeplace. Had an amazing birthday here one year  Enjoy
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Our first experience in Marrakech in ryad 72
Review_Text: The ryad 72 is absolutly unic after arriving in to Marrakech airport the ryad sent a driver to pick me and my wife was our first experience in Marrakech the ryad is an oásis inside the Medina the location is excelent Very quiet and close to the main Marrakech attractions.  The decoration is amazing simple and Very confortabel the rooms confortabel and with Excelent dimensions the bathroom was beautiful Excelent shower Excelent amenities everything clean the towels Very good quality. On the terrace we fund a Very small but fresch kind of pool a could shower and the most confortabel pool furniture i ever experience Very good to take a nap or read a book.  But above all That i have mention above what was really important the service provide for the staff all of them from the lady in the kitchen until the waiters and the door man they really made our tripe fantastic helping with rezervations a 7 stars service allways helping in everything  This hotel is the best value for money That we can have
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This place is an oasis of calm amongst the harsh climate of Marrakesh.  It does not rely on opulence to reflect its luxury - its underatated simplicity in elegantly restored spaces does it all for you. Modern conveniences such as air-con etc are all there. No TV but goodness I hope that you can survive without one with this type of holiday....  A particular gem is to be had with the afternoon worker Rashid. My goodness - are there no bounds to his generousity of time knowledge and patience? His off-sider Shira as well as the lovely morning chef were incredibly accommodating polite friendly and smiling and were a joy to return or wake up to...  The view on the terrace is lovely. The food is great. The service is first rate and genuine. The location is central but also in the heart of the medina - isnt that what you came here for - to have that experience of being in the historic quarter of a millenium-old city????
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A haven in the Medina with plunge pool and caring service
Review_Text: Perfectly situated just inside the Medina on the same side as Place Jma el Fna. Very easy to walk to taxi stand. 2 minutes drive to The Place. They organise airport transfers. Rhislaine welcomed us into this hidden haven and in her gentle way made sure we were comfortable at all times. We enjoyed a lovely traditional meal cooked by Habiba on the roof terrace...3 stories up for each course thank you Rhislaine! For info prices are European at Eur60 for our 3 course meal for two. But how much better than going to a restaurant. Great terrace overlooking Marrakech rooftops with a plunge pool in which we spent Sundown hour with the champagne we took along with us. Comfy Teak loungers. Our 'luxury' room with split level was pretty but if I returned to Riad 72 (which I would happily) I would opt for the standard room or the suite on one level. Hmmm bed was very hard with just one pillow. Ask for a second one! Lovely quality fittings in the big bathroom. Gorgeous public area banana palms cooling fountain birds fluttering around. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: enjoyed:  - staff really made the stay  - rooftop bathing pool a pleasant relief  - great reservations the concierge made for us at Cafe Arabe - best seat in the house  - Fatima the chef - lovely motherly type and good cook  - greenery through the riad - large banana trees in the central court  - lovely design and style throughout rooms    bear in mind:  - decent walk in alley ways if you are concerned for safety at night (though we had no problems)    Overall recommended for great rooftop views calm environment inside and staff who would do anything to please. Thank you for a lovely stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Penni K wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: Very beautiful calm and tranquil space wonderful staff- 0 Emanuela azziz Rashid Jilal (please forgive me if my spekllings are wrong!)Thank you all!  Best Hammam in Morroco- tried many and loved this one- the wonderful lady Aisha provides the best Hammam ever- she works magic! I highly recommend all you ladies meet Aisha and try one of her Hammam sessions- she is absolutely wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Amazing place to stay and the best service you can ever receive.
Review_Text: We spent 5 nights at Riad 72 and I must say that Marrakech would not have been the positive experience it had been without the warm and amazing staff of the Riad. Everything about the hotel the design and the staff is perfect. The hotel director Emanuella is a pleasure to deal with and made everything in her power to make our stay stress free and funRachid is so respectful pleasant and kind and so is Aziz and the rest of the staff. In terms of food well where do we start? After eating in several places in Marrakech we can only confirm previous reviews where food is exquisite all due to the wonderful cook Fatouma who is not only adorable but has a quality of a 5 star international chef. An amalgamation of each individual the perfect and serene decor made our stay one of the most memorable holiday. A sincere and endless thank you to all of you at Riad 72. Stephi and Nina
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Victoria C wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: The staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We ate at the Riad on our first night which was delicious and huge portions. We stayed in Amal room which was a great size and the bath was amazing. The only slight problem was that it was 45 degrees and the air con wasn't very powerful - we managed ok with the use of a cold bath and had no trouble sleeping at night. Unfortunately it was too windy to use the roof terrace for meals but the courtyard was beautiful. The breakfasts were lovely and they catered for whatever we fancied. My boyfriend also proposed to me on our last morning there over breakfast so that confirms how lovely and romantic the place is!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A warm welcome with friendly, courteous and helpful staff
Review_Text: I recently stayed in the Riad 72. I'd read some previous reviews and they were very positive. So I was hopeful but that's the thing about a review each individual will always have a different experience. I wondered whether mine would be as good. I need not have worried. From the friendly driver who picked us up from the airport to the lovely Asiz who met us to wheel our luggage and escort us through the streets to the Riad right through the stay and at every juncture; we were met with smiles and interest wonderful service helpful and willing staff and all of our needs were accommodated.  On arrival we took a seat in the courtyard. Open roofed and with fully grown banana trees it was peaceful and beautiful. A stream of running water leading to small fountain added to the relaxing atmosphere. We were bought mint tea and freshly baked biscuits and as our room wasn't quite ready we asked if we could take to the roof terrace to sit out in the sun and this was not a problem. The plunge pool was being freshly filled with cold water and there is a cold water shower up there too along with a shaded gazebo with comfy low sofas and tables in case you fancy lunch and the view.  The room had been prepared for a couple and when we advised the staff we were friends only it was no trouble at all the rooms were re arranged immediately to accommodate two separate beds on two levels.The bathroom was beautiful and even had a door which led out onto the staircase to take you up to the terrace. There were many original details throughout the Riad with the double height doors and other wooden fret work fabulously maintained. We had a hammam there which delivered me back to room as soft and clean as a new born baby. And was given by Aicha a truly lovely lady. The food we had throughout our stay was delicious!! Breakfast was varied freshly cooked and baked and different every day. Plus it always included as much freshly squeezed orange juice as you wanted. I'm a vegetarian which is not usual in Morrocco and yet Fatima the chef happily made us individually spiced and creative dishes that were divine.  We were assisted in anything we chose to ask for help with. Including booking restaurants being picked up on one occasion after the meal and escorted back through the medina as it was quite late. We were given advice on where to go in the Medina for different things Jalil even accompanied us on one occasion translating and assisting in shopping. So much kindness and hospitality were extended to us with such warmth and sincerity that we were just blown away. A truly wonderful place to stay a real safe haven from the hustle and bustle and chaos just a few steps from the front door. I will definitely return. No question. A blissful stay in a fantastic place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Tracey K wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: I have just come back from 3 nights in Marrakech with my friend. We were picked up at the airport and driven back to the Riad. I was looking out of the window and crossing my fingers that my hotel was going to be lovely. There was so much poverty around me and everything was so different. I really wanted a peaceful surrounding for my short holiday. Well I need not have worried! We were greeted so warmly. We were offered mint tea and biscuits while our rooms were sorted out. We went up to our room and it had everything you could hope for. It was so clean and very traditional. The courtyard was peaceful and it was lovely to sit there and have a drink and watch birds fly in and out. We ate in for the first night and Fatoumah cooked for us. We are vegetarian so I know it was unusual for her but she cooked us a delicious feast! The breakfasts she made were out of this world. I always waddled away from the table very satisfied. Then Aicha took me under her wing and gave me my first ever hammam. Wow! It was such an amazing experience. I was scrubbed and cleaned and then a wonderful mud mask. I have NEVER been so clean and soft. It was incredible. The service was like nothing I have ever had before. Nothing was too much trouble. I was able to eat when I wanted where I wanted they just wanted us to have a nice holiday. Jalal (I am not sure of the spelling) who was one of the waiters there helped us very much. He helped us with all the shopping where to go what spices to buy and translated everything for us. We were taken to restaurants and picked up afterwards in case we got lost. This is such a lovely place to stay and the staff are very very nice. I really recommend this place to stay for tranquility and very helpful staff. What a wonderful place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Melissa C wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Title: Would go back again and again!
Review_Text: The staff at Riad 72 is incomparable. The best service I've ever received while traveling. The riad is stunning no detail went untouched. It's a gorgeous bed and breakfast a very special place. And to boot the food is amazing! The most delicious tagine we had in all of Morocco. Even the breakfasts are fresh and delicious. No need to doubt your decision you will definitely be pleased.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad 72 for four nights. Winding through the alleys our luggage was taken by cart up to the riad. The door opened and we entered into a cool and charming courtyard and greeted with cake and drinks. Our room was large and spacious with a huge bathroom. The food served in the hotel - we ate there on two nights - was fantastic. Anything we asked for was supplied. Thoroughly recommend this Riad. Friendly charming and great service. Lovely roof terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ben R wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: We stayed there for a week and had the most amazing time. The location is great and the building itself is stunning.    We were met at the airport and driven as close as possible we were then met by a member of staff and walked to the riad. They had prepared breakfast for us in the courtyard and from the word go we were treated so so well. The most relaxing atmosphere.    All the staff were brilliant and nothing is too much trouble. Rashid in particular made our stay extra special. Briliant guy.    We ate out a lot and one night had Fatouma's cooking at the riad. We ate on the roof as the sun was setting. I can honestly say that it was the best food we had over the course of the week and so we ate there again on our last evening. Some of the best food I've ever tasted in fact.    I can't recommend it strongly enough. If you are going to Marrakech stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad 72 for a relaxing weekend break. The Riad included one transfer to or from the airport and we were met at the airport by a driver who took us into Marrakech and dropped us with a porter from the hotel who showed us the way to the Riad. The Riad is not hard to find - once you know where it is but you'd struggle to find it yourself first time so I would recommend taking up the option from the Riad of being met from the airport.    The Riad itself is beautiful. The central courtyard has large trees growing within it with colourful small birds that tweet from within their branches and return at night to roost there and water quietly flowing within the courtyard it really is a beautiful quiet oasis.    One of the main reasons we choose this Riad was that it had a wonderful rooftop terraced seating area and the Riad is one of the tallest in Marrahech. We spent a lovely time on the rooftop terrace relaxing and reading with views over the city and of the Atlas Mountains in the distance.    The staff at Riad 72 are simply wonderful they were attentive and knowledgable but left you alone to relax and enjoy your stay. An example of the service at the Riad is that whilst we were on the terrace relaxing they brought up to us tea and biscuits without making a request for them.    We had read the reviews of the in-house cook: Fatouma and we were looking forward to her food having arranged for her to cook for us one evening. We had eaten out the night before and Fatouma's cooking was at least on par to anything we had eaten out. Her starter was stunning but the rest of the meal was good but not up to that standard I would recommend having Fatouma cook for you one evening.    The Riad is approximately 15mins walk to the main square and the Riad's location means you are close enough to anything in the Medina.    I loved staying here - it was wonderful. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was large and accomodating.
