There are only four rooms in the Riad so for you can easily feel that you are the only one staying there and the attentive staff make you feel very welcome indeed and can't do enough for you to make your stay as relaxed and perfect as possible.    Stay here - you won't regret it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I just wanted to say we have a very pleasant stay here. It was calm lovely views and very good food. The staff were briliant with my husband who has an upset stomach. They made him special tea and prepared a light soup. I would recommend this place it is also the right side of town and much better than the north of the main square. Thanks a million.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jane c wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: We have just returned from an amazing stay at Riad 72. This is really a beautiful place and the food is out of this world. We ate at la Mamounia and Gastro MK but we can honestly say Fatima's cooking is by far the best we experienced in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our stay at Riad 72 excelled in everything we had read  reviewed and hoped for.  I love food. I love people who care about food and really enjoy every taste.  Fatima the cook is one of these people. She ensures that every mouth full that we taste is truly beautiful.  The staff are dignified eloquent and discreet. They made the most heavenly meal for my husband and I on the roof terrace ( scattered rose petalsmusic etc ) We will never forget it.  It will cost you money but not that much..  We stayed in the cheapest room. We loved it and we are used to posher sounding accommodation. Does that make sense?  I mean to say that many hotels over play themselves. Not Riad 72  It is beautiful in every aspect.  Enjoy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at Riad 72 in March 2012 and can not say enough good things about it. The cook Fatima and Emanuela could not have been more gracious as well as all the staff. Food was fantastic the space is immaculate and so very peaceful after a crazy day wandering the alleys of Marrakech. Location is great 15 minute walk from everything. I would stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights in March 2012 in the Amal room. We had a really fantastic time in Marrakech and especially so when we were in the Riad! We ate at a number of well regarded restaurants inc. Bo-Zin Le Fondouk and Dar Zellij. However nothing that we sampled came close to Fatima's cooking: her artichoke and lamb tagine was undoubtedly the best dish that we ate in Morocco. She even shared the recipe with us but our reconstruction efforts have not yielded anything like the same result! All of the staff at Riad 72 were so incredibly kind and helpful especially so Emmanuela and Rashid. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Ate their and really enjoyed it...
Review_Text: Loved it loved it loved it... What a place... it was truly beautul and that girl Fatima can cook... We had a Morrocan salad followed by the most stunning lamb and artichoke tajine... We were dining in the beautiful central courtyard and dined on our own... we really enjoyed it. A little pricey for the city but we dont regret our visit for a single second... Fab!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have never written a review before but wanted to comment on what a beautiful riad this is. We had never been to Marrakech before - the location is great a 10min walk to the main square and it feels very safe. Everyone who worked in the riad was extremely polite. We were lucky enough to get upgraded to the suite which was huge and magnificent.  Breakfast was lovely fresh omelettes crepes and lots of different breads with homemade jams.  We ate in the riad on our second night again the food was good (maybe a little more chicken needed in the tagine!)  We had a lovely stay at Riad 72 and would recommend it to others.

We planned a long weekend to enjoy Marrakesh for the first time. The Riad 72 proved to be one of the highlights of our 4 days. The tranquility along with the excellent position in the town gave us the opportunity to mix the excitement of the Souk with the historical and cultural sites and allow us to retreat whenever we wanted.  Fathuma's home cooking was the equal of the most expensive restaurants we tried (Dar Zellig and Le Foundouk) and spending an evening with Rashid looking after you with the greatest attention to detail made staying in for dinner a joy.  We stayed in the Karma suite and took every advantage of having our breakfast on the terrace where we were also well looked after by a young lady whose name escapes us.  All in all a very enjoyable time made exellent by great staff.  Graham and Nathalie (London)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anna J wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Title: A fantastic Riad - we couldn't fault it
Review_Text: We have just returned from a fantastic stay ay Riad 72. It is a beautiful riad with elegant rooms and the most helpful staff especially Rashid and the brilliant cook Fatima. Our room was split onto two levels and was gorgeous with a huge bathroom. We also had easy access to the roof terrace which is a real highlight - as the riad only has 4 rooms it was never busy and watching the sun set every night in the comfortable seating area with a drink in hand will be one of our fondest memories. We ate at the riad on the first night and found Fatima's cooking and the intimate atmosphere just perfect. On the following 2 nights Rashid subtly persuaded us to cancel reservations we had made based on our review of the guidebook and we had 2 wonderful meals as a result - he knows his stuff! Nothing was too much trouble for all of the staff and we would recommend the riad without any hesitation at all. Marrakech and Riad 72 exceeded all our expectations.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad 72 plays its role on the multicultural contemporary Marrakech life.  A traditional riad with a touch of some international interior design pieces mixed with Moroccan average quality crafts it's a good setting for guests looking for some sort of exotic place to stay in the Medina area.  In my opinion the true value of Riad 72 it's his team of friendly Moroccan members leaded by Emanuella an Italian expat.  Staying for seven nights as a single guest I could enjoy the company of Rachid and Aziz in particular both of them always available to chat or to help.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Set in the heart of Marrakech this Riad is probably one of the best! From stepping off the aircraft the staff at Riad 72 were there to help and assist. Driven to the Riad and navigated through the hussle and bussle of this fantastic city the staff here arranged everything.    Greeted by Rashid with green tea and home made butter biscuits we were soon shown around this most impressive building. From the beautiful interior garden and grand living area to the most magnificent roof terrace with spectacular views of the Atlas Mountain ranges.    We were lucky enough to have the room with the mezzanine. Beautiful big bed and exquisite bed linen made for a very comfortable nights sleep. The house keeper was superb also with clean towels every day and bed linen changed on a regular basis. This room also has private access to the roof terrace from the bathroom although not warm enough for us to take some sun we still enjoyed watching the sun go down with a nice bottle of red on an evening.    We arranged dinner in advance on our first night and left this in the capable hands of Fatima who whipped up orange soup two tagines and poached pairs. Delicious! Would recommend eating in the Riad during your stay. Be sure to give your order at breakfast. We often left the decision up the Fatima as whatever she was cooking that day was fantastic. Try the Moroccan salads!!    As for breakfast we spent a good hour or so eating breakfast in the serene setting of the garden. Fatima cooking pancakes Moroccan (what I can only describe as crumpets) cakes in butter and honey and omelets all served with warm crusty breads and pastry's and of course Fatima's homemade preserves. What more can you ask for before a day in the city.    Rashid was most helpful during our stay. As this was our first visit to Marrakech it was wonderful to have him at hand in the evening. Guiding us through the map and pointing out the places to see and visit.    Fatima Rashid and all the other staff at this Riad were wonderful we can't thank them enough for making our stay so comfortable. Thanks to Emanuella for organising the transfer and the evening meal on our first night and for all her help during our week in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Torbjörn W wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: Riad 72 is just the place to stay at when visiting Marrakech. Close to everything and the best terrace in town. The staff is so friendly and helpful and the meals are just wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I travelled to Marrakech for the first time on my own over Christmas 2011. Stayed for 3 nights. As a single female (blond) traveller I was quite nervous about being there on my own (having read the 2 page advisory in Lonely Planet) and I was completely taken care of by Emanuella and her team. They arranged airport transfers for me which were great very friendly and on time and when the transfer reached the central part of the medina where the Riad is located one of the staff from the Riad came to the main road and met me and then transferred me by foot to the Riad. He was very friendly spoke English well so I felt assured from the beginning. Entering the Riad for the first time was truely lovely an oasis - greeted with traditional handwashing mint tea and biscuits was fantstic after the early start from Gatwick. The accommoation was very comfortable quiet and private. They arranged private half day tours for me each morning and I also did 3 cooking classes with the wonderful Fatima who taught me 9 dishes in total --- all delicious and it was really fun. They also have a small private hammam which is fantastic - great staff and a very relaxing and pampering experience. I can't speak highly enough of the friendliness and helpfull of Emmanuella and her team and would highly recommend for any single or couple travellers. I was looked after from the moment I got pick up at the airport till the moment I was dropped off at the airport. Will definitely go back and stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Claire A wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Text: I'm not sure I would ever go back to Marrakech if it wasn't for Riad 72. A tranquil haven from the madness of the medina we had to force ourselves to leave the riad after long lavish breakfasts on the sunny roof terrace with a view to the High Atlas Mountains. The interior design of Riad 72 strikes a perfect balance between luxury and modesty nicely complimenting the generous but not subservient service. We enjoyed meeting the (world class) cook Fatouma and felt immediately at ease with the sweet and jolly staff. Emanuela the director bent over backwards to meet our unusual vacationer requests and has an abundance of local knowledge to share. The drivers who were organized by the Riad were reliable and honest which was a real treat. Marrakech is full of surprises not always welcome. The surprises to be discovered at Riad 72 consistently delight.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed for three nights. No question that the location is excellent. But we found the "courtyard" to be very uncomfortable with limited seating for breakfast. The dining room didn't appear to be active. The breakfast was set out before guests arrived. Rooms were comfortable but nothing special. This was our first visit to Marrakech. Staff was not particularly helpful with directions suggestions transportation etc.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: adam d wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Title: The service was amazing and delicious food.
Review_Text: I looked forward to breakfast every morning. Staff is so friendly and helpful. Rooms are massive and very cool. We absolutely loved this place! It's very well located to all the souks and very quiet at night so no problem getting to sleep.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rohit M wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Title: Riad 72, a tranquil oasis in the medina
Review_Text: I first read about Riad 72 in Amex's Departures magazine before planning my trip to Marrakech. Even with prior research a pleasant surprise awaited when I walked into the beautiful courtyard of this tastefully renovated riad welcomed by the hospitality of its director Emanuela and the wonderful staff. Riad 72 is very beatiful with an intimate setting perfect for escaping the daily hustle of the city. The souks Jemaa El Fna and Koutoubia are all within a comfortable walking distance from the riad. While there are many great places to eat in Marrakech I highly recommend having dinner in the riad after a day exploring the city - the chef Fatima is amazing preparing wonderful meals with fresh ingredients selected daily. My stay at Riad 72 made a wonderful trip to Maroc very memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Nice little find and wonderful staff
Review_Text: We stayed in the Riad for 5 days and really liked it. The Riad is about an 8 minute walk away from the Souks and a 5 minute taxi ride away to wherever you want to go in Marrakech (the new town etc.) The Riad itself is very nice if not rather simple - the roof terrace is lovely for breakfast and dinner (they will usually accomodate if you ask to dine there unless the weather doesn't allow). The staff are absolutely wonderful incredibly sunny and welcoming - Rachid especially is fantastic. I was personally a little dissapointed by the food in Marrakech the restaurants (particularly the much talked about ones) are really not great for food although they are usually beautiful deco-wise; Fatima the chef remedied this with her chicken and lemon tajine orange soup Moroccan salads and especially her royal couscous! Of all the places we went out to eat - Dar Marjana (touted as one of the best where we dropped about 200 quid) Cafe Arab Mai Thai etc. - NONE of them came close food wise to Fatima's cooking. We didn't do the Hammam of the Riad as it is pretty small and there are so many traditional Hammams around the city. I did however get a manicure/pedicure and massage - for all of these treatments they call in local mobile therapists who you pay directly. For the ladies the mani/pedi therapist was really not great - no massage no base coat/no top coat just a lick of paint and the bill basically. The massage on the other hand was really fantastic after a 3 am start for our flight and an afternoon in the souks I was a ball of knots and the massage therapist really made all the difference - my partner also benefited from my diminished whining post massage so everybody was a winner. Salaries in Morocco are very low so fyi tipping is greatly appreciated!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo H wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: The riad was beautiful and the staff and service were excellent.  A wonderful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Nels D wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: I would highly recommend this riad. The staff are super friendly. The atmosphere is pure relaxation and quite a contrast with the busy outside world of Marrakech. Rooms are tastefully decorated and the food is amazing. A perfect stay. Thanks to everyone for making our short break so memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for two nights in Oct 2011. The riad is beautiful furnished and decorated with impeccable taste. The roof terrace is an oasis of calm. We arrived late and had arranged for a meal to be served in the courtyard which was delicious. Pillows need some personal tweaking and the local mosques will wake you at five o'clock call to prayer. But hey this is Morocco - buy ear plugs in the departure lounge. Stunning riad!

We had such a wonderful time. This Riad is gorgeous and the food is phenomenal! Chef Fatuma is perfect. You really should stay here and have the chicken lemon tagine and couscous. The breakfast is wonderful. Do not miss this gem!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A perfect first stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: Riad 72 collects you from the airport so taxi negotiations can be avoided for the very short ride to the Medina. As a first timer to Marrakech I wasn't sure exactly what was happening when your minibus pulls over and your bags are loaded into what appeared to be a customised wheelbarrow. But it's Morocco it's 30C in April and you just go with the flow. The very pleasant bell 'boy' accompanies you to 72 which is about 100m away down a couple of winding streets. Inside it's like stepping into another world; polished concrete smouldering incense swaying palms and a gurgling water feature. We were met by the enthusiastic and chatty Alexandra who sat down and explained everything that we wanted to know over a cup of mint tea. The room was the one that I've seen mentioned on this site before with the steep steps leading up to the bedroom and bathroom. It does take a bit of care but once you're up there it's all quite comfortable. With only four rooms it's deadly quiet and you can normally have the roof terrace all to yourself - perfect for a quick bottle of wine before heading out. The staff were always terribly obliging and any requests were fulfilled efficiently. If you can do try and have dinner there with the amazing cooking by Fatouma. I had a group of friends over for dinner on the terrace (including some French who live in Marrakech) and everyone conceded that it was the best meal that we'd all had in the four day stay - even the expats admitted that it was very good (they were no doubt miffed we had found it first!).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We are a retired American couple who travel extensively. This is our first time in Morocco. We were met at the airport by Mohammed who took us as near the Riad as possible to the Dar el Bacha. We were met there by q man with a hand cart who took our luggage and walked us to the Riad about 200 meters. Once inside we were welcomed with mint tea and an explanation of Marrakesh and what we could expect. We were questioned about what we wanted to do and arrangements were made immediately to book dinner reservations to reserve the hammam and massage and to tour the souk and historic sites. Every wish was made real.    The service was impeccable. There are only rooms so one does pretty much what one wants when one wants. The guest makes the rules. The rooms are well decorated clean and comfortable. I can't think of a thing I would change. We were in Morocco in August and it was quite hot outside. The air conditioning was up to the task and we returned to the Riad midday to cool off and have a nap. This was the perfect stay.

Riad 72 lived up to all my expectations. It combined traditional Morrocan style with a modern twist and attention to detail. We stayed in the suite which was well worth the additional cost as the room was cavenous and comfortable. Staff were friendly discreet and helpful the general atmosphere was quiet relaxing and very much a home from home as you had your front door key. We look forward to returning some day soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Best hotel experience you can have
Review_Text: This is my first review ever and I am so glad to finally sign up to post it just for this hotel. The staff is by far better than anything you would even find at a four seasons the dinner we had by the chef (whom picked up the fresh produce that day) on the rooftop watching the sunset was one of the most magical experiences Alina and I have ever had. Had a great massage in the suite. The hotel is hidden away from all of the intensity of the souks. Alex thanks for everything. Marrakech we will see you again very soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Knowledgeable people say that in Morocco there are two worlds. The street is for men and business and the home is for family. The aggression of the street in Marrakesh can be intimidating at times but enthralling nevertheless. When you visit you need somewhere that is “family” to return to and Riad 72 fits that bill. From the moment we walked in there was a friendliness and calm that allowed us to reenergize to explore the medina the gardens and the Atlas Mountains. The building is beautiful and the cooking is delightful but most of all the staff is wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The perfect place to stay in marrakech!
Review_Text: My mother and i stayed at Riad 72 at the end of March after trawling trip advisor for a Riad. We had high expectations after reading all of the great reviews but the Riad exceeded them all - if you can stay here do it!  We were picked up from the airport and then met at the other end and led to the Riad. Once inside we were welcomed by Rachid (who was the perfect host all week!) with mint tea and biscuits and then shown our room. The interior is amazing beautiful banana trees relaxing music and beautiful decor. Our room was perfect with a huge bath and beautiful Morrocan doors and the view from the roof terrace is amazing. On clear days we could see the snow on the atlas mountains and being one of the highest terraces in the area meant you were never overlooked and could relax/sunbathe.  The food was fantastic - fatuma's food really is as good as the reviews make out  i want to go back! Neither of us could fault it!!  Thanks to everyone at riad 72 for an amazing stay!

We stayed at Riad 72 for Valentines this year. From the moment we arrived and saw the beautiful riad we knew we would have the most amazing time.    We were welcomed with mint tea and biscuits before being taken to our room. Our room was incredible. The interiors just amazing - perfect mix of Moroccan and Italian.    We had the most delicious dinner at Riad 72 on the first night (the best we had in Morocco) and the second night the staff made sure to reserve us a table at another great restaurant in Marrakech. The breakfasts were brilliant too – served in the stunning court yard - your own little piece of paradise. So lush and tranquil.    The roof top terrace was fantastic with stunning views over Marrakech. We watched the sun go down one evening and it was truly magical to hear the call for prayer right across the city.    The staff at Riad 72 were great – especially Rajid and Asif. Always smiling and happy to help you but at the same time very discreet.    We cannot recommend Riad 72 enough – it is a very very special place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Girls weekend away sex and the city inspired
Review_Text: After recently seeing the film sex and the city 2 we could not think of a better place for a girls weekend away than Marrakesh. It could not have been more fantastic. We were greeted at the airport by the Riad and loved walking through the little streets to the Riad. When the door opened all of us were jumping for joy. The atrium is beautiful and the rooms exceptional. We had a fantastic cookery lesson here and the staff took us to purchase the ingredients which was great fun. The staff here are fabulous and cannot be more helpful or attentive. The food is delicious. The roof terrace is stunning and the bed I slept in was enormous. The highlight of our stay was us all having a hammam. We giggled about it all weekend and have never felt so clean. All together fabulous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Bad experiences, one after the other
Review_Text: The room we stayed was apparently nice except because we need to climb to a gallery in a dangerous stair to reach the bed then when i made the reservation (http://www.riadsmorocco.com/riad-marrakech/riad-72/) they offered me a shower and bathtub there was not badtube at all and the shower was encharged to made a mess in the whole bathroom the floor was wet the whole day so we needed to dry it up with the towels of the terrace. where you can find the splash swimming pool is like a play mobil pool is so small. is like a the badtube they did not put in the room.  The worst experience: I decied to invite a friend to drink something in the terrace of the riad not in the room and all of a sudden came the guard in a rude way and shouting at me came and made me a big scandal telling me he will call the police for that and treated me as a criminal. First of all we were not informed about any policy or rule about of not been able to invited people in the public areas of the riad like restaurant or terrace i understand exactly rules but there are ways to communicate things even the manager told me was about the bad french of the guard  i thing was not the topic the excuse was so banal.  Plus there were a hysteric children that did not let us sleep  I would NEVER would like to go back there! They all were so fake! less smiles and better services can help the place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The perfect antidote to the hectic souks
Review_Text: This was the perfect place to stay as a group especially if as we did you have exclusive use of the Riad. The rooms were stylish and modern although if you like your privacy beware the bathroom doors are curtains. My room was on a mezzanine with some steep stairs but with a very nice seating area at the bottom. But if you have a problem with stairs you can access the bedroom through the bathroom. The other rooms were excellent especially the largest one with its huge double bed and fantastic bathroom.  The views from roof terrace were amazing and from one side you could see the Atlas mountains and from the other you face the souks and the old town.  The food was excellent and the staff were brilliant nothing was too much trouble it was a welcome retreat after a busy shopping trip.  The only (minor) downside is the very early call to prayer which you will hear all over the city and once you get used it even the lightest of sleepers will be able to ignore.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at Riad 72 in early Dec 2010 and it was a wonderfully intimate and relaxing place to stay. A small riad with only 4 beautifully furnished rooms the staff at Riad 72 made sure that we felt like we were at home. The owners of Riad 72 have done a wonderful job and putting together a fantastically luxurious hotel but they have done something even more special - created a environment and service culture that makes their guests feel special. No request was too hard and every member of staff were unfailingly polite and always smiling. In particular Fatima their incredible chef was incredibly generous and gave me some of her recipes and invited me into her kitchen to show us how to cook our favourite dishes. All I can say is it was a very special experience and when I go back to Marrakesh I will definitely stay there again. Thanks to the team at Riad 72 for an amazing stay in Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel was an absolute idyll. My male partner and I booked through Mr & Mrs Smith adding a note asking whether they would be comfortable with a gay couple staying. When by the eve of the trip we hadn't had a response we contacted Mr&Mrs Smith once more who whilst they couldn't get an answer from the Riad 72 said it shouldn't be a problem.    The opposite was true. We were made incredibly comfortable. Anything we wanted was provided - a small beautiful hammam with two young Moroccan students who gave us the full hammam wash and scrubdown; breakfast and dinner on the sun terrace; beers and olives in our room before dinner...    Our flight arrived three hours late due to the snow and we were trepidatious about the transfer. A man was there with a sign saying "Riad 72" - they'd checked and rearranged their schedule to make sure we were met. We were welcomed into the Riad [read the other descriptions on this site - they are true!] by the charming Rashid a young Morrocan man with a degree in Political Science and Alexandra who seemed to run the place in the absence of the Italian landlady. They literally couldn't have done more to make us feel at home. Alexandra is the perfect guide for protocol - frank and incredibly helpful especially for the first-time traveller to Morocco she's excellent.    We stayed in the Amal suite which has the biggest bath - perfect for trying out the black soap bought in the souk.    Fatouma is the chef - often she was just cooking for us - who prepares traditional Moroccan fare with a twist. Utterly delicious she'd decide what we'd have that evening and then we'd sit and wait for the delicious courses to be served. Terrific Moroccan wine and beer available - at a significant markup from the duty free but that's to be expected. We ate at two extremely high end restaurants - Fouquet's and Dar Moha - and neither compared to Fatouma's cooking not to mention the simple comfortable ambience of the riad.    We were discreet both inside and outside the riad but it was obvious that we were a gay couple and everyone made us feel totally at home.    If you stand on the sun terrace when the call to prayer begins you get this extraordinary sound of multiple calls to prayer from the various mosques in the city. Enchanting. Take your earplugs if you're easily woken - the call starts at 5am though the sound from within the riad was much much quieter.    I'm hesitant to recommend this too highly in case it's difficult for us to book next time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The perfect relaxing setting in the centre of Marrakech - with some of the best food Morocco has to offer
Review_Text: This little Riad is very stylish with Moroccan / Italian decor - the roof terrace overlooking the city is also a great bonus.  The 4 rooms in this Riad are each unique with lovely moroccan features. The only negative was the bathrooms were traditionally designed and therefore have no door between the bedroom & bathroom (only a curtain).  The location was a very convenient 5min walk to the souks and a 10min walk to the main central square.  Whilst all the staff were excellent the highlight of this Riad was most definitely the food. Fatuma (the chef) has designed a traditional menu executed brilliantly. We also visited several different restaurants recommended by friends and guidebooks none of which compared to the Fatuma's cooking!!  The internal courtyard provided a serene setting for relaxing and eating meals.  As an extra touch this Riad has it's own Hammam room and will also organise massage treatments in your room.  Overall a fantastic trip we will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Seriously - one of the best hotels there is. Peerless.
Review_Text: Let’s be clear. This is a good hotel. In fact it’s a very good hotel indeed. Actually one of the best. And it’s not often you can say that.    My wife and I wanted a week-long break whilst the kids went away for half-term with the school so we found the Riad72 on the Mr & Mrs Smith website. The description didn’t really do it justice so it was a bit pot-luck that we chose it.    It’s quite an exceptional place – just four luxury individually-designed rooms surrounding a lush Moroccan courtyard with an outstanding roof terrace “solarium” and a wonderful staff.    We emailed a few days before and they explained that a hotel transfer from the airport would be provided. Fifteen minutes after emerging from arrivals [allow one hour for passport control if you’re last off the plane] we were walking down an unremarkable side alley and through a rather unlikely front door which revealed the oasis within. It has a real ‘wow’ factor. It was perfectly situated within the Medina but not absolutely in the hub-bub of the Souk yet on-hand for all the attractions.    When we arrived at 9am although check-in wasn’t until later that day it wasn’t a problem and a full breakfast was provided – one of many splendid and tasty meals prepared by the in-house chef the charming Fatouma. The manager Alexandre explained about the various attractions and gave us a map that featured the other properties owned by the same Italian company [Riad Due & Riad12]. Later we went to the RiadDue which was just as nice but a bit more ‘funky’ – it has TV.    We spent the rest of the day until the room was ready on the Sun Terrace. This is billed as the tallest in the Medina and it’s not an idle boast. It can’t be overlooked and there are some supremely comfortable sun-beds [proper mattresses] a [very] little plunge pool outside shower and shaded sitting area. It couldn’t be better…. although there’s a periodic interruption from nearby Mosque’s competing for worshippers with a Call To Prayer. Some days we didn’t leave the Riad at all. Paradise.    We stayed in the Amal room one of the larger ones with an enormous comfortable bed tall ceilings and a bathroom with the largest marble bath imaginable. The nice thing about this room was that it had a little balcony sitting area overlooking the atrium where you can take tea. The decoration was beautifully sumptuous and very tasteful. The other rooms were either not as large having a shower instead of bath or didn’t have this platform.    The Riad has free high-speed wi-fi but no TVs. It’s perfectly peaceful – although we brought our Internet Radio to listen to the BBC in the room.    The food is exceptionally tasty and it’s cooked by the personably Fatouma – everything is made from scratch by her in the kitchen which you can see through the courtyard window. There’s a dedicated staff – about ten of them which for four rooms is amazing – but they were never intrusive and the very essence of understated professionalism. French is the main language but all speak broken English. There is a lovely French lady who speaks perfect English that visits every morning at breakfast to check everything’s okay or to assist with tours – another couple wanted to play golf and she sorted it for them.    The only downside was the fact that the Mosque Call-to-Prayer started at about 5am on some mornings - but if you can't stomach that you shouldn't really be in Marrakech.    As you can probably tell my wife and I were seriously impressed by the Riad72. If you go you won’t be disappointed. Five Stars.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I can´t wait to be there again.....
Review_Text: The riad 72 is an outstanding unique and unforgettable place to stay.  " Thousand welcomes" was the first we heard when we finally arrived there.  And this was the way we really felt ! Alexandra Fatima the beautiful young Morrocan lady & Rashid let us feel like in paradise they red our lips........  The atmosphere is tranquill and just beautiful - it´s hard to leave this place!  And we still dream of the best dinner we had in Morocco - prepared by Fatima!  Thank you from the depth of our hearts!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stylish and serene hideaway in the centre of Marrakesh.
Review_Text: Riad 72 is a stylish unflashy quality hideaway in the centre of Marrakesh. The rooms are spacious and elegant the staff is wonderful the food is unbelievable and the location is perfect for exploring the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing tranquil riad with excellent service from Rashid and food from the chef Fatima to compliment the expereince
Review_Text: My husband and I have travelled extensively and appreciate high quality accommodation something a bit different stylish modern yet authentic and Riad 72 fulfilled our expectations. From the communication we had with the Riad prior to our arrival about transfers from the airport and being met by the concierge who loaded our bags into a cart and escorted us to the riad from the taxi and preparing us dinner on our arrival (we had a night flight) we were thoroughly catered for and looked after.    Rashid was fantastic he took the time and went through a map of the main tourist attractions on our arrival whilst we drank mint tea (the best mint tea by far!!!) In the uber gorgeous courtyard area whilst listening to chill-out music on the riads ipod. Nothing was too much trouble.    We had breakfast at the Riad freshly prepared by Fatima gorgeous! Which we ate on the roof terrace. The chef was amazing by far the best tagine during our stay. Taxis were arranged for us and I had a massage in my room which was again by far the best I have ever had.    Overall our time in Marrakech will be remembered for the hospitality and friendliness of the staff at the Riad. We felt humbled by the experience and would definitely recommend Riad 72 to anyone wanting a bit of luxury and tranquility.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marrakech B wrote a review Aug 2010
Review_Text: Beautifull Riad in the Medina. very central. traditionally restored respecting the original architecture. The staff are so nice and they pay a great attention to the costomer services. I will highly recomand it
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: An amazing place to stay, exceptional staff...but if other guests are inconsiderate it will really impact your stay
Review_Text: In terms of this Riad there is very little to fault it. It is stylish and elegant without being pretentious and the staff and service is impecible yet unobtrusive.    We stayed in the Amal suite that has the most amazing bathroom and a really decent size room although if I was returning with my partner I would definately splash out on the Lile bridal suite (which is just amazing!)    The roof top tarrace has a beautiful panoramic view of the city and the Atlas Mountains and the plunge pool although small is a really nice (and very welcomed) touch.    We ate here two nights on our stay and the food was really very good. In fact it was much better and far more reasonable than the places that we ate out on (all of which were supposed 'top notch' in terms of food and cooking). We ate on the room terrace which was relaxed and comfortable.    The only real downside to this riad is if the other guest are inconsiderate it really will impact on your stay. Our last night was totally ruined by the other to sets of guests coming back very late with non-guests playing music extremely loudly shouting and singing and generally being louts. Although a member of staff was on sight (non managerial) the problem was not nipped in the bud and I had to deal with this problem after nearly an hour of Lady Gaga and rattling about as they helped themselves to the kitchen. As all rooms overlook the courtyard there was no way to avoid being impacted by this noise and as we had to be up for a flight a 6.00 am we were less than impressed.    However this is as a result of very poorly mannered guests and is probably not a regular occurance. All in all a wonderful place but I would recommend the management consider how the riad is managed in the evenings
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Paul Craig wrote a review Jun 2010
Review_Title: Warm welcomes and a pot of mint tea and...
Review_Text: Warm welcomes and a pot of mint tea and home made biscuits made us instantly take to Riad 72. The service was spectacular. Nothing was too much trouble. We spent lots of time on the lovely roof terrace looking at the views over the medina and to the atlas mountains drinking rose.  Our room was clean and comfortable as was the rest of the Riad. It was so calm and restful. The perfect antidote to the hussle and bussle of the souks. Loved it.

The total experience at this riad was fantastic. The room was extreamly clean and beautiful. The staff are always polite and very attentive.  We had dinner at Riad72 their chef Fatima cooked amazing meals which I'm missing very much now...  The location is just outside the souk it was convenient for shopping.  I cannot find any fault with this place. I highly recommend it to anyone who going to Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Romantic Oasis in the Midst of the Medina--Not to be missed!!!
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived in Morocco the staff at Riad 72 made our stay exceptional. Their attention to small detail for instance freshly prepared biscuits alongside a welcoming cup of mint tea made this our most exceptional trip yet. Similarly the Riad is beautifully appointed blending modern Moroccan and Italian furnishings creating a quiet oasis from the busy Medina. A few special notes: the terrace is spectacular and sits above other surrounding buildings the Riad's lovely chef is a true talent--her orange soup and chicken tagine set our tastebuds alight and finally as the Riad houses only four rooms it is the closest thing to a private retreat. This is a property not to be missed---the Riad experience will not disappoint.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo S wrote a review Jun 2010
Review_Title: A hidden Gem in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: The staff at Riad 72 are beyond accomodating ensuring that your every need is catered for. They made our first time in Marrakech an unforgettable experience and nothing was too much trouble. Thank you Halid Rasheed and Alex!  we would definitely stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: VX W wrote a review Mar 2010
Review_Title: Lovely riad in a great location
Review_Text: One of my favourite places to stay - I really loved the decor and feel of the place. Of course the hospitality was exceptional.    I stayed there with my partner and our 5 month old baby. When dining at the riad the cook came out to play with our baby and offered to hold her so that I could eat my meal. The three course meal was delicious and I would highly recommend dining at Riad 72.    Our only small problem was that we couldn't get the air conditioning to work. Unfortunately this only became apparent at 3am when I woke up due to the heat. However I'm sure that this would have been fixed immediately if we'd have realised sooner.    Overall I was very pleased to stay at Riad 72 and would stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautiful, relaxing, great location and amazing service!
Review_Text: We've just spent a weekend at Riad 72 and I can't recommend it highly enough. Our room (Zahwa) was beautiful with a quirky layout and very comfortable. The roof terrace is amazing with a great view and very comfy sun beds also a lovely place to have lunch in the sun.    The Riad is located about 5 minutes walk from the souk but feels very peaceful and relaxing.    The food and service was very very good with lovely friendly helpful staff. I definitely recommend Riad 72!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: tranquil oasis in the city, wonderful service and food.
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad only 4 rooms cool courtyard fine roof terrace beautifully fitted and furnished. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. The food in the Riad is traditional and price compares very favourably with local restaurants. Service second to none.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Daniel B wrote a review Feb 2010
Review_Text: The trip from the airport drop off started the senses wondering if the right decision had been made on Riad 72 however once the dark wooden door opened and we entered the Riad it all became clear. A handwash and a glass (or two) of delightful mint tea set the tone for the relaxed informal yet attentive service and atmosphere we enjoyed during our three days. Our room Amal encouraged serious lounging whilst the roof terrace is beautifully set for long afternoons lazing in the sun and evenings spent under the stars enjoying a glass or two of good wine.  Nothing was too much trouble and a morning spent with Fatouma in the kitchen is an experience not to be missed! From arrival to departure the staff at Riad 72 went out of their way to provide assistance help and anything one could want - from ironing to restaurant bookings to setting up our room for dinner as a valentines day treat the service was impeccable.  If a spot of indulgence a dose of great service and a beautiful place to lay your head are high on the agenda give this place a chance you will not be disappointed. All in all a superb calming oasis in the heart of what can be a manic and at times testing city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A truly wonderful find I'd echo the other recent reviews. Impossible to fault this property and whist the "features" of Souks and Medina may grate after a long day this place oozes total serenity.    With four rooms it's a huge property and you feel like you are alone. Staff only pop out when you need it otherwise it's all yours. We only ever saw other guests once in a three night stay - and only then in passing. The night porter Rashid was a gem - but they're all great. Take breakfast on the roof - just fantastic to start the day.    The decor is a wonderful mix of traditional Riad and Italian the old and the new. Very well appointed.    I would note that the staff don't really speak English so keep a little French to hand. Or wave your arms about - it's owned by Italians so that seems to work too! They are desperately friendly and keen to help with whatever you need (including a local beer - well needed after a day in the Souks and hard to find in the Medina!)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad72 is located very close to the Medina. Is one of the nicest  hotels I ever seen. the furnishing is very very sofisticated the materials  are all naturals and the colours are so warm and unique.  Just few rooms are available ensuring quiet and no crowd. The staff  is very very friendly and anything you ask will be satisfied. ;)  In particular Rashid (if I remembed well the name) a new entry of the staff  was really nice with us.  One note for the "new marry" or "new fiances": The bathrooms have  no doors and is divided from the rest of the room just by a half-wall so  there is not a great "privacy". For me and my gf didnt make any problem  but maybe for the very new couples still "knowing" each other could  represent something embarassing.....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: You won't find a nicer place to stay- just fantastic!
Review_Text: Stay at this Riad and you will not be disappointed it's so calm after the madness of the medina the staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. The food delicious and as good some of the more expensive restaurants the rooms comfortable and quite the location is great and the terrace a perfect spot for tea dinner breakfast etc etc.. it's just a great place to stay really relaxing.  One thing to note is the pool is more of a 'big bath' still nice to cool off in though.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Cliche cliche: an oasis of calm! Delightful staff excellent food - though only sampled breakfast so far. Room clean fantastic bed huge bath - Amal room where bath is partly overhanging and encased in an intricate wooden structure. Would have no hesitation in staying here again. It is hard to locate initially but riad will arrange pickup (though they slightly messed this up with us - but local boy very helpful with locating it and escorting us from where petit taxi dropped / dumped us for 5 Dh!). Just get your bearings use the map and there should be no problem finding the riad again. Easy walking distance to most places in the medina. Ville nouvelle is walkable but a killer in the heat. Ask the taxis to drop you at Dar el Bacha - easy for them to locate and less than 4 mins walk to the riad.  Such a treat to return here after the heat hustle and bustle of the city.  Superb freshly cooked / baked breakfast. No rush in the mornings - starts 08:30 - till whenever you appear! "bien domir?" - most definitely with a leisurely 10:30 breakfast - a great start to the day.  Hotel provide a very useful map but you can pick up "Marakech evasion" map in the newsagent at railway station - also v useful with locations of restaurants sights etc  Enjoyed kefta sandwich at Cafe des epices also at Hassan's stand in the main square. Off now to sample some more Morroccan fare!  Enjoy your stay at Riad 72
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Traditional, clean, welcoming and quiet riad with a stunning roof terrace
Review_Text: It's all in the title. This riad offers a beautiful slice of riad living. It is just a six minute walk to the top of the souks. We highly recommend this riad having recently stayed for the first time in Marrakech and wanted to sample a traditional riad experience. The food is good the service is excellent. No more words just try it out.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a marvellous place. We enjoyed staying at the Riad 72 from the first to the last minute. Service was outstanding we never had to worry about anything.    The riad/hotel is beautifully restored and has four rooms each of them has a completely different design. There is a nice inner courtyard with a fountain and many plants - a perfect place to enjoy the delicious meals of the house chiefs.    The rooftop terrace offers a splendid view over the city of Marrakesh and all the way to the Atlas mountains. There is a small pool on the roof as well but it is very small and if you arrive expecting a large pool you will be disappointed - but the pool is perfect to cool off after a long day in the souk.    We enjoyed our stay very much and we hope to be back one day.
We had a great stay thanks to the kind staff the excellent food and the wonderful location. Best value stay I've ever had!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have travelled extensively for many years and have stayed in some of the world's most prestigious hotels but our recent stay at Riad 72 was truly unique.  Beyond the spectacular elegant and meticulously maintained physical structurewhich cannot be accurately depicted by photographs it is the professional and dedicated attiude of every member of the riad's staff and the amazing service that made our stay so special.  We were lucky enough to stay in the gorgeous Karma suite and really enjoyed the delicious freshly baked pastries every morning.  Every afternoon mint tea and biscotti were offered.  The riad's location is excellent right in the center of the Dar el Basha .This made sightseeing and walking to the Djamma el Fna and many excellent restaurants for dinner very easy. It is just outside the souks but much quieter and felt more safe.  Riad 72's staff made every effort to make our stay wonderful. They made restaurant recommendations and reservations that we loved arranged for a day trip made sightseeing suggestions kept the room immaculate at all times served meals and saw us off at 4 A.M. all with a smile and a genuine desire to please. Highly recommended.

We decided to have lunch at Riad 72 on a hot sunny day. It was not easy to find but when we entered the courtyard we were in awe. The place was so calm and beautiful. Loved their water features and banana trees. The food was very good and the staff was attentitive. If we come back to Marrakech we would definitely stay here.

Review_Date: Tim R wrote a review Feb 2008
Review_Text: My friends and I stayed at Riad 72 for three nights. This is a beautifully restored Riad with a modern-Moroccan decor. The rooms surround a large courtyard with banana trees. The courtyard has several sitting areas for relaxing over a mint tea or for an excellent meal prepared by the Riad's chef (like other travelers I would recommend at least one dinner in the Riad). We chose to have breakfast each morning on the roof-top terrace which has amazing views of the medina. The location is only minutes away from the Koutoubia Mosque and the Djemma El Fna. What made the stay superior was the staff. Everyone was extremely friendly gracious and eager to please. I could not recommend Riad 72 more highly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: from an unassuming street in the Medina we entered the magnificent Riad 72. We could not have imagined how stylish beautiful and relaxing Riad 72 would be within. We were greeted with a brethtaking courtyard with lanterns and water features a banana plant reaching to the stars and Moroccan arabesque features abound.    Our room was a delight - the bed on a mezzanine level with a luxurious ajoining bathroom with local soaps and other products.    Descending the bookcase - staircase was a lounge adorned with roses and magazines Morrocan fruit and cushions.    Service was attentive and friendly. The breakfasts were plentiful mint tea in the afternoon a glorious ritual and the restuarant food in the evening was homely and beautifully cooked. This was a place to cherish to relax in be inspired by and remember forever.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad72 is a wonderful place to stay. It is a perfect for couple's. Romantic quite clean and the food is wonderful.    There are only 4 rooms in the riad we stayed in the the 'Amal' room which has a wonderful bathroom with a huge bath.    At least once during your stay you should have the house chief cook you dinner.    The riad also has a lovely roof terrace with deck beds for catching the sun.    The only complaint would be there was a bit of a wait for the food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was a fantastic and elegant hotel. The food was excellent and the space outstanding. We had the suite just at the top of the entry stairs and it was outstanding -- lots of open space and as nice a hotel room as I have seen.    The service was excellent the view from the room outstanding and the touches in every corner of the hotel elegant and modern.    It is pretty hard to find and the locals of course are no help but once we got close we were able to find it and get help with our bags (service was great). I say that the locals were no help "of course" because asking a local for directions to hotel is almost certain to get you the standard reply of "that hotel is closed/not any good/never heard of it...but my cousin/uncle/brother/father/son has a very fine hotel....follow me". The hotel is not closed and it is grand so keep looking!    We stayed at Hotel Fez in Fez which was also truly spectacular so if you liked Hotel Fez...I think that you will like Riad 72.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Apr 2007
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights in the cavernous Karma suite  followed by 4 nights at Kasbah Tamadot then another 2 nights in 72 (suite again). I`m a fan of minimalist design and booked this riad because of it`s style and the fact it only had 4 rooms (more European/Japanese than Moroccan i hasten to add). The location is excellent for both through the awful Jeema-El-Fna square and the upmarket Gueliz area. A beautiful Riad with the most charming staff I`ve ever encountered we had a wonderful stay here. Mustapha who runs the Riad is knowledgeable helpful and happy to sit down for a chat ( when the phone is not glued to his ear! It`s a busy place). Brahim (a qualified lawyer!) is the most charming person I`ve ever come across with a deilightfully ever present smile  nothing being too much trouble for him- I enjoyed chewing the fat with him at the end of the night. Fatouma`s cooking could potentially be a solution to world peace (I may send her recipes to the UN) and she catered for my wife`s dietary needs perfectly. In fact her tagines were better than those I had at La Foundouk and Le Comptoir. Assiz couldn`t have asked how I was any more often if he tried and the 2 young women who worked there floated effortlessly and efficiently around this oasis.    Our room was truly vast with a stunning 25 foot high carved wooden ceiling and cupola and lovely tadelact bathroom that would have made John Pawson proud (although the bath could have been a few feet longer). The curtain to the bathroom however is not suitable for the shy person though and certainly would not have fitted in with the main tenet of the Bauhaus especially in the aural sense. It must have been worse in the smaller rooms. In my eyes a pointless peace of design for design`s sake. Doors work better people. The terrace is one of the highest in the medina and holds great views once you`ve mastered the tricky steps up and not whacked your head on the little entrance to it. A few health and safety tips wouldn`t go amiss like handrails and a mind your head sign. Dont book if it`s a pool your after- it`s pretty much a big bath on the terrace. There is also a small hammam where you cn have your skin removed from your muscles!!    I loved the serenity of the courtyard the little water feature and huge banana plant and we both made ourselves so much at home that we felt part of the furniture ( so much so that I`d raid the fridge at night when everyone had gone leaving a note as to how much beer I`d scoffed- I`m an honest soul).    The main drawback for us which would affect our return and I presume would be the same for every riad in the medina- the call to prayer at 4 am. It`s a part of Islamic culture and I`ve no right to complain but it drove me nuts. It was loud as hell and woke us up every day.    Although this riad is tucked in the backstreets of Dar El Bacha we were never troubled by anybody even at 3 am. In fact if and when you do become hopelessly lost in the world`s biggest rabbit warren people especially kids will offer to take you back for a tip- well worth it.    All in all a great place to stay with great staff. There are plenty of riads to choose from so check them all out and if we went back I`d certainly try others to compare such as Farnatchi or El Fenn but this one should be near the top of your list.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We didn't stay at this Riad but ate there on recommendation of our guide book and I just wanted to say how wonderful it was. This is a beautiful Riad and although we couldn't see inside the rooms the roof terrance and courtyard were really lovely. The staff were fantastic the service attentive and the food delicious. I have attached some pictures to demonstrate how attractive this Riad is excuse the darkness from the mood lighting! I hope you can still see that the decor was really stunning.

Review_Date: Carolyn W wrote a review Jan 2007
Review_Text: I would HIGHLY recommend this Riad to anyone visiting Marrakech! My visit was last Nov-- I was provided transport form the airport and arrived at the Riad only to be greeted by Brahim (who speaks excellent English) and a wonderful meal by Fatima (the master of the kitchen.) My room was extremely roomy and very comfortable. The decor is incredibly serene and "zen" like-- a welcome change after traversing the many alley ways of the medina. Brahim was able to arrange for a guide as well as assist w/other conveniences. The following morning I had a hearty breakfast on the terrace.    The Riad is not centrally located but this could be a bit of an advantage if you like walking and observing street life. I made reservations by contacting the Riad directly and they were very responsive to my requests. Please note that this Riad has only 3 rooms and a suite; however it is very spacious.    The Riad is very well maintained extremely clean and has a wonderful staff. It even has a small hamman (by appointment.)    I also had the opportunity to meet the owner who has/manages another Riad in the medina (Riad 12).    An excellent bargin and a pleasant surprise!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Oasis of calm amongst the souks
Review_Text: We have just returned from the wonderful Riad 72 and our stay couldn't have been better. We booked the Amal Suite and really recommend this as a place to stay. The staff at the Riad were incredibly attentive and did everything they could to make our stay a success.    Like one of the other reviewers I was not too keen on the souks and attitude I got from some of the native Morrocan men and so it was a delight to return to the Riad for some peace and calm.    We had 3 excellent breakfasts (included) and only on Sunday was the breakfast a bit basic. We also had dinner in the Riad once which was nice but nothing special. We ate out one evening in the square and once at the Maison de Arabe. The dinner at the Maison de Arabe was very expensive and whilst my food was nice my partner suffered from horrendous food poisoning following this meal. We also thought that the restaurant was lacking in any atmosphere and seemed very "corporate" in style.    The roof terrace is a lovely place to have breakfast (depending on the weather) and also to spend some time if the weather is good. There is a small plunge pool there but it's only about 4 feet x 3 feet so it really is just a space for a dip.    There are guests of different nationalities staying there during our trip and given the Riad is so small (only 4 rooms) the whole place is very friendly.    I would definitely recommend the Riad to anyone looking for a relaxing stay although my views on Marrakesh itself are not so positive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Following a horrid reception at Caravanserai my husband and I spent the second half of our honeymoon in Riad 72 Amal room. The difference was incredible.    The staff are so attentive and considerate it's impossible not to relax . The room was fantastic and really more of a suite with a huge tadelakt bath and shower a small lounge area and a balcony outside overlooking the central courtyard and its banana plant.    Food was served wherever and whenever we wanted it with the staff providing great recomendations and constant smiles.    Staying alongside us was a timeout photographer creating a portfolio of Riad photography he confirmed that it was in fact the best Riad he had seen in Marrakecheven staying in the cheapest available room!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I just returned from a week in Morocco at three different riads. Two were in Marrakech and one in Essaouira. My first glimpse of Marrakech came in the evening hours at Riad 72 and what a welcome glimpse it was. I came into the lobby so tired after four flights beginning in Austin Texas and Brahim had me sit and relax next to the fountains while he brought me tea. I was hungry and luckily another couple was eating in that night so I was able to get the same meal as they. It was so delicious a tangine and a bowl of the best soup I have ever eaten. My room was on the second floor and a little bit odd in arrangement. You enter into a small sitting area and have to climb a slightly rickety stairway to get up to the sleeping loft and bathroom. If mobility is an issue at all for you dont stay here or in a riad period! Anyway the staff headed by Raja was very accomodating and every request was answered with a "no problem". I am ambivalent about Marrakech or at least the Medina it is fascinating but very tiring and I can not imagine staying there for an entire week. One piece of advice whenever possible get small denominations of bills and coins.You have to tip everyone in this city from bellboys to direction givers and street performers and children and I never had anything smaller than a 100 dirham ($11). Enjoy!

We just returned from 4 nights at Riad 72 and the experience was incredible. The rooms were spectacular and the staff could not have been more helpful - each person went out of his or her way to make sure that our visit was pleasant. We had dinner at the Riad one night and the meal was excellent as were the breakfasts we enjoyed each morning. I can not recommend Riad 72 more highly!

Riad 72 is stunningly beautiful. The decor is a wonderful mix of traditional Moroccan and Italian chic. All of the rooms (there are only four) are lovely but if you can splash out and book the suite it took our breath away. The staff are all wonderful - really friendly attentive and helpful. The food is fantastic. Breakfast which is included in the price is a wide selection of freshly baked Moroccan breads cakes and pancakes. Other meals are extra but I would recommend having at least one dinner the cook is fantastic (and a lovely lady) and her tangine was the best we had in Morocco. This is the perfect place to relax and enjoy the peace after the hustle and bustle of the city.
